Park Hanho lowered his head. Yeonhee did the same.

"Good morning.”

But it was the wrong greeting.

Orden unconsciously let out a smile.

"No, Yeonhee. You have to say 'goodbye’.”

"Oh. Goodbye. Cindy and Yeonjoo says goodbye, too."

Yeonhee tilted the dolls forward. Orden stared at Yeonhee in silence.

At that moment, Park Hanho turned around, and Orden watched the two leave the room.

‘…She’s cute.’

Orden surprised himself by thinking so.

**

[Pandemonium, a shady alley]

I left the Tower of Wish, or technically, the World of Wish.

The sun was starting to set as I walked through an alley in Pandemonium, looking over the list of requests I had received. Some of these requests were addressed to the Truth Agency, some to the Jeronimo Mercenaries, and the rest to the Chameleon Troupe. I attributed my overflowing mailbox to the ‘Four Monsters of Hell’.

“…There’s so many.”

The Truth Agency was flooded with Orden-related questions. I answered whatever question I could answer with the Book of Truth, and I chose to decline most of the requests addressed to Fenrir asking me to exterminate the monsters. I then kept walking….

“…Eh?”

Suddenly, my body floated into the air. I didn’t realize that I had fallen until my body flipped upside down.

Fortunately, Aether protected me from the impact, but the next attack was even quicker than Aether.

There appeared to be multiple assassins. One sliced the Aether shield open, the other pushed a dagger through the gap, and yet another cut into my Achilles tendon.

I felt burning pains in my shoulder and ankle.

It seemed that the dagger was coated with poison.

Thud—

I fell to the ground. All of this happened in less than a second.

I tried to activate Bullet Time but my Gift didn’t respond. Only then did I realize why I wasn’t able to detect the ambush in the first place.

‘A Gift that nullifies other Gifts.’

One of the settings that I ended up discarding included a description about a group of assassins. One of its members, the Mountain Sage, possessed the nullification Gift. But I wasn’t sure why he was here in Pandemonium when he should be working in the Middle East.

‘…Too bad assassination doesn’t work on me.’

His Gift had nullified my Gift but I still had my Skills.

I activated my unique skill, Time Reversal before the blade reached my throat.

...

Chapter 277. The Mountain Sage (2)

The ‘Mountain Sage’ rose from the Middle East as the successor of the legendary assassin ‘Hassan-i Sabbah’. Their roots date back to the year 1990, when the world had entered a period of rest after overcoming Outcall. It all started from a young Iranian youth who awakened the Gift [Shackles].

This Gift had a simple power – to restrain.

On a smaller scale, it could restrain humans. On a bigger scale, this powerful Gift could restrain even space and the flow of time.

As if this wasn’t enough, the Iranian youth awakened a second Gift, [Void World].

After a thousand years, the successor of the Order of Assassins had returned.

The youth changed his name to ‘Hazen’ and officially inherited the Sabbah.

Using his past title, Lord of Alamut, he called himself the Mountain Sage and accepted only his direct descendants into the assassin group.

Just like that, Hazen began to secretly work in the Middle East. To calm the chaotic political scene, he killed militant leaders by disguising it as accidents and used the chaos that ensued to assassinate the Djinns and humans who were the root of it all.

He continued his mission for 30 years.

They had acted so secretly that even Kim Sukho had only recently discovered them. Although Kim Sukho had stepped down from the position of President, his desire for power had never subsided. In his head, the Mountain Sage’s Order of Assassins was the perfect tool to deal with the Chameleon Troupe. Although its founder, Hazen, was already dead, he had left behind a powerful legacy. Kim Sukho liked their meticulous assassinations and their sole desire for gold.

As such, Kim Sukho called on them to become the mastermind in the shadows. He eliminated those who opposed him by disguising the murders as accidents and dug into politicians who seemed fishy to find their weak points. Through this, he formed a powerful stronghold that was much more powerful than when he was a president.

Kim Sukho believed it wouldn’t be any different this time. Although he had some doubts, the results shown by Hazen’s descendants gave him confidence.

Not long after accepting his request, Hazen’s descendants figured out Black Lotus’ identity through a simple yet difficult method of tracking all of Black Lotus’ whereabouts. It was the work of their third executive who possessed the Gift [Colossal Search].

Just like that, the ‘Kim Hajin Assassination Plan’ started and was almost successful.

No, it already succeeded once.

“Kim Hajin is Fenrir, and Fenrir is Black Lotus.”

In a thick darkness, the first of Hazen’s five descendants, ‘Hassun’, spoke.

They were hiding inside the darkness while waiting for Kim Hajin to show up.

“Interesting.”

The youngest descendant, Hayre, smiled. It was surprising given his usual cold, emotionless attitude.

“We don’t have to report this to our client?”

“Our mission is to assassinate Black Lotus. Further talk is unnecessary. Is he coming soon, Hazehre?”

Hassun asked the third descendant, Hazehre.

“Yes, Kim Hajin will appear here.”

With an incredible inference and calculation ability, [Colossal Search] could even predict the future location of its target. Hazehre had already done his work and learned that Kim Hajin would appear near them soon.

“…He’s coming.”

The five descendants in hiding all sensed a presence.

They flared up the Gift they all shared, [Void World]. Their bodies turned transparent, camouflaging them based on their surroundings, and darkness slowly spread out. Inside this dark domain, enemies were incapable of activating their Gifts.

Just like their past targets, Black Lotus would also be assassinated…

“…Come out.”

However, the target’s voice rang out before they could do anything. The five assassins flinched slightly.

But they didn’t think they were discovered.

They believed Black Lotus was randomly murmuring as one would when coming back to a dark, empty home.

“Otherwise, I’ll go instead.”

In the next moment, the target revealed himself.

“…?”

The five assassins all tilted their heads. The target, Kim Hajin, was emitting some kind of an aura.

Kim Hajin called the spirit power he awakened the Author’s Spirit Power. The best part was that it could materialize the setting he wanted at any time.

As such, Kim Hajin created a setting with his spirit power. [Catch Field] – a skill that could track the presence of anyone within 500 meters.

In addition, he sent his will to Spartan and called for a trustworthy reinforcement.

KOONG—!

Next to Kim Hajin, an eagle and a burly man appeared.

It was then that Hazen’s descendants realized something was wrong.

The burly man, Cheok Jungyeong, spoke.

“What is it all of a sudden?”

“Look over there.”

Kim Hajin pointed at the direction Hazen’s descendants were hiding. At the same time, Kim Hajin’s aura shot out and lit up the area.

Cheok Jungyeong furrowed his brows and followed Kim Hajin’s finger.

“…Should we run?”

Hayre murmured.

“No, it’s already too late.”

“…!”

A husky voice rang out behind them. It was Cheok Jungyeong’s voice, and the next sequence of events happened lightning fast.

Kwang—! Thud—! Boom—!

The sound of combat rang out.

Although the five descendants did their best to resist, assassins were naturally no good in a direct fight. Cheok Jungyeong, who specialized in direct combat, was an unbeatable existence.

**

[England, London]

It was early morning in Central Asia but dinner time in England. Near Buckingham Palace, a rowdy event was underway.

Booom—!

Lightning shot up from the prison cell Jin Sahyuk created. When the lightning disappeared, a flaming whirlpool appeared along with winds that were sharper than blades. The magnitude of the phenomenon easily surpassed what could be found in nature.

Kooong—!

The series of disasters shook the prison cell Toji was trapped in. Hundreds of magicians poured in their magic power to maintain the cell. Still, dozens of magicians were knocked out in ten seconds as Chae Joochul ceaselessly shook the prison cell.

—Uaaaaaah….

Toji’s scream rang out.

His skin melted from extreme heat but still maintained its form and was cut from the metal-attribute wind, yet nothing could sever his body.

Chae Joochul poured powerful attacks into the prison cell from the outside. The injured Toji screamed in pain.

But that only lasted a moment. After a round of attacks finished, Toji’s body regenerated as though nothing had happened. Then, he fell asleep peacefully.

“…He truly is an interesting one.”

Chae Joochul stopped his attacks and murmured apathetically.

Tap, tap.

The magicians who were supplying magic power to the prison cell fainted one by one.

“Amazing. I feel like I’m in a dream.”

“A-As expected of the Immortal….”

Yoo Yeonha and England’s Prime Minister couldn’t hide their awe, while Rachel stood by with her mouth wide open.

Heaven-destroying natural disasters had just occurred inside a tiny, 30-square-meter cell. The Immortal’s power was even more awe-inspiring in person.

“External attacks seem to work, but it looks like indirect attacks from the outside aren’t enough to bring him down.”

“That was indirect…?”

Rachel swallowed her saliva at Chae Joochul’s casual words.

“Wouldn’t he have at least suffered mental damage?”

The Prime Minister asked carefully.

Chae Joochul knew that Toji had forgotten pain. Not even ‘imagined pain’ created from fear, which was far scarier than actual pain, existed in that monster’s mind.

“No. Besides that, where is the person who created this prison?”

Chae Joochul took interest in another matter. Although an external supply of magic power was needed, he had not seen an ability that could endure his power in a long time.

Rachel stepped up and explained, “It was created by a Player. She is gone now.”

“Gone? So she died?”

“…Pardon?”

Rachel thought Chae Joochul was joking. It was then that Rachel met Chae Joochul’s emotionless eyes. From the deep void in his eyes, Rachel felt a chill run down her back.

She squeezed out an answer.

“No, she, she went back to the Tower….”

Chae Joochul then turned away.

“Unless you want to release him from the prison, it looks like someone else will need to handle him. We will need someone who can stop him from regenerating.”

Chae Joochul stepped back with dignity. His words, ‘someone who can stop him from regenerating’, made everyone think of one Hero.

The Sword Saint, Kim Suho.

The man who achieved the greatest title for a swordsman while only being in his mid-twenties.

Knowing that Rachel was acquainted with him, England’s Prime Minister gave her a heartfelt look. It was then.

“There’s no need to call any brats, Old Man.”

A deep voice suddenly rang out.

He sounded like Chae Joochul, but his voice felt deeper and more sonorous.

“…?”

Chae Joochul revealed a hint of surprise as he turned to face the voice.

The government officials surrounding the area quickly parted when they met Chae Joochul’s gaze. Like Moses who split the Red Sea, the owner of the voice quickly revealed himself through the gap.

Dark blue eyes, long braided white hair, a scar on his eye, and wide shoulders with a shabby steel sword by his waist.

The man who appeared… was a legend everyone knew well.

It was an opponent Chae Joochul had not met in a long time.

“But I’m a bit tired from traveling….”

The man gave a profound smile.

Realizing who he was, Yoo Yeonha’s jaw dropped. The man in front of her was truly a legend.

“So I’ll personally deal with him tomorrow morning.”

‘Dresden’s Miracle’, where one man slaughtered ten thousand monsters; ‘Operation Krahan’, where a large Djinn group disappeared overnight… He was the legendary Hero behind numerous tales. Among the Nine Stars, he was known to be second only to Shin Myungchul.

‘Steel Spirit’ Heynckes had appeared in front of them.

Yoo Yeonha couldn’t maintain a straight face because of the shock.

“Heynckes.”

Chae Joochul called his name just as apathetically as before. Chae Joochul knew of the side-effect of Heynckes’ Gift, so he only gave him a dry look.

“Will you be able to do it?”

Heynckes answered easily, “…As an artifact of the past, it’s time for me to help the new generation.”

Objectively speaking, there was nothing special about Chae Joochul and Heynckes’ meeting as they both kept a set distance and only stared at each other.

But everyone else maintained silence as they stared at the two titans. To them, they felt like they were experiencing an important moment in history.

But no one dared to take out a camera to take photos. They simply stared at this once in a lifetime moment in a daze.

“…It’s been a while.”

Only one person managed to muster up enough courage to speak. It was a woman who came as Chae Joochul’s acquaintance.

“Nice to meet you, Lord Heynckes.”

She was the sole exception.

“My name is Yoo Yeonha, the Chief Strategic Officer of Essence of the Strait.”

**

[Inside Buckingham Palace]

Yoo Yeonha came to stay overnight in Buckingham Palace. It was, of course, due to Heynckes. To plan for their meeting the next day, Yoo Yeonha began to study German, German history, Heynckes’ life, and more. She fully employed Falling Blossom’s power to look for topics to talk about.

—Tok, tok.

While Yoo Yeonha was hard at work, knocking sounds rang out.

“Come in.”

The door opened as soon as Yoo Yeonha gave the permission. As she expected, Rachel carefully walked in. She put down a tray of red tea and dessert on the table.

“…Ah, thank you. I was feeling a bit tired.”

Yoo Yeonha smiled brightly. Rachel also smiled back and sat across from her. The two women leisurely enjoyed the sudden tea time.

Yoo Yeonha sipped on red tea while looking over documents. Rachel watched Yoo Yeonha work for thirty minutes or so before finally working up the courage to speak.

“Yeonha-ssi, this is about the guild alliance Essence of the Strait brought up.”

“….”

Yoo Yeonha looked up at Rachel without speaking.

Rachel became a bit nervous, but she was determined.

If the English Royal Court could form an alliance with Essence of the Strait, then the huge unrest the people of England were feeling would subside greatly. Even the Prime Minister who was trying to escape to Korea could change his mind.

“I was wondering if you would like to team up with our guild… We will do our best to meet any demands.”

“….”

Yoo Yeonha didn’t say anything, so Rachel quickly continued.

“We discovered several artifacts from the Middle Ages recently. If our guilds ally, they can be lent out to Essence of the Strait’s members… Ah, and Essence of the Strait can also use rights and interest we possess in Prestige….”

Rachel’s carefulness and Yoo Yeonha’s leisure began to lead to a negotiation. It was then.

Thud—!

The door suddenly shot open.

Rachel and Yoo Yeonha turned to the door without much thought.

“Haam… You were here?”

Standing there was Evandel, with her eyes half-closed.

“…!”

Startled, Rachel jumped up from her seat. Yoo Yeonha’s eyes also shot open.

“What?”

Yoo Yeonha had good memory.

But even if her memory was bad, she would have remembered that kid. She was that cute, like a fairy who came out of a story.

“…Wait.”

But the last time Yoo Yeonha had seen her, the child was with Kim Hajin.

“Ah!”

Rachel quickly ran towards the door and picked Evandel up.

“…Wait, wait, who’s that?”

Yoo Yeonha asked, but Rachel hid Evandel from sight with her back and shook her head.

“Huh? Oh, it’s nothing.”

“What? What do you mean, nothing? Who is she?”

“Nothing!”

Rachel didn’t have the confidence to explain Evandel to Yoo Yeonha. In the end, she quickly ran off.

“Where are you going!?”

Yoo Yeonha shot up and began to chase Rachel.

“Tell me who that is! Hold on a minute, I think I’ve seen her before in Seoul…!”

Tadadadat— Yoo Yeonha shouted as she ran across the hallway.

“Like I said, it’s nothing….”

Tadadadat— Rachel ran, almost in tears.

Yoo Yeonha knew that she couldn’t catch up to Rachel no matter how hard she ran, so she utilized the tools she had in her arsenal.

“If you don’t come back, there will be no alliance! I was going to do it, but not if you run away…!”

Even so, Rachel didn’t stop running away. In fact, she used the power of her elementals to quickly disappear from Yoo Yeonha’s sight.

“Haa, haa.”

Left in an empty hallway, Yoo Yeonha looked around her surroundings in a daze.

Rachel and the mysterious child were gone completely. Yoo Yeonha wiped the sweat that formed on her forehead.

“What the heck….”

She was left with many questions and doubts.

That day, bizarre chaos emerged in Yoo Yeonha’s head.

**

I returned to the Chameleon Troupe’s hideout with Cheok Jungyeong and five prisoners.

Koong!

Cheok Jungyeong threw the unconscious assassins on the floor.

“Why did you bring them back?”

A family of assassins, two in their thirties and three in their twenties.

I wanted to interrogate them since people I only knew about through my setting appeared in person.

But Cheok Jungyeong replied with a grin.

“To use for my training.”

“…Training?”

Though a bit stupid, it was a very Cheok Jungyeong-like answer.

The Chameleon Troupe’s hideout was built with magic engineering, so the exit was removable. Naturally, it was possible to lock someone up.

“Will you be fine?”

Cheok jungyeong grinned and smacked his chest.

“Of course! I’ve been bored, so it’s perfect. There’s Orden, but there’s time until I’ll get to fight him!”

Cheok Jungyeong granted the title, ‘powerful enemy’, to Orden.

But we had yet to even set a date for our battle. We only knew that a ‘spy’ who infiltrated his palace would let us know of a good time.

“These guys have a gift for making critical attacks. So I can use them to train how to avoid critical attacks.”

“Um… sure. But make sure to find out who’s behind them.”

“Yeah, yeah, don’t worry about that. Oh right, Boss imprisoned someone recently. Her name’s Jin Sahyuk. You know her, right?”

My eyes shot open. Jin Sahyuk?

“Jin Sahyuk and Boss? What happened?”

“Who knows? Boss said she’ll use the kid to lure in Bell. Mmmm~”

Cheok Jungyeong stretched.

I pondered.

Bell and Jin Sahyuk, Boss and Bell, and Boss and Jin Sahyuk.

I didn’t know what happened, but there was one thing I was sure of.

Given Bell’s personality (though I didn’t know much about him), it didn’t seem like he’d come save Jin Sahyuk.

“…Hm.”

After a light sigh, I asked Cheok Jungyeong.

“Where is she imprisoned?”

**

I came down to the lowest floor of Chameleon Troupe’s building. Rather than a prison, it was more like an undeveloped floor.

In this empty space, Jin Sahyuk was curled up like a shrimp with her hands and ankles restrained with magic power suppressors.

“….”

She looked feeble, like she hadn’t eaten food or drank water in days. She even had an blindfold on to hinder her vision.

What idiotic thing did she do this time to get herself in this situation?

Looking at her, I suddenly felt sympathy. It was a side-effect I developed after finding out about Kim Chundong’s past. Kim Chundong and Jin Sahyuk formed most of my recent worries.

“Tsk…”

Rather than that, why was someone with the highest potential in my novel getting thrashed around all the time?

“…Who is it!?”

Jin Sahyuk seemed to have heard me click my tongue as she gave a reaction. She raised her head to look at me, but she sighed after realizing the blindfold was still covering her vision.

“I-Is it Bell?”

Bell? Did she lose her intuition too after being locked up?

I approached her with a wry smile. Then, I put my hands on her blindfold.

“Uk.”

Jin Sahyuk trembled. But she seemed to have figured out my intent as she didn’t resist.

“Whew… It’s Bell, right?”

She let out a sigh of relief as I carefully lifted the blindfold.

...

Chapter 278. Commence (1)

I cautiously removed Jin Sahyuk’s blindfold. With the cloth blocking her sight gone, Jin Sahyuk slowly opened her eyes.

She frowned, blinded by the light, then she raised her head and looked at me.

“…You’re not Bell.”

She tilted her head, still in a daze. She sat motionless for the next three minutes.

I was the one who spoke first. With a sigh, I asked, “What are you doing here?”

“…”

Jin Sahyuk didn’t answer and only dropped her gaze to the floor. Her cheeks were slightly flushed from embarrassment.

“If you aren’t going to talk, I’m leaving.”

As I got up, Jin Sahyuk flinched. She bounced up desperately like a fish jumping out of water.

“Wait! Don’t leave!”

I stopped and looked down at Jin Sahyuk.

“Why?”

“…Release me.”

I scanned Jin Sahyuk carefully.

She was bound with ‘Magic Power Suppressors’, a powerful effective good from the Tower of Wish that suppressed all magic power.

“How did you get caught in the first place?”

“I….”

Jin Sahyuk opened her mouth as if she was about to say something but soon shook her head with a sigh.

“…I can’t tell you.”

“Then I can’t let you go either.”

“Why?”

Jin Sahyuk’s resentful glare landed on me.

Our fruitless conversation continued, when suddenly….

“She said she wanted to borrow you.”

I heard a new voice behind my back. It was Boss.

I turned around, slightly confused.

“Borrow me?”

“That’s right.”

Boss scowled at Jin Sahyuk.

“….”

Jin Sahyuk averted her gaze without a word.

It wasn’t too difficult to discern what had gone down between these two.

‘Jin Sahyuk thinks I’m Kim Chundong so she probably told Boss that she wants to take me to Akatrina, which led them to have a fight. Although, I’m not sure why Jin Sahyuk chose to announce her decision to Boss….’

“Hajin, she’s dangerous. She’s planning to kidnap you,” Boss said as she furtively stepped on Jin Sahyuk’s foot.

“Kuaak—” Jin Sahyuk screamed, but she didn’t forget to bite Boss’ shoe at the same time.

“As you can see, she’s vicious. You can’t set her free.”

Boss stared at me with a mysterious look. This time I could understand the meaning behind her gaze even without the help from the Magnifying Glass. She was worried for me.

“…”

I scratched the back of my neck awkwardly. Of course, I had no intention of returning to Akatrina with Jin Sahyuk.

However, I was destined to leave Boss one day.

Technically, I didn’t even exist in this world.

A bittersweet taste lingered in my mouth.

“Well, even if I do end up getting kidnapped, it sure isn’t going to be by her. You don’t have to worry-”

“You still can’t set her free. I have to go now because I have other business to take care of, but if this scoundrel isn’t here when I come back,” Boss looked at me sternly, “Bear in mind there won’t be any forgiveness even if it’s you.”

Boss warned coldly and left immediately.

‘Well, nothing I can do at this point.’

I shrugged my shoulders at Jin Sahyuk.

Jin Sahyuk also raised her head and looked at me.

She whispered, “Just let me go secretly.”

“Are you crazy?”

Jin Sahyuk frowned.

“…At least give me something to eat.”

“Eat?”

“Yeah. I’m starving.”

Right, since her magic power was sealed, it should be harder for her to withstand hunger and thirst.

“Fine. Give me a moment.”

I went upstairs to the kitchen. Cooking was easy thank to Dwarf’s Dexterity.

In 20 minutes, I finished cooking a pot of beef porridge and prepared jangjorim and kimchi as side dishes.

Sniff, sniff—

Jin Sahyuk was already enjoying the smell of the dish before I came down the stairs.

“Here.”

I put the tray down in front of her. But Jin Sahyuk only stared at it without laying a finger on it.

“What?”

“Untie me so that I can eat.”

“You know I can’t.”

“…What, so you expect me to lick it like a dog?”

Jin Sahyuk glared at me. As a former king, she wouldn’t dare endure such disgrace.

Left with no other option, I scooped the porridge with a spoon and offered it to her.

“Open wide.”

“…Fuck.”

Jin Sahyuk seemed to have realized that this was the best treatment she was goign to get as she swallowed the porridge without resistance.

However, the moment that the porridge slid down Jin Sahyuk’s throat….

“…!”

Jin Sahyuk’s eyes widened.

“Pfft.”

I let out a laughter as I had expected her to react this way.

Even the most expensive ingredients wouldn’t be able to recreate the amazing taste of my porridge.

The dish was the manifestation of perfection that only [Young Dwarf’s Dexterity] could create.

“It’s good, right?”

“I-It’s…. Give me more. I need to taste it thoroughly for an honest assessment.”

With a smile, I stuffed the porridge down Jin Sahyuk’s throat.

Jin Sahyuk soon lost all sense of shame.

“Give me that kimchi.”

“Jangjorim too.”

“Give me one more bowl.”

“More.”

“Hey, don’t you have any dongchimi?”

Jin Sahyuk ate like she had been starving for eons.

**

Meanwhile, around the same time, Rachel had evacuated to her room with Evandel.

Although her heart was still thumping from the earlier incident, she was relieved to see that Evandel had already fallen asleep in her arms.

“Phew….”

Rachel let out a sigh of relief.

She was sure Evandel was asleep when she left.

‘Did she wake up because I wasn’t by her side?’

A sense of pride swept through Rachel when she realized that, maybe, she had become important to Evandel. But it was quickly replaced by concern as she remembered what Kim Hajin and Ah Hae-In said to her.

They both had insisted to keep Evandel hidden from others for as long as they could. This was the reason why all royal servants had to swear under the ‘silent oath’.

Of course, Rachel could always argue that Evandel was her cousin or something…. But everything happened so fast and she didn’t want to lie to Yoo Yeonha.

Yoo Yeonha was dangerous because she could do anything for the honor and glory of her guild. Rachel didn’t want to expose Evandel to such an ambitionist.

But for some reason, it seemed that Yoo Yeonha already knew Evandel. Rachel couldn’t stop thinking about what Yoo Yeonha said about seeing Evandel in Seoul.

“Hmm….”

Rachel carefully placed Evandel on the bed.

Zzzz— Zzzz—

Now in a more comfortable posture, Evandel fell deeper into sleep. She seemed as lovely as always.

Putting aside all worries and concerns, Rachel lay beside Evandel and patted her.

“…Guild alliance.”

Yoo Yeonha’s words suddenly popped up in her mind, but Rachel managed to block it.

She didn’t want to use Evandel as a means for negotiation. Evandel was dear to her.

Rachel patted Evandel’s head until her breathing began to soften.

And soon enough, Rachel began to feel sleepy as well.

“…Haam.”

Rachel’s eyes closed and her hands stopped.

…The pair fell into a deep seep.

On the other hand, the victim(?), Yoo Yeonha, was unable to sleep.

“What was that?…”

Yoo Yeonha muttered as she twirled a pen between her fingers.

She had returned to her room after failing to locate Rachel.

The girl who came looking for Rachel earlier was most definitely the girl who was with Kim Hajin. So the most probable explanation at this point was….

“But that girl clearly doesn’t have Kim Hajin’s genes. She only looks like Rachel.”

“What is….”

Yoo Yeonha wrapped her head with her hands.

She couldn’t help but suspect that this all had something to do with Kim Hajin.

Thinking back now, Kim Hajin always wanted to help Rachel out in one way or another.

For example, the negotiation between Essential Dynamics and the British government months earlier was fundamentally the fruit of Kim Hajin’s efforts.

Then were Kim Hajin and Rachel really… Wait.

Then what about Chae Nayun?

“I don’t understand.”

Was Kim Hajin a womanizer who chased after girls at every chance he got?

‘No,’ She thought, ‘He may be a sociopath without empathy but he’s definitely not a player.’

Maybe it was a momentary mistake?

That made more sense. Anything could happen between a man and a woman on the spur of the moment.

“…Oh my god.”

Yoo Yeonha covered her hot, flushed cheeks with her hands.

“Oooh.”

‘So that means….’

The girl seemed to be about five years old at the least.

Which meant it must have happened when they were still in Cube….

“Oh god, I can’t believe him….”

Yoo Yeonha started to feel a sense of betrayal as her imagination intensified.

**

The next morning.

Rachel slowly opened her eyes. Evandel was already gone, probably having left for her morning meditation session with Ah Hae-In.

“Haam….”

Rachel stretched with a yawn.

—Tok, tok.

This knock was probably from her butler.

“I’m awake,” Rachel answered, and the old butler opened the door and came into her room.

“Were you able to get a full night's rest?”

“Yes. And Evandel is…?”

“Lady Ah Hae-In picked her up this morning for their morning meditation. Would you like a cup of tea?”

Rachel nodded and pulled herself out of bed.

“Yes, black tea, please.”

As soon as the butler clapped his hands, servants brought her the tea. Rachel combed her disheveled hair and sat at the table.

“Enjoy your tea.”

The butler left, and Rachel poured the tea out of the teapot into the cup in front of her.

Just as she was about to fight off her remaining drowsiness and begin yet another beautiful day with a sip of bittersweet tea-

—Excuse me, you can’t do this.

A small commotion occurred just outside her room.

—Stop!

—This place is off-limits to outsiders!

‘What’s happening?’

Curious, Rachel turned her head towards the hallway.

—What do you mean by off-limits? I’m the princess’ teacher and I need to speak to her right this moment!

It was then that she recognized the familiar voice.

Rachel flinched. Immediately, the door swung open and a woman entered the room.

“Ah~ I knew you’d be here, Rachel.”

“…!”

Rachel’s grip around the cup tightened the moment she saw the woman.

“How have you been?”

This woman was Rachel’s former teacher, the elementalist ‘Shin Yeohwa’.

Rachel suddenly felt dizzy.

All those horrible days she had spent with Shin Yeohwa unexpectedly emerged in her mind.

She had been beat up, insulted and humiliated for no good reason.

Rachel wanted to erase that portion of her past from her memory forever.

“Why haven’t you been keeping in touch? Do you know how much I missed you?”

However, despite the horrendous treatment she had received from her former teacher, Rachel chose not to take any action against Shin Yeohwa. It wasn’t just because she was afraid of Shin Yeohwa’s reputation as the Earth’s best elementalist. Rachel didn’t want to betray her teacher.

“Why won’t you answer me?”

Shin Yeohwa, oblivious to her former student’s generosity, took advantage of Rachel’s publicity and promoted herself as ‘Rachel’s Master’.

“Don’t you know better than to ignore your teacher?”

Shin Yeohwa gave a sly smile.

**

[Gangwondo, Underground Bunker]

Three weeks had passed since the start of the training camp.

Chae Nayun stayed awake all night again because of the memo Heynckes had left behind the day before.

—Oh, by the way, I met Kim Hajin last week. He seemed to be a feisty lad.

Chae Nayun couldn’t find the right words to answer him. She no longer remembered what she was supposed to feel about Kim Hajin. The only thing that she was sure about at this point was that she wanted to see him badly.

Chae Nayun spent the night in distress and morning came before she knew.

Tiriring-

Everyone got out of bed at the sound of alarm and stood in a line at the center of the bunker.

“Did you sleep well?”

Soon enough, Team Leader Yun Seung-Ah appeared.

This time she was accompanied by a rather unusual guest.

Spirit Speech Master Aileen.

With a stern look and a pair of short legs, Aileen stood beside Yun Seung-Ah.

Yun Seung-Ah looked down at Aileen with a mixture of emotions.

She let out a small sigh and began her speech, “So… today is the day that we begin our mission… Miss Aileen will explain the details.”

Surprised murmurs filled the bunker as no one had expected the mission to begin so abruptly.

Aileen explained, “My Team 1 and your Team 3 will enter Orden’s territory today. We’ve been keeping the exact date hidden for confidentiality, and I hope you understand.”

It was an astonishing and sudden declaration.

“But there’s no need to worry. Our first and foremost goal is to build an outpost. We’re simply setting up a place for us to eat, sleep, and rest while we fight Orden.”

Aileen took out a card from her pocket.

“This is a 7-star card called [Building Fortress].”

***

[Building Fortress] [7-star] Effective Good

- Instantly build a fortress: above the sea, beneath the earth, over a cliff, anywhere.

- The fortress possesses Lv.7 Defense and is equipped with a ‘portal’ that only the card owner’s allies can use.

***

“This card can be used to build a fortress anywhere. We’ll use it to build our underground outpost near Orden’s palace.”

Aileen stopped and laid out on the ground the various camping gears that had been reduced in size with magic engineering.

“All of you, take one each.”

Though they were still stunned by the sudden announcement, the Heroes quickly retrieved the gears from the ground just as they had been instructed to do.

“And now, I introduce you to the man who will help us travel to Orden’s territory.”

A dense fog rolled over the bunker the moment Aileen finished speaking. A man in a robe appeared from within the fog.

“…Nice to meet you. My name is ‘Rebé’.”

The man who introduced himself as ‘Rebé’—’Bell’—smiled at the Heroes. To Bell, the members of the Task Force were basically gold mines, destined to become leaders of the future.

“Is he an outsider?” Kim Suho asked, slightly suspicious.

Aileen answered briefly, “…Yes, he is.”

To be honest, Aileen was also suspicious of this outsider. She had hesitantly agreed to let him in on the mission only because the administration insisted that he was trustworthy.

“Ah, please, do not be worried. I am already under ‘Spirit Speech Seal’, as well as ‘Oath and Vow’.”

It was true. Not only did Bell sign all sorts of contracts, but he also agreed to be put under Aileen’s ‘Spirit Speech Seal’, which proved that Bell’s intentions were pure. He didn’t need to lie about Orden because his goals aligned with the government’s.

“Unni, Spirit Speech Seal is that thing where….”

“Yeah.”

Aileen nodded to Yun Seung-Ah.

“Even if this man has the intention of betraying us, it’s okay. His heart would burst and he’ll die a painful death with just one word from my mouth.”

Everyone was surprised. This meant that Bell had basically entrusted his life to Aileen.

“Well, in that case…”

Kim Suho nodded and stepped back.

“Thank you everyone, for trusting me.”

Bell spoke, trying keep his voice modulation in control.

“My role in this mission is very simple. I’m going to transport all of you to Orden’s territory using my Skill, ‘Mass Teleport’…. Well, I guess I shouldn’t waste any more of your time. Everyone, please gather around me.”

Chae Nayun, Kim Suho, Shin Jonghak, Yi Jiyoon, Yi Yeonghan and the remaining members of Team 3 hesitantly approached Bell.

“Please hold onto each other tightly so that you don’t end up outside the spell circle. Ah, but don’t look so nervous. You’ll be returning here as soon as you finish setting up the outpost.”

Bell released his magic power. Violet air currents swirled around Bell, creating a complicated geometric shape.

Bell shouted cheerfully, “Here we go~”

Guoooo….

Before long, the spell circle was completed and Bell’s Skill, ‘Mass Teleport’, was activated.

...

Chapter 279. Commence (2)

[Mass Teleport] brought the members of Team 3 to Orden’s territory. But when they opened their eyes, they didn’t see anyone from Team 1, including Aileen.

Only the members of Team 3 were on the vast field of Africa.

“…Eh?”

Team 3’s leader, Yun Seung-Ah, became a bit worried when a second flash of Mass Teleport occurred.

Shoooong….

A violet magic power lit up, transferring over others.

Aileen, Yi Yongha, Jin Seyeon, Nicholas, Parma, and Seo Youngji. Although Team 1 consisted of only these six Heroes, everyone other than Seo Youngji and Jin Seyeon were elites of the Temple of Justice.

Everyone from Team 3 except Shin Jonghak stared at them with widened eyes.

“Is everyone here?”

Aileen stepped up and checked the Heroes present. But for some reason, Aileen had an eyepatch over her left eye. This [Smart Eyepatch] was an effective good from the Tower, allowing complicated calculations and deductions to be made with ease.

“…Mm, great. Everyone’s here.”

After receiving the result from the eyepatch, Aileen smiled in satisfaction. Rebé approached Aileen and spoke in a soft voice.

“My role ends here but… if you would like, I can tag along.”

Aileen furrowed her brows.

“What help will you be to us?”

“I can carry your bags, for example. I’ve already made a vow, so you can order me around as you please. Think of me as your sla—”

“Hold on a minute.”

Aileen took out a radio. From what the Hero Association discovered, Orden had the ability to detect magic power within 500km of his palace. But because his detection ability was limited only to magic power, the higher-ups decided to use electronic equipment.

“This is Aileen, we’ve arrived safely.”

—We can hear you. This is Commander Yi Gongmyung.

Yi Gongmyung. His intelligence and strategic mind rivaled the level of a Gift, he became the Minister of National Defense at just 30 years old.

“What should we do next?”

—We deployed a drone and dug a tunnel. It should be nearby, so please confirm it.

“A tunnel?”

Aileen looked around.

Indeed, there was an entrance covered in leaves and rocks.

“I found it.”

—Go inside. Orden and his servants’ magic power detection becomes weak underground. But for everyone’s safety, don’t use magic power until I give the signal.

“Got it.”

Aileen turned around and faced the others.

“Follow me, everyone!”

Team 1 and Team 3 began their march, everyone following behind Aileen.

The tunnel dug by the drone was dark and deep.

Click—

Aileen turned on a flashlight and lit the pathway.

“…Hey, Kim Suho, what’s this?”

Chae Nayun tapped on Kim Suho’s shoulder.

“I don’t know, but we’ve been expecting something like this, right?”

Kim Suho smirked and answered. Chae Nayun also put on a thin smile.

“I guess so. I don’t mind. It’s fun.”

“Same.”

“Don’t lie.”

“I’m not.”

Tak, tak- Only the sound of footsteps rang out.

Shin Jonghak cut in between Chae Nayun and Kim Suho, and Chae Nayun walked while playing a mini-game on her phone.

Chae Nayun, Shin Jonghak, and Kim Suho walked forward side-by-side.

The tunnel ran down diagonally until it became flat at a certain point.

“How have you guys been?”

As the tension was starting to die down, a voice suddenly rang out.

Kim Suho turned around in slight surprise and saw Jin Seyeon who was smiling brightly.

“Ah, Senior.”

“I-It’s been a while.”

“…Hello.”

Kim Suho, Chae Nayun, and Shin Jonghak answered respectively.

“I wanted to see you all.”

Jin Seyeon, who felt uncomfortable in Team 1’s stiff atmosphere, liked being with her juniors more. She first tried to estimate Kim Suho’s strength. She didn’t need to fight him, only needing to look into his eyes. As expected of the man who recently gained the title ‘Swordsman of Wish’, Kim Suho had gotten strong enough to make Jin Seyeon smile.

“Um, Senior, who’s that?”

Kim Suho pointed at ‘Bera’ and asked.

“Mmm—“

“Think of me as a hidden powerhouse.”

Bera answered before Jin Seyeon could say anything. Clearly, Bera had excellent hearing.

“…A hidden powerhouse?”

Seeing Chae Nayun frown, Bera grinned.

“Yes, there are many hidden powerhouses in this world. Heynckes who appeared once again and Black Lotus, for example. Ah, Orden would also be considered one.”

Kim Suho’s eyes slightly widened.

“You know Black Lotus?”

“Mm… Maybe I’m Black Lotus.”

“No, that’s impossible.”

Aileen, who was listening in on the conversation, spoke firmly.

“Black Lotus isn’t so frivolous.”

“…Kuhum.”

Aileen’s sharp tone turned the atmosphere awkward.

Tzzzt— Tzzt—

At that moment, Aileen’s radio turned on.

—If you haven’t been discovered yet, everything is going as planned. Walk 200km from there. You can use buff magic if you want.

“200km…”

Aileen turned around. Yi Jiyoon and Parma were the group’s supporters, but because Parma was a healer, buffing the team was Yi Jiyoon’s job.

“Supporter Yi Jiyoon, prepare [Haste].”

“Yes!”

Yi Jiyoon carefully took out a bow. Then, she weaved ‘buff arrows’ with her magic power.

“One for each.”

“…Can’t you do it using a spell or something?”

Aileen, who didn’t even like syringes, wasn’t happy to be pierced by arrows.

“It’s more effective this way.”

“…Tsk. Go easy.”

Aileen closed her eyes reluctantly, and Yi Jiyoon shot her arrows. Although being shot came with a slight pain, it was more than bearable.

“Let’s go.”

With Yi Jiyoon’s ‘Haste’ buff, the group moved quickly enough to leave behind afterimages. Although 200km couldn’t be traveled easily by walking, their superhuman physical abilities heightened with Haste let them accomplish it in 3 hours.

—This is Yi Gongmyung. If everyone has arrived at the destination, use the card.

They arrived at a spacious area. Rather than a pathway, it was more like a room.

“Understood.”

Aileen took out the fortress card as ordered.

“We will be using it now.”

7-star card, [Building Fortress]. Aileen infused her magic power into it without hesitation.

“I want a tough fortress capable of holding 300 people.”

Shoong—

The moment Aileen’s Spirit Speech was added to the card, the card turned into magic power and seeped into the earth.

And that was it.

There was no rumbling or further undulation of magic power. Only a faint wind blew before space began to warp.

Tough iron fencing rose up from the ground, while dozens of small barracks appeared inside. A headquarters building was constructed in the middle.

“Wow… it’s a real fortress.”

“Amazing.”

Kim Suho and Chae Nayun murmured in awe. But they weren’t the only ones who were surprised. Even Aileen who activated the card stared at the fortress in shock.

“A-Alright, let’s go inside and unpack. This will be our base of operation for the upcoming Orden Assassination Mission.”

Aileen announced proudly as she walked into the fortress.

**

The fortress had 99 barracks. Considering the number of Heroes that would need to use the base, three people had to share one. As such, Chae Nayun, Yi Jiyoon, and Jin Seyeon came to use the same barracks.

Inside the petite log cabin, the three women unpacked their belongings leisurely.

“Hm? Nayun-ssi?”

At that moment, Jin Seyeon called Chae Nayun.

“Yes?”

Chae Nayun, who was changing her clothes, tilted her head.

“You dropped this… what is it?”

Jin Seyeon picked up a piece of paper that fell on the ground. It was wrinkly from being kept in her pocket all this time.

“Oh, that?”

Chae Nayun smiled bitterly as she received the [Invitation Letter to the Loveroom].

“It’s an effective good that can summon a person.”

“…Summon?”

“Yes. I just need to know the person’s Tower nickname.”

Hearing this, Yi Jiyoon cut in.

“Wow, really? Who are you going to summon with that?”

“Hm? Oh, I have someone in mind.”

Extra 7. Chae Nayun immediately thought of her game master, who saved her when she was about to die inside the Tower. Although a couple years had passed since she obtained the summoning item, she didn’t have the chance to use it.

“I think I’ll use it soon.”

Chae Nayun planned to use it before fighting Orden. After all, it would be wasted if she died.

Meanwhile, Jin Seyeon looked at the summoning paper with sparkling eyes.

“It’s a great item. I’d love to have one too. Ah, do you want to exchange it with this card?”

Jin Seyeon took out a card.

***

[A Thousand-day Wait] [6-star]

—Can be used 1000 days after acquiring it. After this card is activated, you will meet someone you want coincidentally the next day.

***

Chae Nayun read the item description then quickly shook her head.

“Nah, I have to wait a thousand days to use it. That’s terrible.”

“No, no, think about it. It’s better since you don’t need to know your target’s Player name.”

“It’s fine. I already know who I’m going to summon.”

Chae Nayun pushed the card away. Jin Seyeon pouted then put the card back into her pocket.

“Who are you going to summon? Can you tell us his Player name? Let’s hear it.”

Jin Seyeon narrowed her eyes at Chae Nayun. Yi Jiyoon also stared at her with eyes full of anticipation.

Of course, Yi Jiyoon already knew who Chae Nayun wanted to summon. It had to be Kim Hajin.

“Technically, I don’t know who he is either… Ah, you might know, Senior, since you’re a gosu.”

Chae Nayun cleared her throat then carefully brought up a name.

“Extra 7… Have you heard of him?”

“Mm… He does sound familiar….”

Jin Seyeon furrowed her brows and fell into thought. Chae Nayun focused her attention on Jin Seyeon, hoping for an answer. After all, Jin Seyeon was a famous Ranker inside the Tower of Wish.

Neither Jin Seyeon nor Chae Nayun paid any attention to Yi Jiyoon.

However…

“…?!”

Yi Jiyoon found the answer easily. She had a huge hint.

The nickname ‘Extra 7’ and what Kim Hajin secretly said to her when he came to cure Chae Nayun’s curse.

—Tell her that an extra came to help.

“…Gulp.”

The question that was lingering in her mind ever since that day was finally answered.

‘So that’s what he meant by extra…’ Yi Jiyoon swallowed hard.

“Haha, sorry, I’m not sure. I’ll try to find out later.”

Jin Seyeon scratched her head and laughed.

“Ah, it’s fine. He likes to keep his identity a secret, so it’s not all that surprising.”

Chae Nayun waved her hands.

“….”

Yi Jiyoon stared at them with a wry smile before heading out of the barracks.

—Ah, why don’t you summon him now?

—Eh? Ah~ no, that’s a bit… haha, I want to, but we’re in the middle of a top-secret mission.

—I’m kidding, of course. But what are you going to say to him when you meet him?

—Nothing much. I just have a few questions to ask him, but more importantly, I want to thank him. He saved my life, you see.

Yi Jiyoon went to find Shin Jonghak, leaving behind Chae Nayun and Jin Seyeon.

**

[England, Buckingham Palace]

As the sun was rising from the east, many spectators were already gathered around the ‘Illusory Prison’ entrapping Toji.

The Prime Minister, Vice-Minister, their secretaries, Princess Rachel, Yoo Yeonha, etc… Everyone except Chae Joochul and Heynckes were present, waiting for Heynckes who declared he would kill Toji.

“Hey, who was that kid from yesterday? Why won’t you answer me?”

Yoo Yeonha nudged Rachel who was standing next to her. But Rachel maintained a thick face and replied shamelessly.

“What do you mean?”

“…What do you mean? Is that all you have to say? You’re joking, right?”

“Huh?”

Rachel’s innocent face dumbfounded Yoo Yeonha even more.

“Wow, look at you. Did you lose your memory?”

In truth, Rachel wasn’t in any state to deal with Yoo Yeonha. She already had a headache from ‘Shin Yeohwa’ who made her nest in her bedroom.

“Um… I’m not sure what you mean….”

“Excuse me! Don’t you want to form an alliance?!”

“Aa! Lord Heynckes is coming out!”

Rachel quickly pointed to the distance.

Tak, tak—

Like she said, Heynckes was approaching the crowd.

Yoo Yeonha decided to put her suspicion aside and ran up to Heynckes.

“Lord Heynckes, I’m Yoo Yeonha. I introduced myself to you yesterday. How are you feeling today?”

Yoo Yeonha spoke in German. Heynckes seemed happy as his eyebrows danced furtively.

“You’re Yoo Jinwoong’s daughter. I’m fine. Your German is excellent.”

“Haha, yes, I enjoy German culture.”

“Oh, do you now?”

“Yes, German beer is the best in the world.”

“Hmmm~”

Yoo Yeonha showed off the German skills she acquired through her crash course last night. Heynckes talked to her in satisfaction as he walked towards the Illusory Prison.

“It’s time for business. We can talk later.”

Heynckes stopped their conversation.

“Yes, thank you.”

Satisfied with the result she got, Yoo Yeonha backed off.

Crack, crack—

Heynckes loosened his neck and shoulder muscles.

“Now… let’s do this.”

“Lord Heynckes, we have a buff magician ready.”

“That’s unnecessary.”

The Prime Minister quickly suggested the use of a buff magician, but Heynckes declined and took out his steel sword.

He had already finished his preparations. Although his body was no longer what it used to be, he honed himself last night, and his resonance with his steel sword was clear.

That was enough for him.

Chwiik—

Hyenckes swung his sword, unleashing his magic power at the same time.

The Illusory Prison shattered. The steel magic power spread out in all directions and formed a new prison, one that encased Hyenckes and Toji inside.

“…What?”

Toji, who was asleep, woke up with a dazed look. He noticed that his surroundings had changed.

“Wha…”

Toji got up, feeling curious. Heynckes swung his sword, piercing Toji’s chest.

“Ak.”

Toji screamed and stepped backwards. He frowned and glared at Heynckes. Pain angered Toji.

“You, kill.”

Rocks crumbled from Toji’s body, which then shot towards Heynckes. But mere rocks couldn’t touch Heynckes. In terms of compatibility, Heynckes’ ‘steel’ displayed absolute superiority against Toji’s ‘earth’.

“You! Kill!”

Seeing that long-ranged attacks were ineffective, Toji began to swing his fists.

Koong—! Koong—! Koong—!

But Hyenckes easily avoided Toji’s inexperienced attacks and countered at the right time. Wounds began to appear on Toji’s body.

“I, no pain.”

Even so, Toji stood unperturbed. He had long forgotten about pain. He believed his body could regenerate itself endlessly, and thus had no fear.

However…

“…?”

Toji soon realized that his body wasn’t moving as he wanted it to.

His arms felt heavy, and his chest stuffy.

It was as if the soil making up his body was hardening.

Toji had no choice but to stop attacking.

“What?”

“Dull little rascal, you just realized?”

Heynckes grinned.

“Real…ize?”

“Steel Transformation. That’s what you’re experiencing. I injected my magic power into your mind.”

Toji’s body was made of earth, and metal defeated earth. It wasn’t hard for Heynckes to inject his magic power into Toji’s body.”

“You also caught the symptoms killing my body.”

The magic power of steel devoured Toji’s body of earth, and steel transformation quickly took place.

“This….”

Toji could no longer move. He stared at his body, which was solidifying and becoming metallic.

“…What an anticlimactic end.”

Heynckes felt Toji’s final moments were no different than his own. He knew he would meet the same end one day.

“It’s hard to see it any longer.”

Heynckes raised his sword. Like a wind-up doll that stopped functioning, Toji stood still with his head facing down.

“…Haa.”

After a sigh, Heynckes’ steel sword swung down.

**

[Africa – Orden’s Territory]

Late afternoon of early winter, in the African continent filled with monsters, I arrived in Orden’s territory along with Spartan.

“Black Lotus. I just arrived.”

It was to accomplish the secret mission assigned by the Hero Association to the Chameleon Troupe – ‘Spy Retrieval’.

—Yes, confirmed.

The commander of the mission, Yi Gongmyung, answered from the radio.

He was a character I created, a genius in tactical warfare and strategy, so I had confidence in his abilities.

—I’ll send the signal to the spy soon.

I didn’t know how, but he managed to plant a spy in Orden’s territory. The Chameleon Troupe was tasked with retrieving him safely. The reward was, as expected, an astronomical amount of money and the cancelation of the bounty placed on them.

There was no reason not to accept.

“What comes after the signal?”

—You can go to the fortress we prepared underground.

“…Fortress?”

Underground fortress. The unexpected phrase surprised me.

—Yes, we prepared a fortress to use as our base camp. It was prepared in secret, so I’m afraid I can’t tell you too much about it.

“….”

Well, nothing was really impossible in this world. I wouldn’t be surprised if Atlantis existed too.

“Understood. Contact me after signaling your spy.”

—Yes, understood.

As soon as the communication cut off, a beeping signal arrived.

It was a Morse code signaling a coordinate.

...

Chapter 280. Commence (3)

Beep— Beep—

Orden Spy Retrieval Mission. The Association needed the strongest and the stealthiest member of the Chameleon Troupe for this mission they named ‘Sunrise’. Boss was the most suitable member, of course, but the reason I volunteered in her place was simple.

It wasn’t just because I could turn back time and Boss couldn’t.

I was worried about her.

It was a strange feeling.

I didn’t want to see her get hurt.

Beep— Beep—

Boss must have thought the same thing. Before I came here, we had a little argument over who would participate in this mission.

I won in the end, but… Boss was probably watching me from somewhere right now.

Beep— Beep—

I took out the [Mysterious Magnifying Glass] again, which allowed me to identify other people’s emotions and weaknesses. Boss’ emotions that I witnessed the other day continued to linger in my mind.

“Haa….”

I heaved a sigh.

I suddenly remembered that it had been 8 years since I first woke up in this world.

That’s enough time to graduate from both middle and high school.

More than half of those years, I spent with Boss.

Beep— Beep—

Over the years, through all the laughter we shared, she changed me and I changed her. She had become close to me before I knew it.

“…Yi Byul.”

I muttered her name.

It was then that I realized this could be an interesting pun.

‘Yi Byul (Separation) had become close to me before I knew it.’

Beep— Beep.

My thoughts were starting to get off topic when the Morse code finally stopped.

I ceased thinking and turned my attention to the screen which displayed a pair of numbers.

[7.273853, 20.141379]

Converted to latitude and longitude, the result was: [7º16’25.9”N 20º08’29.0”E].

These coordinates, according to the map… was in the middle of Orden’s palace.

“…What the.”

The coordinates were pointing to the center of Orden’s palace.

Well, to be fair, this mission wouldn’t have come with such great rewards if it was easy.

I picked up the radio and whispered, “I received the coordinates.”

—Roger that. Contact us after rescuing our agent. Also, please wear the camera we gave you. After we confirm that our agent is safe, we’ll let you know the location of the underground fortress.

The radio stopped there, and I took out the [Book of Truth] to make sure all of this wasn’t a trap.

My question: ‘Is this mission a facade for capturing the Chameleon Troupe?’

The answer: ‘No.’

“That was a waste.”

Though it sounded simple, the question actually took up two streaks of Stigma, because it required an understanding of human psychology and its structure. Fortunately, thanks to the Orb of Regeneration, it would take only three hours to fully recharge Stigma.

“Mmm~”

I stretched before I began the mission.

I put on some armor and other equipment I brought with me.

First was the carbon fiber armor reinforced with magic, rare ores, and enchantment — the [Black Lotus Uniform].

***

[Black Lotus Uniform] [Masterpiece] [Composite Attribute]

A masterpiece born of great dexterity. When you look at this armor, you can’t help but admire the craftsmanship of the Dwarves, the ‘creation race’.

「Defensive power — 7/10」

「High-rank Shock Absorption」

「High-rank Magic Power Circulation」

「High-rank Physical Strength Enhancement」

「High-rank Magic Power Reinforcement」

「Pinnacle-rank Instant Acceleration」

***

Even though this uniform weighed as light as a t-shirt, it had the sturdiness of a military tank. In addition, I granted it four ‘high-rank’ and one ‘pinnacle-grade’ enchants through Four-colored Enchant.

I put extra effort into the last option, 「Pinnacle-grade Instant Acceleration」.

“I’ll try it out today.”

A while ago, Boss severed one of Kurukuru’s wings. I ground it into powder and used it as material for Four-colored Enchant. As a result, I was able to reproduce Kurukuru’s speed, though only for a moment.

After the great [Black Lotus Uniform] was the [Black Lotus Robe], which was meant to be worn over the uniform.

My creativity was at its limit, so I ended up naming all my equipment after ‘Black Lotus’.

Somehow their names made them feel more luxurious.

***

[Black Lotus Robe] [Luxury] [Multiple Attributes]

A masterpiece born of great dexterity. When you look at this robe, you can’t help but admire the craftsmanship of the Dwarves, the ‘creation race’.

「Defensive power — 5/10」

「High-rank Shock Absorption」

「High-rank Concealment ∙ Stealth」

「High-rank Anti-Magic Force」

***

Not only did the robe come with a stealth function, but it was also equipped with an ‘anti-magic power’ function, making me immune to almost all petty spells.

Furthermore, I also brought the [Black Lotus Walker], which increased my speed, and the [Black Lotus Wrist Protector], which increased the power of my arrows.

Click— Click—

I was now dressed from head to toe in the complete set of ‘Black Lotus attire’.

Lastly, I put the invisibility cloak over Spartan who was sitting on my shoulder.

“Are you ready?”

—Pururu.

Now fully grown, Spartan was as big as the length of my forearm.

“Let’s go rescue that agent.”

—Pururu.

Spartan was already aware of the coordinates. He closed his eyes and started shaking.

Soon, Spartan’s Authority ‘Long-ranged Teleportation’, which allowed for instant travel over a long distance, activated.

When I opened my eyes again, I was in front of Orden’s palace.

“Okay, Spartan, you should head back now.”

—Pururu?

Spartan shook his head, but this place was too dangerous for him. One hit in the wrong spot and he could die.

I didn’t want to risk losing Spartan, so I forcefully sent him away.

After I made sure Spartan left— I turned on the camera I received from the Association, which was hanging at the end of a necklace around my neck.

“This is Black Lotus. I turned the camera on. Can you see?”

—Yes. Thank you for your cooperation. Please capture the palace as much as possible….

**

Meanwhile, Aileen created an island of her own inside the commander’s tent of the underground fortress. She built walls with boxes of snacks from all around the world and placed cute stuffed animals here and there for decoration.

“Mm~ Mmm~”

The combination of snacks, a penguin plush, and a shark plush was indeed beautiful.

“Aren’t you guys the cutest~?”

Some people might criticize Aileen for being so laid-back during a serious mission, but this was how she always was.

Aileen never had the chance to experience real fear because she had been incredibly powerful since she was a child. She was always first place, revered by all. Many people expected her to become the strongest Hero in history.

However, as Aileen grew stronger, she became lonelier.

To Aileen, who became a High-rank Hero at the tender age of thirteen, ‘friends’ were nothing more than a fantasy. Aileen turned to these stuffed animals to soothe her loneliness.

A penguin with glasses and a baby shark that sang songs.

“Huhu….”

She took a step back to examine the room she decorated. The longer she saw it, the more satisfied she became.

‘Now this is worth willing to save the world for,’ Aileen nodded her head in satisfaction when suddenly…

Tok, tok—

Someone knocked on her door. Aileen flinched.

“Guys, go hide for a minute.”

Aileen whispered, and her Spirit Speech activated right away.

Sssss….

Spirit Speech descended from the ceiling like a powder and concealed the animals from view.

“Okay, come in.”

As the door opened, Aileen returned to her chair and took out her laptop. She even started typing to pretend she was working.

“Oh, what are these? There’s a ton of snacks here.”

Aileen recognized the guest’s voice right away.

It was Jin Seyeon.

“I’m not going to give you any, so go awa…?”

Aileen turned around, declining Jin Seyeon’s request in advance.

But Jin Seyeon wasn’t alone. She was with Chae Nayun.

Chae Nayun scratched the back of her neck nervously and bowed.

“Haha…. How are you, Captain Aileen? It’s me, Chae Nayun.”

“…Who are you? Where’s your team leader? What’s Yun Seung-Ah doing right now?”

“She’s training with Kim Suho.”

“…She’s flirting during a serious mission?”

Tzzt— Tzzt—

The moment Aileen frowned, the radio began crackling again. This time, a window popped up on her laptop screen. It was a video call.

—I have been informed that you finished setting up the fortress.

Yi Gongmyung’s face appeared on the screen.

“Yup, we did. What’s next?”

—We’ve got a plan going on our side currently. Soon, the person we hired will be rescuing our spy from Orden.

The Association had dispatched a spy into Orden’s territory about three months ago. They were able to win over a few people whom Orden had been trying to recruit.

“…Hired?”

—Yes. He’s skilled enough to break in unnoticed.

Aileen wasn’t convinced. The Association had deployed spies many times, but Orden had uncovered them all.

“Wait, are you sure that the spy’s trustworthy? What if he betrays us?”

—You can trust him.

The problem was the ‘vow’ that all spies had to take. This vow served as a safety net to prevent spies from turning on the Association. However, Orden possessed the ability to discern the difference in magic power caused by said vow. So, the spy this time was sent in without a vow, oath, or even a seal.

“…Well, I guess I have no choice but to trust him. How’s the mission going?”

—The rescue agent departed a few moments ago.

“And who is this rescue agent?”

—It’s someone you all know well.

Though Yi Gongmyung’s voice was full of confidence, his answer wasn’t enough to satisfy Aileen.

Aileen folded her arms with a frown.

“What’s his name?”

She asked again, and this time, Yi Gongmyung was straightforward.

—’Black Lotus’.

“…What?! Black Lotus?”

“What? For real?”

Not only Aileen but also Jin Seyeon and Chae Nayun were surprised.

—Yes, we entrusted Black Lotus with the mission to rescue the spy.

“What, are you serious?”

—Why would I lie about it?

“Uh…. Kuhum. No wonder that old geezer from the Association was brimming with confidence.”

Yi Yukho, the current chairman of the Association. When Aileen met him a week ago to discuss the current mission, that old, bald codger had told her not to worry.

“Black Lotus seems like a safe bet, as long as he doesn’t betray us.”

Though she sounded calm on the outside, Aileen was quite surprised. She never imagined the Association would hire Black Lotus. The present circumstance reminded her once again of the grave importance of their mission.

—Right. Black Lotus is currently heading towards…. Ah, he turned the camera on.

“Camera? Please show us!”

Jin Seyeon shouted out of surprise. Chae Nayun also pushed her head towards the laptop screen.

“Ugh, get out of my way, all of you! Hey, do you even know who Black Lotus is?”

Aileen placed her hand on Chae Nayun’s cheek and pushed her away.

“Of course I do, though I’ve never met him in person.”

“Then you don’t really know him. Move!”

—I’ll share the view of Black Lotus’s camera with you.

Yi Gongmyung turned on the view that was connected to Black Lotus’ camera.

Pat! With a tiny flash of light, the screen switched to a view of Orden’s palace.

—This is Black Lotus’ point of view. Coordinates are being updated in real time, so please assist him if the situation gets out of hand.

“Okay, okay.”

Aileen, Chae Nayun, and Jin Seyeon all gathered around the screen.

At first, Black Lotus seemed to be wandering around the palace aimlessly.

Then, suddenly, he rushed to the gate at the speed of light.

“Wow! Oh wow, he’s so freaking fast. Er, I mean… he’s really fast.”

Chae Nayun was thoroughly impressed with Black Lotus’ speed. But realizing that her language wasn’t appropriate given the situation, Chae Nayun slapped her mouth with her hand in embarrassment.

“You’re right, he’s very fast. He… seems to have gotten stronger.”

Jin Seyeon muttered. She wasn’t at all aware that the increase in Black Lotus’ speed was due to the equipment he had on.

Aileen also nodded in agreement.

“He moves like lightning.”

“…It’s almost too pretentious for an archer.”

Suddenly, they heard an unfamiliar voice.

—I’ve entered Orden’s palace.

It came from the laptop. It was Black Lotus’ voice.

At that moment, as he turned a corner, Black Lotus spotted a humanoid monster.

The monster seemed to be a guard on patrol. Black Lotus quickly hid behind a wall.

“…!”

“Look!”

The trio flinched in surprise.

—A monster is coming this way. I’ll dispose of him.

But Black Lotus was calm. He took out his bow and positioned an arrow against it. In the next moment, something mysterious happened.

Chwaaa—

The monster was definitely standing on the right side of the corner. However, Black Lotus aimed his arrow straight ahead. The arrow flew in a straight line, before suddenly warping to the right.

Crack—!

An impossible attack from a blind spot.

Naturally, it was unavoidable, and the humanoid monster fell to the ground after the arrow pierced his neck.

“That arrow just bent on its own. I’ve seen him do that before too,” Aileen muttered, pointing at the screen.

“Oh, you’re right. It wasn’t even a magic arrow. Interesting…” Chae Nayun also chimed in but stopped when she suddenly felt a sense of déjà vu.

‘A self-bending arrow. Where have I seen that before…?’

“His skill is almost god-like.”

Jin Seyeon was also intrigued by Black Lotus’ skill.

It was then.

“What’s going on here?”

The door swung open and Yun Seung-Ah entered the tent.

And she wasn’t alone. Kim Suho, her training partner, was also with her.

“Shhh. Be quiet. We’re watching Black Lotus right now.”

Yun Seung-Ah widened her eyes at Aileen’s remark.

Kim Suho couldn’t help but shout out in surprise.

“Black Lotus?”

“Yeah, we recruited him for the mission. He’s on our side for now. How’s that? Our connections are pretty amazing, huh?”

Aileen smirked.

As a foe, Black Lotus was fearsome; but as a friend, he was more dependable than anyone else.

Aileen knew how annoying Black Lotus could be from the time he blocked the bridge on the 8th floor of the Tower of Wish. But this time he was on her side and there was nothing to be afraid of.

“Oh… let me see. I want to see too.”

Yun Seung-Ah and Kim Suho joined the trio.

Though the tent became a little cramped for space, there was still enough room for everyone.

“What? Black Lotus?”

However, this wasn’t the end.

Suddenly the entire fortress started to buzz with voices, probably because of Kim Suho’s shout out from earlier.

“Where~?”

“Did you just say Black Lotus?”

More and more people started to pour in, and soon enough, Aileen’s tent was filled well beyond its maximum capacity.

“Dammit, I can’t see! Get lost, all of you!”

The tiny commander— Aileen yelled in annoyance.

But no one seemed to pay attention to her. Rather, they pushed Aileen away and nestled in front of the screen.

“Heh~ So this is from Black Lotus’ point of view? I was actually really curious about him. I’m going to watch how he plays~”

Nicholas from the Temple of Justice seemed especially excited.

This was due to the recently formed rivalry between the Temple of Justice and the Chameleon Troupe as the latter began to gain recognition among the public.

—I believe the spy is in a different building.

At that moment, Black Lotus spoke again.

He had just entered the palace. The inside was very spacious and filled with several different buildings.

—I’ll head there right away.

Black Lotus rushed towards one of the buildings.

But the scene that appeared on the screen next was simply absurd.

“Huh… that’s… a lot of monsters.” Jin Seyeon muttered.

Just as she said, the building was fiercely guarded. It was apparent even from afar.

There were at least a hundred monsters on land and a dozen in the sky.

—Can you make it?

Yi Gongmyung asked Black Lotus. He was worried because he hadn’t expected there to be this many guards.

—….

There was a short silence, followed by a burst of small laughter.

—Piece of cake.

The screen changed swiftly.

Black Lotus was as fast as lightning but as silent as wind.

In only a second or so, Black Lotus had moved to a completely different location.

“Ooh~ Look at him go….”

Nicholas licked his lips with a grin.

“He’s really, really fast.”

“And he doesn’t make any sound when he moves.”

Yun Seung-Ah and Kim Suho also voiced their opinions.

The audience(?) gathered in the commander’s tent admired every move Black Lotus made.

The first mission finally began.

...

Chapter 281. Commence (4)

Orden’s mansion looked very luxurious on the outside. I didn’t know how Orden learned to construct such a building, but I was impressed nonetheless.

—Can you make it?

A worried voice flowed out from the radio as I examined the mansion.

“Piece of Cake.”

I activated the [Pinnacle-rank Instant Acceleration] attached to my suit.

“…!”

My body moved much faster than I expected, at a speed far beyond that of sound. I knew I couldn’t control this speed as it was.

So I activated [Bullet Time].

Instantly, the world around me slowed down. I moved like the wind and made it inside the mansion in no time.

—…Successful infiltration confirmed.

‘Wow, that surprised me. That was some crazy speed.’

I calmed myself down and looked around, taking in my surroundings. The walls became transparent and I could see the entire mansion at a glance.

The number of humans in this building was… 33 in total, including Park Hanho, a former member of the Temple of Justice, and his revived daughter.

Park Hanho was reading his daughter a book. It was a surprisingly peaceful and humanly scene, which was a strange thing to say considering both were still humans.

‘More importantly, where is the spy?’

I turned my head slowly, searching for the spy.

As I scanned the rooms one by one, I discovered a likely candidate in the guest room on the 5th floor.

It was a woman. Her eyes kept wandering nervously.

There was a machine used to send the Morse codes at the foot of her bed.

“I think I just found the spy. Please confirm.”

I used [Pinnacle-rank Instant Acceleration] again.

Each floor was crawling with monsters, but I was confident they wouldn’t recognize me even as I pass by them, just as I was unaware of Kurukuru’s presence in the past.

Chwaaaa—

I arrived at the guest room on the 5th floor at the speed of light.

I appeared like the wind, quite literally.

“…Ah!”

The woman shook in surprise at my sudden entrance.

Her strawberry blonde hair and long arms and legs stood out.

She swallowed hard as she looked at me.

“….”

I waited for the confirmation in silence.

—Yes, she’s the one.

“…Hello.”

At that moment, the woman spoke.

“My name is Rumi.”

She seemed to have calmed down and even offered me her hand.

I examined the woman.

For whatever reason, I felt like I’d seen her before….

—You may use the [Return Scroll] now.

But now was not the time to dwell on it.

“Do you have any belongings?”

Rumi nodded.

“I have them with me already. I brought my ‘Inventory’ from the Tower.”

“If you say so.”

I took out the [Return Scroll].

Then, just as I was about to tear it in half…

“Hi~”

A cold, unfamiliar voice suddenly approached me like a blade.

I tore the scroll without even looking back.

Chwaaak—!

The sharp sound of paper tearing rang out.

“Huhu. Where do you think you’re going?”

However, the scroll failed to activate due to obstructive magic power.

I turned around with a sigh of annoyance.

A humanoid monster who looked like a giant peacock stood before my eyes.

“Good thing I decided to act on my hunch~♪ I knew you were a traitor~♪”

From her appearance and the tone of her voice, I could tell this monster was female.

I frowned.

“…Who are you?”

“Mm… That’s none of your business~”

The humanoid monster suddenly began to sing.

“Here is the inescapable mystery….”

Her voice was mesmerizing and her rhythm was perfect. Her song spread abnormal magic power into the surroundings.

The magic power melted the room and reshaped our surroundings into what looked like a concert hall.

Everything became dark and quiet.

The stage and the seats were separated, and a beam of orange spotlight shone over the center of the stage. I felt as if classical music would suddenly start playing. I looked around this strange space in a daze.

‘Where am I, and what kind of an ability is this?”

“…She’s one of Orden’s elite monsters. Her name is Doloren, and she can imbue her songs with magic power. It’s similar to Spirit Speech but different. We’re inside Doloren’s barrier right now,” Rumi explained quickly.

“Aha.”

‘So that’s Doloren, one of the four monsters that’s new to the setting. Does she shed her feathers because she’s a bird? She’s different from what I saw on TV…’

“We… should’ve gotten out of here before she set up a barrier. It’s too late now.”

Rumi’s voice was tinged with despair. She bit her lips so hard that they started to bleed. It seemed she had already given up.

I asked, “It’s just a barrier. Why are you so scared?”

“It’s not just a simple barrier. You can’t escape from Doloren’s barrier. And rather than a barrier, it’s more of a world of its own.”

It was no surprise that Rumi knew about Doloren in detail; she was the spy, after all.

“There are only two audience members but that’s enough,” Doloren muttered as she climbed up the stage.

She stood on the podium like a conductor and looked down at us. Rumi turned white with fear, but I was confident I could breakthrough the current situation.

“But fundamentally it’s only a barrier, no?”

“…Pardon?”

I pulled Rumi into my arms and took out the [Mystic Key].

***

[Mystic Key] [Magic Artifact]

—A mystical key.

- Evolving Item — EXP 「90000/100000」

- Lv.8 Unlocking

※Was converted into an effective good through the 8-star card, [Card Conversion].

***

I had upgraded the Mystic Key tremendously using [Item Experience Coupons].

Even the most solid barriers should become powerless in front of it.

“The first number is Messiah by George Frideric Handel. Ahem….”

Doloren began warming up. She was completely at ease, probably because she had already concluded that we could never break out of her barrier.

I thrusted the key into the ground. Its tip sunk into the ground, and click— it was hooked. It had reached the core of the barrier.

Woooong….

I forced Stigma’s magic power into the key. This would surely strengthen it.

I then turned the key to the right with all my strength.

Koong—!

It sounded as if someone had pushed down on all the lowest keys on the piano at once.

Doloren’s concert hall turned into gravel.

“…What? What’s going on? My concert, where did it go?”

She looked around in confusion.

“Let’s run.”

“Excuse me? What are you— Kyak!”

I picked Rumi up and started running.

This was my third time using [Pinnacle-rank Instant Acceleration] today, yet I was just as fast as i was the first time. I could use this option without any limitation as long as I had the Orb of Regeneration with me.

**

Meanwhile, back at the underground fortress, everyone was already out of their tents, eagerly waiting for Black Lotus to return.

They all had witnessed Black Lotus’ triumph from the camera around his neck.

Their hearts sank when ‘Doloren’ appeared, as she was known to be as equally powerful as a Master-rank Hero. However, to their surprise, Black Lotus defeated her easily and escaped with the spy.

His performance was nothing less of perfection.

“I knew he was a good bet.”

Aileen nodded with satisfaction. Today, she had witnessed the true strength of Black Lotus.

“Right. And I’m really curious how he broke that barrier. What do you think, Aileen? That barrier didn’t have any noticeable weakness in it. That monster looked confused, too.”

Nicholas was overcome with excitement and curiosity.

“Hey Nayun, do you think he’d be willing to take a photo with me? I think I’ll be able to get, like, 300 million likes if I post it online.”

That last remark was Yi Jiyoon’s.

Other Heroes also looked forward to meeting Black Lotus. They didn’t expect him to answer all their questions, but still they were thrilled to finally meet Black Lotus in person.

“Ah, he’s here!”

With her extraordinary eyesight, Jin Seyeon was the first to point to the other side of the tunnel. Everyone turned to where she pointed, and soon, two silhouettes appeared on the other side.

It was Black Lotus and the spy Rumi.

Rather than waiting for the two to come, the Heroes went to greet them. Aileen, as the commander in chief, stood in front of Black Lotus.

“Oi, it’s been a while.” Aileen greeted.

Black Lotus remained silent. He handed Rumi over to Parma, who was known as the ‘Saint’. Rumi had fainted after failing to withstand Black Lotus’ supersonic speed.

“…Hey, don’t you know me?”

Aileen frowned, thinking Black Lotus just ignored her.

Black Lotus’ answer was short.

“I do.”

“Then why are you ignoring me like that?”

“It’s not my job to look after you.”

“…”

Aileen’s face turned slightly red. Few muffled laughters broke out behind her.

“I never asked you to look after me! Be courteous, you!”

“….”

Black Lotus looked beyond Aileen. His gaze moved across Kim Suho, Nicholas, Yun Seung-Ah, Shin Jonghak, Jin Seyeon, then Chae Nayun. His gaze lingered on Chae Nayun for slightly longer. Having noticed it, Chae Nayun tilted her head in confusion.

“I’m leaving now, but be sure to tell me the information that the spy discovered.”

Black Lotus turned around, but Aileen’s high-pitched voice stopped him.

“Do you have any other business to take care of?”

As an ally, Black Lotus was more dependable than anyone else. Seeing as Black Lotus and Orden were archenemies, Aileen wanted to keep Black Lotus on her side at least until they defeated Orden. Black Lotus could secure their rear, attack the front, and even assist other Heroes from the back.

He would be the perfect addition to the team.

“…”

However, Black Lotus neither looked back nor spoke.

An eagle suddenly flew in from a distance and landed on his shoulder.

“Hey! Answer me before you leave!”

Black Lotus answered Aileen in a nonchalant voice.

“Contact the Chameleon Troupe if you want to recruit me.”

And that was all he had to say.

“Excuse me, before you leave, can you maybe take just one photo with m-… uup!”

Chae Nayun and Kim Suho managed to stop Yi Jiyoon before she could finish her sentence.

Immediately afterwards, Black Lotus turned into a handful of dust and disappeared into thin air.

Silence descended on the fortress.

The Heroes all stared at the spot where Black Lotus had just stood.

The man came and left quite literally like the wind. Black Lotus should have been the enemy of Heroes, yet a sense of gratitude filled their hearts.

Kim Suho and Shin Jonghak. Yi Jiyoon and Jin Seyeon. Chae Nayun and Yun Seung-Ah….

Each member of the Task Force now had their own story of Black Lotus to tell.

And their stories would soon spread to the rest of the world in the form of rumors.

**

[World of Wish, 8F Crevon]

On a starry night in Crevon, Margrave Tomer was having teatime with a guest in the reception room of her mansion. The atmosphere was rather grave.

Staring at the dark clouds outside her window, Tomer muttered with a sigh.

“A lot has changed ever since the 30th floor crumbled down.”

When Kim Suho cleared the final floor of the Tower, Crevon was under a state of emergency.

Cults heralded the end of Crevon one after the other. Some sought to overthrow the current regime.

However, this period of turmoil only served to bring Crevon together.
