Araha, the fifth princess of Crevon, declared herself the king, finally unleashing all the ambition that she had tried so hard to keep hidden over the past years. She launched a series of innovative and radical policies to address the people’s concerns.

Araha also recruited a number of skilled Players and regularly sent them on expeditions to the 9th floor. Half of the 9th floor that was once crawling with mythical monsters was now cleared out, and that was clearly a triumph on her part.

“What do you think?”

Tomer asked the guest while sipping on tea.

Recent changes had put her in a rather tricky political situation.

“…I am worried.”

The clinking sound of iron resounded throughout the room along with a low-pitched voice.

The guest, a giant man, stared down at the cup in front of him, which was barely the size of his thumb, before picking it up and placing it on his palm.

Tomer gave a small smile.

“So even you’re scared, Lü Bu?”

“…”

Lü Bu did not answer. He only grabbed his Square Sky Halberd with the hand that wasn’t holding the cup.

However, before long, he raised his head again and stared Tomer in the eye.

“I heard that Earth will also transform into the Demon Realm.”

“…Yes, that was the prophecy.”

The highest-ranking administrators of the Tower of Wish—Buddha, Jesus, and other saints—had already ascended to Heaven. They left behind a single prophecy before they left.

[Demonic energy shall invade the blue world. We hope you will all work together to overcome this ordeal.]

“But… the prophecy only applies to the outside world,” Tomer muttered and glanced at Lü Bu, anticipating his response.

The outside world.

Tomer had begun to refer to Earth as the outside world.

She recalled her parents. Earth had left nothing but scars on Tomer’s family. This was the reason she did not want to leave Crevon. Tomer cherished the peaceful life she had here.

“Do you wish to descend as well, General Lü Bu?”

But others had very different opinions. Not only the administrators but also Lü Bu, Lancelot, and practically anyone who originated from Earth wanted to descend onto the outside world.

Lü Bu turned his head slowly and glared at Tomer.

“I’m merely following my lord.”

“Right, and your lord is here in Crevon. Yet you worry about Earth.”

“….”

Lü Bu clenched his teeth, which made his chin appear more threatening. Tomer stared back at him without being intimidated.

As the atmosphere between the two began to grow hostile….

Guoooo….

Suddenly, a strange vibration shook their surroundings.

Tomer and Lü Bu stopped and looked around in confusion.

It wasn’t long before a message window popped up in front of Tomer.

[There has been a huge change to the System.]

Only Tomer could see this message because she was simultaneously an NPC and a Player.

Her eyes widened as she read it.

**

The sky was dark without a hint of light.

I returned to Pandemonium. After a quick shower, I headed straight to Boss’ office to give her a report of the mission.

“You’re back.”

Boss greeted me with her usual nonchalant look.

“I already received the news that you succeeded.”

“Did you get the reward?”

“Yes. The Chameleon Troupe is now officially pardoned. Though I’m not sure how long we can manage to stay off that list this time….”

With a chuckle, Boss got up from her seat and came up to me.

“You did well.”

Boss stared at me. Then she leaned over and hung something around my neck. It was a necklace.

“This is better than the one I gave to you when you first joined. I got this from the Association in exchange for accepting their newest request. You earned it, so you keep it.”

[Heimdallr’s Necklace] was its name. You could tell from its name how priceless this necklace was.

“This is….”

I was surprised that of all people Boss had chosen to give this to me. I knew from her official setting that she was an avid jewelry lover.

Grateful, I held the necklace up to examine it in detail.

It was then.

Guoooo….

I felt a huge vibration echo off the walls.

At the same time, several windows popped up, blocking my view.

[Outline — the narration has caught up with the original story; the remake story will take over fully.]

[Problem — the last arc before the hiatus was much too dull.]

[Setting Change — a huge ‘system’ has been incorporated into the story to minimize the dullness.]

[Original Author’s Privilege — Your eyes can now see other people’s life force, among other ‘stats’….]

...

Chapter 282. Great Change (1)

[England, Buckingham Palace]

After subjugating Toji, Heynckes was received hospitably by the English government. Heynckes didn’t want the public to find out about his return, and England did its best to stop the information from getting out. As a result, Heynckes stayed in England for two more days before returning to the Himalayas.

“…Hmm.”

With Heynckes gone, today was the last day Yoo Yeonha would stay in Buckingham Palace.

She stood in front of a mirror in her room and checked her outfit.

She was wearing a black dress designed by the world-class designer, Yi Yoojoong, a pinnacle-grade artifact called ‘Siren’s Black Pearl Necklace’, and an ancient Silla artifact called ‘Bronze Necklace’. Together with the beautiful Buckingham Palace, her beauty stood out even more.

“Huhu.”

Every time she saw herself in the mirror, she couldn’t help but thank her parents. She couldn’t imagine how they managed to pass down only the best genes.

Immersed in confidence, she made various poses, smiling like a cute girl, biting her lips like a seductress, and looking stern like a worried CEO.

She was well aware of the benefits her beauty brought. She had experienced it firsthand in business. Her appearance exuded trust and evoked admiration, boosting the image of her guild even more.

There was a reason that Yoo Yeonha was the face of Essence of the Strait.

…But her appearance had never garnered ‘love’ from anyone.

“Tsk.”

A sense of skepticism suddenly swept through her. Yoo Yeonha clicked her tongue and turned away from the mirror.

But the feeling of helplessness didn’t go away easily. She subconsciously thought of Shin Jonghak. She had liked him ever since she was a kid but gave up on him after realizing he would never be hers.

‘How did I come to like him?’

It was a tale from a long time ago.

“Haaa….”

Yoo Yeonha sat down on the corner of her bed and recalled her first meeting with Shin Jonghak.

…The official name was probably ‘Guild and Business Friendship Conference.’ It was a social gathering for corporate leaders and top-class guild executives.

As adults and their children all attended, the 5-year-old Yoo Yeonha looked forward to the conference. She was just as ambitious back then as she was now.

That day, she tried on dozens of dresses with her mother. Although her mother was also passionate, Yoo Yeonha was even more heated up. What dress to wear, what accessories to pick, she spent 7 hours worrying about her outfit.

—How do I look, Father?

The dress she finally picked was similar to the one she was wearing now. A black dress and a necklace to make her look mature.

—Adorable, Yeonha!

—A-Ah, stop! You’re going to make my dress wrinkly! Stooop!

Her father hugged her with a hearty laugh, and Yoo Yeonha remembered being angry at her father for making her dress wrinkly.

Not long after picking her dress, her uncle, Yoo Jinhyuk, who was a rising-star Hero at the time, also arrived. Together, they headed to the conference.

The conference was held in the garden of Chae Joochul’s grand mansion.

—Wow….

Fancy classical music played in the background, and beautiful flowers glistened under the sun. Yoo Yeonha’s eyes widened from the clear weather and scenic view. Although she came from a rich family, the Immortal’s grand mansion had a certain noble charm that she didn’t see in her home.

—Oh, if it isn’t Air Blitz Yoo Jinwoong!

—Haha, Leader Yoon Youngho, it’s nice to see you.

—No need for greetings. Follow me, Shin Myungchul brought an amazing child with him. Her name is Aileen. She was born with an extremely rare Gift called ‘Spirit Speech’.

—Oh?

Her father and mother disappeared with Leader Yoo Youngho. Uncle Yoo Jinhyuk led her to the place where all the children were gathered. It was a playground built just for young kids. Yoo Yeonha puffed her cheeks unhappily.

—Uncle Jinhyuk, can’t I say hi to adults too? Kids are boring.

—Nope, you can’t.

—But why?

—The goal of this conference is ‘making connections’. Your parents will take care of the adults, and it’s your job to connect with other kids. Your parents' connections will eventually become yours anyways. Plus, you’re only five-years-old. Don’t go around calling kids boring when you’re one too.

What Yoo Jinhyuk was saying made sense.

Left with no choice, Yoo Yeonha went to the kids’ playground. There, she saw ten or so kids her age.

Huu… huu….

Yoo Yeonha collected her breath before approaching them.

—Hello, my name is Yoo Yeonha.

30 minutes was enough.

With her conversational skills and beauty, she captured the hearts of the other kids. Just when she was sure she became the main character of the meeting…

—Ugh, annoying.

A boyish girl appeared. She was wearing jeans and a t-shirt. The upset girl sighed and sat down on a nearby chair.

At first, Yoo Yeonha was dumbstruck. How could someone come to such a noble meeting in that getup?

But she soon realized she could just ignore the girl. Yoo Yeonha snorted and invited her newly made connections to eat some pudding.

—This pudding is great. Would you like to try… some?

However, most of the kids around her had already disappeared.

‘Where did they go?’ Yoo Yeonha looked around, confused. Then, she saw them flattering the boyish girl.

—…Eh?

The words, ‘Nayun, Nayun—‘, entered her dazed ears. It was then that she realized who the girl was.

Chae Nayun.

Daehyun’s youngest daughter and the granddaughter Chae Joochul adored.

That was when Yoo Yeonha met Chae Nayun for the first time, and it was also when she felt inferior for the first time. But she refused to yield. She believed she was superior in appearance and clothing.

—…Hello, how old are you? I’m five.

She tried her best to recapture the attention of the other kids… but it was futile. The sons and daughters of mid-sized guilds left for other nobles when the chance came.

The ‘noble’ wasn’t necessarily Chae Nayun. Sons and daughters of more honorable guilds and corporations, they seemed to possess ‘something’ that was even more important than appearance.

It was at that moment that Yoo Yeonha realized she wasn’t the main character. That she was only an extra.

The young and proud Yoo Yeonha was sad that she wasn’t at the center of the meeting. Her resentment was pointed toward Chae Nayun, who became the center of the meeting in only jeans and a t-shirt.

She held back her tears and glared at Chae Nayun. Although she was surrounded by many people, she seemed annoyed by it.

—…That girl. Bad, stupid, idiot…

Yoo Yeonha ate pudding as she sobbed. Only the sweetness of her pudding consoled her.

It was then that ‘Shin Jonghak’ appeared in her life.

—Is that pudding good?

His voice was childish, yet full of confidence. He wasn’t talking in polite speech, but Yoo Yeonha didn’t care.

‘Someone came to me!’

Just that one fact made her happy. Yoo Yeonha wiped her tears elegantly and turned around.

There, she saw a handsome boy who seemed to have popped out of a painting.

She asked in a daze.

—…Who are you?

Shin Jonghak smirked, then said softly.

—Shin Jonghak. My grandfather is Shin Myungchul.

—Shing Myungchul…?

—It’s Shin Myungchul, not Shing Myungchul.

Yoo Yeonha’s eyes widened. There wasn’t anyone in the world who didn’t know Shin Myungchul.

Shin Jonghak seemed to have liked her huge reaction as he stayed and consoled her.

—Don’t worry about those guys. They’re only puppets of their parents.

Shin Jonghak must have spoken from jealousy. Since he liked Chae Nayun for the longest time, he must have disliked seeing Chae Nayun surrounded by other guys.

But Yoo Yeonha didn’t know that at the time.

—People who chase after special people without trying to become special themselves only end up as trash.

He was just as arrogant then as he was now.

—…Un, okay….

Back then, he seemed like the coolest, most wonderful person in the world.

That was the memory from her childhood. When she recalled it now, her heart didn’t thump like it used to.

About 12 years later, Yoo Yeonha met another man.

A man who didn’t have anything to his name but continued to get on her nerves.

Although she was annoyed, even ignoring him and reproaching him, he saved her life. Not only that, but he also turned her life around forever.

Kim Hajin.

Thanks to him, she was able to become a ‘noble person’ like she always wanted to be. Essence of the Strait became the number 1 guild in the world and entered the top 10 of corporate entities.

She had achieved the ambition she always had…

Tok, tok—

A knock interrupted her recollection. Yoo Yeonha shot up from her bed, startled.

“Who is it?”

—Um, it’s Rachel. I heard you were leaving, so I came to see you off.

“…Hmm.”

Yoo Yeonha straightened the hem of her dress and opened the door.

Rachel was standing right in front of her. She seemed tired from having to deal with Shin Yeohwa, but she greeted Yoo Yeonha with a bright smile.

“You look great. Are you ready to go?”

“….”

“…Yeonha-ssi?”

Yoo Yeonha glared at Rachel silently. Rachel was acting subservient and modest as always.

In a way, it was to be expected. Yoo Yeonha knew she had risen to a position where she could determine the fate of a country. With little exaggeration, she could end England if she set her mind to it.

“You.”

Yoo Yeonha was displeased with Rachel’s attitude. The emotion she felt towards Chae Nayun that day surfaced once again.

She couldn’t hold back.

She shot the pent-up feelings she carried in her heart at Rachel.

“What relationship do you have with Kim Hajin?”

At that moment, Rachel’s shoulders flinched.

“Pardon? What do you mean—”

“Don’t act like you don’t know.”

Yoo Yeonha turned serious.

“The child you ran off with two days ago, I saw her in Seoul. At the time, she wasn’t with you but with Kim Hajin.”

“….”

Rachel didn’t say anything. As far as Yoo Yeonha was aware, the silence was the same thing as an answer.

“I’ll ask again.”

Yoo Yeonha’s face turned serious.

She clenched her teeth and asked straightforwardly while sharpening a knife in her heart.

“Did you sleep with Kim Hajin?”

The moment she asked that question.

Guoooo….

A boundless magic power began to pour down from an unknown place.

**

[Final Arc ▷ ‘You Can’t Jump Off a Running Train’]

[Earth’s Demon Realm Transformation is progressing… 3% Complete.]

[Calculating Towers that have not been conquered.]

[Tower of Miracles, Tower of Eternity, Tower of Beasts, Tower of Sorrow, Tower of Despair…]

[…A total of 13 Towers were found. The power of these 13 Towers will be released to the outside world.]

“…Hajin, magic power just—”

“Fuck, what now?”

“Eh… w-what?”

A sudden change to the system in the name of an ‘arc’.

Unable to hold back my anger, I ran towards the window and looked up.

Then, I lost all words.

Chwaaa—

Thousands of shooting stars were falling from the sky, illuminating the darkness.

A meteor shower.

Rich writing appeared on the shooting stars. I was most likely the only one who could see it.

「Enough time has passed since the destruction of the Tower of Wish’s shell. But during this time, humanity paid little attention to conquering the remaining Towers. They had little choice because of the great enemy known as Orden.

Tower of Miracles, Tower of Eternity, Tower of Beasts, Tower of Sorrow, Tower of Despair… a total of 13 unconquered Towers have released their powers. It was because of the ‘rejective force’ resulting from the materialization of the Tower of Wish. Their powers served as a catalyst for hastening Earth’s Demon Realm Transformation.

…Now, meteorites are falling on the world. The meteorites contain hundreds of demonic monsters, demon merchants, and destruction-hungry demons. This is the start of the Demon Realm Transformation.

But this Demon Realm Transformation wasn’t a simple phenomenon like the one from the Tower of Wish. ‘Not all demons are enemies’. The Demon Realm Transformation will change Earth and bring about a new age….」

“The fuck does that mean, you piece of shit?”

I cursed at the sky, looking at the words I couldn’t understand. Then…

KWANG—!

A few meteorites exploded as they landed. The earth rumbled and smoke rose up.

[Rewards have been granted to all of humanity for clearing the Tower of Wish — ‘Blessing of the Saints’ has been activated.]

[A new system has been initialized.]

[Interesting, your system is level 6, the only Player to have surpassed level 4.]

System level.

While I was climbing the Tower of Wish, I had used [Consolidation Coupons] to level up the system to level 6.

[Your stats have been condensed to 5 attributes.]

[Your attributes are 1. Sharpness 2. Tenacity 3. Creativity 4. Materialization 5. Consolidation]

“Boss?”

I turned to Boss. She seemed to be experiencing the same phenomenon as she was staring into the air.

—Grrrk.

—Grrrk.

Next, strange roars began to ring outside. I widened my eyes and looked outside the window.

—Grrrk.

From the meteorites pinned to the ground, hundreds of demonic beasts were crawling out.

[Arc Progress – Demonic beasts of the Demon Realm invade humanity.]

[Countless ‘Dungeons’, ‘Mirror Worlds’, and other battlefields will be created.]

[Every time a Dungeon is cleared, or a demonic beast is killed, you will receive DP (Dark Points).]

[DP can be gained by ‘anyone’ and can be spent in ‘demon towns’ or with ‘demon merchants’.]

[Note, demon merchants and demon towns are not your enemies. They are ‘neutral entities’ who wish to seek benefits through this war.]

[You can convert SP to DP.]

Clang—!

At that moment, a black demonic beast jumped through the window and landed on me. I swung my hand subconsciously. The demonic beast was cut in half cleanly.

“…The hell?”

I looked down at my palm, which had suddenly become sharp.

[7 points of sharpness will be imbued in all actions you make.]

[You obtain 5 DP from killing a demonic beast.]

“What just….”

“Hajin?”

As I was murmuring in bewilderment, Boss called my name.

I turned on the TV without answering her.

—Emergency report. The world is experiencing an unprecedented meteor shower. These meteorites are causing huge explosions; civilians are recommended to stay inside….

“No, Hajin.”

Boss tapped on my shoulders like she was frustrated.

“Yes?”

“L-Look over there.”

“Huh…?”

I turned to the direction Boss was pointing to.

Three minutes ago, it was a vast field in Central Asia with nothing to note.

But that wasn’t the case now.

General stores, clothing stores, weapon stores, magic stores, and others…. Benches surrounded a pond in a plaza with 4-story high inns. There were even existences that looked like people.

A meteorite had struck and created a new town.

“…What’s that?”

The system returned an answer to my confused murmuring.

[They are ‘demon merchants’, beings who came to Earth through the meteorites. Demon merchants are fundamentally different from demons, devils, Djinns, and demonic beasts. Demons are not a single race, only referring to those who came from the Demon Realm. Demons have different settings depending on what race they belong to.]

[Devils will employ Djinns and demonic beasts to conquer Earth. Humanity will try to stop them. These ‘demon merchants’ are here only to reap benefits from the two sides’ war.]

[They will sell you anything, whether it be technology to annihilate members of their own race, weapons, magic, or whatever. As long as you have DP, that is.]

[How is it? Not so boring anymore, right?]

“Are you kidding me, you son of a bitch…”

Seeing the last sentence, I couldn’t hold back my anger.

“Huu…”

But being angry wouldn’t change anything.

I calmed myself. There was something I needed to do.

I took out the [Purifying Crystal] from my Stigma.

But at that moment, Boss discovered something else.

“…Hajin.”

She pointed at the sky with her trembling hand.

‘What now?’ I looked up, somewhat fearful of what I would see next.

Immediately, my thoughts stopped.

“…A dragon.”

Boss murmured quietly.

Boss and I looked up at the sky in a daze.

It wasn't something like the Human Dragon Aileen, but an actual dragon.

In the sky, a member of the mystical race known as dragons was circling the moon.

“Jesus Christ is this for fucking real….”

I couldn’t help but curse. I had not cursed in a long time, but this damned co-author just wouldn't let me be.

Chap—

“Uk!”

Boss hit my mouth with her hand.

When I looked at her confused, she gave me a coy look.

“Don’t curse.”

“…Ah, okay.”

...

Chapter 283. Great Change (2)

[44 days left until the start of the first development - ‘Advent of the Calamity’.]

[As the original author, you are given the privilege of accessing the outline of the development.]

[You may access the outline using your original Gift, ‘Observation and Reading’.]

[And don’t forget, you have the right to ask me a question or a favor.]

I ran with Boss to where the meteorite fell. After 3 minutes of running, we finally began to see a village that had appeared only a few moments ago. The village looked similar to the one I saw in Akatrina. Houses were made of bricks, like a classic Middle Age design.

“…What’s this?”

It wasn’t just us who came. Djinns and mercenaries of Pandemonium also gathered at the village. A few rambunctious Djinns seemed to anticipate a fight. However, most calmly observed the Demon Realm village which was shrouded in a dark fog.

“As I thought, you’re here too.”

Suddenly, a familiar voice called us. I pushed my hood down further, and Boss looked at our ‘business partner’.

It was Wicked—a member of the Nine Evils.

Boss asked Wicked, “Do you know anything about the current situation?”

“No, I don’t.”

Wicked shook her head, and so did the three executives who were with her.

So far, I had released only three of her six executives. I set aside the remaining three for later use in case we needed to negotiate with Wicked again. This was the way I intended to keep things for a while since Wicked’s Gift allowed her to become stronger as the number of her followers increased.

“…This phenomenon seems to be related to the Demon Realm. How can you not know what’s going on? Aren’t you a Djinn?” Boss probed.

“Djinns aren’t from the Demon Realm. I only serve my lord devil. I have no idea what’s going on either. Let’s head inside together and find out.”

Wicked’s explanation made sense, so we headed to the village together.

The village was pretty big and divided into different sectors. We continued to walk, taking in our surroundings when suddenly an Aileen-sized demon jumped out in front us from the corner of the street.

—Hello!

Frankly, I was pretty surprised (as was Boss and Wicked), but my pride wouldn’t allow me to jump in fear.

Wicked exchanged glances with her underlings. One of her executives stepped forward with a stern look.

“Who are you? Reveal yourself.”

—Mm. So we can communicate. That’s good.

As expected, the demon spoke Korean. He was small but had big curved horns growing out of his temple.

“Tell us about yourself and what you’re doing here.”

—My name is Kuong and I’m a merchant. Though I’m still trying to figure everything out….

I used [Original Author’s Privilege] on the demon.

「Demon Realm Merchant Kuong」

[Life Force 100/100]

[Alignment — Neutral]

[Realm — Stage-1 Average]

[Job — Middle-grade merchant]

[Status — Speaking the truth]

—I have a lot of things for sale that will be of help to you. Here, please take a look.

Kuong showed us his shop's catalog.

[Special potion]

[Protective Wall]

[Artifacts from Other Dimensions]

[Mercenary for Hire]

…

…

[Body Enhancer]

[State of Existence Enhancer]

—You can buy these items with DP, which is the currency we use in our world. You can earn them by hunting demonic beasts. Ah, do you know what demonic beasts are? They’re not much different from monsters. When monsters become contaminated in the land of the Demon Realm, they become what we call demonic beasts. I highly recommend this item here, ‘State of Existence Enhancer’! It’s expensive but worth all the cost!

“Land of the Demon Realm? Are you referring to Demon Realm Transformation?”

Boss frowned. People who participated in the Tower of Wish were all somewhat aware of ‘Demon Realm Transformation’.

—Yes. Today’s meteorites mark the beginning of Demon Realm Transformation. If you fail to work together to fight back, Earth will completely transform into the Demon Realm in no time.

All three of us fell silent. A sense of shock swept through us.

I looked down at the Demon Realm Merchant ‘Kuong’ and spoke in an intimidating tone.

“We get DP from killing demonic beasts… so what happens if I kill you?”

—Pardon?

“Can I earn DP by killing you?”

—Oh, but you can’t kill me. I’m only a hologram. My physical body is in the real Demon Realm.

[Status — Speaking the truth]

I didn’t exactly plan on killing him but regretted not being able to.

“I see.”

—There’s no use killing us anyway. We’re willing to do anything for you as long as you pay us DP.

“…Geez, another form of currency.”

DP, TP, SP. It was starting to get a little bit confusing… but that was no reason to shun them.

I did have a talent for making money. Even if I was to suddenly become stranded in the middle of nowhere without anything on me, as long as that place was somewhere in this world, I could survive without worry. Just like the saying went, success was a little bit of skill and a whole lot of luck.

“Do you have casinos here?”

—Ah~ The higher-grade merchants run them. But I do have lottery tickets!

“…Yeah?”

—Yep. They cost 20 DP per ticket and you can see the result instantly. First place winner gets 1,500,000 DP, second place winner gets 150,000 DP, third place gets 15,000 DP….

I could make 1.5 million DP with just 20 DP. Of course, just like all lottery, the chances of winning were probably slim to none. Kuong proceeded to explain.

— The chance of winning first place is 1 in 30,000,000. For the second place, it’s 1 in 9,000,000. For the third place, 1 in 300,000….

1 in 30,000,000.

1 in 9,000,000.

1 in 300,000.

At a glance, these numbers seemed insanely low, but why was it that I couldn’t stop the corner of mouth from twitching upwards in joy? I tried to appear calm.

“That’s pretty bad, huh?”

—The chances are pretty low, but we sell these tickets in other dimensions and worlds, so I do hope you understand~

“Yeah, well, it’s alright.”

It didn’t matter how low the chances were.

I was confident that my superhuman luck stat of 9.1 points would bring me a tremendous amount of DP, despite the ridiculously low probability.

**

[Africa, Underground Fortress]

「VIOLET’s gossip - Black Lotus Q&A」

Q. Why does Black Lotus oppose Orden?

A. I don’t know the details, but I think there’s a reason behind his hostility. Like, his family members were murdered by Orden or something.

Q. How strong is Black Lotus really?

A. I can answer this question with confidence. Black Lotus is equally as powerful as—if not more than—Chae Joochul. Chae Joochul is old, so I expect Black Lotus to take the lead as time goes on.

Q. Really? We know that Swordsman of Wish Kim Suho is also very powerful, and ‘Fenrir’ has killed Black Lotus once before.

A. I heard Kim Suho also acknowledged Black Lotus. In fact, Kim Suho might be stronger than Black Lotus in a fair 1 on 1 fight. But considering all other factors, I have to say that no Hero can stand against Black Lotus. As for Fenrir… I decline to comment. But I still think Black Lotus is stronger than Fenrir.

Q. What kind of atmosphere did Black Lotus have?

A. …He looked sad. He was cold, but I could spot a very human weakness in him. I feel like he has a deep scar in his heart, one that can’t be erased. Even his nonchalant attitude couldn’t hide his sorrow. He was a wounded beast… or a fragile snowflake.

Q. If that’s true, why do you think Black Lotus is so hurt?

A. I’m not sure. There could be many reasons. His battle against Orden, or that duel against Fenrir in the Tower of Wish, or maybe it’s the Association’s oppression….

But more than anything, I think it’s because Black Lotus is noble. He has the world at his feet and he leads the Chameleon Troupe. The higher you go, the colder and more fierce it gets.

***

Meanwhile, Yi Jiyoon was in the middle of spreading rumors through Violet Banquet. Though these rumors were all derived from her delusions, she didn’t feel guilty. In her mind, these rumors wouldn’t cause any harm to Black Lotus; plus, she really believed that her analysis was true.

Tap, tap— Tap, tap—

She accumulated more and more Violet Banquet points as the sound of keyboard typing grew louder.

Yi Jiyoon’s Violet Banquet ID grade was an astounding [Blue Diamond]. This was the reason people believed whatever she said without even thinking to cross-check the facts.

“….Mm. I should check up on my social media account now.”

After she finished the Q&A, Yi Jiyoon turned Violet Banquet off and pulled up her official social media account.

[Yi Jiyoon]

[Posts 2,480] [Follower 36.3M] [Following 103]

“Huhu.”

Fellow members of the ‘Orden Assassination Team’ treated the high-intermediate-rank grade-1 Yi Jiyoon as nothing but an immature supporter. But on the internet, she was an extremely popular celebrity thanks to her excellent ‘image marketing strategy’.

On her official social media account, she gained worldwide popularity by posting photos of her with other famous Heroes such as Chae Nayun, Yoo Yeonha, Kim Suho, and Shin Jonghak. On Violet Banquet, she ran a secret website called [VIOLET’s gossip], where she posted gossip like the earlier Q&A. Her initial goal was to earn Violet Banquet points, but along the way she had gained a lot of followers.

—So all you do is sell?

“…They’re still not done?”

Yi Jiyoon turned her smartwatch off and got up from her seat.

She opened the door slightly and looked outside through the gap. Aileen was still interrogating a demon.

—Yes, all we do is sell goods.

“How do you expect me to believe that?”

After countless meteorites landed on Earth, the underground fortress went through a huge change as well. One meteor passed through the ground and became a ‘shop’ stationed just outside the fortress.

—Look at us. We’re not built to fight. I’m shorter than you.

The demon twirled.

“…You’re kidding, right? Well, it’s true that you’re shorter than me.”

Yi Jiyoon stepped outside and stood next to Chae Nayun and Kim Suho, who were watching Aileen.

“Nayun, Suho, is she still not finished?”

“Hm?”

“No, but I think it’ll be over soon. Ah, right. What kind of stat did you get?”

‘Stat?’ Yi Jiyoon wondered what Kim Suho meant. Then, she realized he was referring to the ‘great change’ that happened last night.

“Oh, I got ‘Buff’. How about you two?”

“I got ‘Tenacity’ and ‘Extremity’.”

“Mine’s ‘Amplification’.”

Kim Suho received Tenacity and Extremity. Chae Nayun received Amplification.

“Huh? Why do you have two, Suho?”

“Um… I’m not really sure.”

“Maybe because he cleared the Tower of Wish?”

Chae Nayun tapped on Kim Suho’s chest. Kim Suho drew back, covering his chest with his arms.

“Ah, that makes sense.”

At that moment, the conversation between Aileen and the demon seemed to finally reach an end.

“So you promise not to tell anyone about our fortress?”

—Of course.

“We just want to kill Orden.”

—Sure. I don’t know who that is, but we can help you achieve your goal! As long as you have DP!

“Whatever. Hey, everyone, come on out!”

Aileen’s voice rang out.

All 177 members of the Special Task Force stepped outside their tents.

“We’re going to start training!”

With a shout, Aileen took out the [Training Simulator]. The device had been updated to reflect Rumi’s report of Orden’s Palace. It was now more realistic and precise.

“I want to lay this out to all of you. The mission start date is not going to change! We strike three weeks from now, just like we planned! We’re going to go kill Orden!”

Aileen’s high-pitched voice resounded throughout the underground cave.

“Furthermore!”

This was still not set in stone. The Association had told Aileen that they would ‘try and negotiate’, but Aileen decided to announce it to the members to lift morale.

“Black Lotus will be joining us on this mission!”

Thankfully the members took the news well.

Shin Jonghak widened his eyes in surprise. Chae Nayun nodded in seriousness, Kim Suho recalled Black Lotus with tension, and Yi Jiyoon hoped to finally take a selfie with Black Lotus.

“…Unni, is that true? I thought the negotiation was ongoing.”

The only person who knew the truth—Yun Seung-Ah—approached Aileen and whispered in her ear.

“…I heard that the cost of the negotiations is really high…. There are rumors that the down payment is 50 billion won.”

“Whatever, that’s the old geezer’s problem. We need Black Lotus to end Orden for good.”

Aileen declared indomitably despite Yun Seung-Ah’s concern before beginning their training routine.

**

[Demon Town in Central Asia]

I returned to the demon town after hunting exactly 100 demonic beasts with Boss and Wicked (she insisted on following us). Currently, Demon Realm Transformation was only 3% complete, and demonic beasts were only as strong as intermediate-rank monsters.

Kuong greeted us when we returned.

“I’ve got 1000 DP, so give me 50 lottery tickets.”

—Ah. We don’t sell them here.

With a smile, Kuong led us to the general store just around the corner.

—Welcome~ Come in~

I was the first to enter the store.

There were all sorts of cool stuff inside, and the shop owner was a giant who was as big as Cheok Jungyeong.

I approached the shop owner and spoke.

“Hey.”

—Nice to meet you. I’m Deong.

“Do all of your names end in ‘ong’?”

—That’s right.

“…Oh. Well, I’ll cut to the chase. Give me 50 lottery tickets.”

—You won’t win. It’s a 1 in 30 million chance. Humans never win.

For some reason, Deong didn’t seem to want to sell us the lottery tickets.

“I’ll show you that my luck is beyond human. Just give me the tickets.”

—….

Deong gave me a discontented look, but I kept glaring at him and he eventually gave in. He handed me 50 tickets.

—It’s not gonna work.

I scratched the 50 lottery tickets on the spot.

The first ticket was 6th place. 100 DP.

The second ticket was nothing.

The third was 6th place again. 100 DP.

Boss widened her eyes.

“Oh, it comes out pretty often for a 1 in a 30 million chance.”

“…Huh? Oh. He meant that it’s 1 in a 30 million chance for first place. Everything else has a higher probability.”

“Uh… I see. K-Kuhum. I’ve never bought a lottery ticket before.”

Boss let out a dry cough in embarrassment.

I continued with the lottery scratching.

The fourth ticket was 5th place. 500 DP.

The fifth ticket was 3rd place. 15000 DP.

—Wow! You won the third place! Congratulations!

—3rd place? That’s something.

“Oh. You’re pretty lucky.”

Kuong, Deong, and Wicked congratulated me but I still wasn’t satisfied. I scratched the reaming tickets. 15th, 23rd, 33rd, 50th…. Although I didn’t win first place from the first 50 tickets, I bought another set of 150 tickets with the DP I won from the lottery.

I started at it again. 69th, 75th, 83rd…. And when I finally reached the 109th lottery ticket.

I saw a golden glimmer at the tip of my fingers.

“Ah. This one’s first place.”

It was a very familiar feeling, so I scratched the ticket with confidence.

[First Place]

The result was exactly what I expected.

With a smirk, I shoved the first place ticket at Deong.

“You see? Now give me that DP.”

**

[Seoul, Korea]

…10 days had passed since the ‘Demonic Meteor Shower Incident’.

Humanity quickly adapted to the sudden change.

When the initial confusion settled down, the difference between ‘demon merchants’ and ‘demons’ was defined, and Heroes began purchasing useful weapons from demon merchants to hunt monsters and demonic beasts more easily.

Also, starting last week, articles about ‘Black Lotus’ started to increase in number. I didn’t know why, but since they were more or less worshipping Black Lotus, I just decided to let them be.

It was probably the work of my ‘luck’.

“…When is she coming?”

Currently, I was in Seoul waiting for Yoo Yeonha to arrive. Today was the day I was scheduled to meet Oh Jaejin, a member of the Nine Stars.

Oh Jaejin’s original setting was made of two simple sentences: ‘The only magician among the Nine Stars’, ‘The only 10-star magician in the world’.

‘What should I talk about with Oh Jaejin today?… Does he know about demon merchants and DP?’

“Ah, here she comes.”

At that moment, a limousine covered in bullet-proof material appeared in the distance.

“Hey, over here….”

I waved my hand at the limousine from the sidewalk. But, chweek— the limousine passed by me coldly.

“What the.”

‘Was that on purpose? Or did I make a mistake?’ I asked myself, confused.

It was then.

Chwaaa—

A gust of wind blew past me.

“…Huh?”

Then, the Dwarven Supercar I gave to Yoo Yeonha appeared beyond the wind.

“Phew.”

Yoo Yeonha was sitting on the seat of the snowmobile with a helmet on.

“Oh~ You look nice today.”

I smiled, and Yoo Yeonha took her helmet off.

Her long hair fluttered in the air, and for some reason, she was frowning. She glared at me with a dissatisfied, annoyed, vicious look.

Yoo Yeonha tapped on the seat behind her, her expression unchanged.

“…What’s with the face?”

“Just get on. I have a lot of questions for you but we won’t be able to meet Oh Jaejin if we’re late.”

“Mm? O-Okay. Sure.”

I got on the seat behind Yoo Yeonha. She grabbed the handlebars and pushed down on the accelerator. It only took the Dwarven Supercar 0.3 seconds to start. On the seat of a vehicle moving at 500 kilometers per hour, I asked Yoo Yeonha.

“Why can’t we meet him if we’re late?”

“It’s not that we can’t meet him. It’s more like we won’t be able to have a conversation with him.”

“…Yeah? What’s his side-effect?”

I was unsure since I hadn’t gone into a lot of details about him in the setting.

“Dementia.”

“Aha…? …What?”

Yoo Yeonha leered at me and answered nonchalantly.

“His side-effect is dementia.”

...

Chapter 284. Clouds of War (1)

Yoo Yeonha and I arrived in North Pyeongan Province. Back when I was still in Cube, North Pyeongan Province was still an abandoned land due to the number of monsters in the area and its arid land. Another reason was that it was close to Manchuria, which was filled with barbaric Djinns.

“…A lot has changed, huh.”

But now, North Pyeongan Province was completely different from before. It was as if I was on a completely different part of Earth. Although buildings weren’t built tall due to potential monster attacks, magic engineering techniques had turned the place into a high-tech city.

AI machines ran around the streets, and I could see soldiers carrying ‘magic lasers’ rather than guns.

“You told me to invest in abandoned land, so that’s what I did. Immigrants will flock here soon.”

Yoo Yeonha spoke curtly.

“Oh, yeah… I did say that, huh.”

I scratched my cheek awkwardly. I did text her about a few business ideas, but I never expected the proud Yoo Yeonha to go through with it. Maybe this was thanks to my luck too.

“I guess there are a lot of foreigners.”

Most of the people walking about were foreigners. People from all over the world had gathered here, perhaps because their home country was too dangerous or because they simply admired Korea.

“100% of the land here belongs to me. It’s not just North Pyeongan Province. North Hamgyeong Province, Chagang Province, and Yanggang Province, which were all abandoned during Outcall, were reclaimed by Essence of the Strait.”

“Oh? Good job.”

“North Hamgyeong Province and North Pyeongan Province went through the biggest change. In addition to residential buildings, they now even have schools, academies, Hunter’s associations, among others. They still can’t be compared to Seoul, but about 2 million immigrants live there now. As you can see, we’re doing our best to contribute to society.”

“…Yeah, that’s great.”

I walked as I listened to Yoo Yeonha’s self-praise. Walking past immigrants who were speaking Korean, we arrived in front of a hospital surrounded by a magic barrier.

A nurse was waiting for us led us inside. We followed her past an empty hallway into an elevator.

Yoo Yeonha pressed basement 6F.

With a ding, the elevator door opened.

“…Are we in the 70s?”

The 6th basement floor of the hospital was built like a residential area. It almost looked like we traveled back in time through the elevator, as houses were built in traditional style with old TVs and even rotary phones.

Seeing that I was confused, Yoo Yeonha explained.

“They built it like this on purpose so that Nine Stars Oh Jaejin-nim doesn’t go berserk. He was living in hiding in an old village on Jeju Island. This floor is a replica of the village.”

“…I see.”

I imagined the damage a 10-star magician could cause. It was undoubtedly best to eliminate anything that could provoke him.

“Follow me.”

We entered a large house. Yoo Yeonha took off her shoes and stood in front of the sliding door of the house’s main room. I followed after her.

Tok, tok—

Yoo Yeonha knocked, and a reply immediately sounded.

—Come in.

The aged voice was that of a woman’s.

“Excuse us.”

I walked into the room with Yoo Yeonha.

The warm, rural look of the room reminded me of my grandparents’ house. Inside, a husband and wife pair were looking at us.

“…Hello, I’m Yoo Yeonha. This person is Kim Hajin.”

“Hello.”

We both bowed. The old couple greeted us with smiles.

“Nice to meet you both. My name is Yi Yoon-Ok. Dear, you should say hi too.”

“…I’m Oh Jaejin.”

Oh Jaejin replied briefly.

He seemed cold and sharp and was exactly what I imagined a magician would look like with his long beard and long hair.

“Nice to meet you.”

“Since I don’t have much time, let’s cut to the chase. I hear you have a way of curing my side-effect?”

Oh Jaejin went straight to the point.

“Yes, it’s possible.”

Hearing my confident reply, Yi Yoon-Ok’s face brightened. But Oh Jaejin didn’t say anything. He stared at me and blinked a few times. Then, he turned to his wife.

He spoke, “…Mom, I’m hungry~”

“Ah… there he goes again. Don’t worry, just tell me and I’ll relay the information to him later.”

“I’m hungry~ I’m hungry~ I’m hungry~!”

The old Gandalf began to throw a tantrum.

“I’m hungreeeeeey~!”

I was a bit caught off guard, but I didn’t panic and took out the ingredients I brought along with a mortar.

“Shamrock plant, Otoren, pure light plant, essence of emerald, and Minotaur’s horn. They’re all medicinal ingredients from the Tower of Wish.”

“I’ll eat them!”

Oh Jaejin quickly tried to snatch the ingredients away, but I put them in a mortar before he could get his hands on them.

With my astonishing dexterity and Stigma’s magic power, I crushed the ingredients and forged them into a pill. Yi Yoon-Ok, Yoo Yeonha, and Oh Jaejin all observed my godly pill-making skills in a daze.

Soon, a total of five pills came out.

[Miracle Pill]

The pills came with various effects, but I erased most of them with ‘Setting Intervention’ and added ‘Dementia Side-effect Reversal’ as their only effect.

Each pill took 70SP to make, and the ingredients cost 100,000TP altogether.

350SP and 100,000TP were not cheap, but it wasn’t expensive if I could win over Oh Jaejin.

“These pills with cure Nine Stars Oh Jaejin-nim’s side-effect.”

Yi Yoon-Ok looked at the pills in my hand with a shocked look.

“But I would like you to promise me something.”

One pill every two weeks.

“Once he is cured, he has to help humanity.”

When I handed the pills to Yi Yoon-Ok, she nodded firmly.

“Of course, even if I stop him, he will want to do so more than anyone else. My husband is the most heroic Hero I know.”

Unsurprisingly, Yi Yoon-Ok had great trust in her husband.

**

Yoo Yeonha spoke as soon as we left the hospital.

“…That went better than I expected.”

“Yeah.”

We didn’t need to convince them much.

In a way, it was to be expected. The Nine Stars were Heroes chosen by the people based on their strength and character.

The only thing stopping them from helping humanity was the side-effect of their abilities. As long as that problem was settled, most of the Nine Stars should be happy to help.

“…By the way, do you know about this?”

It seemed Yoo Yeonha still had more to say.

“This is top-secret info, but I hear Black Lotus helped the Hero Association with their Orden Mission.”

Black Lotus. The words made me flinch every time I heard it, but I nodded leisurely.

“That’s interesting.”

“Right, so… are you not going to participate?”

“Me? I care about my life. What if Black Lotus kills me?”

“Pft… Right, you did kill Black Lotus in the Tower. I guess you brought it upon yourself then.”

Oblivious to the truth, Yoo Yeonha giggled.

“Now that I think about it, you really are amazing.”

“…Thanks. And by the way…”

Thinking that the conversation would become harder to navigate, I quickly changed the topic.

“What are you up to these days?”

“Busy as always. Even busier, actually.”

“Why?”

“You know, with the demon towns and demon merchants that suddenly appeared… I have to think of ways to get DP.”

“What are you going to do with DP?”

This was an important question. I wasn’t sure how to use the 1.8 million DP I got through the lottery. I was sure Yoo Yeonha would give me a good idea.

“A lot. Buying artifacts from other dimensions are one, but what’s even more important is DP being an instant currency. If you want a building, you can buy it. If you want gold, you can buy it. If you want a weapon, you can buy it. You can build an entire city in 3 seconds if you have enough DP.”

“Mm, I see.”

“DP can become anything, making it revolutionary. We will no longer have to wait for a project to finish or for research to be over.”

“Aha….”

I nodded and took out the [Anything Checkbook].

***

[Anything Checkbook] [8-star] ＊Effective Good＊

—A checkbook that can pay out anything. The receiver of this check must also carry out what he was paid for.

***

I wrote down 1 million DP and gave the check to Yoo Yeonha who was staring at me weirdly.

“…What’s this?”

“1 million DP.”

“…Come again?”

Yoo Yeonha took the check with a bewildered look.

“You’ll have a million won when everyone else has a thousand. You should be able to control the market with this, right?”

“Um, what is this again?”

“It’s a check for DP. Just tear it, and you’ll get 1 million DP.”

“What are you talking about….”

Yoo Yeonha grumbled as she tore the check in half. My DP fell into her hands immediately as I was left with only 800,000 DP.

“…?!”

Yoo Yeonha’s eyes popped out about 2 meters into the air. She looked even more surprised than when she found out that I was alive.

“W-What’s this?”

I grinned seeing the flustered Yoo Yeonha.

“1 million DP. I’m investing it, not giving it away for free, so use it to drive the market. You can do whatever you want with it, but half of what you achieve is going to be mine, okay?”

“Well, that’s obvious, but how did you make a million DP? Hunting demonic beasts shouldn’t be enough to….”

‘No, wait, am I dreaming?’ Yoo Yeonha shook her head and slapped her cheeks. She snapped out only after her cheeks turned red.

“Wow… hehe, hehehe.”

Yoo Yeonha smiled brightly after realizing she wasn’t dreaming.

It was an ambitionist’s smile stemming from pure bliss of being able to get ahead of her competitors.

**

…On the other hand, a meeting was underway within the Hero Association. In truth, it was more of a debate than a meeting. Only three people were present as well.

“I hear Heynckes has returned.”

The current chairman of the Hero Association, Yi Yookho, spoke. His bald head shined brightly under the room’s light.

“What do you think? Chae Joochul and Heynckes should be able to kill Orden if they work together.”

The man who responded was the former president of Korea, Kim Sukho.

“It’s not impossible, but I don’t think Chae Joochul would be willing to take any loss….”

“With Black Lotus and Kim Suho, it should be easier.”

Black Lotus.

Kim Sukho flinched when he heard Yi Yookho mention this name.

He had even hired Mountain Sage to assassinate him, but Black Lotus survived, while he lost contact with them. It was clear what that entailed.

As such, Kim Sukho wasn’t fond of Black Lotus.

At that moment, the third member of the meeting spoke up.

“But Black Lotus is too expensive. Accepting the price they put out would put the association in a deep hole.” The third member brought up a financial concern. “They’re skilled, yes, but they’re also too expensive. Those dogs don’t know what they’re worth.”

Yi Yookho retorted, “It’s better than losing to Orden. Didn’t you see the decree that arrogant fool sent? Plus, feeding your hunting dog isn’t a waste. The tougher it is, the more you have to feed.”

This week, Orden had threatened the Hero Association and various countries with an official decree. He said he would declare war if his decree was not released to the public.

The third member nodded in response to Yi Yookho, “…Then I guess we have no choice.”

Kim Sukho stared at the third member with a look of expectation.

If each of them had 33% of authority over the Association, the final 1% likely belonged to the third member as not only did he possess authority but also ‘strength’.

“We’ll just have to put down the dog after the hunt is over.”

Kim Sukho liked what he was hearing.

**

Next day.

I returned to Pandemonium and put on my Black Lotus Uniform. It was confirmed that the Chameleon Troupe would participate in the Orden Assassination Mission.

“Are you ready?” Boss asked.

“Yes, I am.”

“Oh~ Black really does look good on you.” Cheok Jungyeong commented from the side.

I shrugged and asked, “What happened to the assassins? Did you find out who was behind them?”

“No, they wouldn’t spit it out no matter what we did.”

“Mm… well, that’s to be expected from Mountain Sage. What about Jin Sahyuk?”

“She’s still imprisoned. She’s a tough one too. We sent Droon to her expecting her to get a bit scared, but she got even feistier.”

Droon’s Mimyo had multiple abilities. One of them was an illusion spell called ‘Illusory Death’, which was specialized for torture. But it probably didn’t work on Jin Sahyuk.

“She even withstood the Banshee’s Curse, so it’ll be hard to crack her.”

If anything, her endurance was top-notch. Anything less than the Banshee’s Curse probably wouldn’t leave a dent in her mental strength.

“Mm, I see… Oi, you guys, get over here!” Cheok Jungyeong suddenly shouted.

Then, the slow-moving members of the Chameleon Troupe quickly arrived.

“Geez, stop being so loud. It’s unsightly.” Setryn muttered. “You don’t need to roar for us to hear you either.”

Following her, Khalifa, Jin Yohan, Droon, Jain, and Kaita (who managed to not die) arrived. Eight of us, including me and Boss, would participate in today’s mission.

“Quiet. Now that everyone’s here, open the portal, Khalifa.”

Khalifa opened the portal at Boss’ command.

An oval portal appeared in the air, and burning heat blew out from inside.

The moment we all stepped into the portal, an emergency sound rang out from my smartwatch.

—Emergency news. The Monster King, Orden, sent a video to news agencies all over the world along with a decree. He has threatened to declare war if the decree is not released to the public. As such, after careful consideration, the government has decided to release the decree…

**

Same time, immediately after members of the Chameleon Troupe left for Africa.

“…Huu, huu.”

Click—!

Jin Sahyuk barely managed to remove the magic power suppressors on her wrists. Her body was drenched in sweat as she breathed a sigh of relief.

“Ehew….”

It was thanks to the two stats, Nonobservance and Distortion, she gained after the recent incident.

[Nonobservance] allowed her to ignore some of the magic power suppressors power, and [Distortion] strengthened the power of her Reality Manipulation.

“Bastards, just you wait….”

Jin Sahyuk staggered up. Although she was trapped in the Chameleon Troupe’s jail cell for a long time, she had still heard about the changes that happened outside.

Demon Realm Transformation and demon merchants.

Things had progressed as Bell foretold, so the next situation would be the descent of Baal.

In other words, it wouldn’t be long until she could return to Akatrina.

“Huu, huu…”

After collecting her breath and recharging her magic power, Jin Sahyuk closed her eyes and transmitted her will.

—Bell, you son of a bitch, where are you?

Although she wasn’t too familiar with using Mental Transmission, her sheer talent gave her more than enough edge.

—Oh? You got released, Sahyuk~?

—Shut it. Where are you?

—I’m with Rumi in an underground fortress.

—Underground fortress?

Jin Sahyuk frowned. ‘What the hell happened while I was imprisoned here?’

—It’s an advance base built in subterranean Africa. It’s to kill Orden. Kim Suho’s here too.

“What?”

‘I missed out on so much fun!’ Jin Sahyuk frowned.

—I’m heading over too.

—Mm? No, you can’t. Kim Suho will find out if you do. Plus, something urgent just happened.

—What.

—Orden wants to talk to the public.

‘Talk to the public? The hell does that mean?’ Jin Sahyuk wanted to ask, but she wasn’t familiar with the Mental Transmission technique and got a headache. As such, she made a portal. Her first goal was to escape from this damned prison.

“…No.”

But thinking about it a second time, leaving this place seemed like a bad idea. Her relationship with the Chameleon Troupe would end if she left. Perhaps it was better to stay here for Kim Hajin…

At that moment, a lightbulb lit up in her head.

“Oh right.”

Jin Sahyuk materialized the ‘inventory’ she made with Reality Manipulation and took out a card from it.

***

[Body Double] [6-star] ＊Effective Good＊

—Creates a puppet that looks and acts like you. (Ignition Keyword – ‘Actualize’)

—The puppet will last for 150 days, and you can switch places with the puppet at any time.

***

“Actualize.”

The moment she muttered the ignition keyword, a puppet identical to Jin Sahyuk popped out. Jin Sahyuk put the magic power suppressors on the puppet and gave it a command.

“Act like me as much as possible. Go crazy.”

The puppet stared at Jin Sahyuk blankly before nodding.

“…Okay.”

“Good.”

With a satisfied smile, Jin Sahyuk went through the portal.

...

Chapter 285. Clouds of War (2)

[Underground Fortress in Africa]

“He’s planning on building a nation.”

This was Rumi’s last testimony as the spy.

“…A nation?”

Aileen and Jin Seyeon, who were writing down Rumi’s words, tilted their heads in confusion.

“Yes. He’s already built a number of villages in Africa. Didn’t you say there were missing people after the recent monster incident?”

“Huh? Yeah, I did, but… that can’t be right.”

Rumi drank a sip of cold water and sighed.

“…Your guess is correct. Orden probably forced those missing people to migrate into the villages he built. Your drones weren’t able to detect it because his hypervigilant monster birds destroyed them beforehand.”

What Rumi was saying made sense. The government had dispatched a thousand drones to Africa but 990 of them had already been destroyed. They had to utilize the remaining 10 to plan a safe route.

But the fact that Orden kept humans alive and even built them a place to live was difficult to believe.

Rumi continued, “Trust me. I’ve seen his papers. I was in charge of assigning categories.”

“Categories?”

“Yes. I ranked monsters and villages.”

Rumi recited the ‘settings’ of Orden’s Kingdom. All monsters were assigned a category among Sacred Bone and True Bone, rank-1 to rank-9. Similarly. All villages were assigned a rank of either low, middle, and upper.

“…So you’re saying there really are villages.”

“That’s right. They’re human villages run by monsters. Orden chose this method because he knew there weren’t enough humanoid monsters compared to humans. But among Orden’s monsters are scientists who are researching ways to turn the kidnapped humans into monsters.”

When the conversation reached that point, Aileen was frowning like a dwarf in agony. Yi Gongmyung’s face on her laptop screen had a similar look.

Yi Gongmyung spoke.

—…We’ll hear about the details from the others.

“Hmm?”

Aileen and Jin Seyeon both seemed confused.

‘Is he trying to say that there are other spies besides Rumi?’ they wondered.

“What do you mean by ‘others’?”

—Oh, I received this news just now.

Yi Gongmyung let out a sigh of relief and relayed the message he had just received from his superiors.

—Apparently Black Lotus and the rest of the Chameleon Troupe are participating in this mission. They’re traveling by land, so if there really are villages, then they’ll be the first to run into them.

**

We arrived in Africa. At first, we couldn’t help but wonder if we arrived at the wrong place. A lot had changed since the last time we visited.

“Isn’t that a village~?”

Jain muttered in surprise. Other members, including me, were surprised as well.

“…Yes, that seems to be a village.”

It sufficed to say that Africa had also went through a ‘great change’. The land that once crawled with monsters had been transformed into one fit for human survival. There weren’t any tall buildings or skyscrapers that could be seen in a city. However, there were small, round buildings which were enough to create a rural scenery.

“Where are we exactly, Khalifa?”

Boss asked Khalifa.

“I’d say we’re on the outskirts of Orden’s Territory. We only have to travel 700 km to reach Orden’s palace.”

Orden would’ve noticed instantly if we had set up a portal near his palace. So, Khalifa created his portal on the outskirts of Africa. This village was erected in the middle of the shortest route to Orden’s palace.

“But those villagers aren’t monsters.”

Cheok Jungyeong narrowed his eyes and peered into the distance, tilting his head sideways.

“You’re right. They’re all humans.”

Because I had better eyesight than him, I had noticed that the second we arrived here. All the villagers were humans. Not monsters but pure humans.

“Ah~ I heard that the number of missing people skyrocketed after the recent monster incident~ So this is where he brought all those people~ By the looks of it, he even brainwashed them a little~ How interesting~”

Jain chuckled.

The Middle East and Western Europe were still infested with monsters, yet the number of missing people were much higher than the number of casualties. It made sense for the village to be this big if we assumed that those missing people were kidnapped rather than killed.

“Hmm. Well, let’s see what Orden has to say first.”

I pulled up the live broadcast of Orden’s declaration on my smartwatch.

—…First, I demand humans be sent to Africa. Each country is to send two hundred million people. I promise to keep the hostages safe.

—Second, I demand official acknowledgment and respect of me and my servants as ‘Neohumans’. Neohumans are superior to humans. Humans should be grateful that we’re not choosing to eliminate them or rule over them forcefully.

Orden’s demands were quite absurd. No country would ever agree to hand over two hundred million citizens to any entity, much less a hostile one.

—…As a tolerant ruler, I am willing to offer the humans a grace period of 6 months.

“That’s enough crap for a day. It seems that Orden built this village.”

I turned the smartwatch off and looked at the members of the Chameleon Troupe.

They were all looking at me.

“Well… Why don’t we build an outpost for ourselves first? Like that underground fortress, the Special Task Force built.”

“Outpost~?”

Jain tilted her head questioningly.

“Yes. This mission will probably take a while.”

“Why don’t we just use that village as the outpost?”

Cheok Jungyeong suggested.

“Mm, that sounds like a good idea.”

“So I guess even a bonehead like you can be useful once in a while~”

Not only Jin Yohan and Setryn but also Jain agreed.

“Uh….”

“Why are you hesitating? We could wipe that place out in a second.”

It was then that I realized the true strength of our party.

In fact, Cheok Jungyeong and Boss alone would be enough to overwhelm most humanoid monsters.

“…Okay, then.”

With a smile, I raised a finger and pointed to the center of the village.

“How about that castle over there? Seems like a place where the village lord would live.”

The castle wasn’t enormous but it was taller than all the other buildings around it.

“Good. Let’s head there.”

At Boss’s declaration, we moved like the wind.

[‘Crean’, a low-rank village located in the far south corner of Orden’s Kingdom]

“Hmm….”

‘Tenzuhar’ was the name of the humanoid monster selected to become the lord of Crean. He was small and looked like a lizard. He was selected as the lord because he was an eloquent speaker and possessed a rare ability called ‘Brainwash’.

It was also because stronger humanoid monsters preferred to stay in the central palace rather than rule over humans.

“…Hmm.”

Tenzuhar pondered, shaking his leg. ‘How can I win Orden’s affection and acquire fame and fortune? I can’t possibly satiate my thirst for ambition on the outskirts of a hot country like this.’

“Surely improving the village won’t be enough. Slurp.”

Only humans resided in Crean. Villages located deeper into the mainland had at least some monster residents. But he’d have to be at least rank-1 to be able to take over villages like that.

“Slurp. Even if I dig the mines, all the ores end up flowing into middle or upper-rank villages….”

Crean was a low-rank mining village.

“But if I don’t produce anything, I’ll only end up getting punished. Slurp.”

Premian, the most delicate magic ore on Earth.

A large amount of Premian was buried in Crean and that was why all the villagers were humans. With monsters’ sharp claws, they would crush Premian into dust before even digging them out completely.

“There’s no opportunity for me to stand out…. Slurp.”

Tenzuhar smacked his lips.

Most small humanoid monsters possessed a great desire to succeed. It was a genetic predisposition, granted to them as compensation as they weren’t as strong as other monsters.

Tenzuhar was no different. He was dissatisfied with the village he was in charge of, even though Crean was far too good for him.

“Darn it. Guard!”

Irritated, Tenzuhar called in a guard to gratify his hunger.

—Krrrk!

Tenzuhar’s guard was a rank-4 monster who lacked the ability to speak or to think complex thoughts. He was assigned rank-4 only because he was strong. Strong enough to win against a high-rank grade-3 Hero.

“Give me something to eat!”

—Krrk!

The guard nodded his head and left.

“Tsk.”

The criteria for classifying monsters had been developed only recently. Most monsters were assigned into a class between rank-1 and rank-9. Only a select few could become a ‘True Bone’ or a ‘Sacred Bone’.

“Slurp. What can I do with underlings who can’t even speak?”

In fact, the primary criterion for classifying a monster was its ability to speak. If you couldn’t speak properly, you were rank-2 at best. The second most important criteria considered strength, intelligence, and special ability.

Tenzuhar was a rank-3 humanoid monster. He was weak but could speak fluently. His ability was decent and his intelligence was above human average.

Crash—

At that moment, he heard a ruckus downstairs.

Tenzuhar got up from his seat, full of anger.

“Slurp! He can’t even do something as simple as bringing me food! Slurp.”

He stomped towards the door to go give his guard a scolding.

It was then.

Kiik— The door opened.

No, somebody opened the door.

Confused, Tenzuhar looked at the human beyond the gap.

“…?”

The human was huge. His muscles were the size of his head and his legs were as thick as his waist.

‘Did I have a resident who looks like that?’ Tenzuhar pondered.

Suddenly, ssk—

A sharp blade reached Tenzuhar’s neck. The humanoid monster gasped at the sudden coldness.

“Quiet.”

“….”

Tenzuhar glanced at the enemy behind him.

He couldn’t see the intruder’s face, but Tenzuhar noticed that he was wearing a black robe with a lotus embroidery.

‘Black Lotus.’

His symbol was well known among Orden’s monsters as well. Tenzuhar started to drool in fear.

“…Do you have anything to say?”

Black Lotus asked.

Under overwhelming pressure and fear, Tenzuhar answered.

“Spare me…. I know nothing. Slurrrp. Slurp, slurp. Slurrrrp….”

Tenzuhar began to roll his tongue rapidly and soon lost consciousness when he choked on his own tongue. Kim Hajin looked at his stats.

[Life force 33/100]

[Name — Tenzuhar]

[Alignment — Misdemeanors / Ambitionist]

[Realm — Stage-1 Average]

[Potential — Stage-3 Average]

[Job — Low-rank Administrator]

[Status — Unconscious from fear]

[Special Ability — Low-intermediate-rank Brainwash]

[Potential to coax — Surprisingly high]

He didn’t have the ability to call for help remotely.

There was no reason to kill him, so Kim Hajin threw him on the floor.

**

We easily took over the castle. I tied Tenzuhar up with a rope and hung him upside down. Then, I settled on a nearby sofa.

“Hm. The view is surprisingly beautiful from here.”

“So now that the outpost is taken care of….”

Boss looked outside the window and Jain muttered with a map in her hands.

“There are only four villages from here to Orden’s Palace.”

“…!”

At that moment, Tenzuhar opened his eyes.

“Huuak!”

“Eh? What the. You didn’t kill this guy, Lotus~?”

“No. I thought maybe we could use him later on.”

“Slurp. Please spare me. Spare me, slurp. Slurrrp….”

Tenzuhar fainted again soon after opening his eyes.

‘What a strange monster.’

I ignored him and summoned a demon merchant.

[You spent 1000 DP to summon the demon merchant ‘Kuong’.]

—Nice to see you! I’m the visiting demon merchant, Kuong!

Kuong, the only ‘neutral’ demon merchant I’d seen, appeared before us. He beamed at me.

“I need a communication device that I can use to contact the underground fortress. Do you have anything like that?”

—Yes, of course~ One for you and one for the fortress. That’ll be 1250 DP including the delivery fee.

When I paid him the 1250 DP through the System, Kuong handed me a black handheld transceiver.

—Thank you. Is there anything else?

“Uh… Maybe?“

The demon merchant system turned out to be more useful than I thought. The fact that they were willing to do anything for me as long as I paid them was very convenient, just like Yoo Yeonha said.

I stroked my chin as I spoke.

“…Hey.”

—Yes?

“Is there a way to, um, make DP without doing anything?

—You already did, with the lottery!

“Well, that’s true. But you said that the number of first place tickets is fixed. And it’s pretty tiring to scratch all those tickets.”

DP lottery was divided into different rounds and there were only 10 first place tickets in a round. So, as the number of first place tickets decreased, the chance of winning decreased as well. And there was no way for me to know if all the first place tickets had already been picked, especially considering that this lottery happened in multiple dimensions like the demon merchant said.

—Mmm~ Then, would you like to try the minigame?

“Minigame?”

“Hey, Lotus~ Are you having fun with the merchant~?”

Jain suddenly intervened, and I pushed her away.

“What is it?”

—Please look over here.

Kuong spread his palms and, all of sudden, a video popped up.

[A dimension within a dimension. Your DP donation can save other subdimensions.]

It sounded like a line from a public service advertisement.

After about 5 seconds, a sphere appeared above Kuong’s palms.

“What’s this?”

—Similar to the lottery, this is a game of luck. This planet is called ‘Lailos’. It’s a subdimension of Earth.

“Subdimension?”

—Yes, it’s a dimension that’s lower in rank than Earth. The difference between Earth and Lailos is kind of like the difference between ‘reality’ and a ‘novel’.

“…Why would you compare it to a novel of all things?”

—It’s just an example. Anyways, look here.

Kuong shook his hand to zoom in on ‘Lailos’. The sphere transformed into a plot of land. A group of knights were standing there.

Kuong spoke.

—’Lailos’ is also fighting against Demon Realm Transformation. You, a being from a higher dimension, can help the people of Lailos.

“Why would I help them? I’m busy taking care of myself.”

—By sponsoring a person, you can earn DP every time the person you sponsor kills a demonic beast.

“…Hmm. Really?”

I looked closely at the knights.

‘One, two, one, two—!’

Hundreds of tiny knights were training hard.

‘You won’t kill a single demonic beast if that’s all you’re capable of!’

Even the superior knight’s scolding sounded cute.

—Why don’t you give it a try? But be careful! You can only sponsor up to three people. It’s usually one, but you get two extra because you have 5 stats! Anyways, you should try to pick someone with high potential.

“Ah~ So that’s why you said this was similar to the lottery.”

—That’s right! You should pick the strongest and the most diligent one! Time also flows quicker in this dimension. A year in Lailos is 30 days in this world. You’re going to be sitting on a mountain of DP soon!

“Got it.”

The conditions were extremely advantageous for me.

I didn’t even have to use my luck.

I looked over the knights one by one and began gauging their potential. It didn’t matter how strong they were right now. I focused on their ‘potential’.

One knight had a potential of [Stage-3 Average], the other was [Stage-4 Rare], and even the superior with the loud voice was only [Stage-5 Rare].

‘Does anyone here have actual talent?’

I carefully studied the knights.

“…Ah, found one.”

A woman was hiding behind a tree, watching the other knights train.

She looked young and she still had her baby fat. But the look on her face was upright and determined just like a knight should be.

[Life force 100/100]

[Name — Litrain]

[Alignment — Good / Ambitionist]

[Realm — Stage-0 Below-Average]

[Potential — Stage-9 Extraordinary]

[Job — Squire]

[Status — Feeling envious of her seniors]

[Potential to coax — Looking for a master to serve]

Her potential was an astounding stage-9. I wasn’t exactly sure how good that was, but I assumed it was good enough that she could grow on her own even if I left her alone.

I picked Litrain as my beneficiary.

[You have chosen to sponsor Litrain, a squire.]

—How much would you like to donate?

“100,000 DP.”

—Wow, you’re very generous~

[You have donated 100,000 DP to Litrain. Litrain has gained the feature ‘Status Window’.]

[Litrain will gratefully use your donation.]

The next moment, Litrain’s eyes widened. Unsurprisingly, she looked confused.

But this ‘donation’ appeared to be a well-known phenomenon in Lailos. Litrain clenched her fists and jumped up in joy.

—Hooray~! I was chosen-!

At her shout, all the other knights turned their attention to her.

“What’s this? She’s suddenly happy.”

—Ah, the people of Lailos are familiar with donations… Hmm? Something strange happened during the donation process!

Kuong’s eyes suddenly widened, and a number of system messages blocked my view.

[Your interdimensional luck activates.]

[As a result of your luck, Litrain’s physical ability is strengthened!]

[As a result of your luck, Litrain’s growth is accelerated!]

[You can now receive 100% of DP that Litrain earns from hunting demonic beasts.]

—Congratulation! This character will become very strong, very soon! You’ll be able to recover your initial donation of 100,000 DP in two months.

“…Mm, well this sounds great.”

I looked at Litrain, who was jumping up and down in joy, then turned the ‘minigame’ off.

“That’s done.”

I grabbed the transceiver I bought and turned around.

“Underground Fortress, can you hear me?”

The transceiver was connected to the underground fortress.

The answer came quickly.

—Yes, I can. This is Aileen, and you are… Lotus? I received the transceiver. So we meet again. It’s good to see you, I guess?

Aileen’s voice sounded cheerful as usual.

I spoke in Black Lotus’s usual nonchalant manner.

“This is Black Lotus. We have taken over one of Orden’s villages.”

...

Chapter 286. Clouds of War (3)

—Village? There’s really a village in Africa?

Aileen’s tone went up as if in surprise.

I looked at the map on the village lord’s desk and said, “Yes, the village is named Crean. We just took down the lord.”

—What? It even has a lord?

“It was a humanoid monster resembling a lizard. Tenzuhar was his name.”

—….

Aileen became quiet for a moment, and other voices began to buzz from the other side.

“Ah~ It’s that kid again~?”

Jain grumbled unhappily. I smirked and turned the transreceiver off.

“I’ve been curious, Jain. How do you know Aileen?”

“Me? Mm~ It’s nothing special~ I used to act as a Hero in the past. She was my superior. That stupid brat is only two years older than me. I hated how she acted all important because of her Gift~”

Tzzt—

The transreceiver buzzed as soon as Jain finished her sentences.

—Who’s living in the village?

It wasn’t Aileen’s voice but Yun Seung-Ah’s. Jain, who had a bad relationship with her, frowned.

I cleared my throat with a cough, then replied with my voice changed to Black Lotus’s.

“Humans.”

—Are they doing okay?

“They’re physically healthy. It looks like they were brainwashed, but it didn’t look like they were being abused. They think of themselves as ‘miners’ who have been living here for a long time.”

—….

It became silent once again.

Since I wasn’t hearing any static noise either, I guessed that they turned off their transceiver and started a meeting.

I checked the ‘minigame’ while I waited for a response.

「…Half a day had passed since Litrain was chosen. Many knights congratulated her, but it was obvious how much they envied her.

Litrain’s physical strength improved the moment she was chosen, and she received close to 130,000 points. It was clear that Litrain’s sponsor was an unprecedented magnate.

The knights couldn’t understand what such a rich sponsor saw in Litrain.

An uneducated squire who came to the capital without a plan, a country bumpkin who would only remain a baggage carrier, that was who Litrain was in their eyes.

No one knew whether Litrain was aware of the knights’ dissatisfaction, but she began to turn her life around. The moment she was ‘chosen’, she set up a shrine for her sponsor in her small room and prayed before every meal. Being ‘chosen’ was her dream. Now that she achieved it, her happiness knew no bounds….」

“Hm.”

Things seemed to be progressing well. Though, she didn’t really need to worship me…

Seeing Litrain, who was praying before eating, I pondered.

***

[Buster Call] [High-rank]

—Using Stigma’s magic power, summon from the Tower of Wish vassals, who swore loyalty to Kim Hajin, or his possessions.

***

My sole active-Gift, Buster Call.

By adding another word or two after ‘Tower of Wish’, I felt like I could use it to summon Litrain as well.

For example, [summon from the Tower of Wish or another dimension…]

“Oi, Kuong.”

I spoke to Kuong who was standing around silently.

—Yes?

“You said we live in a higher dimension, right?”

—Yes, compared to the minigame’s dimension.

“Then is it possible to summon a being from a lower dimension to a higher dimension?”

—Mm, I’m not sure since I haven’t tried. But it could be possible. Afterall, you are from an upper dimension.

“…What’s the difference between an upper dimension and a lower one?”

—Simply put, higher dimensions are more stable. To people from lower dimensions, beings from

higher dimensions are like gods.

‘Stable…’ I was thinking about the meaning of this word when Kuong kindly explained it.

—More stable dimensions have weaker humans. The most stable dimension would be one where an individual human would have the least freedom to interfere with nature.

It was clear what Kuong was saying.

But why did I think of my original world, ‘Earth’?

The Earth I lived in didn’t have magic, mana, magic power, martial arts, or anything of that nature.

Although humanity advanced technology to overcome nature, countless number of people died during the process. It was certainly the world where ‘an individual human would have the least freedom to interfere with nature.’

I stared at Kuong with a look of suspicion. But Kuong only grinned without saying anything.

“Now then—”

Tzzt— At that moment, the transceiver buzzed again. Kuong also said his time was up and disappeared.

—This is Beetle. Can you hear me?

“…Beetle?”

—It’s a codename. What are your plans from now?

“…We plan on using the village lord as our pathfinder.”

—Pathfinder? Ah, got it. Let us know when you reach the next village. I have a meeting to attend to now.

With that, the transreceiver went quiet.

I looked at Tenzuhar, who was tied up and dangling from a rope in the ceiling. His eyes were closed as though he was unconscious, but I could see his status.

[Status – nervous he might be discovered.]

He was pretending to be unconscious.

“Open your eyes. Otherwise, I’ll kill you.”

“….”

“Five, four, three….”

“I, I’m awake!”

Tenzuhar shot his eyes open before I even reached two.

“Oh~ He was awake~?” Jain grinned and approached him.

Tenzuhar made a submissive smile and rubbed his hands together. “Slurp. I, I just woke up… Slurp.”

“….” I left him dangling in the air and spoke, “Oi.”

“Yes?”

“…Can you act as our pathfinder?”

“Pathfinder?”

“That’s right. We have to keep going.”

Even if I could avoid traps using my excellent eyesight, it likely couldn’t compare to a humanoid monster who had knowledge of the area.

“…O-Of course! Slurp.”

Tenzuhar seemed to ponder for a moment but quickly gave an enthusiastic reply. He must have realized this was the only way he could live.

It was then.

[How have you been, Hyung-nim?]

A message popped up in front of me.

[It’s jajangman. It’s been a while ㅋㅋ ^^]

“…What’s this?”

[I stopped in TOW (Tower of Wish) to pull some cards. I’m messaging you because I pulled something interesting. ㅋㅋ Hold on, let me see if I can send you the card info.]

“The hell?”

Chae Nayun’s voice was also transmitted along with the message. The ringing sound gave me a slight headache.

[ㅋㅋ Look at this ㅋㅋ I screamed the moment I pulled it ㅋㅋ It’s the first 8-star card I pulled ㅋㅋㅋ]

A card info popped up in front of me.

***

[Infinite Communication] [8-star] ＊Effective Good＊

—Select 55 Players for unlimited communication.

—Text and voice will be transmitted simultaneously. The receiver cannot reject your communication without the 7-star card, [Refuse Communication].

—The user of this card becomes immune to mental interference-type effects.

***

[Hahaha, how is it, Hyung-nim? Have you pulled an 8-star card before~? Ah~ It’s been a while since I quit the Tower but pulling this makes me want to go back. I have an important mission to do too….]

“Geez, so loud….”

Wasn’t she supposed to stay in the underground fortress? Why did she go to the Tower?

[…Ah, oops, my bad. I put the sound up too high ;;]

Well, it seemed she figured it out.

Chae Nayun’s voice, which was akin to a roar, fell to the level of a whisper.

“Haa… haaa….”

[Ah, Hyung-nim, I set it so the communication is bi-directional. If there’s anything you want to say, you just have to text me.]

“…What kind of a card is this?”

How did she pull an 8-star card anyways with her luck?

I clenched my head and collected my breath.

**

The next day.
