—Perfect. Do you know what to do?

“…Of course. If he used the internet even once, I can track him down.”

In the Falling Blossom guild, a man named Kim Hosup had risen to the number 1 position in tracking. In the current digital age, there wasn’t anyone who lived without using the internet.

Now linked with a supercomputer worth billions of won, Kim Hosup could find anyone who was born after the 1980s.

—Great, then I’ll wait for the good news. Be careful.

“Okay, talk to you later. I have a meeting to go to now.”

—Ah, wait, how is the guild business going recently?

“…Guild business? Pft.”

Yoo Yeonha laughed. With the recent Orden Incident, Essence of the Strait had risen to the undisputed number 1 position in the world.

Although Creator’s Sacred Grace skyrocketed to the rank 2 position with the help of Kim Suho and Yun Seung-Ah, the gap between the two was still huge. Essence of the Strait had also made great achievements, thanks to Guild Leader Yoo Jinwoong, Vice-Leader Yi Jin-Ah, and the rising star Chae Nayun.

The guild aside, Essence of the Strait’s subsidiary businesses were simply insurmountable.

Essential Pharmacy, Essential Dynamics, and the other conglomerate-scale businesses were on the precipice of record high revenues in their fields.

“It’s going great. At this rate, people might start calling me the Queen of Korea instead of the Queen of Seoul.”

—Ooh… Well, that’s great to hear. Looks like I can live off my niece when I grow old.

Yoo Jinhyuk laughed lightly.

—Then see you later.

“Yes, see you later, Uncle.”

Tk—

“Let’s see… Falling Blossom Team, answer.”

As soon as the caller hung up, Yoo Yeonha relayed the mission to Falling Blossom.

**

…You completed the third phase with high contributions. A streak of Stigma is added. Proficiency of Master Sharpshooter increases. You gain a significant amount of SP. Young Dwarf’s Dexterity…

Several sentences entered my faint consciousness. It wasn’t just the sentences. Chae Nayun’s voice struck my ear as well.

[Kim Hajin, are you awake?]

[You didn’t run away again, did you?]

[I heard from Old Man Heynckes. I heard you’re going to get stabbed my his knife if you don’t reply to me.]

[Message me when you wake up.]

From the looks of it, humanity seemed to have won the war.

I tried to send Chae Nayun a message.

[I’m up.]

The constraints on me were starting to loosen. Although I couldn’t move my body yet, I could reply to Chae Nayun’s Infinite Communication.

[…]

But Chae Nayun didn’t reply no matter how long I waited. It seemed she was busy with something.

“….”

I put strength into my eyes. I needed to see before I could do anything.

“…Huu!”

Thankfully, it didn’t take long for me to open my eyes. A white ceiling filled my vision.

Ssk— Ssk—

Next, I focused my strength on my fingers and toes. It was a bit harder this time around, but I eventually regained control of my body after about 10 minutes of struggling.

“Ehew….”

This was enough for now.

I let out a sigh and turned my head to the side where I was hearing the ruffling of paper for a while.

“…Huh?”

I was faced with an unexpected scene. Jin Sahyuk was lying on a couch, reading a manhwa.

“Hm? Oh, you’re awake.”

Jin Sahyuk spoke with her eyes still fixed on the manhwa. I stared at her blankly.

“…Why are you here?”

“What do you mean?”

Tak—

She closed the manhwa. She stared back at me, then muttered something I couldn’t quite understand.

“I’m protecting you from certain danger.”

...

Chapter 302. After the War (2)

Jin Sahyuk spoke words I couldn’t understand. But it didn’t seem like she was joking. To be honest, we weren’t exactly close enough to be exchanging jokes.

So I simply asked back.

“…You’re protecting me?”

“Yep, you heard right.”

She even put the manhwa down and looked at me seriously.

“…I need more details.”

Jin Sahyuk shrugged.

“I don’t know much either. It was an order from Bell.”

“Bell?”

“Yeah. He said Yi Yeonjun was planning to kill you. I know you’re not the type to go down easily, but people that Bell warn me about are usually strong.”

“…?”

‘Is it because I’m still drowsy? I feel like I just heard something crazy….’

I looked at Jin Sahyuk with a frown.

Jin Sahyuk shook her head.

“I already told you, I don’t know much. I just took you out of the bunker because Bell said it was dangerous for you to be around the Chameleon Troupe right now. So, I saved you, in a sense.”

“…Wait, did you just say Yi Yeonjun?”

I knew who ‘Yi Yeonjun’ was.

He was the former leader of the Chameleon Troupe who died as a result of Bell’s betrayal.

According to Boss, at least.

“Yeah.”

“Isn’t he dead?”

“Hmm….”

Jin Sahyuk stroked her chin as she tried to sort her thoughts.

“I don’t know the details, but… I heard he came back to life.”

“How’s that possible?”

“How would I know? More importantly,” Jin Sahyuk placed her index finger on my chest and said, “It’s your turn to speak.”

“Speak about what?”

“You said Bell confessed to you.”

“Confessed? What the hell are you….”

Then I remembered. Bell had informed me that he was Baal’s incarnation body and that I’d have to kill him in order to reach a happy ending.

Jin Sahyuk brushed her hair off her face and looked at me.

“…Bell said he told you all his secrets.”

“Ah, so that’s what you meant. Well….”

I shrugged my shoulders and told Jin Sahyuk everything I heard from Bell.

Her expression became more and more serious as I continued to talk. She even started to bite her fingernails when I told her that Bell was Baal’s incarnation body.

“…That’s all I heard from Bell.”

I finished talking and turned on my smartwatch. There were lots of messages from lots of different people, including Kim Suho and Evandel. But the name that caught my attention immediately was ‘Boss’.

[Hajin whre are you?]

[Where are you?]

[I have someone I’d like you to meet. Where did you go?]

‘Don’t worry, I’m on the Genkelope’s Vessel.’ I wrote back and got up from the bed. Then I took a quick tour around the place.

The gray walls were neat and the kitchen and the bathroom were clean. I could see the whole of the East Sea beyond the windows.

It was late at night and the ocean waves were dancing in the darkness. For me, it felt as if the ‘final arc’ that I didn’t know about was lurking in the very same darkness.

“What are you looking at?”

Jin Sahyuk came up to me. She, too, turned her gaze to the sea.

I asked Jin Sahyuk, “Do you still think I’m Kindspring?”

I smiled wryly at the thought of the misunderstanding. Sorting it out with Jin Sahyuk would most likely cost me a lot. Bringing up Kindspring just now raised ‘Synchronization’ by 0.3%.

[Current Synchronization — 13%]

Jin Sahyuk turned her head to look at me. She didn’t seem too upset now— perhaps Kim Chundong’s emotions had affected her as well.

She looked at me in the eyes and gave a small laugh.

“…Not anymore. But I’m sure you have something to do with Kindspring.”

I smiled. It was a silent affirmation.

Jin Sahyuk announced, “I’ll be by your side until I figure out your relationship with Kindspring.”

“…That’s also an order from Bell, huh?”

“Yeah. So just tell me one thing every month,” Saying so, Jin Sahyuk turned her gaze to the sea. I did so as well. Things I still didn’t know were dancing in the shadows.

It was then something suddenly crossed my mind.

I asked carefully, “…Do you still plan to return to your homeland?”

“Of course,” Jin Sahyuk nodded without a hint of hesitation.

“Why?”

“Because people are waiting for me there.”

“Akatrina has already fallen.”

“No, you never know. Akatrina is stronger than you think.”

“…”

As the original author, I knew that Akatrina had fallen for good. Not to mention, 30 years had passed after Jin Sahyuk’s death. Akatrina wouldn’t have been able to survive for that long.

“What if Akatrina doesn’t exist? Are you still going to go back?” I asked coldly. I was feeling somewhat sympathetic towards the king who hoped for something impossible.

“…It doesn’t matter.”

I thought Jin Sahyuk might get mad.

But instead, she shook her head calmly.

“Without Akatrina, I have no reason left to live.”

“…”

She carried the most resolute determination in the world. Though Jin Sahyuk lost many things, she still held onto this hope.

“I’ll gladly meet my death in my homeland.”

‘Akatrina’ meant everything to Jin Sahyuk.

[Someone inside you responded to the king’s conviction.]

[Synchronization has increased by 2%.]

[Current Synchronization — 15%]

[Warning! Be careful not to lose yourself.]

It seemed that Kim Chundong’s loyalty towards Jin Sahyuk was also genuine.

“…”

I turned away from Jin Sahyuk. To distract myself, I called Spartan. Spartan appeared out of the void and landed on my shoulder.

“What’s that?”

I ignored Jin Sahyuk’s question and turned my attention to my smartwatch.

[Hajin, I miss you ㅠ-ㅠ]

[I’m bored~]

[This is the spirit beast I made today~ Cute kitty~ Do you like it?]

[ㅠㅠ Why won’t you reply?]

[I miss you]

[ㅠㅠ]

All these were messages were from Evandel. I couldn’t answer because I had been unconscious.

They were enough to make me forget about Synchronization.

“…Spartan?”

—Piek?

“Let’s go see Evandel.”

—Prrr.

“What? Where do you think you’re going-”

With a nod, Spartan immediately activated Teleportation.

**

We arrived at a dense forest filled with the energy of spirit beasts. This forest belonged to Evandel.

Most humans could never enter this natural fortress because of the magic power filled up inside their bodies. But I could, thanks to my [Magic Dysfunction Physique] and the [Black Lotus Uniform].

I walked towards Evandel’s cabin with Spartan on my shoulder.

My Gift, [Master Sharpshooter], which had leveled up to grade-1, allowed me to comprehend the structure of the forest and Evandel’s location the moment I set foot inside it.

[♥ Evandel’s Cabin ^-^ ★]

Soon, I arrived at a cabin with a cute door plate.

With a smile of satisfaction, I knocked on the door.

I heard a noise inside.

Not being able to wait any longer, I peeked through the door. Evandel was rubbing her eyes in bed. It seemed she just woke up.

“Evandel, it’s me.”

I whispered in front of the door. Immediately, Evandel’s eyes widened. She got out of bed in a hurry and bolted to the door to open it.

“…!”

Her eyes became even bigger when she saw me.

“How have you been?”

“…Aaaang!”

Having been left alone for months, Evandel jumped into my arms with tears in her eyes. The way she called my name repeatedly—‘Hajin~ Hajiiin~’—made me tear up a little as well.

I hugged Evandel and patted her head.

…It was most definitely a touching reunion.

For the next 4 hours, I looked around the cabin with Evandel, went outside to play with Evandel and her spirit beasts, had Evandel introduce all of her spirit beasts to me one by one, and then returned to the cabin.

“Do you want to meet Rachel now?”

“Rachel?!”

Evandel squealed in joy.

“Yes, but we can’t meet her in person. We’ll just call her.”

“…Ah.”

At first, she seemed a little disappointed, but soon a smile appeared on her face.

For a more vivid experience, I opened an app called [Hologram]. I then sent Rachel a text asking her to give me a video call.

Tiriring—

Soon, my smartwatch rang, and I immediately picked up Rachel’s call.

[Entering Hologram Chatroom]

A hologram of Rachel appeared in front of us. It was so realistic that I felt as if Rachel was there in person.

“Hi.”

—What’s going on? How did you get in there, Hajin-ssi?

“I have my ways.”

“Rachel~”

Evandel spread her arms out and went up to Rachel. She was going for a hug, but because Rachel was just a hologram, Evandel passed right through Rachel’s body.

“Ah.”

—…Hold on a little longer, Evandel. We’ll see each other again soon.

Rachel gave a gentle smile. Evandel nodded.

But the heartwarming atmosphere did not last for long.

Beep— Beep— Suddenly, a number of messages popped up in the air accompanied by the sound of alarms.

[Administrator is entering the chatroom through admin permission.]

[Code:1231]

Administrator’s interference.

Immediately, a different hologram appeared in the cabin.

—Hm. So it was you two, after all.

“…What the.”

My heart skipped a beat from surprise.

The administrator who hijacked our chatroom was none other than ‘Yoo Yeonha’.

Yoo Yeonha looked at Evandel, then Rachel, then me before smiling.

—She’s that child?

Yoo Yeonha pointed at Evandel.

“H-Huh? What do you mean?”

I quickly hid Evandel behind me, but Yoo Yeonha frowned like a demon.

—I already heard everything from Rachel.

“What?” I turned to Rachel.

With a bitter smile, Rachel nodded.

—She’s right, though it was more like we got caught. But she promised to become Evandel’s patron. I left you a text because you didn’t answer the phone… I guess you didn’t see it.

Yoo Yeonha grinned and held out her hand to Evandel all of a sudden.

—Hi. It’s nice to meet you.

“Ah, yes, hello….”

Though a bit shy, Evandel responded courteously.

—Hmmn…. Cute girl.

“How did you even manage to come into this room?”

Yoo Yeonha folded her arms in a pompous manner.

—My company made this app. More importantly….

Tadadak— Yoo Yeonha started typing on a keyboard. She was trying to send a private message to me.

[You’re the one who asked Yoo Jinhyuk to investigate Yi Yeonjun, right?]

“…!”

I flinched, then threw a quick glance at Yoo Yeonha. She seemed convinced that it was me.

I really couldn’t get anything past Yoo Yeonha. At this point, I knew she wouldn’t believe me even if I said it wasn’t me.

“Kuhum”

I let out a dry cough and nodded slightly.

[I knew it. We’re putting our all into the Yi Yeonjin investigation right now. The whole thing does seem a little shady, but why are you looking for a dead man?]

So she already figured out Yi Yeonjun is officially dead.

Impressed, I sent Yoo Yeonha a private message.

[Rumor has it that he’s alive.]

—Pardon?

Yoo Yeonha frowned further.

[Oh, then maybe….]

She didn’t finish her sentence, but I knew she was asking about the Kwang-Oh Incident.

[Yeah, Yi Yeonjin was the leader of the Chameleon Troupe during the Kwang-Oh Incident. Back then, the Chameleon Troupe was more cruel and inhumane than now.]

[…I see.]

Yoo Yeonha made a somewhat sad expression.

[I get why you’d want to catch him.]

Tadadak—

Her typing continued.

[…I get it but don’t do it alone. I know how much you resent the Chameleon Troupe, but… promise me you’ll work with me this time.]

Regret, sadness, determination, resolve… all those emotions were embedded in Yoo Yeonha’s expression.

[Okay. I’ll count on you, then.]

I replied with a faint smile.

However.

Rachel, who had been left out all along, suddenly narrowed her eyes.

—…What are you two doing?

—…Doesn’t concern you. It’s something important.

Yoo Yeonha waved her hand at Rachel as if shooing away a fly. Rachel closed her mouth in embarrassment. Determined to take revenge, she then tweaked a few settings, shrinking the size of Yoo Yeonha’s hologram.

—What the. What are you doing? Can’t you tell that I’m in the middle of a conversation?

—No, I’m the one who was in a call with Hajin-ssi. You’re the intruder, Yeonha-ssi.

—What? Are you kidding me?! …Wha-

Suddenly, Yoo Yeonha’s voice became high pitched. Rachel had not only altered Yoo Yeonha’s size but also her voice….

—What do you think you’re doing? Change me back! We didn’t make this feature so that you could do something like this!

—Haha. You’re cute when you’re small, Yeonha-ssi. Would you like bunny ears as well…?

Rachel tapped on the screen a couple of times. Yoo Yeonha’s nose became red and a pair of bunny ears popped up on her head.

—Hey! Are you crazy?!

Yoo Yeonha was not the type to let things slide. She used administrator privileges to make Rachel smaller than Evandel.

—Ah. What is this? Change me back!

—You started it.

—Stop being childish.

—You’re the one to talk.

Yoo Yeonha and Rachel, both 130cm tall, glared at each other.

Evandel watched them as if she was watching a play. I called Spartan.

“Spartan?”

—Prrr.

Words weren’t necessary between me and Spartan.

Spartan could read my mind and always did what I needed him to do.

“Nothing’s wrong with the invisibility cloak, right?”

—Prrr.

“Good. Be careful, and if you get caught, return immediately.”

I asked Spartan to monitor Yi Yeonjun and Boss. I wanted to see what Yi Yeonjun was up to and protect Boss.

—Kiaaao!

Spartan flapped his wings and disappeared into the sky.

—Just because the media is calling you the Elemental Swordsman, you’re holding your head too high….

—Don’t you know that it’s a crime to use company admin rights to spy on a private chatroom…

Meanwhile, Rachel and Yoo Yeonha were still arguing with each other. They were yelling and pointing fingers at each other, but I couldn’t understand half the things they were saying because of the voice alteration.

It looked like it would take a while for them to settle down….

“Evandel, do you wanna go outside and play?”

“Yeah!”

Evandel grinned.

“Okay, let’s go.”

I let the two holograms quarrel and left the cabin with Evandel.

Outside the cabin was the forest full of Evandel’s spirit beasts.

The view was straight out of a fairy tale. The unicorn was flying in the sky, the cat and the squirrel were racing against each other, and the hare and the tortoise were scratching each other’s backs.

All was peaceful and heartwarming.

**

[Pandemonium, Chameleon Troupe’s Hideout]

At the rooftop of the Chameleon Troupe’s hideout, Yi Yeonjin was looking down at Pandemonium, the city that once belonged to the Chameleon Troupe. His eyes were dark but full of greed that could devour Pandemonium whole.

“…You did well, Byul. I’m proud of you.”

Yi Yeonjun patted Yi Byul who was standing beside him on the shoulder. Yi Byul looked at Yi Yeonjun with eyes full of confusion.

She had always believed that he was dead.

After she killed her own parents, Yi Yeonjun had taken on the role of her father. The fact that he had returned alive was something she couldn’t accept so easily.

“Um… Boss.”

“No, you’re the boss, Byul. Don’t call me that.”

But his voice, scent, the way he talked, and even his magic power were the same as before.

“I’m no longer a member of the Chameleon Troupe. The Chameleon Troupe belongs to you, and I don’t plan to take it away from you,” Yi Yeonjun said.

He looked at Yi Byul. Yi Byul looked up at him from below.

“…But you see, the Seat of Black that you took in… Kim Hajin, was it?”

All of a sudden, Yi Yeonjun said something totally unexpected.

“He’s dangerous.”

“…Pardon?”

“It’s not a surprise that you didn’t know, Byul. He teamed up with Bell. The same Bell who murdered me.”

A voice flowed into Yi Yeonjun’s ears as he spoke.

—You’re selling my name already?

It was a Mental Transmission from Bell.

Yi Yeonjun answered with a straight face.

—Byul thinks you’re the enemy. So if I can use you to turn her against him, then I will. You need to understand.

—…Hmm. It’s just that, I’m not sure it’ll work~

As Bell expected, Yi Byul quickly shook her head.

“No, you’re wrong. Hajin would never do that.”

Yi Yeonjun stared at her and gave a small smile.

“Really? I hope so. …Mm, I should go back now.”

“Pardon? To where?”

“My body isn’t completely recovered yet. Don’t worry, I’m not mad at you.”

“…But Boss, I mean… Wait.”

Yi Yeonjun tried to leave, citing his health as the reason, and Boss chased after him worriedly.

—See? I told you, Kim Hajin ruined Byul. She’s completely different now. If you want to get rid of him, you’ll have to do it yourself.

Another Mental Transmission flowed into his ears. Bell sounded cheerful as he made fun of his friend’s failure.

With a nonchalant expression, Yi Yeonjin kept his silence.

…Meanwhile, hidden in the deep darkness, a bird was watching them.

“Prrr—”

Spartan delivered not only the conversation between Yi Yeonjun and Boss but also the Mental Transmission Yi Yeonjun was receiving.

‘Yeah, I’m listening. Go after them, but come back if it looks like you’ll get caught.’

A reply from Kim Hajin.

Masked by the shadows of the night, Spartan chased Yi Yeonjun.

...

Chapter 303. After the War (3)

I woke up on a small bed in Evandel’s cabin. The temperature inside was pleasant, and my arm was serving as Evandel’s pillow. I could hear her breathing calmly in her sleep.

Looking at her, all sorts of emotions swept through me: pride, gratitude, sadness… Although she wasn’t my real daughter, I likely saw her as one.

“Haa….”

I felt sorry and ashamed, and this feeling would only grow stronger in the future.

A long time had passed since I came to this world. The farewell that seemed so far away was ever closer. Soon, once the final arc ended, I would most likely be sent back to Earth, and this world would go on without me.

“….”

I looked at Evandel, who was sleeping soundly. Morning light shone through the window and gently caressed her face.

Looking at her, an unknown feeling began to rise in my heart.

‘I don’t want to leave.’

That thought surfaced in my head for the first time.

Just like the song I once heard in the other world… I was more afraid of not being by their side than them not being my side.

“…Ehew.”

A sigh left my mouth. By the looks of it, I was done sleeping for the day.

I picked up the smartwatch I placed on the drawer next to the bed. Then, I began to look through the social media accounts of Heroes who participated in the Orden mission.

***

[Yi Jiyoon]

Jiyoon2

Nayun, Suho, and Team Leader Yeonha came to visit me at the hospital. #ImFineNow #OneStepStronger

[♡9,154,352]

***

Being a social media addict, Yi Jiyoon’s most recent post was from last night. Tigris had torn off her arm, but thanks to quick treatment, she managed to avoid being permanently disabled.

***

[Chae Nayun]

IM_Chae_Na_Yun

To protect. My final sword.

#EssenceOfTheStrait #ChaeNayun

[♡6,104,952]

***

Next was Chae Nayun’s page. She posted a picture of two greatswords she recently bought.

“…Huh?”

I widened my eyes the moment I saw them. My Gift, [Observation and Reading], activated.

[Unknown Artifact Greatsword] [???] [???]

[Crusader’s Zweihander]

I didn’t know which sword Chae Nayun used as her main weapon. But even [Observation and Reading] couldn’t see through [Unknown Artifact Greatsword]. It meant it was a high-rank artifact at the very least.

If she bought it, she got lucky. If Essence of the Strait lent it to her, they probably didn’t know its true value.

***

[Kim Suho]

Saver_KIM

I love you all. Thank you and sorry. I will continue living my life to the fullest.

[♡53,953,112]

***

Kim Suho only had a post comforting the victims of the Orden incident. As expected of the Swordsman of Wish, he had more than 50 million likes.

***

[Temple of Justice]

Justice_Temple

Spirit Speech Master Aileen has been appointed as the Temple of Justice’s 5th chairman. “I will do my best to atone for my predecessor’s sins and march forward proudly.”

[♡14,003,112]

***

Temple of Justice, Essence of the Strait, Yun Seung-Ah, Creator’s Sacred Grace, Shin Jonghak… I looked through social media posts for about 20 minutes before carefully leaving the bed.

I walked up to the window of the cabin, then received the memories Spartan transmitted.

The conversation between Boss and Yi Yeonjun and the secret message between Yi Yeonjun and Bell replayed in my head.

“…Yi Yeonjun.” I muttered calmly.

He was currently the most mysterious character. I didn’t know anything about his motive, but I knew that he wanted to kill me.

“Bell, you bastard….”

I understood why Jin Sahyuk cursed at Bell 24/7. Bell had known about Yi Yeonjun, and he had hidden Yi Yeonjun’s existence on purpose.

“Hm…”

A bitter taste remained in my mouth. The best way to avoid being killed by Yi Yeonjun was undeniably to kill him first. But that would make Boss sad. She might even hate me for it. I knew how much she longed for Yi Yeonjun from the rare instances she talked about him.

So I didn’t want to kill him. It wasn’t that I couldn’t. I just didn’t want to. I was tired of being hated.

“…?”

While I was standing deep in thought, messages suddenly popped up in front of me. They looked just like the ones I received from the co-author.

[★Announcement★ The final phase is starting soon.]

[The temporarily stopped Demon Realm Transformation has resumed.]

[As the original author, you may view a map of the regions undergoing Demon Realm Transformation.]

[It is recommended that you visit these sites.]

[Do not forget. You have the right to ask me a question.]

“…Yeah, thanks.”

The co-author didn’t even make me mad anymore. His messages just passed through me like water. After all, getting mad wouldn’t change anything.

But the fact that this was the ‘final’ phase made me a bit sad.

“Mmnn….”

Evandel tossed and turned on the bed. She was pulling on the blanket as if to find me.

With a grin, I turned on the smartwatch and messaged Yoo Yeonha.

[Hey, let’s meet in two days.]

Her reply came quickly.

[Two days later?]

[Yeah, there’s something I need to tell you about the Demon Realm Transformation.]

Yoo Yeonha’s guild and businesses had to stand in the forefront of humanity’s battle against the Demon Realm Transformation.

In the next moment, I got curious about something else.

[By the way, are the two swords Chae Nayun uploaded to her social media page from your guild?]

[Yes, we bought them and permanently lent them to her. Those were the only two greatswords on the market.]

“Mm.” I nodded and typed my reply.

[She’s using both?]

[No. Nayun said she’d use the Crusader’s Zweihander only. We lent them both so she could see which one she liked. Once she returns the other artifact, we’ll lend it to another Hero. We couldn’t appraise that one though. It must be because it’s damaged.]

Damaged. Surprisingly, Yoo Yeonha was bad at judging weapons.

Well, I understood where she was coming from since 95% of inappraisable artifacts were trash.

[Don’t give that to someone else. Bring it with you when you come to see me. We’ll meet in North Hamgyeong Province…]

**

I spent two days with Evandel, making her pretty clothes, crafting comfortable furniture, and installing the equipment so that she could talk to her friends whenever.

“I should be able to drop by once a week.” Today was the day of farewell. I kneeled in front of Evandel and said with a smile.

“Okay!” Evandel was tearing up but didn’t cry. Instead, she replied cheerfully. Just as I’d grown in the past 8~9 years, Evandel had grown as well. I gave her a warm hug one last time and then called Spartan.

“I’m leaving then.”

“…Ah, so next week, are you coming on Tuesday or Wednesday?”

“Mm, Tuesday.”

“Yay!”

Evandel smiled brightly and nodded.

“Then see you Tuesday.”

“Okay~ I’ll be waiting~”

After waving my hand, I told Spartan of my destination. With a nod, Spartan teleported me to that place.

—Prrrr!

The place we arrived at was Korea’s North Hamgyeong Province. Although it was close to a high-rank monster danger zone and Russia’s Vostok region, where the Evil Society was located, the area had undergone great development through national defense weaponry and magic engineering.

“Keep your eyes out for any strange occurrence! If it gets through, private citizens will be in danger!”

Demon Realm Transformation was underway at the northernmost border of North Hamgyeong Province. The Korean military, along with Heroes dispatched by the Hero Association, were monitoring the situation beyond the [Essence Barrier].

“When are the Hero reinforcements coming?! There’s a battle every hour, shouldn’t there be at least 4 more Heroes here!?”

I glanced at the grumbling soldier. Judging by the symbol on his chest, he seemed to be a captain in charge of this area.

“My apologies. We’re messaging the Association, but they seem to be busy taking care of the aftermath of the recent incident…”

“Who cares about the aftermath!? We need to find out what that thing is and do something about it! Those damned Association bastards….”

The captain yelled and pointed at the field burning black in front of him. About 200 meters of land had turned into the Demon Realm.

—Kuek, kuek.

At that moment, four pillar-sized boars stepped on the demonized land.

“Ah, damn it! I told you to kill them before they touch that land!”

Immediately after the captain shouted…

—Kueeeeeeeek!

The boars’ flesh melted, and they began to charge at the humans as undead monsters.

[Undead Wild Boar] [Intermediate-rank grade-2]

Wild boars had turned into an intermediate-rank monster just by touching the land. The captain soon took out a sword. I also walked toward them with my Desert Eagle in hand.

“Get ready!”

The army quickly prepared themselves for battle.

“Fire on command—!”

Each of their magic bullets cost a million won, but magic bullets without attributes were incapable of killing undead monsters. It seemed their plan was to weaken the boars with magic bullets, then finish them off with the captain who could use magic power.

I decided to help them out.

Click—

I fired the Desert Eagle. The magic bullet quickly flew towards the dozens of magic bullets shot by the soldiers, displaying a beautiful white color.

—Kuek!

The bullet pierced the four boars one-by-one.

“…?”

The bullet moved too quickly for normal human vision, making it look like the boars suddenly fell. While the soldiers were taken aback by the sudden phenomenon, wooong— a golden snowmobile suddenly appeared in the air.

It was the Dwarven Supercar I gifted Yoo Yeonha.

“You’re already here?”

Yoo Yeonha drove down with a smile.

“I just arrived.”

We shook hands while receiving the gaze of countless soldiers. Soon, the captain who recognized Yoo Yeonha’s face rushed over.

“This is Captain Yi Joonkyung. I heard you were coming, but I never expected you to come from the sky!”

“Keep standing on lookout. Don’t mind us.”

“…Yes! Understood!”

The captain took the hint and quickly went away. Yoo Yeonha and I watched the demonized land.

The ground had turned reddish-black, and ominous flames were flickering above it. It looked like a powerful enemy was going to rise from the ground.

“Why did you want to meet me here?”

“I think something will happen here today. I wanted to see what it was and plan accordingly.”

I looked at the system message in front of me.

[Demon Realm Transformation of North Hamgyeong Province is underway. A special change will occur in 20 minutes.]

It was the first ‘special change’ on Earth. I figured I should be here to witness it.

“Really? I don’t have much time… Oh right, here.”

Yoo Yeonha gave me a long piece of metal.

“What’s… oh, that greatsword.”

“Yep.”

“But it didn’t look like this on the picture Chae Nayun posted.”

“I infused magic power into it to see what it would do, and it changed into that, like all trash artifacts that can’t handle magic power. It’s really not worth the 3 billion we paid for it.”

Yoo Yeonha shrugged.

“Hmm….”

I infused Stigma’s magic power into my eyes and began to appraise it with Observation and Reading. There was a big difference between seeing the item in a photo and seeing it in real life.

Observation and Reading quickly appraised the item. I blankly stared at the window that popped up in front of me.

“If you’re interested, you can have it.” Yoo Yeonha spoke.

I flinched. This had to be the work of my luck.

“You’re giving this to me? Really?”

“Yeah, I don’t see why not.”

“…If you say so, I’ll gladly take it.”

I put the sword on my back without hesitation.

“Do you know what this is?”

“I told you, we couldn’t appraise it. Why? Do you know what it is?”

I pitied Yoo Yeonha for the first time in a while.

“Yeah, I do.”

“You do? Well, I don’t really mind it…”

Yoo Yeonha didn’t pay much attention to it, as she handed me an envelope of documents.

“This is what we found out about Yi Yeonjun.”

“…Ah, thanks.”

I put the envelope away.

“Also, have you heard?” Yoo Yeonha continued, “A riot broke out in Pandemonium.”

“A riot? What happened?”

“It’s because of the demon town that appeared in Pandemonium. Djinns and demons… something seems to have happened between them. I hear it’s a big secret. Here.”

Yoo Yeonha took out another envelope. I received it with furrowed brows.

“You sure have a lot.”

“It’s a request for a mission.”

“Mission?”

I opened the envelope and took out the documents inside.

The first few words I saw were [Escort Mission Contract].

Yoo Yeonha smiled brightly. “I’m going to go to Pandemonium too. So I was wondering if you could act as my escort.”

“….”

I glanced at Yoo Yeonha before putting the document away. Since I knew nothing about future events, it was probably best to participate in what looked like major plot points.

“I’ll think about it.”

“Think about it positively. If we can excavate the mineral that’s said to be there, it’ll help us deal with future disasters.”

“Mineral?”

“Yes, but, ssh—” Yoo Yeonha suddenly put her finger on her lips. “Looks like you haven’t heard, but I can’t tell you anything until you accept the request.”

“…What?”

“You have until next week.”

“Hm… Okay.” I nodded.

“Good.” Yoo Yeonha smiled leisurely. She then glanced at the sword that was hanging on my back.

“So, going back to that, you know what it is?”

“Oh, yeah, I do.”

“Ho~ I didn’t know appraising was your hobby.”

“Rather than being a hobby, it’s more that my eyes are good.”

“Ah, you’re right. So, what is it?”

Yoo Yeonha asked playfully, but I responded seriously.

“It’s Balmung.”

“Ah~ Balmung~ ….?”

Yoo Yeonha answered with a smile, which soon disappeared as her expression stiffened.

“C-Come again?”

“Balmung. You’ve heard of it, right?”

“…Pardon?”

Yoo Yeonha tilted her head. For the record, I was telling her exactly what I was seeing with Observation and Reading.

***

[Unknown Artifact Sword] [???] [???]

—A greatsword of unknown origin.

[Observation and Reading] with Stigma’s magic power unlocks a portion of the item’s description.

—Balmung.

—The treasure of the Nibelungs acquired by Siegfried. Golden mithril envelops the huge blade like silk.

—It can reflect magic power and its strength is amplified when used in simple ways.

—To become the master of this sword, one must infuse 500ml of one’s blood and have the sword judge one’s qualification.

-More details will be unlocked once the item awakens-

***

“Haha, you’re funny. Balmung, haha.”

“I’m not kidding.”

Yoo Yeonha was trying to escape reality. I, of course, didn’t let her.

“…If you’re not kidding, then that sword… it’s really the Balmung that I know?”

Yoo Yeonha asked with a stiff face. She stared at the sword on my back with an odd gaze.

“Yeah, it’s the one written in The Song of the Nibelungs.”

“….”

Yoo Yeonha swallowed hard. I was curious about what she was thinking about, but I didn’t have the time to find out.

[The demonized land undergoes a major change.]

The moment a system message popped up in the corner of my eyes…

“U-Um, c-can you return that to m-me….”

And the moment Yoo Yeonha asked stutteringly…

KOONG—!

The demonized land we were watching erupted with a strange explosion.

**

[Hideout near East Sea]

“…Hm.”

On the other hand, Jin Sahyuk was looking at the items Kim Hajin left behind in the hideout. A magnifying glass, a robe, Basilisk’s leather, colorful crystals, etc… they seemed inadequate for the time and effort she put into protecting him.

“What’s this?”

Jin Sahyuk picked up the magnifying glass from the stash. She tilted her head at first, but it didn’t take her long to figure out what it was. It was the gift the king ‘Prihi’ gave Kim Hajin in the recorded past of Akatrina.

“It was mine to begin with, so…”

Jin Sahyuk put the magnifying glass in her pocket without feeling guilty. She also took a few pieces of Basilisk’s leather and tried on the robe Kim Hajin left behind, which she thought felt excellent.

…It was then.

Koong—!

A strange vibration reached Jin Sahyuk through the East Sea.

“…?”

Jin Sahyuk, who was feeling up Kim Hajin’s robe, stopped and raised her head. Soon, more vibrations rang out.

“What now?”

Jin Sahyuk snickered. Curiosity and desire for excitement swept through her. She finally felt like she could relieve her boredom.

“Kuaaaa~”

Jin Sahyuk stretched and activated Reality Manipulation. A portal popped up in front of her, and another space was stretched out inside it.

“Let’s go.”

She stepped into the portal without hesitation.

...

Chapter 304. Lawless Zone (1)

The first thing I recognized was the explosion. The land turned over and crimson pillars of fire shot up into the air. I saw the flames penetrate the protective walls and stretch out in all directions.

Aether moved before I could think. It stretched towards the flames before turning into a thick barricade that stopped the fire from spreading.

The explosion stopped, but this was only the beginning.

Koong—!

The earth shook violently, followed by huge crustal movements.

Everywhere I could see, the earth was starting to slither like a snake. Suddenly, a giant ‘door’ appeared at the center of the transformed land. It was a rectangular, metallic door.

“Uaah, uuk…!”

Yoo Yeonha leaned against me, swaying back and forth from the earthquake. I created a foothold with Aether and stood on top of it with her. Now in a more stable position, Yoo Yeonha let out a dry cough of embarrassment and turned her gaze to the other side.

“…What is that?”

“I have no idea.”

Runic language that I couldn’t understand floated around the mysterious door.

It was a rather strange scene.

I carefully looked over the symbols.

[Interpreting the runes with Gift ‘Observation and Reading’]

[First step to Demon Realm Transformation — Erosion]

[30 days left until the door to the Demon Realm opens]

“…It looks like bad things will happen when that door opens,” Yoo Yeonha said with a frown, “Though I’m not exactly sure what that is-”

“Be quiet while I interpret the runes.”

“…What?”

Yoo Yeonha’s face distorted into a scowl.

I ignored her and continued with the interpretation.

[This is the ‘Demon Realm Gate’ which increases the rate of Demon Realm Transformation of the land surrounding it.]

“This is the ‘Demon Realm Gate’ which increases the rate of Demon Realm Transformation of the land surrounding it.”

I spoke out loud so that Yoo Yeonha could hear.

She looked more comfortable now.

[30 days from now, the Door of Challenge will open. A total of 200 people may rise to the challenge.]

“30 days from now, the Door of Challenge will open. A total of 200 people may rise to the challenge.”

[If the challengers are victorious, the door will disappear forever.]

[However, if the challengers are defeated, the door will open completely and the ‘devil’ shall descend.]

[Entrance is first come first served.]

The moment I finished the interpretation, demons suddenly rose from the transformed earth. They looked similar to humans except for the horns on their heads, just like the demons I saw in the Tower of Wish.

“…The Demon Realm Gate.”

The name sounded strangely familiar.

‘The Demon Realm Gate, the Demon Realm Gate…’

I kept repeating it inside my head. Then I suddenly remembered.

“Ah, this is-”

‘The Demon Realm Gate’ was among the settings I had discarded. It was quite different from regular Erosion.

I went on a hiatus before I could utilize it, but I knew for sure that a new world and challenges were waiting inside it.

It would be the perfect stepping stone for a memorable ending.

“This is- What?”

“Huh? Oh, it’s nothing.”

I shook my head at Yoo Yeonha’s question.

“I just wanted to say, all the information I just told you, be sure to keep them to yourself. I don’t want any Djinns to enter the Gate 30 days from now.”

“…Of course. You didn’t think I’d know that?”

Yoo Yeonha shrugged, slightly offended.

“But I already heard everything you said.”

All of a sudden, I heard Jin Sahyuk’s voice.

Startled, I turned my head to the side, and there she was, Jin Sahyuk, just as expected.

Jin Sahyuk looked at me and Yoo Yeonha and smirked.

“I’ll definitely be one of the 200 challengers.”

“…”

I was really self-conscious because of Yoo Yeonha. I had to pretend that I had never seen Jin Sahyuk before in my life.

“I’ve seen her before. She’s Crevon’s former Knight Commander,” Yoo Yeonha remarked.

“Ah. You’re right,” I said with a nod.

“…This is ridiculous.”

Jin Sahyuk began digging into her pockets. At the same time, I heard loud footsteps from a distance. Heroes were probably on their way here.

“What is she doing?”

Yoo Yeonha stared at Jin Sahyuk with doubtful eyes. Jin Sahyuk was looking at me through a magnifying glass.

….Wait.

A magnifying glass?

“Hey, hey! Stop!”

I stretched Aether towards the magnifying glass, but….

Boom!

It shattered into pieces before Aether could reach it.

Chwaak….

Pieces of glass fell on the ground.

“Damn it.”

I had no idea why the magnifying glass suddenly shattered.

Maybe Jin Sahyuk broke it, or maybe it broke naturally.

But I knew one thing for sure.

“…”

That Jin Sahyuk definitely saw something.

Her widened eyes and dazed expression told me so.

But I didn’t have any time to react.

“Hey! What happened here? I’m the high-intermediate-rank Hero Kim Wajung from Creator’s Sacred Grace!”

Soon, hundreds of Heroes and reporters poured in, and I took my eyes off of Jin Sahyuk for about 1 second.

“…Damn it.”

And Jin Sahyuk was gone.

**

[Heart of Pandemonium — Chameleon Troupe’s Building]

“…A request, you say?”

The next day, Boss received a call from Kim Hajin. He informed her of his decision on accepting a request in the name of Jeronimo’s Fenrir.

—Yes, I was hired as a bodyguard.

Bodyguard. That made sense considering how dangerous Pandemonium was. It was much bigger and far more brutal than any civilian could imagine.

“Are you heading to the west?”

Initially, Pandemonium started in the plains of Mongolia. However, as the Djinns gained more and more power, the territory stretched beyond Xinjiang into Kazakhstan.

—Yes, to Kazakhstan.

Boss nodded, her gaze fixed on the TV screen.

[The appearance of the ‘Demon Realm Gate’ at the border area of North Hamgyeong Province has driven the Association to call for an emergency meeting….]

Reports of ‘Demon Realm Transformation’ in North Hamgyeong Province were in full swing. Rather than the news, Boss was more focused on Kim Hajin and Jin Sahyuk. Though it was only for a brief moment, Boss saw the two of them together on the screen.

“…Are you going alone?”

—Yes, it’s highly confidential.

“…”

She said nothing. But currently, her imagination was running wild.

Kim Hajin continued.

—I’m sorry that I’ve been so busy lately. But my gift should’ve arrived there by now… Boss, did you not get it yet?

“…Gift?”

Boss raised her eyebrows.

—Yes. Clothes and a robe.

“I didn’t get any-”

As Boss shook her head, she suddenly recalled last night's strange incident.

Jain was wearing a dress and a robe both of which Boss had never seen before. When Boss asked her about them, Jain, clearly surprised, had answered, “It’s nothing.”

‘Did she really…?’

Boss felt anger well up in her heart.

“It appears that Jain stole them.”

—Ah, Jain? Again?

“Again? I can’t believe this.”

So this wasn’t the first time Jain had done something like this.

‘Why didn’t I notice before?’ Boss wondered. Soon enough, she realized that Jain must have used her ability to disguise as herself.

“Jain…” Boss muttered to herself, “How dare you insult me, your boss?”

Boss clenched her fists.

—Boss?

“I’m hanging up.”

As soon as she hung up, Boss called Jain.

Her hands were shaking with rage, but she tried to remain calm. She knew that even the slightest hint of anger would be enough to drive Jain away.

—Hey, Boss~ What’s up~?

Jain picked up right away, thankfully.

“Jain, where are… Kuhum.”

Boss gulped nervously and put on a smile.

She felt the need to feign kindness in order to lure Jain in.

“Where are you~?”

—…Huh?

Jain had never seen Boss smile and speak so warmly.

Slightly bewildered, Jain began to stutter.

—Um…. I’m at Paris for a party. Why did you call me?

“Ah, nothing~ I was just wondering~ When are you coming home~?”

—…

But Jain felt wary of Boss’s overly friendly demeanor. It was just as the old saying goes, “too much water drowned the miller.”

From the other side of the smartwatch, Jain asked carefully.

—Boss…, did you, um… by any chance… find out…?

**

Under the night sky lit with a full moon, Yoo Yeonha left her mansion, concealing herself under a robe and a mask. Only two people were allowed to accompany her on this top secret mission: her secretary ‘Jin Sechan’ and Master-rank Hero ‘Jin Seyeon’. The two had already arrived in Pandemonium and just now sent her a message saying that they found a place to stay.

Yoo Yeonha once again scrutinized the most crucial piece of information before departing for good.

***

《Dimensional Entropy》

—★★★x300000000!! The most important item right now.

—A source of unknown energy. Buried somewhere in Pandemonium’s lawless zone.

—Rumor has it that the Djinns and demons are fighting over it.

***

This was her first and foremost goal.

The name ‘Dimensional Entropy’ was only temporary, because no one knew for sure whether this item was an ore or something entirely different.

But she knew for sure that it was the source of energy that spanned the entire globe.

Therefore, she couldn’t risk having it fall into the hands of the Djinns or other entrepreneurs. Yoo Yeonha believed that only she, the Queen of Seoul, could handle an item of such importance.

“With this, I’ll have the entire world in the palm of my hand.”

Yoo Yeonha clenched her fist. It was then, a man appeared from the shadow of the garden. It was, of course, Kim Hajin.

Yoo Yeonha crossed her arms and said, “You’re here.”

“Yeah. Where’s the Dwarven Supercar?”

“Wait a second.”

Yoo Yeonha approached the pond at the corner of the garden. The water was crystal clear and carp were happily swimming inside it. However, when Yoo Yeonha pushed a button on her smartwatch, shooong— a huge platform ascended from the bottom of the pond.

“Woah…. You did a good job hiding it.”

A Dwarven Supercar, sleek and shiny, was sitting on the platform.

“It’s become my hobby to go out for a ride whenever I’m too stressed. I can’t risk having it stolen.”

Yoo Yeonha smiled.

“Let’s get going, then.”

“Right.”

Kim Hajin sat in the front and Yoo Yeonha sat in the back.

Kim Hajin immediately activated [Random Consolidation System]. Suddenly, something amazing happened. Not only did the vehicle become sturdier and more efficient, but its seats also became wider and cozier.

“…You’re really a man of mystery.” That was all Yoo Yeonha could say.

“I’m going to drive slowly, so why don’t you take a nap? This will take at least an hour.”

“I’m not sleepy. More importantly, did you finish reading the Yi Yeonjun files?”

Kim Hajin nodded.

“I did. He’s more dangerous than I thought.”

Currently, Yoo Jinhyuk was in the process of researching Yi Yeonjun’s past based on Kim Hosup’s reports.

Although much research had yet to be done, what he found so far was enough to prove Yi Yeonjun was evil.

“He is.”

He had to get what he wanted at all costs.

He and Yoo Yeonha were similar in that sense, but the difference was that Yi Yeonjun cared for neither rationality nor practicality.

He relied only on violence to meet his needs.

“….Ah, right.”

Yoo Yeonha casually brought up the subject that had kept her awake for days in regret, the question that she had been wanting to ask him for so long.

“You were lying about ‘Balmung’, right?”

He had to be. How could he recognize ‘Balmung’ so quickly when even professional appraisers couldn’t recognize it?

“No, I wasn’t.”

But Kim Hajin was unwavering. Yoo Yeonha felt the confidence in his voice. It made her heart heavy.

“…Then give it back.”

Yoo Yeonha caught Kim Hajin by the sleeve and pulled feebly.

“Give it back.”

“…Give what back?”

“I was going to give it to Nayun anyway….”

“Pft.”

Though Yoo Yeonha was starting to sound pitiful, Kim Hajin only smiled.

“Okay, how about we make it a lease? I want more shares.”

“You have plenty already.”

“No,” Kim Hajin shook his head bitterly and said, “I need a lot more to prepare for the future.”

**

[Pandemonium — Kazakhstan Lawless Zone]

In the face of the recent monster invasion, most Central Asian countries had declared the dissolution of state. Kazakhstan was one of such countries. Still, its legacy lived on as humanity began to refer to the lawless zone as ‘Kazakhstan’, for that was where it was.

“We’re here.”

The sky was starting to fade when we arrived at the ‘Kazakhstan Lawless Zone’, which was notorious for its, well, lawlessness.

“…Huh?”

The flight was exactly 1 hour. Before landing, I woke up Yoo Yeonha, who had fallen asleep in the back seat while working. I then put the Dwarven Supercar inside the ‘vehicular spatial pouch’ that Yoo Yeonha had prepared in advance.

“…Are you sure we’re at the lawless zone?”

Yoo Yeonha muttered doubtfully. For a land that was infested with over 3 billion monsters, everything seemed surprisingly peaceful.

“Just because this is the lawless zone doesn’t mean everyone is fighting 24/7. There are Circles here.”

“Ah~ I get it.”

“Because-”

“I researched it in advance. I don’t need your explanation.”

“…Hm.”

A Circle referred to a group of Djinns, similar to ‘Satan’s Servants’. All Djinns living in the lawless zone were a member of a Circle, be it big or small. Things were peaceful right now because there was a balance of power between different Circles. One hasty move could lead to a full-blown war, as insulting a member of a Circle was tantamount to insulting the Circle itself.

“…Huh?”

Suddenly, Yoo Yeonha pointed into the distance.

“Look, over there. Looks like they even sell food here.”

I turned my gaze to where Yoo Yeonha was pointing.

[Skewered Pork]

A stall was there. It had large chunks of meat placed on wooden skewers for display.

However, as evident from the way Yoo Yeonha was drooling, it was not an ordinary meat. In fact, it was the meat of an intermediate-rank grade-5 monster, [Effellie Boar]. Effellie boars live only in Central Asia, so there was no way to get it in Korea.

“Should we get some?”

“…Well, if you insist.”

Together we approached the stall. A grim-faced Djinn was roasting the meat.

I asked, “How much?”

The Djinn glanced at me and replied, “300,000 won, or 300 DP.”

It seemed that in Pandemonium, both won and DP were widely used.

However.

“Fuck that.”

“…Eh? W-What?”

Yoo Yeonha seemed surprised at my sudden cursing.

I could easily pay 300000 won, of course. But like I said, all Djinns belonged to a Circle. So if I let this one undermine me, the members of the Circle that he belonged to would do the same.

In the society of Djinns, weakness was considered a sin.

“‘Fuck that’?”

The vendor glared at me. Though he appeared quite threatening, he failed to scare me.

“Yeah, fuck that.”

“Then get lost.”

“I would, but you haven’t sold me the food yet.”

“…”

Yoo Yeonha seemed confused.

“What’s wrong with you? I told you we have to be secretive,” she whispered, but I ignored her.

“…Are you gonna pay in DP or won?”

The Djinn finally gave up.

“Won.”

“70,000 won each.”

That sounded much more reasonable. Having received a discount, I payed 250000 won for 4 skewers.

…5 minutes later.

“It tastes even more amazing because of the discount. Let’s head over to the hotel now.”

Nom, nom— We munched on the meat as we walked towards the hotel.

“This place is far more dangerous than you think. Remember to keep your robe on at all times.”

“Yes, I know. …Ah, there it is.”

Finally a hotel came into our view.

It was a wooden building that looked more like a pub than a hotel. The name of the hotel was [Djinn Days]— obviously very cheesy.

“Let’s go.”

“Yeah.”

We went in.

Kiik—

“Mm?”

“Wow, this is surprising.”

Our eyes widened the moment we opened the door.

Though the hotel appeared shabby on the outside, the lobby was big and even had a bar. There were lots of customers as well.

“Let’s get going.”

“Okay. They said room 303….”

Yoo Yeonha quickly passed through the lobby. However, just as she was about to set foot on the staircase, I saw a man sitting alone at a corner table. I had no idea why, but he stood out to me.

He had disheveled hair and a bushy beard. Right then, the morning sunlight seeped through the window and shone over the man's face.

“…!”

Immediately my hair stood on end.

The man leaning against the window—I wasn’t sure if he was drunk or just sleepy—I had seen him before through Spartan’s eyes and also in the composite sketches.

It was Yi Yeonjun.

...

Chapter 305. Lawless Zone (2)

Yi Yeonjun was sitting at a table in the lobby. It was certainly the same Yi Yeonjun I saw through Spartan’s eyes.

At first, my thoughts stopped. If Yi Yeonjun was nearby or up to something suspicious, Spartan would have told me about it.

But as surprised as I was, I made sure to not stare at him for more than 3 seconds. Yi Yeonjun should know my face. It would be bad if he saw me here.

—Spartan, where are you.

I transmitted my thoughts to Spartan as I quickly climbed up the stairs.

—….

Soon, Spartan’s thoughts returned. Right, he had been sleeping. I was a bit dumbfounded, but I quickly understood. Spartan’s stamina was fairly low, after all.

—Did you sleep well? You know, Yi Yeonjun is right here.

—…!

Spartan’s consciousness spiked up. He then gave an excuse, ‘I planned to chase him after a quick nap. I only slept six hours.’

—Don’t worry about it. From now, just tell me if you’re going to sleep. Seeing Yi Yeonjun here startled me. Anyways, continue following him once you’re refreshed.

I ordered Spartan, who began to wash his face at a nearby lake. He would probably eat something before heading over.

“What are you doing over there?” Yoo Yeonha asked while leaning against the guardrail.

“Nothing.”

I glanced at Yi Yeonjun one last time. He was sipping on alcohol, seemingly exchanging Mental Transmissions with Bell.

“Do you want to grab a drink? We don’t have much time.” Yoo Yeonha asked again.

“No, it’s nothing, really.” I shrugged and continued moving.

After arriving in room 302, Yoo Yeonha and I met two people who were waiting for us, Jin Sechan and Jin Seyeon.

“It’s been a while, Hajin-ssi.”

Jin Seyeon greeted me with her unique gentle smile.

“Nice to meet you. We’ve seen each other before. I hope you remember me.”

Next, Jin Sechan respectfully reached out with his hand. He was Yoo Yeonha’s secretary.

“Ah, yes, how can I forget. I’m still using the Desert Eagle you gave me.”

I shook his hand, then took off my robe. Jin Seyeon took it and smoothly hung it on the hanger. Yoo Yeonha then sat at the head of the table and began the meeting.

“…Kuhum.”

With a cough, she put on a serious expression.

“I’m sure you all know why we’re gathered here.”

Yoo Yeonha projected a holographic video with her smartwatch. The video took place deep underground in first-person view. Faint lights hung from the ceiling, which were the only sources of light lighting the dark surroundings.

“The footage is taken by our agent. He infiltrated Pandemonium five years ago, disguising himself as a Djinn.”

Koong— Koong— Koong—

Large rumbling rang out. The agent marched towards the source of the sound. Yoo Yeonha sped up this part of the footage to 16x speed until the agent arrived at the end of what seemed like a mine shaft.

“Here.”

And at the end of the mine shaft was the item Yoo Yeonha wanted to get.

“This is the transcendental energy I dubbed, ‘Dimensional Entropy.’”

Dozens of Djinns were surrounding a spherical ore emitting a dark-green glow.

—What are we going to do with this? The demons in the north are demanding it.

—…I’d hand it over to Terror before handing it to those bastards.

Yoo Yeonha then stopped the footage.

“As you can see, demons and Djinns aren’t getting along, or at least these demons in the north. Not only do demons look more grotesque, but they also seem to be serving a different devil. Furthermore, demons don’t have money. DP is distributed by demon merchants, who are different entities than normal demons.”

A few months before Orden was defeated, ‘demons’ and ‘demon merchants’ appeared in the world. Although they both came from the Demon Realm, they were treated in completely different manners.

—I don’t know about that either. If we give this to Terror, who knows what he’ll do with it. Wouldn’t it be better to go with Wicked, who’s more moderate…?

—No.

The Djinn who seemed to be the leader shook his head.

Yoo Yeonha paused the footage again and explained, “By the way, that Djinn is Vicious. The original Vicious died and a new Djinn took his place. He is currently the lowest ranked member of the Nine Evils, but because he united several Djinn Circles, he has a powerful influence over this lawless zone. Now, keep watching.”

Vicious spoke as soon as the footage resumed.

—This ore has enough power to destroy the balance of Djinn society. If it falls into the hands of demons, we will have no choice but to submit to them. But if it falls into Terror or Wicked’s hands, we don’t know what they’ll do with it. Now unfortunately, we can’t have it ourselves since we don’t have the strength to protect it or the means to utilize it.

At that moment, several system windows popped up in front of me.

***

[Information has been added due to witnessing a special setting change.]

[Dimensional Entropy – clusters of condensed energy created when demons crossed over dimensions.]

[Co-author’s opinion – using it properly will be of help to you.]

***

‘Co-author’s opinion… He’s been talking more and more recently. Is it because the ending is approaching?’ I sighed and smiled. Regardless of the co-author’s intentions, I wanted it if it would be of help.

I had to prepare for the final arc thoroughly, no matter how slow I do it. That way, everyone could reach the proper ending.

—So instead, we will sell it to humans for money and artifacts. Oi, Licros!

When Vicious yelled the name ‘Licros’, the camera moved towards Vicious. That seemed to be the name of Yoo Yeonha’s agent.

—Go to Essence of the Strait. Tell them I, Vicious, will sell them a life-changing item.

With that, Yoo Yeonha stopped the video.

“That’s how this mission came about. You get the gist, right?”

Jin Seyeon and I both nodded.

Yoo Yeonha continued with her arms still crossed, “But that ore can’t be transferred through normal means. Because of its size, it is too noticeable and making contact with magic power causes it to explode. We determined we needed a special case and a special vehicle to move it.”

Yoo Yeonha paused, and Jin Sechan stepped up. He put out a case on the table.

“This is a tilionium case. Lightning magic has been applied to it already. With the information we received from Vicious, we built it to withstand the Dimensional Entropy’s energy.”

“Mm… so we’re going to put the ore in the case and transport it with the Dwarven Supercar?”

Yoo Yeonha shook her head at my question.

“The Dwarven Supercar operates using magic power. Even with the case protecting it, it still isn’t a hundred percent safe. We prepared another vehicle for this mission. We’ll go back to Korea on it.”

“…Is there a reason you came personally? It’s a bit dangerous to return to Korea from here over land.”

I was worried for Yoo Yeonha’s safety. She was only high-intermediate-rank grade-2. Although her growth speed was quick given her age, it was still nowhere near geniuses like Chae Nayun or Kim Suho.

Yoo Yeonha stiffened her expression resolutely.

“This is my job, so I will do it. Plus, only the five of us can know about this.”

‘Five of us… Ah, including the agent.’ I thought.

“According to international law, ‘mysterious items transcending common sense’ have to be turned over to the Association. But knowing the corruption within the Association, we can’t let other people find out.”

Jin Seyeon quickly replied to Yoo Yeonha, “I agree. Yeonha-ssi is far more trustworthy than the Association.”

“…Huh? You really think so?” I asked. The Hero Association loved Jin Seyeon more than any other Hero.

Jin Seyeon answered with a bitter smile, “I’m very disappointed with the Hero Association because of the recent incident. Park Hanho, the Girl of Authority… the Association seems to have lost their founding principles. That’s why I decided to follow Yeonha-ssi.”

“Ah….”

The Association kept the Girl of Authority’s kidnapping a secret. It wasn’t until Park Hanho’s betrayal that it was revealed to the world, causing a huge discussion. As the person who planned her abduction, it did sting my conscience a bit.

“Oh right, did Park Hanho’s daughter really come back to life?”

“Pardon? Ah, I don’t know that much…”

“No.” Yoo Yeonha answered my question. “That girl isn’t Park Hanho’s real daughter. It was a chameleon humanoid monster who had Park Yeonhee’s brain transplanted. It could be argued, I guess, since the humanoid monster really believed she was Park Yeonhee.”

“Ah… I see. Then, Yeonha-ssi, do you know what the Association will do about Senior Park Hanho…?” Jin Seyeon asked bitterly.

“Execution would be my guess.”

The atmosphere turned grim at Yoo Yeonha’s words. Cold wind seeped in from the window. Blood and magic power were mixed in the air.

Chak, chak!

Yoo Yeonha clapped to lighten up the mood and the air. She spoke with a smile, “…Let’s stop talking and rest. We’ll have to wake up early tomorrow.”

**

[Vicious’s Mine Shaft]

We went underground to Vicious’s mine shaft early in the morning. We weren’t here to sightsee, so we quickly moved. I carried a spatial pouch filled with 50 billion won and Jin Seyeon carried six high-rank artifacts, both of which would be traded for [Dimensional Entropy].

“…Hand over the items and money first.”

In a dark underground space, Vicious and his comrades stood before us. They showed no signs of compromise.

“50 billion won, cash. The artifacts will be given once we retrieve the item and leave the lawless zone.”

Yoo Yeonha took the spatial pouch from me and threw it over to Vicious. One of his comrades checked the content of the pouch.

“50,000 won bills, 100,000 of them. It’s 50 billion won, alright.”

“…Great, you know that us Djinns hate checks.”

Yoo Yeonha smirked at Vicious’s words.

“The spatial pouch will be a gift. It’s a pinnacle-grade spatial pouch, so it’ll easily go for 3 billion won on the market.”

The Djinn holding the spatial pouch flinched. He then glanced down at the spatial pouch in shock.

Vicious stared at Yoo Yeonha fixedly before taking a deep breath and nodding.

“Good. We’ll open the way. Follow me.”

Vicious turned around first, and we followed after him.

Tak, tak. The path became narrower the more we walked. The soot in the air stuck to our skin. Even qi reinforcement was useless here.

“Haa….”

Yoo Yeonha’s breathing became rough. Jin Sechan looked at her with worry.

After about 5 minutes of walking…

“….!”

All of a sudden, a fierce gust of magic power blew over. The magic power put heavy pressure on our bodies.

I held myself back from vomiting and walked over.

“It’s here.” Vicious spoke.

We looked forward in a daze. Chwaaa…. A mysterious, spherical ore was pulsing with dark green magic power.

***

[Dimensional Entropy] [Durability 10/10]

—A transcendental stone condensed with the power of multiple dimensions.

—Will release magic power until its durability runs out.

***

“Take it. If you can, that is.”

This time, I stepped up. With Aether, I grabbed the Dimensional Entropy. The ore was only the size of a baseball, but it weighed over a ton. Aether burned from the ore’s searing magic power.

“…Whew.”

I carried the Dimensional Entropy over and put it inside the tilonium case. The case hugged the ore gently and sealed it inside.

The dark green color lighting the mine shaft immediately subsided, and the queasy feeling in my stomach disappeared.

“Oh? As expected of Essence of the Strait. That’s an interesting piece of equipment. Is it light?”

“It’s enchanted with weight reducing magic.”

I picked up the case. Yoo Yeonha turned around without a word. She seemed to be in a hurry to leave.

Then again, most girls wouldn’t want to be in mine shafts.

Jin Sechan quickly followed her, and Jin Seyeon handed over the six artifacts she had with her.

“Here you go.”

“Ohoho. Oi, Lilac! Appraise them.”

“Go ahead, Hajin-ssi. I’ll finish the trade.”

I took Jin Seyeon to her word and left the mine shaft. There were two identical cars waiting outside the mine shaft. They were made with adamantium, the strongest known metal in the modern world. The windows were jet-black. It was easy to see that the two sedans had the sturdiness of war tanks.

Tok, tok—

Knocks rang out from the car parked in the front.

I opened the passenger seat with the tilonium case in hand.

“Hm?”

The back seat was for Yoo Yeonha, but a man I didn’t know was sitting in the driver’s seat.

Seeing that I was standing in a daze, Yoo Yeonha explained.

“…You saw him in the video, right? This is that agent, Licros. I got a separate driver so you can focus on guarding the item.”

Licros looked at me and nodded.

“Nice to meet you.”

“Ah, yes, nice to meet you.”

I greeted him back and sat down next to him.

Yoo Yeonha spoke, “We’ll leave once Jin Seyeon-ssi comes back.”

Jin Sechan and Jin Seyeon would ride the other car, which was prepared just in case anything happened.

Soon, Jin Seyeon came out of the mine shaft and got on the driver’s seat of the other car. As Jin Sechan was already sitting in the back seat, Jin Seyeon started the engine and took off.

“Let’s go.”

Licros nodded his head and stepped on the accelerator.

Vroooom—

The sound of a gas engine was rather nostalgic, as I often teleported from place to place.

But at that moment, Yoo Yeonha began to act strangely in the back seat. She moaned, hit her chest, and bit her nails.

“Are you okay?”

When I asked, she was massaging her temple with both hands.

“Yeah… I’m fine. It’s just that I hate confined spaces.”

“Oh… you have claustricphobia?”

“…It’s claustrophobia, not claustricphobia. And yeah, I’m a bit embarrassed to say it, but it’s pretty severe.”

“…I see.”

As the person who created Yoo Yeonha’s background setting, I obviously knew about it. It wasn’t just claustrophobia. Germaphobia, paranoia, coulrophobia… Yoo Yeonha was fated to live with countless mental illnesses.

These mental illnesses would only continue to worsen, as she would be under constant threat of assassination given her position.

“Just sleep. I’ll take care of the rest.”

“…Heh, okay.”

Yoo Yeonha laughed and nodded her head.

The sedan left the heart of the lawless zone and reached the outskirts. I looked outside the window with my senses heightened. I couldn’t sense any threat.

“We’re about to leave the lawless zone,” I said.

“Got it.” Yoo Yeonha seemed to be feeling better as she replied with a smile. “Oh right, the Association finished deciphering the runic language around the ‘Demon Realm Gate. They should start gathering Heroes officially in a few days.”

“Gathering Heroes?”

“200 people need to be present to enter the Demon Realm Gate. You’re going to participate too, right?”

“Why would I? I can just sneak in.”

“…Pft, I won’t help you if you get caught.”

I shrugged, and Yoo Yeonha leaned back. As she looked comfortable, I didn’t worry about her too much.

I faced front.

…From the front, something sharp was flying over.

“…?”

Before I could perceive it, it broke through the window. Bullet Time didn’t activate. Something simply pierced through the window, and the driver’s head exploded in the next moment.

“…Eh?”

A dazed voice rang out. I turned to the side. Licros’s head was missing, replaced by an arrow.

I turned around. Licros’s blood and brain fluid were covering Yoo Yeonha’s body.

“What….”

Yoo Yeonha muttered blankly, and in the next moment, another arrow flew over. I released Aether, forming a shield. The arrow hit the shield, veering slightly off course and piercing Yoo Yeonha’s shoulder rather than her head.

“Kyaak!”

Yoo Yeonha screamed, and I immediately shouted louder.

“DUCK!”

But Yoo Yeonha didn’t listen. She wasn’t in any state to do so. She was in a panic. This was probably the first time she witnessed such a gory death.

I couldn’t use ‘Time Reversal’ either because it was on cooldown.

I quickly strengthen the sedan with Aether and Stigma.

Chwaaak—

Aether enveloped the car. A mere arrow wouldn’t be able to break the sedan anymore, but I couldn’t do anything about the shattered window.

I shouted loudly, “Duck! Duck, Yoo Yeonha—!”

“Ah, aah, aah…”

But Yoo Yeonha was having trouble even breathing normally. She was clutching her arms and whimpering.

Another magic arrow flew over. As expected, it wasn’t enough to break through the car, which was strengthened with Aether and Stigma.

Using this time, I moved over to the back seat. Yoo Yeonha was clearly having a panic attack, shaking like a schizophrenic. I pushed her head down first.

“Calm down. Calm down.”

I caressed her head with Stigma’s magic power and said, “It’s me. Look at me!”

Hearing me, Yoo Yeonah slowly raised her head. She stared at me with eyes full of fear. Tears were flowing down her cheeks.

“Kuhuk!”

Yoo Yeonha suddenly coughed. A piece of Licros’s shattered skull came out of her mouth. Yoo Yeonha saw it too. She seemed to have swallowed it subconsciously. Immediately, her eyes rolled over, and her body swayed.

“Hey, snap out of it!”

“T-This…”

“Just keep your head down. We just have to keep out of the shooter’s firing line. The arrow can only come in through the broken window since it can’t do anything about the car.”

“….”

“Got it?”

Yoo Yeonha nodded her head.

“…Geez, talk about a surprise.”

I muttered to myself and sent a Mental Transmission to Jin Seyeon. Is this what people felt when they faced Black Lotus?

“Jin Seyeon-ssi, where are you!?”

She quickly responded.

—Hajin-ssi! We’re…

Tzzt—

However, her message was cut in the middle. They seemed to be under attack as well. Without a choice, I called Spartan over and took out the Desert Eagle.

There was nothing I could do inside the car.

But as I was about to leave the car…

“W-Wait!”

Yoo Yeonha grabbed my hand strongly.

“A-Are you going somewhere?”

“…You wait here. It’ll be safer.”

“No, no! I don’t want to!”

I shook off Yoo Yeonha’s hand and opened the door. Yoo Yeonha reached out and shouted desperately, “Don’t go! Don’t go—!”

But I left and was immediately greeted by an arrow. Bullet Time didn’t activate this time either. Instead, a system window popped up alerting me why.

[Warning! You are facing a sharpshooter possessing a similar level of Gift. Master Sharpshooter’s sub-Gift will be temporarily sealed.]

“Similar level my ass….”

I gritted my teeth and took out the Desert Eagle. If our Gifts were on a similar level, I just had to strengthen mine with Stigma.

“…Ah.”

It was then that I realized something important. To transform the Desert Eagle into its sniper rifle form, I needed ‘Aether’.

But Aether was currently fused with the car, protecting Yoo Yeonha.

As such, I could only use… my ‘bow’ and ‘arrow’.

...

Chapter 306. Lawless Zone (3)

I hid behind the car and sent a command to Spartan. He quickly appeared in the sky and looked down at us.

Whooosh—!

At that moment, another arrow flew towards us, targeting the car’s tire. Aether tried to protect it, but because the tire wasn’t strong to begin with, it couldn’t withstand the attack even with Aether’s help.

Kwang—!

The tire popped like a balloon as Spartan shared his field of vision with me.

I could see the enemy about 5km to the east. It wouldn't be hard to see him at first through Spartan’s eyes, but his location was made very clear in the next moment when he shot an arrow at Spartan.

—…!

Spartan flapped his wings and dodged the attack, but the arrow quickly turned and chased after Spartan.

Chwaaaa…. The fiercely flying arrow was quicker than Spartan. At this rate, Spartan would die as well.

The moment the arrow grazed Spartan’s feathers, I ordered him to escape. Spartan teleported out just in time, and the arrow pierced through thin air. But at that moment, an unpleasant system alert popped up.

[Spartan’s wing has been injured – he is unable to use his Authority.]

I bit my lips. Returning to my normal field of vision, I looked around the surroundings. We were attacked in the outskirts of the lawless zone. Although a few pubs and inns were nearby, fights were commonplace here. Even if I asked someone for help, it was unlikely for any of them to listen to me.

“…Tsk.”

The only thing protecting me was a sedan enveloped in Aether. I was running out of time. I doubted that the sedan could withstand the enemy’s terrifying arrows any more than this.

Without any other choice, I took out [Temujin’s Bow Blessed By Horus] and [Athena’s Moonlight Arrow]. I didn’t hesitate much. To save Yoo Yeonha and to save myself, I needed to do this.

The moment I grabbed the arrow, Master Sharpshooter’s senses heightened. I looked to the east. My vision quickly stretched out until it reached my target 5km away.

I finally caught a glimpse of the sharpshooter that attacked us.

It was a woman holding a black bow. Her dark eyes seemed to be staring at me directly.

No, she was most certainly staring at me. Our eyes exchanged glances from 5km away.

Kiiik—

The enemy pulled her bowstring.

For some reason, I felt like I knew her. Blue hair flowing down over her black leather armor. Slightly tanned skin and fair facial features… The sharpshooter looked just like the person I imagined while I was writing.

“…Leraje.”

That should be her name. She was one of the ten devils I thought of using for the final part of the story – Leraje the Green Devil.

As her title suggested, green was her symbolic color, but the background story was that she hated green so much that she dyed her green hair blue.

Leraje held more moderate views among the devils, and by the looks of it, she still seemed to be staying in her incarnation body.

Still, she was the sole archer among devils. She was not an opponent I could deal with easily.

“Huu.”

Why was the 14th ranked devil here?

I was annoyed by the sudden turn of events, but I knew complaining about it wouldn’t do me any good.

I took a deep breath and nocked [Athena’s Moonlight Arrow] onto my bow. Then, I poured everything I had into it: Stigma’s magic power, Random Consolidation System, Constraints and Amplifications.

A terrifying magic power descended on the moonlight arrow, and brilliant rays of light began to stretch out in all directions. The moonlight’s holy power enveloped the earth and sky. I aimed the cluster of light at the devil and pulled the bowstring strongly.

…But due to Leraje’s strange reaction, I didn’t fire the arrow.

—….

She put her bow down and stared at me. Her gaze held no hostility or killing intent. Her expressionless face only showed her cold beauty.

After staring at me for a long time, Leraje muttered.

—My name.

A fleeting voice came out of her coy lips. Next, Leraje suddenly put away her bow and arrows.

I couldn’t understand what brought on the sudden change, but it was clear she no longer had any desire to attack. As such, I put my bow down as well.

In that instant, Leraje’s form disappeared like a mirage.

“…What?”

I was taken aback.

“Did my arrow scare her away? No, I doubt that’s the case…”

No matter the reason, the current situation was better for me. Not only did I conserve my strength, but I also didn’t have to risk my life fighting her to the death.

[A huge luck erupted!]

[A Single Word Pays Back a Debt of a Thousand Gold – Your thoughtless mumbling saved your life!]

[The great ‘Rank 14 Devil – Leraje’ takes interest in the human who recognized her.]

[Information regarding Leraje has been added to your Gift 「Observation and Reading」.]

[You obtain 333SP!]

[Narrow Escape from Death (7/9) – Special stat, Accumulation of Luck, becomes partly unlocked!]

Narrow Escape from Death popped up once again.

“That was luck too?”

I exclaimed in surprise, then I remembered someone.

“Ah!”

I quickly ran to the side of the sedan and opened the door. Yoo Yeonha was sitting in the corner, her face pale and her body trembling.

The inside of the car looked different than just now. The remnants of Licros’s corpse were nowhere to be seen, and a hot current of electricity was crackling inside.

Yoo Yeonha had burned Licros’s blood, flesh, and bones into nothingness.

**

[North Pandemonium – Undeveloped Area]

In the Russian land north of Pandemonium, a temple no human knew about existed.

Monsters swarmed the area, and the temple was shrouded by tall coniferous forest. Inside this dark temple, countless Djinns and demons were gathered to worship the rank 14th devil.

“…She should be fine on her own, right?” The Djinn assigned to this temple, Destruction, said worryingly. In front of him were many Djinns and a few demons who were waiting for their lord to return.

“The outside world is dangerous… We know what happened to Plucas.”

Destruction was always interested in the descent of the devil he was serving. When signs of Demon Realm Transformation appeared, he helped the descent of the rank 14 devil more carefully than any other Djinn.

Destruction took care so that no one would find out about his lord’s descent. He knew very well what happened to Rank 50 Devil Plucas, whose existence was revealed to the world.

“Don’t worry. Lord Leraje is a noble who is among the strongest in the Demon Realm.”

But the devil’s henchman seemed to be carefree. Corte, the most human-looking servant among the demons, said with a smile.

“Lord Leraje isn’t someone a mere human can injure.”

And at that moment, Leraje returned to the temple. Her ability allowed her to change the composition of her body freely. She took the form of wind and quickly arrived at her throne.

The servants waiting for her all bowed with respect.

“…?”

But Corte noticed something. Leraje didn’t have the [Dimensional Entropy] in her hands. That was the object she had left to obtain personally.

At that moment, Corte’s gaze met Leraje’s. Corte flinched, while Leraje simply gave a command.

—Rise.

Her command wasn’t in the form of words. She projected letters using Earth’s technology known as a smartwatch.

This was a small constraint placed on Leraje. She had to expend her lifeforce every time she spoke, so she used this smartwatch given by Destruction to express her thoughts.

—I didn’t bring the object you talked about.

Corte and Destruction stared at the words appearing in the air.

—There was a mysterious human who knew my name.

With that, Leraje leaned against her throne. Her youthful look and soft figure shone seductively.

Corte was displeased. [Dimensional Entropy] was an important item in the descent of a devil, yet Leraje had given up because she took interest in a mere human.

“Lord, you are a nobleman renowned across the Demon Realm. It isn’t strange for tales of Lord’s strength to have spread to Earth. So how can it be strange for—”

Leraje furrowed her brows and cut him off.

—Humans don’t know me. This isn’t the Demon Realm.

Tadadak— Leraje typed on the holographic keyboard as she looked around her surroundings.

—He even knew my name.

“…Is that so?”

—Of course, I don’t lie.

Next, Leraje yawned. As her descent wasn’t fully complete, Leraje slept often.

—I’m sleepy.

—Wake me up if those old devils contact us.

—Look into the human who recognized me too.

—He really was quite interesting.

With four final messages, Leraje fell asleep.

Corte stared at Leraje’s sleeping figure and then faced Destruction next to him.

“Destruction.”
