“Yes, Lord.”

“…Look into this human Lord Leraje has taken interest in. You’ll also have to bring back the [Dimensional Entropy].”

“…?”

Destruction widened his eyes in surprise, then put on a deep smile. This was exactly what he wanted to do.

From what he recently learned, the human who took the [Dimensional Entropy] was none other than the daughter of Yoo Jinwoong.

“Understood, leave it to me.”

Destruction replied and laughed happily.

**

[Central Asia]

I threw the car away. It could be repaired, but it was already too tattered, and in its current state, it was at a huge risk of being attacked again.

I summoned Sannuri, who I turned into a card, and ran with Yoo Yeonha. Sannuri was burdened by the [Dimensional Entropy] I was carrying, but she was still as quick as ever.

Click— Clack—

As Sannuri sped forward, I checked Yoo Yeonha’s condition. She was trembling sporadically, her body was freezing, and her breathing was labored. Like a bird drenched in rain, her frail body was devoid of strength.

Yoo Yeonha needed time to rest.

I saw a natural cave surrounded by greenery with my Thousand-Mile Eyes, and I led Sannuri to it.

“Get down.”

“….”

Yoo Yeonha came down from Sannuri’s back without a word. She staggered but didn’t fall. She sat down against the cave wall, pretending to be fine, and stared at me. I took this moment to message Jin Seyeon.

“Jin Seyeon-ssi, are you okay?”

—….

Tzzt. Static noise rang out a few times before she returned a reply.

—Yes, we managed to survive. The car broke down, but we were able to escape. Where are you now?

As expected, a Master-rank Hero wasn’t so easily killed. It seemed she even managed to protect Jin Sechan.

“I’ll send you the coordinates. Tell me if you’re too far.”

I sent her our current location. After a brief silence, a troubled voice rang out.

—Yes, we’re far, perhaps two days away on foot. We went in different directions after all…

“Then send me your location. I’ll pick you up.”

—Pick me up?

I looked at Sannuri. She immediately understood my intention and snorted unhappily.

“Yes, I have a horse with me. She’s incredibly smart, beautiful, and kind.”

Sannuri’s expression brightened. Jin Seyeon’s confused voice rang out.

—…A horse?

“Yes. Anyways, send me your coordinates first.”

—Ah… yes.

Soon, my smartwatch beeped, and I showed Jin Seyeon’s location to Sannuri.

Sannuri stared at the coordinate for about 10 seconds before neighing with a nod. She seemed to be in a good mood.

“It’s pretty far, huh? You can run as much as you want.”

—Hiiing.

“Yep, you don’t have to carry anyone on your way there, so run as quickly as you want. If you run into any monster or demons, feel free to kill them all.”

—Hiiing!

Sannuri cried cheerfully before immediately bolting out of the cave. Whoosh—! She was as quick as lightning. Black soot flickered above the ground she passed over.

“…Haha.”

I chuckled and sat down as well. It was then that I noticed Yoo Yeonha staring at me fixedly from the side. Her face was pale white, like a patient who was on the brink of fainting.

I met her gaze, then smirked.

“Are you okay?”

“….”

Yoo Yeonha nodded. Did she lose her ability to speak? She hadn’t said a word since she got on Sannuri.

To lighten up the mood and to make her talk, I said mischievously, “You look like you’re going to die soon.”

“….”

But Yoo Yeonha didn’t say a word. She only stared at me fixedly. Then, after a long time, she gulped and said simply, “I saw it.”

“Saw what?” I asked back nonchalantly.

“You using a bow.”

At that moment, a gust of wind blew through the cave. The wind made a strange humming sound echoing off the walls, and I couldn’t hear Yoo Yeonha properly because of it.

“…You saw?”

“Yes.” She nodded resolutely.

“Your bow, your arrow, and the huge undulation of magic power you aimed at the enemy.”

“….”

“Thinking about it now, I was the idiot for not even suspecting it. Even when we were in Cube, your skill with the bow was amazing. I still remember the curve shot you showed during the festival.”

I didn’t say anything and just scratched my head. I was hoping she was panicking too much to have noticed, but it seemed that wasn’t the case.

Yoo Yeonha let out a low sigh.

“That bow you took out. I know what it is. No, even if it isn’t me, anyone decently skilled in the field of information would recognize Black Lotus’s bow.”

I just sat still. I was contemplating how to respond. Should I admit it or deny it? I couldn’t think of any excuse.

But, when I heard Yoo Yeonha’s next words…

“You’re willing to go that far to take revenge on the Chameleon Troupe?”

My head turned blank. It felt like my brain stopped functioning for a moment.

I had no other choice but to maintain my silence… and Yoo Yeonha continued talking.

“You’re willing to dirty your hands and hurt yourself to—”

Yoo Yeonha paused and looked at me. Her gaze was filled with sympathy and pity. I didn’t understand where they were coming from.

The only reaction I could give in response…

“….?”

…was to tilt my head.

...

Chapter 307. The Stories That Become Bridges (1)

Blood covered her entire body along with gooey flesh and hard pieces of skull. Cranial fluid splashed into her eyes and brain matter flew into her mouth.

The incident from a couple of hours ago was playing again in Yoo Yeonha’s head.

Chwaaak—!

An arrow had flown into the car before anyone could realize what was happening.

The driver’s head exploded like a balloon. The sickening stench, the sticky texture, the blood and the flesh… she felt disgusted by it all.

Even after emptying her stomach, she still felt sick. Death clung to her like a leech and she couldn’t fend it off.

“…!”

After tossing and turning in her nightmare, Yoo Yeonha opened her eyes.

Darkness filled her view and she was covered in sweat.

She felt nauseous.

Yoo Yeonha staggered to her feet and barely remained standing by holding onto the cave wall.

She threw up yet again.

“…Ah.”

Yoo Yeonha leaned against the wall and fell to the ground from sheer exhaustion.

What happened today left her with a trauma.

Death was much more horrific than she expected, especially up close.

She thought she would be indifferent, she believed she had become tough. Yet…

‘Is it because I stayed clear of real battles for too long, or is it because I’m too young?’

Yoo Yeonha clenched her teeth, blaming herself.

She recalled Licros.

She had personally selected him as an agent of Falling Blossom. The brave Mexican, who volunteered to be the spy, was also a husband and a father of two. But today, he disappeared without a trace.

Yoo Yeonha was the one who burned his body.

“…I’m sorry.”

Her selfishness was the reason for his death.

Deep in sorrow, Yoo Yeonha vowed to forever remember him and to always help out his family.

She wiped her tears and looked around.

Kim Hajin was nowhere to be found even though she remembered he was by her side when she fell asleep.

“Where did he go now…?”

Fear struck Yoo Yeonha, and she turned her smartwatch on instinctively.

[T-The number you have c-called cannot be reached at t-this time—]

But her broken smartwatch was still not working. Left with no other choice, Yoo Yeonha walked up to the mouth of the cave. She didn’t want to be alone inside.

“…Haa.”

With a whip in hand, Yoo Yeonha cautiously approached the cave's exit, then suddenly let out a sigh of relief.

Kim Hajin was sitting by the entrance of the cave. He must have been standing guard but ended up falling asleep.

Yoo Yeonha put the whip down with a smile, and she slunk towards Kim Hajin.

“….”

Seeing him asleep made her remember the horrific dream once again. In it, Kim Hajin was holding Black Lotus’s bow and arrows.

She muttered in pity, “You poor thing….”

Just how much weight was he carrying?

Yoo Yeonha couldn’t even imagine the pain and the pressure he had to bear.

Though Kim Hajin refused to comment, she was sure that he became a member of the Chameleon Troupe to seek revenge against them. Kim Hajin had walked into the mouth of the monster in order to earn its trust and bring it down for good, even if meant he had to get his own hands dirty.

“…He who fights with monsters must take care, lest he thereby becomes a monster himself.”

‘If you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss gazes back into you….’

Yoo Yeonha recalled the famous quote by Friedrich Nietzsche. It made her heart heavier.

Slowly, Yoo Yeonha stretched her arm and smoothed Kim Hajin’s ruffled hair. He looked like a child in his sleep, which made him look all the more pitiful.

‘A person can’t bear that much weight alone. You can ask your friends for help, so why won’t you?’

“….” Yoo Yeonha sat next to Kim Hajin in silence. Was it because of the heat from Kim Hajin’s clothes? The ground and the air around him was warm.

“…Haam~”

The warmth was making her feel sleepy again. This time, she was positive she wouldn’t have a nightmare.

“Uhm…. Ahmm….”

Yoo Yeonha slowly dozed off. She slouched, leaning against Kim Hajin’s shoulder. His firm shoulder was her pillow that served as a gateway to a pleasant dream.

…5 minutes later.

The moon shone into the cave filled with silence and wind.

Under the dim moonlight, Kim Hajin was wide awake. He stared at Yoo Yeonha who was leaning against his shoulder.

“Why does she always misunderstand things?” Kim Hajin grumbled but couldn’t deny that her sleeping face was quite adorable.

He covered Yoo Yeonha with a blanket made from Aether. Wrapped in warmth, Yoo Yeonha sunk into a deep sleep. Away from nightmares, she smiled.

**

A new day dawned and the morning sun rose.

Sannuri brought Jin Seyeon and Jin Sechan back. Judging by their appearances, I could only imagine the kind of hardship they experienced since we parted ways yesterday. We celebrated our reunion with a simple hug.

“We were ambushed by an archer. We managed to escape but our car was destroyed and we were chased by the Djinns.”

“…You too?”

I learned a new fact. I wasn’t the only one attacked by Leraje. She attacked me and Jin Seyeon at the same time. She was truly impressive.

Anyways.

United once again, we began the strategy meeting. Our goal was to return safely.

We knew that we couldn’t rely on the Association for reinforcements. Fortunately, we had our own means of transportation, ‘Sannuri’.

The conclusion of the meeting was already decided.

However, Sannuri hated being around the [Dimensional Entropy]. So I cut down trees and sharpened stones to make a carriage. Thankfully, Sannuri didn’t mind pulling a carriage.

“Hop inside.”

I led others to the carriage I made. I had only invested 3 hours into making it, but it was sturdy and spacious enough for 4 people, all thanks to [Young Dwarf’s Dexterity].

“It’s surprisingly cozy in here.”

“I agree.”

Yoo Yeonha and Jin Seyeon exclaimed in surprise, but I still had more to show. I put my hand on the carriage and activated [Random Consolidation System].

The number 60 appeared on the carriage.

Soon, the carriage became bigger, lighter, and better in terms of design. The concept of ‘carriage’ was enhanced by 60% exactly. The inside of the carriage was now big enough for 4 people to lie down.

“Enchant.”

Lastly, I activated [Four-colored Enchant].

“Black, Flow Isolation.”

I muttered the keywords. Immediately, Stigma seeped into the carriage, blending it in with the surroundings. This enchantment was used for [concealment].

“Let’s go.”

I climbed into the carriage. The trio stared at me in awe before climbing in as well.

After all passengers embarked, Sannuri started moving.

I stared outside, preparing for a possible ambush.

“…I’m glad I chose you to be my bodyguard.”

I simply smiled at Yoo Yeonha’s compliment. I still felt a little bit awkward around her because of her misunderstanding from the day before.

Sannuri raced across the grasslands of Central Asia. She was running at about 400 kilometers per hour, and the view outside the carriage window was changing at an equally quick pace. Our destination was Pyeongan Island in Korea. At our current speed, we should arrive in two days.

…I suddenly recalled the cold yet beautiful voice.

—My name.

That was what Leraje muttered as she stared at me. I looked at the information I got through [Narrow Escape from Death].

***

[Leraje] [Current Power 9.3 / Potential 9.85]

—Rank 14 Devil

—Invasion Alignment - Neutral & Moderate

—Has taken an interest in you.

—Likes archers like herself.

—Loves board games such as chess….

***

Some of them were settings I came up with and some weren’t. I carefully went over the list.

It was then.

[Sorry, I turned my smartwatch off during training. I just saw your text.]

Suddenly, I received a text from Chae Nayun.

**

[Seoul, Korea — Hero Plaza]

Jin Sahyuk returned to Seoul. No one was by her side. She was visiting the ‘Hero Plaza’ alone.

The Hero Plaza was a large domed stadium located in the heart of Seoul. It was used by Heroes for ‘Ranking Battles’ or ‘Grade Promotion Battles’. Currently, the stadium, which could accommodate a total of 60,000 people, was crawling with Heroes, their managers, and reporters.

—We’ll now start the second preliminary round for the ‘Gate of Glory’!

Only the winners of this tournament would be allowed to enter the ‘Gate of Glory’, formerly called the ‘Demon Realm Gate’.

The Association avoided any mention of the horrors and deaths that lay in wait beyond the Gate and only publicized wealth and fame.

It was a very Association-like way of dealing with the issue.

—A total of 10,000 candidates currently remain in the race. Today, 1000 of the 10,000 candidates will be handpicked by the judges and 500 of the 1000 will advance to the next round!

Jin Sahyuk looked down at the stadium filled with hopeful Heroes. Among the candidates were Kim Suho, Shin Jonghak, Bell, and Rumi.

The task of the second round was to complete a maze. Two Heroes were paired at random and the two had to get through a gigantic maze built in the basement of the stadium.

“Haa.”

Jin Sahyuk let out a deep sigh. The cause of her concern was not the maze but something else.

“…I don’t understand.”

With another sigh, Jin Sahyuk took out the magnifying glass from her pocket. The glass part of it had shattered and only the frame remained. But Jin Sahyuk still remembered the words that had appeared on the glass. Those words represented Kim Hajin’s true feelings.

“…”

She waved the frame of the magnifying glass from side to side as she recalled Kim Hajin’s emotions.

[Pity]

The first was ‘pity’.

If that was all there was, she simply would’ve been mad at the fact that he took pity on her.

However.

[Sympathy] [Mild animosity]

The next were ‘sympathy’ and ‘animosity’. The two words seemed to contradict each other, but those weren’t too confusing either.

What truly baffled her were the countless words that suddenly filled her view afterward.

They overflowed and shattered the magnifying glass.

They instilled chaos in Jin Sahyuk’s heart.

—Emotions that will be 'synchronized' when the Synchronization rate increases (currently 15%)—

[Loyalty] [Faith] [Reason for living] [Happiness] [Sense of guilt for not being able to help] [Desire to be together] [Desire to protect]….

She couldn’t understand the source of the emotions that filled the magnifying glass and was even more clueless about the word ‘Synchronization’.

‘What in the world is Synchronization?’

‘What happens when it increases?’

‘And how do I increase it?’

Jin Sahyuk was completely confused.

“…Haa.”

Jin Sahyuk sighed and looked below.

As she glanced over the arena full of Heroes, she met a man’s eye. He had a handsome face and brown hair.

It was Kim Suho.

The moment their eyes met, Kim Suho’s face stiffened. He then hurried to the stairs.

Tong— Tong— Tong—

The hollow sound of iron stairs rang out. Kim Suho made it to the end of the staircase in no time and stood next to Jin Sahyuk.

“Are you here as a candidate?”

With a nod, Jin Sahyuk answered, “I don’t want to miss out on the fun. Isn’t it obvious? Idiot.”

Despite her insult, Kim Suho only smiled.

“You should stop here if you plan on doing anything rash inside. You know this is important.”

Jin Sahyuk’s face distorted into a frown.

“Who do you think you are?”

“…”

“Who do you think you are to order me around?”

Kim Suho looked at Jin Sahyuk in silence. Jin Sahyuk, too, glared at Kim Suho.

For a minute, they only stared at each other.

Suddenly, Kim Suho smiled and remarked playfully, “Or else, I’ll tell Hajin.”

“What did you say?”

Jin Sahyuk’s face stiffened.

“Mm? So I guess you don’t want Hajin to get mad at you.”

“I dare you to say that again, you bastard!”

Jin Sahyuk was angry. No, not angry. She was actually flustered.

‘Did Kim Hajin tell Kim Suho? Does he know about the things on the magnifying glass?’

“I’m just kidding.”

Kim Suho shook his head, but Jin Sahyuk was still suspicious of him.

She glared at Kim Suho with flames in her eyes.

However, unfortunately, she had run out of time to interrogate.

—Next up is the candidate you’ve all been waiting for~ Swordsman of Wish Kim Suho! He turned down a special offer from the Association and chose to participate in the preliminary rounds! Kim Suho will participate in this mission with intermediate-rank Hero, Yi Yijin!

The host declared Kim Suho’s turn.

“I have to go now. Try not to cause a commotion, okay?”

Kim Suho gave a small smile and left. Jin Sahyuk continued to glare at him.

…It was then.

Jin Sahyuk noticed that someone was staring at her as she stared at Kim Suho. It was Chae Nayun. The mere sight of her annoyed Jin Sahyuk.

But the moment their eyes met— Jin Sahyuk remembered something Bell had said in the past.

‘Aren’t you curious about the relationship between Chae Nayun and Kim Hajin? I assure you it’s much more scandalous than you think.’

Maybe the whole synchronization thing was somehow related to this. Yes, Bell was an asshole, but he was a truthful asshole.

When her thoughts reached that far, Jin Sahyuk glared at Chae Nayun and activated ‘Reality Manipulation’. Jin Sahyuk’s magic power slipped into reality and altered it ever so slightly.

Now, the next team would be— Chae Nayun and Jin Sahyuk.

...

Chapter 308. The Stories That Become Bridges (2)

Jin Seyeon looked out the carriage window. The steppes of Central Asia looked different than what she saw on textbooks. Weeds grew to knee-length, trees stood tall reaching towards the sky, and there were even villages formed by small Djinn groups.

“…It feels like I’m in a fantasy world.” Jin Seyeon muttered in a daze.

In response, Jin Sechan also looked out the carriage. But because his eyesight wasn’t as inhumane as the others, he couldn’t see the same scenery as Jin Seyeon. So, he turned his sight back to Yoo Yeonha.

“….”

Yoo Yeonha was staring at the tilionium case she was holding in her arms. She seemed to be deep in thought. Jin Sechan was worried about her but couldn’t bring himself to say anything. In his mind, his only role as her secretary was to watch her from the sidelines.

“Are you okay?” Jin Seyeon asked what he wanted to. Jin Seyeon smiled at Jin Sechan before moving over to the seat next to Yoo Yeonha.

Yoo Yeonha glanced at Jin Seyeon, then said with a nod, “I’m fine.”

“Don’t keep that case too close to your body. It will have bad effects. If you want, it’s not too late to call demon merchants.”

Hearing this, Yoo Yeonha smiled bitterly. The group had already considered calling demon merchants, who would do anything for the right amount of DP.

“…No, demon merchants are demons also. They’ll desire this as well.”

But Yoo Yeonha didn’t trust them. There was no guarantee that demon merchants wouldn’t want something that other demons were desperate to get.

Yoo Yeonha let out a deep sigh and looked at the case holding the [Dimensional Entropy].

“Is that item that important?” Jin Seyeon asked.

Yoo Yeonha nodded her head and replied without a moment of hesitation, “Yes, I know from the Skills I obtained from the Tower of Wish. [Basic Skill - Lv.9 Law of Thoughts], which amplifies the speed and strength of my thinking, and [Special Skill - Lv.9 Appraisal Eyes], which lets me appraise an item in my field of vision.”

Analysis of [Dimensional Entropy] was still happening inside Yoo Yeonha’s head. Essential Dynamics was also the best in the world at extracting magic power from crystals and mana stones.

“This item can save the lives of countless people.”

“….” Jin Seyeon looked at her for a moment, then smiled and said, “I hope so too.”

Yoo Yeonha smiled back at her feebly.

“Hmm….” On the other hand, Kim Hajin, who was watching the two from nearby, couldn’t understand the bond between them. As far as he was aware, there shouldn’t be any connection between the two. Just when did they develop such a sister-like relationship?

“…How did you two get so close?” Kim Hajin asked, unable to hold back his curiosity.

Yoo Yeonha and Jin Seyeon glanced at Kim Hajin, but both leaned against the carriage without saying anything.

“What the…” Kim Hajin pouted and furrowed his brows.

Yoo Yeonha found this side of him cute. “I’ll tell you later.”

“…Tsk.” Kim Hajin nodded unhappily, then in the next moment, his eyes widened. He suddenly began to scan the air with his eyes.

[Where are you? I’m taking the test for the Gate of Glory.]

Chae Nayun had messaged him. Kim Hajin smiled and shook his head.

[I can’t tell you that.]

[What? Why not? …Actually, that’s probably for the best.]

[Huh?]

Chae Nayun gave up surprisingly quickly. Kim Hajin tilted his head.

[I don’t think I’ll be able to talk if you’re in front of me. I’m not ready yet… you know what I mean?]

‘Heh.’ Kim Hajin smirked.

[Yeah, I guess it’s still a bit awkward. So?]

[Right, so… I was thinking we could just talk a couple of times a day with this. So that we can get familiar with talking to each other. We can also play games. Did you know there’s a new version of Gladiator of the Century?]

[No.]

[Download it. It’s popular among Heroes because it helps with image training. They added a bunch of skills, so it’s super popular. Tournaments regularly get over 900,000 viewers….]

As expected of a known gamer, Chae Nayun began to talk about recent news. Kim Hajin just listened to her with a smile on his face, while Jin Seyeon and Yoo Yeonha stared at him like he had gone mad.

[Ah, wait, the heck, I’m paired up with Jin Sahyuk.]

[What? Jin Sahyuk?]

[Yeah, I’m hanging up for now.]

“What are you doing by yourself?” As soon as Chae Nayun cut off the communication, Yoo Yeonha asked. It was then.

“…!” Kim Hajin’s expression stiffened. It wasn’t just him, Jin Seyeon was the same. With their supernatural perception, the two of them had sensed someone’s ‘gaze’.

An outsider was watching them from afar.

“….”

“….”

Kim Hajin and Jin Seyeon exchanged glances silently. Soon, Jin Seyeon’s Mental Transmission rang out inside Kim Hajin’s head.

—We should just let this person keep watching. I don’t know who it is, but I don’t sense any hostility. We should act normal.

Kim Hajin nodded his head.

Jin Seyeon smiled brightly and said, “By the way, everyone’s raising a ‘sponsored character’ with DP, right?”

The DP System was granted to anyone who hunted demonic monsters even once. Those who earned more than 50,000 DP could play something called the ‘minigame’. Sponsoring the people of Lailos was growing in popularity.

“Of course, you’ll be surprised to know who I’m sponsoring.” Yoo Yeonha said proudly.

“Oh, really? Show me.”

With a grin, Yoo Yeonha displayed the information of the individual she was sponsoring. It was a high-rank knight named Gimitos.

“Wow, Gimitos the Berserker! He was yours? The Lailos Community was full of comments praising him.”

“…Lailos what?” Kim Hajin asked in surprise. Though he wasn’t aware, an online community had developed for Lailos sponsors. The site already had more than 200,000 members.

“There’s a post every time Gimitos buys a new armor or weapon. Didn’t he buy the Black Flame Dragon Armor recently?”

“…Well, I don’t want to brag. So, what about you?” Yoo Yeonha shrugged her shoulders and changed the subject.

“I’m raising an archer. Look.”

The Lailosian Jin Seyeon was sponsoring was an intermediate-rank archer named Lekio. Yoo Yeonha and Jin Sechan looked at him with flashing eyes.

“That bow looks like it’s made with emetos ore. Ah, his armor is made with quality leather as well…”

While the three of them talked, Kim Hajin checked up on his retainer, Litrain.

「Litrain became the youngest Master-rank knight, obtaining the title, Starlight Knight.

Even after rising to the position of a knight order commander, she didn’t stop training. The once small ‘Extra Temple’ now had over a thousand visitors per day. Serving under her were dozens of apprentice knights who were drawn by her charisma.

An order of knights called the Starlight Knights was created inside the existing knight order of the kingdom, making Litrain’s influence one of the strongest in the kingdom.

However, Litrain was still worried about one thing. Recently, her disciples and the followers of the Extra Temple were growing suspicious of Extra-nim. They knew that over a year had passed since he last sponsored Litrain…」

Litrain had grown tremendously since the last time Kim Hajin saw her. He had earned over 200,000 DP from her, a third of which he immediately sent back to Litrain.

“Who are you sponsoring, Hajin-ssi? Show us.” Jin Seyeon asked at that moment.

Kim Hajin hesitated for a moment. “…Well, it’s her.”

He displayed Litrain’s information rather casually. But everyone else immediately dropped their jaws.

“Wait, Litrain… she’s famous in the community… My Gimitos….”

Soon, Yoo Yeonha’s jealous voice rang out.

**

On the other hand, Leraje was watching them from a distance. As seeing far was her specialty, she didn’t have any trouble following their movements. She stared at the man named Kim Hajin carefully.

He knew her name, and he didn’t mutter it thoughtlessly. Leraje had the ability to discern what state someone was in based on their voice.

“What are you up to, Duchess?”

At that moment, her henchman, Corte, asked her. Leraje replied simply.

—Bored.

—Being here alone is boring.

—Did you get in touch with those old devils?

“Yes, three devils obtained incarnation bodies. Rank 3 Devil, Prince Vassago, Rank 29 Devil, Count Astaroth, and Rank 62 Devil, Valac.”

Hearing this, Leraje immediately frowned.

—Old Man hasn’t escaped his curse yet?

Old Man. She was referring to Baal.

Corte smiled and shook his head, “No, King Baal has escaped the curse. The Gate of the Demon Realm will soon open, so his descent is not far away.”

—How long will it take?

“Three months and not a day more.”

Three months. It was too long for Leraje. If she became too bored, she might wander around the outside world. Corte wanted to avoid risking her identity as much as possible.

To do this, Corte took out an electronic device he had brought beforehand.

—What’s that?

“It’s called a game console. Humans like to play it to entertain themselves. With this, you will never be bored.”

—…Is that so?

Leraje showed interest. It was a good sign. Corte knelt down and offered the virtual reality gaming console to Leraje.

—How do I use it?

“You just have to wear the helmet and turn the game on by moving your fingers.”

—….

Leraje did as Corte suggested. Her vision turned black for a moment, then a blue screen popped up in front of her. At the same time, a strange sensation of being transported to another world encompassed her.

[I will explain how to use this console. Please do as I say.]

Before she could get used to the sensation, a message popped up in front of her, and Leraje furrowed her brows.

—Who are you to tell me what to do?

[Try moving your fingers.]

—I don’t want to. Introduce yourself first.

[Try moving your fingers.]

—Impudent.

Leraje moved her fingers, her intent being to destroy the impudent being talking to her. But the moment she moved her fingers, the world changed. The blue room she was in transformed into a vast grassland.

Leraje widened her eyes in surprise.

[Here is a list of popular games. Click on the one you want to play.]

[1. Gladiator of the Century]

[2. Reolesk]

[3. Grand Theft Auto]

…

Leraje stared at the messages before clicking on ‘Gladiator of the Century’.

[You already own the game. Accessing ‘Gladiator of the Century’…]

[Welcome to the world of Gladiator of the Century.]

[Please set your ID.]

[Your ID will be your name inside Gladiator of the Century.]

—You’re kind unlike the one before.

Leraje nodded in satisfaction before writing down her ID.

[Lijengy]

Lijengy was purely a typo, but Leraje didn’t catch it in the slightest.

[Welcome, Lijengy.]

—What? Lijengy? You…

Having become Lijengy, Leraje expressed her anger at the machine for calling her the wrong name.

**

[Next up, Essence of the Strait’s rising star, Chae Nayun, and the black horse of the tournament, Jin Sahyuk!]

Seoul’s Hero Plaza.

Chae Nayun and Jin Sahyuk were placed in the same team, and the two of them entered the maze side by side.

“Screw off.”

Of course, Chae Nayun showed no intention of working together with her, bolting off to the opposite direction the moment they entered the maze.

Although running in a random direction wasn’t recommended inside a maze, Chae Nayun’s intuition gave her an undeniable edge. Chae Nayun knew about her supernatural intuition, so she believed she would find the exit before long.

“….”

But Jin Sahyuk had no intention of letting that happen. She activated Reality Manipulation. Her magic power seeped into the maze and changed its structure.

Kiiik— Kiiik—

The change in the maze eliminated the exit altogether. Chae Nayun, who wasn’t unaware of the change, thought of the shifting maze as part of the trial.

“…She really is an idiot.” Jin Sahyuk sneered. Now, Chae Nayun wouldn’t be able to find the exit no matter what she did. All Jin Sahyuk had to do was wait until she grew tired and came back.

Plop—

Jin Sahyuk sat down on the floor and sent Mental Transmissions to Bell to pass time.

**

[Central Asia]

The carriage continued to race through Central Asia as Jin Seyeon, Yoo Yeonha, and Jin Sechan kept their eyes glued to Litrain. They were fully watching her every move, exclaiming every once in a while about her beauty, strength, and kindness.

By the time they fell asleep, they had become avid fans of Litrain.

After sleeping for 3~4 hours, the carriage reached China. The safe zone wasn’t far away, but we kept our guard up.

“…The gaze went away.” Jin Seyeon said.

“Yeah.” I nodded my head.

Clack, clack. The carriage moved peacefully. Then, I turned to Jin Seyeon. She was also looking at me. By the looks of it, she must have also felt the unusual presence approaching us.

“Yeonha-ssi, we should get ready for battle.”

Yoo Yeonha was startled by Jin Seyeon’s words, but she soon took out her whip courageously.

Jin Seyeon said, “We’re surrounded. There’s no way to break through. Rather than being ambushed, we should go out and face them.”

“…I agree.”

It would be annoying if the carriage was destroyed by an ambush.

I opened the carriage door and walked outside. Jin Seyeon, Yoo Yeonha, and Jin Sechan followed suit.

In that instant, hostility and killing intent shot up. Wind carrying demonic energy blew over, and the enemy’s presence drew closer.

“Don’t worry, we’ll win for sure. I’m a hundred percent certain.”

Jin Seyeon took out her bow as she calmed Yoo Yeonha. I also took out my Desert Eagle.

Guoooo—

Suddenly, demonic energy filled the air. A giant storm seemed to brew as a shooting star shot down from the sky.

KWANG—!

The shooting star landed a little ways in front of us. Unsurprisingly, the shooting star was a living being.

“Haha, how are you all doing on this fine day?”

“….”

I knew who he was. The mask covering half of his face made it obvious. It was Destruction.

But Destruction wasn’t the only enemy. Dozens of Djinns appeared from the ground, sky, and land and surrounded us.

“Uhahahaha.” Destruction burst out into laughter. Yoo Yeonha stared at Destruction and clenched her teeth.

“It’s been a while, Yoo Jinwoong’s daughter.”

“…You know him?” Jin Seyeon asked.

“A little bit. He lost to my father back in the day.”

“…Pardon?”

“He went crazy from his inferiority complex and ended up losing half of his face to my father.”

Hearing this, Destruction’s face contorted heavily. Seething in rage, he glared at Yoo Yeonha.

“It seems the daughter is just as trashy as the father…”

Then, he took a step forward with a grin. The Djinns around the area all released their demonic energy and transformed into a devil-like form. Unsurprisingly, Destruction’s subordinates were all skilled with Devil Transformation.

Destruction asked, “Where’s the Dimensional Entropy? Inside the carriage? I’ll let you die peacefully if you hand it over.”

However, Yoo Yeonha shook her head.

Destruction furrowed his brows, “Trust me. If you hand over the Dimensional Entropy, I’ll chop off your heads cleanly and send you mostly intact to the father you love so much. Otherwise—”

“Shut it. Your breath is smelly.”

“….”

Destruction’s expression turned ugly. I transformed the Desert Eagle into its machine gun form.

“Huu….”

Destruction let out a deep sigh. Then, he scratched his head with his long nails, which began to turn black. Without a doubt, this partial change was also Devil Transformation.

“…Looks like I’ll have to go back on my words.”

A giant horn protruded out from his head, and his body began to turn black with demonic energy. Destruction bent his body like a track runner at the starting line, then shot forward like a bullet.

No, that’s what he tried to do.

“Stop.”

A clear, child-like voice rang out from the sky. Shackles of magic power bound Destruction’s body.

It wasn't just Destruction. The entire world seemed to have responded to the voice as Destruction’s subordinates and even the blowing wind froze solid.

“Ku….uk.”

Destruction turned his head desperately to the direction the voice came from.

A ‘small person’ was floating 10 meters above the ground. Her symbolic white hair shone beautifully, and her proud, chic eyes glared at Destruction sharply.

The Hero who defined a generation had arrived.

“…Why did you come so late?”

Jin Seyeon looked up at her and smiled.

“I came as quickly as I could. You told me to come secretly. I’m the chairman of the Temple of Justice, you think it’s easy for me to leave work without anyone knowing?”

Aileen grumbled and hopped down from a puff of cloud she was standing on.

Tadat—

She landed lightly inside the area frozen in time by her single word.

“Looks at all the trash here.” She said with a sneer.

“….”

Yoo Yeonha finally snapped out of her daze and glanced at Jin Seyeon, asking for an explanation.

Jin Seyeon smiled and whispered.

—I told you, we’re going to win for sure. I secretly asked for backup.

“Kuuu…uuuuk….”

Destruction resisted Aileen’s Spirit Speech as hard as he could. He twisted his neck forcefully and muttered with rage.

“You’re… Ai…”

“Shut your mouth.”

Aileen’s words muted Destruction, but his eyes were still glaring at her with killing intent.

Aileen furrowed her brows

“…You’re annoying. Just get crushed!”

A short exclamation rang out in the empty field. And that was enough.

“Uk, uuuuuaak—!”

Destruction’s body folded on itself in a strange way before exploding.

…That was the end.

“….”

“….”

We stared at the scene in a daze. Aileen had gotten far more powerful than when we saw her in the Tower of Wish, or even when we saw her during the fight against Orden.

She was almost at the level of a ‘transcendent’.

Just what happened?

“Pft, impressed? I got an amazing Unique Skill at the Tower of Wish. This is nothing to me now.”

Aileen strutted her chest and looked around. The leader of the Djinns were now dead, but the remaining ones couldn’t move because of Aileen’s Spirit Speech.

Aileen ignored them and approached Jin Seyeon.

“Anyways, why are you here?”

“Yes? Ah… about that.”

Jin Seyeon scratched the back of her neck for a bit, then placed her hand on Yoo Yeonha’s shoulder.

“Let me introduce her first. This is Yoo Yeonha, the Chief Officer of the guild I’m in.”

“…Chief Officer? What do you mean, you’re not in a…”

In an instant, Aileen’s eyes widened.

“Wait, you mean…?”

Yoo Yeonha was the first to realize what Jin Seyeon meant.

“…Ah!”

This was Jin Seyeon’s response to the offer she made a long time ago. Yoo Yeonha looked at Jin Seyeon, then at Aileen, then at me.

“Y…Yes!”

Then, she jumped excitedly.

...

Chapter 309. The Stories That Become Bridges (3)

[Seoul, Korea — Maze at the ‘Hero Plaza’]

After 3 hours, Chae Nayun realized something was wrong. Her intuition told her that this maze had no exit.

But how could that be the case? This test was designed to pick out 200 challengers for the Gate of Glory. Chae Nayun explored the maze for 2 more hours to reaffirm her doubt.

Meanwhile, Jin Sahyuk grew more and more tiresome as she watched Chae Nayun go back and forth. She assumed Chae Nayun would give up soon enough, but clearly, she was wrong. Chae Nayun’s tenacity was beyond her imagination.

“Ehew.”

Jin Sahyuk let out a sigh and got up, about to intervene in Chae Nayun's wandering.

It was then.

—Sahyuk.

She heard a voice. It flowed into her ears, freezing her brain. Jin Sahyuk widened her eyes and turned her gaze to where the voice had come from.

There, a semi-transparent, fog-like existence glimmered in the air. It was Bell, without a doubt.

“Bell, you bastard—”

Was it because they had been apart for too long? Jin Sahyuk jumped at Bell with a needlessly excessive amount of joy. She stretched her arm and grabbed Bell in his gaseous state by the collar. Bell smiled as he looked down at her grip.

“Where have you been—”

—Shh.

Bell put his finger to his lips.

“Shh? Are you crazy?”

—Hey, keep it down. I’m only here because it looked like you were gonna be eliminated from the tournament.

“Eliminated my ass….”

—You’ve accomplished nothing during the last 6 hours. Don’t you want to enter the Gate of the Demon Realm?

“…Is there a reason why I should enter?” Jin Sahyuk remarked flatly. She was here because she wanted to enter the Gate of the Demon Realm. She just felt the need to revolt because she was pissed at Bell.

Bell smiled, thinking Jin Sahyuk was cute.

—Of course you do. You have to kill me inside the Gate.

“…What?”

Jin Sahyuk’s face stiffened. But Bell looked as comfortable as he always did.

—I know you already heard most of what you needed to know from Kim Hajin.

“….”

Jin Sahyuk remained silent. Bell was finally starting to take form.

Bell reached out towards Jin Sahyuk and put his hand on her shoulder.

“Please continue to work hard. I believe in you, Sahyuk.”

Bell’s voice, now even clearer than before, danced in her ears.

“I’ve repeated the past countless times and finally found you….”

Jin Sahyuk looked at Bell. She couldn’t understand the firm trust and the earnest hope lurking in his eyes.

“…My death.”

Bell put his hand on Jin Sahyuk’s head. He recalled the moment he first met Jin Sahyuk. Back then, she was so small that they couldn’t even see eye to eye even when Bell bent over. But now she was an adult.

“You can do it, right?”

A broad smile spread across Bell’s face.

Staring at the beaming smile, Jin Sahyuk nodded.

“…If that’s what you want, of course I’ll kill you.”

Jin Sahyuk was full of confidence. Death seemed like a befitting gift for the frenemy she’d known for about 20 years.

“The end is finally near~”

“But,” Suddenly Jin Sahyuk gave a wry smile and said, “I have one condition.”

She had one last question, one last thing she needed to know before she killed Bell.

“Do you know what ‘Synchronization’ is?”

**

[East Asia]

Aileen didn’t ask much. She seemed confused as to why we couldn’t use portals or skills but still provided us top-grade protection.

“Are you sure you can leave for this long?”

“I’ll take this as a vacation. I’ve been so busy recently that I was starting to get annoyed, honestly.”

Aileen shrugged at Jin Seyeon’s question.

“And this is the first time I’ve ever been in a carriage. Oh, right, what are you gonna do about the carriage? If you’re gonna throw it away, can I keep it?”

“Huh? Ah, of course. You can keep it, Aileen-ssi.”

“Really?! Wow, thanks!”

Aileen beamed.

“…Kuhum.”

But the smile quickly faded and Aileen looked at me and Yoo Yeonha in her usual expression.

“Anyway, I won’t ask what you did. I’m sure you were careful not to get involved in anything illegal.”

“…Of course.”

Yoo Yeonha nodded and, all of a sudden, pointed outside the window.

“Ah, it’s Pyeongan Island!”

We all sat up straight like meerkats.

As she said, I could see the Korean border in the distance. Yoo Yeonha didn’t care to hide her joy, and I sent a text to Boss with my smartwatch now that the reception was back.

—Boss, I’ve completed the mission.

The reply came quick.

—Good job. Rest well.

At that moment, clunk— The carriage stopped and Sannuri began to throw a tantrum. She was startled by the border guards coming at us with guns and swords in their hands.

“I’ll deal with them.”

Yoo Yeonha was the first to step out of the carriage.

“Who are you?” Asked one of the guards. But when they saw Yoo Yeonha, all of them immediately gave a 90 degree bow and escorted us back to the mainland.

Later— Yoo Yeonha dragged me to ‘Essential Dynamics Non-Divisional Unit’ located in South Pyeongan Province.

The base was larger than most universities. Yoo Yeonha had been preparing this base ever since she first heard of [Dimensional Entropy].

“…This is where we’ll open the Dimensional Entropy.”

Right now, there were only four of us—Jin Seyeon, Jin Sechan, Yoo Yeonha, and me—here inside the enormous base.

“And, this is the ‘Celestial Extractor’— the culmination of magic engineering that will be used to activate Dimensional Entropy.”

Yoo Yeonha walked towards a large machine with the tilionium case in her hands.

At the center of the machine was the ‘energy heart’, a place to lay down a crystal or a magic ore. Circular pieces of machinery were revolving around the heart. The whole picture reminded me of the Solar System.

We stared at the magnificent scenery in awe. Even Yoo Yeonha, the architect, seemed fascinated by the machine.

“…The energy extracted using this machine could be used for bullets, artillery shells, engines, barriers, power… everything. Essence of the Strait will take humanity to the next level. We’ll be able to stand against any and all possible threats from now on.”

The energy was glowing in green.

I stared some more at the miniature Solar System before turning around with a small smile. Yoo Yeonha looked at me, slightly confused.

“Are you leaving?”

“Yeah, I’m busy.”

I had to deliver the last dress to Medea who was waiting for me in the Tower of Wish. I also had to visit Evandel as promised.

“…Sure. Thanks again for your hard work. You can always come back if anything happens-”

“Just remember to send me those shares,” I said and turned my gaze to Jin Seyeon and Jin Sechan, “Then, do you plan on joining the Essence of the Strait, Jin Seyeon-nim?”

Jin Seyeon gave a broad smile.

“Yes, it’s finally time for me to start considering politics.”

“…”

I smiled in silence.

Next up was Jin Sechan, but I didn’t have much to say to him. But when he noticed that I was looking at him, he bowed to me first.

“It was all thanks to you that I survived. Thank you.”

“…N-No. Thank you for your hard work.”

With that, the mission ended for good.

“I’m leaving now. Take care.”

“Yes, see you later.”

I said goodbye to Yoo Yeonha and left the base.

Then, I immediately headed to ‘Evandel’s Forest’ with Spartan who had completely healed.

[♥ Evandel & Hayang’s Cabin ^-^ ★]

One word had been added to the adorable door plate.

I opened the door to the cabin without even knocking.

“Evandel~”

Evandel, who had been playing house with Hayang in the living room, widened her eyes. She looked at me in a daze and suddenly dropped the doll she had in her hand on the floor. And….

“Hajin—!”

…With a radiant smile, she jumped into my arms.

**

11 PM.

I lay in bed with Evandel as I surfed the web.

[The second preliminary round for the Gate of Glory has ended.]

[What lies beyond the Gate of Glory?]

[‘The Road Ahead for Korea’, Chae Joochul’s speech receives a standing ovation….]

The Internet was filled with news regarding the ‘Gate of Glory’. There was excitement but no panic, probably because the Association changed the name of the gate from the ‘Gate of the Demon Realm’ to the ‘Gate of Glory’.

“…Mm?”

All of a sudden, I saw the virtual reality helmet lying on the floor of the room. I had brought it with me because I thought Evandel might take an interest in it.

“Hmm.”

Evandel was asleep and I was bored.

I stretched my arm and grabbed the helmet.

“Scan.”

Scan was a must. I put the helmet on after I checked it had been enhanced by 59%.

Jiing—

The boot-up usually took about 2 minutes, but with the enhancement, it only took 10 seconds. I looked over the list of games.

[Popular Games]

[1. Gladiator of the Century]

[2. Reolesk]

[3. Grand Theft Auto]

…

‘Gladiator of the Century’ certainly caught my eye. Chae Nayun had asked me to play it with her before, so I figured I should get some practice.

[Purchasing ‘Gladiator of the Century’…. Purchase complete.]

[Accessing ‘Gladiator of the Century’….]

[Welcome to the world of ‘Gladiator of the Century’.]

[Please set your ID.]

My username was always a given.

Extra 7.

[Your username is ‘Extra 7’.]

[Welcome. Would you like to view the tutorial?]

“No.”

I skipped the tutorial.

The first thing I did was look at the [Current Rankings] list. Games were always more fun when you played with someone good.

——————

[Current Rankings]

1 — Fralo 161 matches, 130 wins, 31 losses

2 — BritishSpirit 146 matches, 121 wins, 25 losses

3 — Lijengy 70 matches, 70 wins

4 — Wolf 150 matches, 103 wins, 47 losses

…

——————

“Let’s see….”

First, I sent a goodwill match request to the No.1 player.

[Failed to send a goodwill match request to ‘Fralo’. This user has chosen to decline goodwill match requests from strangers.]

“Ah, right.”

Most rankers chose to decline match requests from players other than their friends. This was the case for other games as well. If they didn’t, newbies would pester them continuously.

‘Should I just play ranked games?’ I thought when I noticed ‘Lijengy’. She was the only ranker who didn’t have the [Automatically Decline Goodwill Match Request] option turned on.

“70 matches and 70 wins….”

She looked strong.

After a moment of hesitation, I sent the request.

[You have sent a goodwill match request to ‘Lijengy’.]

[…‘Lijengy’ has accepted your goodwill match request.]

“Oh?”

The moment Lijengy accepted my request, my body was transferred to an arena.

[Map - Gladiator’s Colosseum]

Dust and the cries of the crowd filled the arena.

My opponent was standing on the other side of the Colosseum.

The sword she was holding was so strangely short that it almost looked like a dagger.

After some thought, I chose a baseball bat as my weapon.

[You have chosen ‘baseball bat’, a beginner’s weapon.]

[3, 2, 1]

[Begin!]

The duel began.

Taat—!

I ran towards ‘Lijengy’ with the baseball bat in my hand. I swung it at her as hard as I could.

Whish—

Lijengy tried to evade my attack, but I relentlessly swung my bat at her.

—Quadruple Baseball Bat Swing!

I shouted.

Whoosh— Whoosh— Whoosh— Whoosh—

My bat moved back and forth 4 times.

And that was the end.

—Kyaaak!

Lijengy died, not being able to withstand my attack.

“…What the.”

It made sense once I thought about it. My console had been enhanced by an astounding 59%, so my character was alone in an accelerated world. I was basically using a speed hack.

“This is bad.”

‘I should probably turn off [Random Consolidation System]. It trivializes the entire game…’

As I was about to turn the game off….

[‘Lijengy’ has requested you for a rematch.]

…I received a match request from Lijengy.

I accepted it, but the result was the same.

—Quintuple Baseball Bat Swing!

—Kyaak!

[K.O.]

[Winner - ‘Extra 7’]

Again, the match ended in less than 3 minutes.

But Lijengy was persistent.

[‘Lijengy’ has requested you for a best of three rematch.]

“…Someone’s competitive.”

I accepted her request.

I was transferred to the Colosseum again.

I jumped at her and swung my baseball bat.

Lijengy fell, but she immediately asked for a rematch.

[‘Lijengy’ has requested you for a best of three rematch.]

[‘Lijengy’ has requested you for a best of three rematch.]

[‘Lijengy’ has requested you for a best of five rematch.]

[‘Lijengy’ has requested you for a best of five rematch.]

[‘Lijengy’ has requested you for a best of seven….]

I was still invincible after 50 rounds and Lijengy continued to send me rematch requests.

[‘Lijengy’ has requested you for a best of nine rematch.]

“Let’s not….”

‘Best of nine is just excessive,’ I thought, when I received a text from Jin Sahyuk.

[Kim Hajin, where are you? Let’s meet.]

I declined the rematch request and typed a reply to Jin Sahyuk’s text.

[You have declined Lijengy’s match request.]

[Lijengy has sent you a message.]

“…What’s wrong with her?”

[Why did you decline my request, Extra 7?]

[You’re the strongest human I’ve ever met.]

[Accept my request.]

[Don’t decline my request.]

“Is she crazy?”

[Accept my request right this moment. I haven’t lost completely yet.]

[Answer me. Don’t test my patience.]

[Don’t make me wait.]

I took off the helmet without replying.

It was then.

Whish—

I received a ‘signal’ from the Tower of Wish.

It came from [Tomer’s Crystal Ball] that I had put inside my Stigma.

**

[Tower of Wish — 8F Crevon]

After I spent some time with Evandel, I returned to Crevon with Jin Sahyuk who had contacted me yesterday.

“Why did we come here again?” Jin Sahyuk asked me, walking down the hallway of Tomer’s mansion.

“I think Tomer wants to talk to me about something.”

And while I was here, I planned to deliver the finished robe to Medea.

“…Ah, why did you text me yesterday?” I asked back.

Jin Sahyuk leered at me and said, “You said you’d stay by my side for half a year. It hasn’t been half a year yet.”

“…Yeah?”

Startled by the fact that Jin Sahyuk had been keeping track, I quickened my pace and arrived at Tomer’s office.

Tok, Tok—

Tomer answered as soon as I knocked.

—Come in.

I opened the door and went in.

Kiik— With a screeching sound, the wooden door swung open.

Tomer was sitting in a chair, all alone in an office that was more modest than I remembered.

“Welc- Oh? Well, if it isn’t the former Knight Commander!”

“She’s with me. Is that okay?”

“Yeah. Sit down,” Tomer said and pointed at a chair.

I sat down.

“So?”

“So- what?”

“…Why did you call me?”

“Ah.”

Tomer’s face stiffened at my question. She looked at me then Jin Sahyuk and said in a low voice, “I wanted to speak to you about Descent, and also about the prophecy.”

“…Prophecy?”

“Yeah. It comes from the administrator of Crevon….”

Tomer showed me a piece of paper. There were only two sentences written across it.

[An enormous calamity shall descend upon the outside world.]

[The inside and the outside must unite as one in order to overcome this ordeal.]

I widened my eyes. The tip of Tomer’s mouth slanted upward.

“The queen wants to speak to you… about the prophecy.”

“Queen? You mean Araha?”

“…Hey, watch your mouth.”

Tomer frowned.

I smiled bitterly and restructured my question.

“What does Her Majesty wish to speak to me about?”

“The second sentence sounds tricky. The part where it says ‘the inside and the outside must unite as one.’”

The inside and the outside must unite as one. It was a very simple sentence, and an idea naturally crossed my mind.

‘Temporary Descent of everyone from the Tower of Wish to fight against the devil and the Demon Realm Transformation.’

“…Yeah, I get that, but why did the queen pick me? I’m not really famous here.”

“How should I know? But listen to me carefully. Araha is a tyrant.”

“Araha? Are you sure you can call the queen by her name?”

“I’m allowed,” Tomer replied and took out a pen, “Now, listen carefully, because I’m about to tell you the dos and don'ts….”

...

Chapter 310. The Stories That Become Bridges (4)

“Araha hates black clothes. She also hates arrogant people and hates being ignored even more. She has an inferiority complex because she wasn’t the first-in-line to become the king.

“The reason Araha is calling you should have something to do with Prestige. You’re Prestige’s master after all.

“I don’t know what Araha thinks about the prophecy. I assume it’s a mix of interest and displeasure….”

After receiving Tomer’s advice, we went to the royal palace, which was several times bigger and grander than the last time I had seen it.

“…By the way, Jin Sahyuk, did I kill you once or twice?” Before going in, I asked Jin Sahyuk.

Her pride seemed to have been hurt as she frowned without a reply.

“I’m not making fun of you. I’m asking how many Skill slots you have left.”

“…Five.”

“Five? Three basic and 2 special? You didn’t learn any?”

Jin Sahyuk nodded her head.

“You’re more prudent than I thought. Well, you’ll be learning some today.”

The royal palace should have a few buff-type passive skills. I would be surprised if the royal palace’s vault had nothing of the sort.

“No, I don’t need any.” But to my surprise, Jin Sahyuk shook her head and grumbled. “I can’t learn Ultimate Skills and Unique Skills because of you. I don’t need other trash skills.”

“What? No.”

Now that Jin Sahyuk was becoming more and more redeemable, it was important for me to strengthen her.

“Synthesized Basic Skills and Special Skills that take up two slots are worth learning. We’ll have to look through the vault to see what’s available though.”

“…The hell does that mean?”

“It’s fine if you don’t understand. Let’s just go in.”

Jin Sahyuk and I entered the palace. Once we showed our royal invitation letter to a guard, a knight came down to greet us.

“My name is Wilhelm Tell. Follow me, Her Royal Highness is waiting.”

Wilhelm Tell. He wasn’t all that famous in modern Earth, but his story remained as a small legend.

We followed Wilhelm past a huge garden. Countless knights were lined up along the hallway we walked through. I wasn’t sure if they were there to greet us or threaten us.

“Go in.”

Eventually, we arrived in front of a well-decorated door.

“…Yes.”

I turned the doorknob and slowly pushed the door in.

The door opened smoothly, and I could see Araha sitting at the head of a long, rectangular table.

Once the door fully opened, Araha smiled. Standing next to her were Lancelot and Lü Bu.

“Welcome, Master of Prestige and Former Knight Commander Shin Jahyuk,” Araha said.

“…We’re humbled to be in your audience.”

I greeted her the way I learned from Tomer. Jin Sahyuk, on the other hand, simply nodded her head. It seemed to be a matter of pride. After all, she was a former king.

“I see you haven’t changed, Knight Commander. Please sit.”

Araha didn’t seem to mind Jin Sahyuk’s attitude as she guided us to our seats. I tilted my head at Araha’s reaction. The impression I was getting from her was different than what Tomer taught me.

“Hajin-ssi?”

Then, a woman who was sitting near Araha called my name. A knight with blonde hair and sparkling eyes. She was someone I knew well.

“Rachel?”

Rachel and I exchanged curious glances.

“Hm? You two know each other?” A smile of interest emerged on Araha’s face.

Rachel looked back and forth between me and Jin Sahyuk before asking with a gulp, “How did you two…”

“Ah, Jin Sa-, er, Knight Commander Shin Jahyuk came as my companion. Her Royal Highness called us here.”

“Please, sit. Or do you plan on keeping me waiting?” Araha interrupted us and said with a cheery voice.

“Ah, yes.”

Jin Sahyuk and I sat down. Rachel still looked confused, and Araha clapped her hands, still smiling.

Immediately, several servants walked into the room with plates of food.

“Go ahead. I heard there’s a saying in your world that one should fill their stomach before enjoying the mountain view.”

With that, we began to eat. I munched on a king crab’s leg, and Jin Sahyuk sliced a premium steak.

Araha asked, “You’ve heard about the prophecy from Margrave Tomer, correct?”

“Yes.”

“I’ve called you to talk about that. We discovered a pathway that leads to your world, Earth.”

My eyes immediately widened.

Araha continued slowly as she munched on a piece of escargot, “But this pathway is in a dangerous place, and a huge amount of energy is needed to open it. Crevon isn’t capable of providing this energy.”

Energy…. That shouldn’t be a problem since the [Dimensional Entropy] was in our hands.

“I should be able to take care of the energy. Where is the pathway?” I asked.

Araha stared at me fixedly before letting out a deep sigh. “The 9th floor.”

“…Pardon?”

“The pathway to the outside world…” Araha paused. After collecting her breath, she muttered in a heavier voice, “…is deep inside the 9th floor filled with mythical monsters.”

**

[Desolate Moon Guild Building – Vice-Leader Shin Jonghak’s Office]

Desolate Moon’s newly appointed vice-leader, Shin Jonghak the Conqueror, was decorating his office. He placed his spear, which was the main reason he was granted the title ‘Conqueror’, on a shelf and placed a sculpture of himself he was gifted a long time ago next to it.

“Hahahaha.”

Just looking at the sculpture brightened up his mood. It suited the interior design of the office and was perfect to represent the Hero Shin Jonghak, at least in his eyes.

“…Kuhum.”

Shin Jonghak, who was wearing a satisfied smile, suddenly furrowed his brows. He had remembered it was Kim Hajin who sculpted this piece.

“That guy, why don’t I ever know where he is?”

Shin Jonghak clicked his tongue, sat down on his office chair and opened the newspaper. The first, second, and third pages were all about the ‘Gate of Glory’.

[3rd Round of Selections Begins for the Gate of Glory. Rising Star Chae Nayun, Kim Suho the ‘Sword Saint’, Shin Jonghak the ‘Conqueror’ Included]

[Norwegian Hero Bjormoj Steps Up to the Challenge… High-intermediate-rank Hero Leitlison Fails at 2nd Round]

—Vice-Leader, there’s news!

“Uwoah!”

A loud shout broke out as Shin Jonghak was reading. Startled, Shin Jonghak ripped the newspaper. Looking at the torn newspaper in his hands, Shin Jonghak sighed.

“…What is it?”

—I’ll send it over right now!

Shin Jonghak received the news on his computer. It was related to Essence of the Strait.

[Breaking News! Master-rank Hero, ‘Divine Archer’ Jin Seyeon, Joins Essence of the Strait!]

[Essence of the Strait Stocks Skyrocket…. Up 19% in 5 minutes!]

“…Pft.”

Shin Jonghak broke out into laughter while reading the news report. Jin Seyeon joining Essence of the Strait was certainly a shocking piece of news, especially considering how long she had remained independent. But it was nice seeing Yoo Yeonha, his long time friend, doing so well.

Although he wasn’t happy that Essence of the Strait was so far ahead of Desolate Moon, he knew Yoo Yeonha was no match for him in terms of battle prowess.

Shin Jonghak continued to read with a pleased smile on his face. Then, his gaze subconsciously turned to the frame next to his monitor.

“….”

Inside the fist-sized frame was the young Shin Jonghak and his grandfather Shin Myungchul, both smiling happily.

“Haa…”

Shin Jonghak picked up the frame with a sigh. Shin Myungchul, the brightest of the Nine Stars and the man whose name will be forever recorded in history.

Even as his grandson, Shin Jonghak couldn’t understand why Shin Myungchul sacrificed himself.

Wasn’t his life worth more than the lives of a few million ordinary people? Didn’t he know that? Or did he sacrifice himself regardless?

“…Grandfather.”

Shin Jonghak recalled an old memory. In it, he was crying in the arms of his grandfather. At the time, just being by his side consoled him. Shin Jonghak was prouder of him than anyone else and considered him the eternal hero of humanity.

Shin Jonghak muttered bitterly as he looked at his young self in the frame.

“I still resent you.”

**

On the other hand, inside the Essence of the Strait guild building, now being flooded with calls, Yoo Yeonha summoned Chae Nayun who was one of Essence of the Strait’s most famous Heroes.

Chae Nayun shouted as soon as she entered Yoo Yeonha’s office, “Is it true?! Jin Seyeon Hero-nim is joining our guild?!”

Her voice resounded loudly. Yoo Yeonha grinned and nodded her head.

“Wow….”

Chae Nayun’s jaws dropped. It was an understandable reaction as most Master-rank Heroes who weren’t guild leaders themselves rarely stayed in guilds.

Jin Seyeon joining Essence of the Strait was truly a piece of news worthy of all the buzz. But that wasn’t all that was surprising.

“Anyways, Nayun.”

“Hm?”

Yoo Yeonha smiled lightly and took out the Balmung Kim Hajin gave her. Chae Nayun tilted her head.

“Take it.”

“What’s this? A baseball bat?”

Her reaction was to be expected. Balmung currently looked like a long stick more than anything else.

“This artifact is perfect for you.”

“This? What, is it the stone club Beowulf used?”

“No. Just try holding it.”

Yoo Yeonha wanted to surprise Chae Nayun. So she gave Balmung to her without an explanation, and Chae Nayun held it with keen interest.

And at that moment— whoosh!

Yoo Yeonha formed a small whip with her magic power and made a small cut on Chae Nayun’s arm.

“Ow!”

Blood flowed from the cut, and Chae Nayun turned to Yoo Yeonha.

Tk, tk— Blood seeped into the stone sword.

“What was that for?”

Chae Nayun eyed Yoo Yeonha angrily.

“Just watch.”

“I’m bleeding, geez.”

“Right.”

Yoo Yeonha shrugged. 500ml of blood was necessary to awaken Balmung, so she had no choice but to make the cut a little deep.

“Right? Look at my arm! It’s bleeding a lot!”

“Look at what’s in your hand.”

Hearing this, Chae Nayun looked down, seething.

“…!”

Chae Nayun’s body shook. The stone lump in her hand was sucking in her blood.

“H-Hey, what’s…”

She didn’t have the time to ask. Once Balmung absorbed enough blood, it emitted a bright light. Yoo Yeonha and Chae Nayun instinctively clad themselves in qi reinforcement.

Kwaaaa— The erupting light soon seeped back into the stone.

“…Uh.”

Silence descended in the room.

Chae Nayun let out a short sound. The lump of stone in her hand had transformed into a sword.

Navy blue blade and a golden hilt. Just like in the myth of Siegfried, both light and darkness coexisted in the 1.8-meter-long greatsword.

Yoo Yeonha looked at it and said, “That’s Balmung.”

“Bal… this… holy…”

While Chae Nayun was lost in shock, Yoo Yeonha took out a document from her drawer. It was a contract for permanent lease of the weapon.

“You want it, right? You can have it if you sign here.”

“…Huh? Oh, yeah, of course.”

When Yoo Yeonha showed her the contract, Chae Nayun signed it without even giving it a brief glance.

“What’s happening!?”

Then, Yoo Yeonha’s office door burst open. Heroes who detected Balmung’s magic power rushed inside.

But once they saw that both Yoo Yeonha and Chae Nayun were safe, their gaze turned to the only odd object in the room.

“…Wow.”

“The heck….”

Balmung, a weapon of many legends.

Yoo Yeonha smiled at the dazed Heroes and gave them an explanation, “This is Balmung. Our major shareholder, XJ-nim, lent it to us.”

XJ was short for EXTRA HAJIN. His name was well-known as a major shareholder of Essence of the Strait, though no one knew his real identity.

“Cool, right? Feel free to take pictures and brag about it to your friends.”

A guild having such a valuable weapon boosted its image.

Even after hearing Yoo Yeonha’s explanation, the Heroes continued to stare at Balmung blankly.

**

[Tower of Wish – 8F, Crevon]

Rain was falling in Crevon. I was sitting in the royal palace’s reception room, deep in thought.

Araha said that the pathway was on the 9th floor. I didn’t know whether or not she was telling the truth, but I could probably just leave the Chameleon Troupe to take care of it. After all, Cheok Jungyeong was always itching for a fight.

“Why haven’t you responded to my messages?”

Then, I heard Rachel’s voice from nearby. She was talking to Jin Sahyuk.

“Do I have a reason to?” Jin Sahyuk answered.

“…I see.” Rachel nodded her head without even the slightest change in her expression. But anyone could tell that she was hurt by the blunt response.

“Hajin-ssi?”

“Yes?”

I turned to Rachel with a smile. Rachel also put on a smile and nodded.

“It’s been a while.”

“Ah, yes.”

“….”

Meanwhile, Jin Sahyuk looked back and forth between me and Rachel. Feeling her gaze, Rachel also turned to Jin Sahyuk.

Just like that, a silent battle began between the two.

“Haha… huh? What’s that?”

Looking around the room, I found a pool table in the corner of the room. From what I heard, all sorts of sports spread by Players were trending in Crevon.

“Um, do you guys want to play some pool?”

“Huh? Pool?”

Rachel’s eyes suddenly brightened.

“…I’d be happy to. Are you good, Hajin-ssi?”

“Uh… It’s hard for me to be bad at it, I guess?”

I had Young Dwarf’s Dexterity after all.

“Pft.” But Rachel suddenly snorted. It was the first time I was seeing her sneer. It must have come out subconsciously as she immediately fixed her expression, but I was taken aback.

“Ah, sorry. It’s just that I’m… quite good at pool. I even won a tournament.”

“Ah… I see.”

I nodded thoughtlessly at Rachel’s proud comment, but that ended up triggering Jin Sahyuk’s competitive spirit.

“What pool are you talking about?”

“English billiards, straight pool, carom, eight-ball, it doesn’t matter to me.”

“Yeah? Then let’s go with carom.”

“Sure.”

Rachel was full of confidence, which Jin Sahyuk seemed to hate. Jin Sahyuk stomped towards the pool table and grabbed a cue. Rachel also grabbed one with a grin.

“Shall we begin?”

“Ah, it’s a bit boring if we’re not betting on something. What should we bet?”

“A bet… What about a wish?”

“Good.”

Everything happened in the blink of an eye. But just as the match was about begin…

“…?”

I was contacted by Spartan who was outside the Tower of Wish.

—Yoo Jinhyuk messaged that his investigation of Yi Yeonjun is complete.

—Yi Yeonjun seems to be up to something. It doesn’t seem urgent. Currently on the lookout.

I got up to return to Earth the moment I received Spartan’s thoughts.

“I’m leaving now. You guys have fun.”

“Huh? Where are you going?”

“She’s right. Kim Hajin, you’re playing too.”

But Rachel and Jin Sahyuk grabbed me simultaneously. Rachel even handed me a cue.

“Don’t run away. You’re playing for a wish too.”

“…Me too?”

“Of course.”

Rachel and Jin Sahyuk were ready to go all out.

“Uh… okay.”

Since Spartan wasn’t in a hurry, I agreed and decided to quickly stomp them and leave.

“Then I’ll go first.”

I put some chalk on the cue tip and got ready. But Jin Sahyuk and Rachel weren’t placing me in their eyes at all.

“I’m curious how good you are, Former Knight Commander.”

“I’m curious too.”

“Please, teach me.”

“I don’t know if you’re good enough to be my disciple.”

“…Annoying me. Is that a tactic?”

“Please, why would I need to stoop to such a level against a beginner?”

“….”

Little did they know, they wouldn’t even have the chance to show off their skills.

“I’m going.”

I planned on ending it on turn one.

...

Chapter 311. Virtual Reality Containing the Truth (1)

“….”

“….”

Rachel and Jin Sahyuk sat in the reception room of the royal palace in shock. The pool table and the cue sticks that they never got to use were in front of them.

The game had ended instantly.

At this point, neither of them could remember how many points they were playing for. They didn’t even want to think about how the game unfolded.

Kim Hajin, the man responsible for this mess, instructed Rachel to ‘give Jin Sahyuk skillbooks’ and Jin Sahyuk to ‘listen to Rachel’. He then left the royal palace without looking back.

Everything felt futile.

“…This game shouldn’t be that easy,” Jin Sahyuk muttered and put a cue stick down on the table.

Hit too hard, the ball breaks. Hit too weak, the ball loses its course. Using magic power was also prohibited.

Pool was a difficult game for superhumans who had beyond average strength.

Tak—!

She posed properly and hit the cue ball. The ball hit the first target, bounced against the wall and then hit the second.

“I'm in a good condition today. Can’t believe the game ended before I even got to play. Oi, you…?”

Jin Sahyuk casually turned her gaze to the side, only to be startled by Rachel.

The princess looked as if her soul had escaped her body.

“…Are you crying?”

“…Eh? N-No.”

Kim Hajin didn’t know this, but as the three-time winner of Crevon’s Pool Tournament, Rachel took pride in this game. With delicate and elaborate techniques stemming from her experience in dealing with spirits, Rachel has long been the reigning queen of billiards.

“It… doesn’t matter anymore. Please, follow me.”

Still in shock, Rachel beckoned to Jin Sahyuk. She planned to show Jin Sahyuk the skill books as she had been instructed to do by Kim Hajin.

“…Sure.”

Jin Sahyuk followed Rachel willingly.

Rachel walked ahead and asked, “Special and Basic Skills, right?”

“Yeah. Something that will be useful in real life. Got anything good?”

“There should be. This is the royal palace, after all.”

The two of them walked down the hallway and arrived at the library accessible only to the members of the royal family and their close associates.

“Come in.”

“…Ooh.”

The library was big and the ceilings were high. Jin Sahyuk looked around in amazement. Every single one of the carefully carved bookshelves was a masterpiece.

Of course, they were nothing compared to Plerion.

“Why don’t you look around and see if anything catches your eye?” Rachel said.

Jin Sahyuk did as she was told. She walked slowly, her eyes skimming over the books. Skillbooks, history books, magic books, educational books, etc. The library had everything.

Jin Sahyuk spent some time looking over the books and studying various skills. In the past, she had thought some of them were useless, but now they all seemed interesting.

“Excuse me, Shin Jahyuk-ssi.”

Suddenly, Rachel called Jin Sahyuk.

“Mm?”

Jin Sahyuk asked back, her gaze still fixed on the book.

“Um….” Rachel hesitated.

Finding it strange, Jin Sahyuk raised her head and looked at Rachel. 10 seconds passed by.

Finally, Rachel asked with a small sigh, “What kind of relationship do you have with Hajin-ssi?”

“…Hm? Uh… nothing, I guess.”

But Jin Sahyuk already knew Kim Hajin’s secret.

She also learned about ‘Synchronization’ from Bell.

And, she knew how Kim Hajin would change once she managed to increase his Synchronization rate.

And so— with a meaningful smile, she added, “…For now.”

**

[16F — Genkelope’s Vessel]

I returned to the Genkelope’s Vessel. The vessel was again roaming above the ‘Genkelope Zone’ on the 16th floor. It seemed that the mission to recapture the Zone was still in progress.

“Welcome back, Ship Commander.”

Horner came out of the Commander’s Office where he had been observing the land below to greet me. I welcomed Horner with a smile.

“Good to see you. And my guest?”

“She’s waiting for you in the VIP lounge.”

Today was the day I would deliver the [Ceremonial Descent Robe] to Medea, my last guest in the Tower of Wish.

“Okay, thanks.”

I headed for the VIP lounge, surrounded by warm welcomes from the crew.

I held a beautifully decorated gift box in one hand and opened the door with the other.

Medea was waiting for me inside, as expected.

“You’re finally here.”

Medea looked at me with a surly expression. It was a natural response, as I was well past the deadline.

I gave a small smile and held out the gift box in my hand.

“I put a lot of effort into making it.”

“Well, even considering that you’re way too late….”

Medea stomped up to me. Her face glimmered with joy and desire that she failed to hide.

“Give it.”

But there was one more thing I had to ask Medea before giving her this robe.

“Are you planning on descending soon, then?”

“…Probably?”

Medea nodded nonchalantly with her arms crossed.

“And you haven’t forgotten about our promise, right?”

“…Promise?”

I took out the copy of [Heynckes’s Dagger].

“Oh~ that?”

Medea and I made an oath over this dagger to never betray humanity and to help humans out at all costs. I couldn’t risk having Medea run away like the former Nine Star Oh Jaejin.

“Of course I haven’t.”

Medea nodded with a smile.

That was all I needed to hear.

Medea, the great sorceress who had been mentioned several times in Greek mythology.

“I don’t want to see the world that I’m going to live in fall apart either.”

I was sure that a person of such caliber would be of great help to this world.

**

After I delivered the robe to Medea, I left the Tower of Wish. Spartan informed me that Yi Yeonjun was still in France, and my next destination was determined.

With Spartan, I flew to Paris, France.

More precisely, my destination was the Champ de Mars where the Eiffel Tower, the iconic landmark of Paris, stood. I planned on observing Yi Yeonjun from there.

…However.

[★ Hosting the 3rd preliminary round of the Gate of Glory Qualification Tournament ★]

[Welcome to Paris.]

[The Paris branch of Essence of the Strait welcomes you!]

[Heroes, please join us at the Eiffel Tower!]

[We love you Kim Suho ♥]

[Hero discount….]

“…What’s going on?”

Paris was clearly in the middle of a celebration. Though it was late at night the city was brightly lit, parades and carnivals everywhere. From the big banners written in Korean, I could tell Paris was excited to be the host of the 3rd preliminary round of the Gate of Glory Qualification Tournament.

“Is it really worth getting this excited about?”

Even considering the fact that the Qualification Tournament was drawing global attention, it still felt excessive. It was as if Paris had been chosen to host the World Cup.

Anyways.

I began searching for Yi Yeonjun under the bright lights.

“…Where is he?”

However, no matter how hard I tried I couldn’t spot Yi Yeonjun and was left with no choice but to rely on Spartan’s vision again.

Yi Yeonjun was not above but underground.

“What the.”

The man next to Yi Yeonjun looked familiar. No, it was more than just familiar— I knew who this man was.

Switching sides on a whim, he was notoriously fickle, but just like Team Rocket, he never accomplished anything.

“Team Rocket, I mean, Lancaster?”

Dumbfounded, I listened in on their conversation.

—…I offer you ‘England’.

As expected, Lancaster was scheming against England again.

He sure was persistent.

—I have top secret information about the British national security with me as well as other confidential documents. With this, you can turn England into a second Pandemonium. The class-1 security codes can neutralize the entire British system and disable all shields.

Yi Yeonjun stared at Lancaster in silence.

Thinking he spotted greed in Yi Yeonjun’s nonchalant expression, Lancaster offered a proposal.

—…There’s only one thing I want. Please destroy the British royal family.

Top secret information about the British national security that Lancaster claimed to know… I wasn’t sure what they were, but right now my top priority was Yi Yeonjun.

I took out my smartwatch and opened Violet Times.

==[Violet Times]==

[Investigator Yoo Jinhyuk has completed your request.]

[Here is the flash drive containing information about Yi Yeonjun’s past.]

[Please pay the complete amount within two weeks.]

***************

A small portal appeared above the smartwatch.

I put my hand inside the portal and pulled out the flash drive Yoo Jinhyuk sent me.

…It was then.

“What’re ya doing here?”

A familiar voice struck my eardrums with crushing weight. Startled, I looked up.

“…You scared me.”

There, Cheok Jungeyong was looking down at me.

With a smirk, he put his hand on my shoulder.

“It’s been a while.”

“…You’re right. But why are you here, Cheok Jungyeong?”

“Me? They’re hosting the 3rd preliminary round or something here, that’s what I’m here for.”

“Alone?”

“Yup. Fun things should be done alone.”

“Mm.”

I nodded and turned my attention to the flash drive and Yoo Jinhyuk’s message.

[Yoo Jinhyuk: I’ve put together the most crucial pieces of information regarding Yi Yeonjun’s past. I even included a flash drive containing all the information as a gesture of goodwill for the VIP customer.]

[Directions: Infuse your magic power into the flash drive and insert it in a virtual reality capsule or a virtual reality helmet.]

[I recommend a ‘whole body capsule’ in place of a ‘helmet’ for a more engaging experience.]

***

[Yoo Jinhyuk’s flash drive]

—A flash drive containing the extracted past.

***

“…Mmm.”

‘So something like this was possible, after all.’

The reason Yoo Jinhyuk delivered his research in the format of a flash drive was that he wanted his customers to experience the same things as himself.

“Oi, what’s that? Looks sort of fun.”

Suddenly, Cheok Jungeyong shoved his head in towards me.

“Nothing. It’s just….”

I was about to change the subject when, suddenly, an idea crossed my mind.

No one said this flash drive was strictly for one person. I knew more than two people could play the same game or watch the same video at the same time using the ‘party’ option in a whole body capsule.

“…Cheok Jungyeong?”

“Hm? What?”

“Do you know Yi Yeonjun?”

Cheok Jungyeong gave a small frown.

“No, not really. All I know about him is that he was the former leader of the Chameleon Troupe and also Boss’s savior.”

Cheok Jungyeong was honest.

I looked down at the flash drive in silence.

Cheok Jungyeong had no prior relationship with Yi Yeonjun. What’s more, he even seemed disgruntled by the former leader's presence.

Well, then….

“Cheok Jungyeong, follow me.”

“Eh? Why?”

“This,” I put up the flash drive and suggested, “You said this looked fun. So let’s look at it together.”

“…Hmm.”

Cheok Jungyeong folded his arms, pretending to be uninterested, but soon broke into a smile and came close to me.

“Where can we look at it?”

“Right over there.”

I pointed at [Capsule de Mars], the largest capsule cafe and one of the most famous tourist attractions in France.

“Capsule? So that thing runs by a capsule?”

“That’s right. Let’s go.”

“I’ve never used a capsule before.”

I headed to the capsule cafe with Cheok Jungyeong who still looked confused.

“Welcome~”

I paid the cafe owner in won and borrowed two capsules. An extra-large-sized capsule for Cheok Jungyeong and a medium-sized capsule for me.

As soon as I was online, I sent Cheok Jungyeong a friend request.

“Cheok Jungyeong, are you ready?”

—Uh… wait… this is so damn complicated…. Ah, there. I accepted your friend request and party invitation. Am I all set?

“Yeah. Give me a moment. I’m putting in the flash drive now.”

I infused my magic power—Stigma—into the flash drive.

“Here we go,” I said and plugged the flash drive into the capsule.

…It was then.

Chwaaaa—

“What the….”

A cluster of light formed inside the capsule.

The mysterious light shot out of the capsule and enveloped my entire body.

**

Meanwhile, Kim Suho and Chae Nayun were busy playing games in the capsule cafe. Their excuse was to relieve stress and relax before the 3rd preliminary round began.

But the real reason they came here was purely because of Chae Nayun.

There was no way that Chae Nayun, an avid gamer, could pass up an opportunity to visit [Capsule de Mars], the world-famous capsule cafe.
