“Way to act high and mighty with such cheap furniture. The stuff we have in our hideout is thousands of times better.”

“…!”

Cheok Jungyeong only meant to make a snarky remark, but it was something the servant couldn’t overlook. His expression contorted viciously, his shoulders shook, and his stomach boiled with anger.

He felt a strong urge to kill Cheok Jungyeong on the spot, but he barely held himself back, knowing his Lord would dislike his challengers disappearing.

“Please refrain from telling such lies. This Colosseum is under our Lord’s control. He can be watching you if he so wishes.”

“I’m not lying, you hunchback weasel. Have you been to our hideout? Have you sat in our chairs or lay in our beds?”

The Chameleon Troupe’s hideout was full of furniture crafted by Kim Hajin. From Cheok Jungyeong’s perspective, Kim Hajin’s furniture was far better than the ones he saw and felt here.

“….”

The servant became speechless. Jin Seyeon spotted fury from his cold expression and quickly blocked Cheok Jungyeong’s mouth.

“Ahem, thank you for guiding us.”

Even so, the servant didn’t stop glaring at Cheok Jungyeong. Of course, Cheok Jungyeong wasn’t the type to shy away from a battle, much less a staring contest. He looked back at the servant and smiled proudly. In his mind, he was only thinking of relieving his boredom by fighting.

—Let it go.

At that moment, a voice rang out from the ceiling, startling both Jin Seyeon and Cheok Jungyeong. The servant immediately retracted his anger and knelt down.

“My apologies, Your Highness.”

Cheok Jungyeong looked up at the ceiling. The voice rang out once more from the same place.

—What you said catches my interest. Every item in my possession is of the finest quality. You say that they are lacking?

Vassago wasn’t as perverted a collector as Baal, but as a devil who specialized in discovering treasures, what Cheok Jungyeong said caught his interest.

“I’m saying that the stuff we have in our hideout is better.”

Cheok Jungyeong spoke with confidence. The servant jumped in shock, while Vassago remained silent.

Of course, Cheok Jungyeong’s confidence was only natural given the origin of the Chameleon Troupe’s furniture. Dwarves were one of the rarest races and the race with the best craftsmanship. Vassago’s journey across many dimensions had allowed him to obtain several dwarven items, but he only possessed ‘weapons’. This was because the dwarves were known to only craft weapons.

“Rather than that, your voice is more feminine than I expected.”

Cheok Jungyeong put aside talking about furniture. He was more curious about Vassago’s gender. Hearing the silvery voice that rang out from the ceiling, he could only guess that Vassago was a woman.

—…Devils don’t have genders. Rather, it depends on the incarnation body. If you are talking about now, I am indeed a woman.

Vassago answered. Although she talked like she was being generous, the discontent in her voice was clear.

—In any case, I would love to see the furniture in your hideout. If you can get out of here alive, that is.

“Kuhahaha. Great, I’ll personally bring your head to the hideout and show you around.”

—…Good. I hope that confidence isn’t just coming from the natural arrogance of humans.

With that, Vassago’s voice cut off. Vassago’s servant sent Cheok Jungyeong one last glare before leaving as well.

“…It looks like our theory is correct.”

As soon as they vanished, Jin Seyeon muttered in a serious tone.

“What theory?”

“That devils are naturally more obsessed with things than humans. If you think about it, Djinns are humans who were influenced by devils to pursue their desires. In that case, devils should be the incarnation of desire.”

“So what?”

Cheok Jungyeong asked with a frown. Jin Seyeon clenched her fists and gazed at Cheok Jungyeong. She sent him a Mental Transmission in case Vassago was listening.

—It means it might be possible to defeat devils without fighting them. All types of tricks can be used.

**

[Baal’s Devil Castle]

Kim Suho entered the Devil’s Castle. The first floor of Baal’s castle only consisted of stairs. Despite the eerie atmosphere, there were no traps or obstacles, so rather than worrying about enemies, Kim Suho eyed Jin Sahyuk who was technically his ally.

After about 20 minutes…

“Do you have a plan for killing Baal?”

Jin Sahyuk suddenly asked. Kim Suho flinched at the unexpected question before letting out a cough and answering seriously.

“…I’ll cut him down. That’s it for now.”

They only had two days left, which wasn’t enough to form a detailed plan. Kim Suho simply believed in himself and his sword, Misteltein.

“What about you? Do you have a plan?”

Aileen asked from next to them. She was floating in the air with the help of her Spirit Speech, mainly because she wanted to stay at their eye level. Jin Sahyuk suddenly stopped. Her pause caught Kim Suho, Aileen, and Shin Jonghak’s attention.

“…You do? Then tell us.”

Seeing Jin Sahyuk remaining mute, Aileen urged her. Jin Sahyuk looked back and forth between Kim Suho and Aileen.

“I’m going to ask Black Lotus.”

Kim Suho, Aileen, and Shin Jonghak all shook with shock. Shin Jonghak made a dissatisfied face, while Kim Suho and Aileen looked curious more than anything.

Aileen asked, “You’re going to ask him? How?”

“When I send the signal, he will fire an arrow at the Devil’s Castle. If it’s him, he should be able to destroy the entire Devil’s Castle.”

“W-What? You think that’s possible? Even my Teleportation didn’t work inside this castle. That’s why we’re running up, remember? And if that was possible, why are we even climbing it in the first place? We can just wait for Black Lotus to destroy the castle and….”

“Quiet. I know he’s capable. He will destroy the castle from the outside, but we have to take care of what’s inside.”

Jin Sahyuk stood steadfast in the face of Aileen’s sarcastic comments.

“….”

On the other hand, Kim Suho kept staring at Jin Sahyuk. He couldn’t understand why Jin Sahyuk trusted Black Lotus so much. In fact, he couldn’t understand how Jin Sahyuk trusted anyone at all.

“Jin Sahyuk, what’s your relationship with Black Lotus?”

He asked a logical question.

“What?”

But to his surprise, Jin Sahyuk acted mad, muttering, “Kim Suho, you bastard, you’ve grown arrogant!”

However, in the next moment, she smirked like it wasn’t a big deal.

“Actually, rather than Black Lotus, I have a relationship with Kim Hajin.”

“…Huh?”

Kim Suho immediately became lost for words. He was so shocked that he couldn’t speak. Kim Suho wasn’t sure whether he heard what he thought he just heard. But before he could carefully go over what was just said, Jin Sahyuk added even more provocative info.

“Kim Hajin has complicated feelings for me, so much so that it’s troubling even for me.”

It wasn’t a complete lie taking the ‘Synchronization’ into account. It was also true that Kim Hajin’s ‘complicated feelings’ were ‘troubling’ her.

“….”

“….”

But Jin Sahyuk’s words were more effective than she imagined. This time, even Shin Jonghak and Aileen’s heads turned blank.

“That’s all I’m saying. Is that so surprising~?”

Jin Sahyuk chuckled to herself and began climbing the stairs once more. This time, her steps were more poised and elegant.

...

Chapter 341. Final Banquet (1)

[Baal’s Castle]

Kim Suho continued to climb a seemingly endless spiral staircase. As he grew closer to the sky, he continuously mulled over what Jin Sahyuk said two hours ago.

‘Kim Hajin has complicated feelings for me, so much so that it’s troubling even for me.’

‘If you knew how Kim Hajin feels, you would all be shocked speechless….’

Unable to understand what she meant, Kim Suho called Shin Jonghak.

“Shin Jonghak, do you know anything about it?”

“About what?”

“About what Jin Sahyuk said.”

Shin Jonghak shook his head.

“No clue. I only followed her here…. But I’ve seen that woman stare at Kim Hajin with a warm look.”

“What? Really?”

“Don’t worry about it, Suho. I’m sure she’s lying. Why would Fenrir like that crazy woman anyways?”

Aileen cut in.

To be honest, Kim Suho thought the same way. But he knew Jin Sahyuk wasn’t the type to make such jokes. She considered herself as royalty, and joking was something that didn’t suit their dignity.

“Rather than that, I’m curious when we’ll reach the end of this staircase.”

Aileen crossed her arms unhappily. Just as she said, the group had been climbing the staircase for almost three hours, but they had yet to catch a glimpse of anything resembling a pathway.

“…Oi! Black haired girl!”

Aileen called Jin Sahyuk, who was climbing ahead of them. Jin Sahyuk stopped and looked back at Aileen.

“Are you sure we’re going the right way?”

“…Who knows?”

Jin Sahyuk shrugged irresponsibly.

“What?”

Aileen scowled, to which Jin Sahyuk smirked.

“What other choice do we have? It’s not like we can shout for Baal to come out. Let’s just keep going, and in the meanwhile, I’ll send a Mental Transmission to Black Lotus.”

“…Mental Transmission? To Black Lotus?”

“Yep.”

Jin Sahyuk nodded and sent a Mental Transmission to Kim Hajin. Her way of sending Mental Transmissions was rather unique, as she used ‘Reality Manipulation’ to do so.

—I’m in Baal’s castle with Kim Suho. You stay outside. Don’t enter the castle. If you want to save the world, then do as I say.

Kim Hajin replied about three minutes afterward.

—…Why?

It was a short, blunt question. Jin Sahyuk laughed inwardly at this cute reaction. Behind her, Aileen’s loud voice rang out.

“Cmon-! How long do we have to keep—”

“Oh, there it is.”

Jin Sahyuk interrupted Aileen and pointed to a spot on the spiral staircase. Shin Jonghak, Kim Suho, and Aileen all turned their gazes to the spot Jin Sahyuk was pointing to.

“…Huh? You’re right. It really is there. But there wasn’t anything just a moment ago.”

Aileen’s eyes widened. Just like she said, a huge gate had suddenly appeared at a previously empty spot.

“…I’ll go in first.”

Shin Jonghak stepped forward as soon as he saw the gate. He hopped up the staircase, three steps at a time until he reached the gate. Seeing how Shin Jonghak was practically running, Jin Sahyuk smiled.

Soon, all four members of the group reached the gate. Standing in front of the ogre-sized gate, Shin Jonghak stared at Jin Sahyuk, and Jin Sahyuk nodded her head. Shin Jonghak then grabbed the knob on the right side while Kim Suho grabbed the knob on the left. Together, they pushed it forward.

Kiik—

The giant gate opened with a course sound. Immediately, a brilliant light shone from the other side, and classical music began to play. The four of them blinked their eyes at the dazzling light, and in the next instant, their thought processes stopped.

A scene they hadn’t expected to see was spread out before them.

“…Where is this?”

Aileen muttered quietly and rolled her eyes to study the area. To describe it simply, they were at the scene of a ‘banquet’. A fancy chandelier cast light in all directions, and a sumptuous feast was prepared inside. They could also see well-dressed men and women dancing to the tune of classical music.

No matter how they looked at it, they were in a banquet hall.

“…There he is.”

While the others stood confused, Jin Sahyuk spotted a certain person from the crowd and smiled.

Kim Suho and Shin Jonghak also followed Jin Sahyuk’s gaze, while Aileen’s attention was caught by a waiter holding a plate of fancy chocolates.

“That’s Yi Yeonjun, the previous boss of the Chameleon Troupe.”

The moment Jin Sahyuk mentioned this…

“What?”

Aileen’s eyes shot open, and her attention turned to Yi Yeonjun.

“That bastard… he’s really alive?”

Aileen also had an ill-fated relationship with Yi Yeonjun. Currently, he was sitting on a chair at a balcony on the upper floor of the banquet hall, looking down at the crowd below.

**

[Demon Realm Gate – Baal’s Barrier]

I stood in front of Baal’s castle. Jain and Shimurin were standing next to me. Although I used up most of my bullets, I eliminated all the demonic beasts running amok inside the barrier. Soon, Rachel, Yun Seung-Ah, and the other Heroes should arrive here as well.

“Let’s go in.”

Just as I was about to enter Baal’s castle…

—I’m in Baal’s castle with Kim Suho. You stay outside. Don’t enter the castle. If you want to save the world, then do as I say.

Jin Sahyuk’s Mental Transmission flowed into my ears. I paused immediately.

“…Hm? What’s up~?”

Jain tilted her head curiously.

“Uh… hold on, I just got a strange message.”

I messaged back.

—Why?

But she didn’t return an answer. After waiting for a few minutes, I contemplated ignoring her warning and going inside. I gave it more thought and concluded that the changed Jin Sahyuk wouldn’t lie to me.

“Let’s wait a bit more.”

I spread Aether out like a mat and took a seat on the ground. Jain and Shimurin also sat down next to me. Jain yawned, and Shimurin took out a scroll as soon as she sat down.

“Is that the dimension scroll?”

I looked at her scroll with keen interest. Shimurin nodded her head with a grin.

“This scroll will summon a portal connecting two dimensions together. It’s still incomplete and unsafe. The portal isn’t big enough either. There’s still a lot I have to fix… Why? Do you want to give it a go?”

“…”

I stared at the scroll fixedly. Then, a brilliant idea flashed across my mind.

“Let me test something.”

I took out two A4-sized pieces of paper. Shimurin tilted her head and asked.

“What’s that?”

“They’re just pieces of paper for now….”

I activated Setting Intervention, adding [Linkage], [Recording], and [Durability] to their setting. I also changed the name of the papers to ‘Messenger’.

[You used 103SP to change the setting of a set of objects.]

[Luck activates.]

[Item, ‘Messenger’, increases in rank.]

[Item, ‘Messenger’, has been strengthened in functionality.]

“Now it’s a messenger.”

“A what?”

Shimurin’s eyebrows went up, and Jain turned her gaze to us with interest.

“A messenger. If you write something on one paper, the same thing will be written on the other.”

I demonstrated the Messenger’s function. Shimurin nodded her head.

“So that’s what it is. You want to send this to your world?”

“Exactly.”

“…Hm.”

Shimurin rubbed her chin and fell in thought. After about 30 seconds, she continued.

“It’s likely that the paper will burn while crossing over to your world.”

“It’s fine. This paper has good durability.”

At the very least, it should withstand being burnt. I added [Durability] to its setting, not to mention the added bonus from luck.

“You’re that confident? This scroll might look tiny, but it’s expensive enough to be a national treasure you know?”

“Just do it. Who cares about money when the world is at risk?”

“…Well, that’s true.”

Shimurin let out a dry cough and tore the scroll in half. The grand magician’s magic power flowed into the scroll, and a small, fist-sized portal appeared in the air.

“Alright, Kim Hajin, it’s your turn now.”

“Got it.”

I sent Stigma’s magic power into the portal and set the coordinate to Evandel’s cabin.

“Done. I’m going to give it a go then.”

I wrote a message on the paper, folded it into a paper airplane, and sent it flying inside the portal. With my Master Sharpshooter Gift, the paper airplane practically flew like a real one.

“Wow~ how cool~ so we just have to wait now~?”

Jain muttered, but Shimurin and I only stared at the remaining paper.

…It was then.

—We just found Yi Yeonjun in what seems to be the first stage, a ‘banquet hall’. You wait outside and destroy Baal’s castle with an arrow when I give the signal. I know you can do it.

Jin Sahyuk returned a belated reply.

“What is she talking about?”

I spat out a complaint out loud. When Shimurin and Jain gave me a curious look, I returned a reply.

—Are you crazy? How am I supposed to destroy Baal’s castle?

—You can do it.

—No way.

It was impossible, especially when even Baal’s barrier could only be partially destroyed with the help of the ‘Mystic Key’.

…Wait. Mystic Key?

—You should be able to do it. So when I give the signal, shoot immediately and destroy the castle.

Ignoring my worries, Jin Sahyuk gave a firm command.

**

[Earth – ♡Evandel and Hayang’s Cabin♡]

On the other hand, Ah Hae-In and Evandel returned to Evandel’s ‘domain’.

“TV, TV~”

Evandel hummed happily as she turned on the TV inside the cabin.

—Valac’s army retreated from Europe.

A timely report of the day’s news came out.

—Duchess Ah Hae-In and her disciple led humanity to their first victory.

Ah Hae-In and Evandel had successfully stopped Valac’s army from advancing into Europe. Evandel and her unicorn commanded 5000 spirit beasts as though they shared one mind, while Ah Hae-In fully utilized the power of the Cardinal Guardians to force Valac to retreat.

—The streets of Europe are filled with people cheering the two magicians’ achievements….

“Oooh, look Hayang, we did good~”

Evandel watched the news with sparkling eyes. Seeing her achievements broadcasted across the world, she was both excited and proud.

—We captured footage of a black wolf defeating Valac’s adjutant. Let’s take a look.

“…Fenrir, Fenrir, come over here! They’re praising you on TV!”

Evandel hugged Fenrir excitedly. Fenrir maintained his indifferent act while stealthily gazing at himself appearing on TV.

Kwaaaaaa—!

A house-sized wolf was storming forward and crushing several demons.

“So cool!”

—Krrr.

Fenrir shrugged hearing Evandel’s cheer.

“…Haha.”

Ah Hae-In chuckled and left Evandel to enjoy her time with her spirit beasts. Then, she turned on her smartwatch, which she kept off during the war.

She was immediately stormed with messages from the Association.

[Demon Realm Gate – Kim Suho, Aileen, Yun Seung-Ah, Shin Jonghak, Rachel, Yoo Yeonha, and others]

[Valac – Ah Hae-In]

[Leraje – Game to be released next Monday]

[Astaroth – Leore, Kim Hwaoong, Yi Heejoon, and 13 other 8-star magicians]

[Vassago’s Colosseum – Jin Seyeon, Vast Expanse, and others]

She received a report containing the activities of various Heroes. Ah Hae-In found the name ‘Rachel’ on the list and looked back at Evandel.

Evandel was clapping her hands like a seal and watching the news with widened eyes.

“…Cute.”

A faint smile emerged on Ah Hae-In’s face. She became worried when both Kim Hajin and Rachel left, but it seemed that her worry was unnecessary.

Tiriring—!

As she was watching Evandel play with her friends, she received another message.

[Duchess Ah Hae-In, when will you introduce your disciple to the world? Everyone is curious. Earth needs an icon of hope.]

It was from the Association yet again. In truth, the Hero Association already knew who Ah Hae-In’s disciple was, that it was a young girl of the name ‘Evandel’.

That was why they kept pestering her. A ten-year-old genius magician who could wield an army of spirit beasts. Evandel was truly the perfect candidate for an ‘icon of hope’.

“….”

Ah Hae-In ignored the message and turned her smartwatch off. At that moment, a paper airplane flew inside the cabin from the window.

“What’s this…?”

Ah Hae-In frowned and grabbed the airplane. When she touched it, her face immediately stiffened. She could feel a trace of magic power from the paper material.

She quickly opened the airplane and checked the contents.

[Evandel, are you doing well? It’s me, Hajin. If you have something you want to say to me, all you have to do is write something on this piece of paper. I can reply to you on the same paper. I want to see you.]

“…!”

It was, without doubt, a message from Kim Hajin.

...

Chapter 342. Final Banquet (2)

[Leores – Underground Bunker]

Rachel, Yun Seung-Ah, Chae Nayun, and other members from Earth returned to the underground bunker. When they arrived, they were met with cheers from the people staying in it. Airun and the Republic’s knights smiled wryly as they shook hands with evacuees. The group then headed to the office of the person in charge of the bunker – Yoo Yeonha.

Yoo Yeonha greeted them and said as she looked back and forth between the knights and the members of the Secret Service.

“There’s too many of you to be stuffed in this small place.”

Six Secret Service members and twenty-six knights had entered the room. There were also hundreds of knights waiting outside.

“….”

Airun sent her subordinates a shooing look. The Knights took the hint and left the room, leaving behind Rachel, Chae Nayun, Airun, Kim Youngjin, Yi Yeonghan, and Kim Horak.

“…Huu.”

Yoo Yeonha wasn’t happy that an outsider like Airun was still in the room, but she greeted her with a smile knowing she was an important character in this world.

“Well done, everyone. But we don’t have time to rest. Next, we—”

“Where’s Kim Suho?”

Chae Nayun interrupted Yoo Yeonha to ask.

“Did he go to the bathroom?”

She blinked her eyes with an innocent look. Yoo Yeonha coughed before replying immediately.

“He went to Baal’s castle with Lady Aileen.”

“What? Already?”

“Yeah, Fenrir was going to end the war with demonic beasts anyways.”

Yoo Yeonha made a faint smile. It was the objective truth that Kim Hajin performed the best in war. Although Kim Suho could cut down dozens of enemies with one swing of his sword, Kim Hajin could kill hundreds just by the click of a button.

“Sorry, but where’s our Prince!?”

Airun shouted urgently as if she was tired of hearing about Fenrir, Baal, and whatnot. Yoo Yeonha stared at Airun before taking out seventeen small bottles from her desk drawer.

“There’s a large castle in the middle of the barrier. We call it Baal’s castle. The Prince is probably there. Here, take this.”

“…Miracle herbs?”

Rachel muttered silently when she saw the plants inside the bottles. She could feel the energy of elementals from the plants.

“That’s right. We looked all over the country and could only find seventeen of them. Taking it will recover your energy within 2~3 hours.”

In other words, she wanted them to get going as soon as possible. It wasn’t the most encouraging words to hear for people who just returned from hours upon hours of battle, but they knew the situation they were in. The seven of them took the bottles and consumed the herbs. Then, they put the remaining ten bottles in their pockets.

“Give some to Kim Suho and Aileen when you meet them. They left before I had the chance to give them out. The rest, you can use in times of emergency.”

As she said that, Yoo Yeonha took out a suitcase and put it on the desk. Then, she took out several more. Koong- koong- koong- koong- She took out a total of seven suitcases, and the seven members stared at Yoo Yeonha curiously.

“These are treasures used for exorcism. I kind of stole them from their original owners, but that’s not important now. Use them when you reach the castle.”

The seven members hesitated. Using stolen goods was one thing, but they were just too hungry.

“Hurry. There are other people I have to talk to. This bunker has over 200 people. I’m busy trying to take care of everything. Your hunger should disappear too when you consume the miracle herb.”

Yoo Yeonha urged the Heroes, practically forcing them out with suitcases in hand.

**

[Baal’s Castle – Banquet Hall]

“Shoot.”

Tk- The toes of two people clashed. Aileen furrowed her brows, but Kim Suho took the next step with tenacity.

“Damn it. Argh.”

But not long afterward, their feet tangled once more. High-class music flowed in the air, but the two people’s minds were all over the place. Even so, they continued to dance.

Aileen grit her teeth and asked, “Why do I have to do this?”

“..Just wait until they’re done talking.”

Kim Suho glanced at the second floor of the banquet hall. There, Yi Yeonjun was staring at Jin Sahyuk and Shin Jonghak.

“Agh, when is it ending….”

For the record, there was a reason Aileen and Kim Suho were dancing. Baal’s castle had ‘rules’ that had to be followed. Other than Jin Sahyuk who could manipulate reality and Shin Jonghak who was unaffected for some reason, everyone who didn’t follow the rules was kicked out.

“Sh, be quiet, so we can eavesdrop.”

Kim Suho danced half-heartedly and focused his attention on the second floor. Jin Sahyuk and Yi Yeonjun met face to face just a moment ago.

Jin Sahyuk spoke, “We meet again.”

Jin Sahyuk’s eyes narrowed like those of a fox.

“….”

However, Yi Yeonjun remained silent and simply looked back and forth between Jin Sahyuk and Shin Jonghak. From the look in his eyes, he seemed confused.

Soon, he spoke up.

“Looks like Baal’s rules don’t apply to you.”

“…I have my Authority, but I don’t know why it doesn’t work on him.”

Jin Sahyuk pointed at Shin Jonghak, who was completely unaffected by Baal’s rules.

“Hm, you’re an interesting one.” Yi Yeonjun said to Shin Jonghak.

Immediately, Shin Jonghak swung his Conqueror Spear. The spear cut through the air and stopped right in front of Yi Yeonjun’s neck.

Shin Jonghak asked, “Answer. Where’s Baal?”

“Baal is raging.”

A rather random reply came back. Shin Jonghak frowned, and Jin Sahyuk immediately asked back.

“We asked where Baal is, not what he’s doing.”

“He’s raging.”

“Is your head okay…?”

Jin Sahyuk paused for a moment and stared at Yi Yeonjun fixedly.

“….”

Something seemed off about Yi Yeonjun. His eyes were murky, and his body didn’t move. Almost like someone who lost something important, he sat dazed in his chair.

“…Baal’s raging?”

Jin Sahyuk asked somewhat seriously. She wanted to grasp the situation accurately. Yi Yeonjun didn’t wait to answer Jin Sahyuk.

“That’s right. Baal saw the truth from Bell’s memories.”

“Truth? What truth?”

Yi Yeonjun tilted his head and looked at Jin Sahyuk. However, Jin Sahyuk couldn’t look at him straight. She preferred his old, greed-filled eyes rather than the current hollow eyes.

“Did you know?” Yi Yeonjun asked. Jin Sahyuk looked at Shin Jonghak before answering, and when Shin Jonghak shook his head, she looked back at Yi Yeonjun.

“Know what?”

“That this world we live in is nothing but a novel.”

“…?”

Jin Sahyuk furrowed her brows, but that was the only change in her expression. She couldn’t make sense of what Yi Yeonjun said, so she couldn’t react in a big way.

“So you didn’t know either.”

Yi Yeonjun was serious. With a twisted smile, he began to murmur incomprehensible things.

“But Bell knew. He knew that this world is a novel written by a single man…. That’s right, a novel. A damn novel and a worthless one at that. The world I wanted to obtain so much wasn’t worth a penny to ‘that man’. Even the almighty devil is nothing but a creation of a magicless ‘complete world’….”

Yi Yeonjun continued to mumble as if he had lost his mind. Jin Sahyuk tried to pick up on any clues she could find, but in the end, she gave up and sighed.

“Fool, it looks like Baal ate your brain. This is what you get for being too greedy and trying to obtain what’s out of your league.”

“Out of my league… that’s right. A mere character like myself dared to take over a world….”

“Shut your mouth.”

Jin Sahyuk gathered magic power in her hands. She tried to kill Yi Yeonjun.

It was then. Bell’s face suddenly popped up in her mind. Before he died, he said he knew ‘two’ truths, but he died while keeping one of them to himself.

That truth most certainly would have flowed into Baal’s head. As a curious devil, there was no doubt Baal would absorb the memories of his host.

“…Oi.”

Jin Sahyuk retracted her magic power and looked into Yi Yeonjun’s eyes.

“Tell me slowly and in detail. What did you hear from Baal? No matter what he found out, he couldn’t possibly fear anything.”

“Baal is raging.”

“No, there is no human who is afraid of an ant. Rage is just another form of fear.”

Some people might detest ants, but no one was angry at them. Similarly, there was no reason for Baal to be angry at humans.

Hearing this, Yi Yeonjun closed his eyes and opened them back up. Jin Sahyuk’s stiffened face was right in front of him.

“Fine, if you want to hear it so much, I’ll tell you….”

With a straight face, Yi Yeonjun began to describe the memories he ‘received’ from Baal.

**

[Outside Baal’s Castle]

—Hajin? It’s really you, Hajin?

Evandel replied. I immediately wrote back.

—Of course, it’s me. Have you been doing well? Duchess Ah Hae-In is treating you well, right?

—Un! This is really cool. How did you get this to work?

Evandel’s handwriting was neat and clean. Seeing how much she grew up, I held back my tears.

—I made it, but a magician in this world helped me send it over.

At that moment, the magician in question spoke.

“How interesting. I didn’t think it would work so well.”

Her face didn’t show any sign of happiness or pride.

“Aren’t you happy?”

“It’s not like I did much. I only brought a scroll without a destination. You’re the one who completed it in an absurd fashion. I didn’t see you make any calculations. I didn’t even see what you did to modify the scroll.”

“…Mm.”

I scratched the back of my neck. I didn’t have much to say to that. That was just how Stigma was. The co-author said it was a special authority of the Creator… though I could barely call myself the Creator at this point.

“Anyways, you helped prove something I wasn’t sure of. That dimensional travel is possible. I can cross dimensions and go to another world….”

While Shimurin was murmuring, I felt a group of people approaching us. I turned my head in that direction.

“Huh?”

Rachel, Yun Seung-Ah, Chae Nayun, Yi Yeonghan… People I was familiar with were walking over with exorcist weapons. I quickly put on Black Lotus’s hood and mask and then took out the Black Lotus Bow.

“…Be careful Jain. Those guys are coming.”

“Hm, who should I turn into…?”

Jain pondered for a moment before turning into Cheok Jungyeong. She flexed her hulk-like muscles and looked at me.

“How is it~?”

Jain grinned sweetly with Cheok Jungyeong’s face. I held myself back from puking.

“Don’t talk and smile like that when you’re in that form…”

“Ah, sure~ sure~”

Chae Nayun and the others arrived a bit afterward. They stopped running when they saw us.

“…What are you guys doing here?”

Yun Seung-Ah was the first to speak. Behind her, Rachel and Chae Nayun looked at us suspiciously. Jain then gave the same arrogant smile Cheok Jungyeong often made.

“Nothing much. Are you trying to enter this castle too?”

“Oi, fat boar, who’s that next to you?”

Chae Nayun asked as she glared at me. Jain shrugged as if the answer was obvious.

“It’s Blackie. Can’t you see?”

I grabbed my bow to emphasize my identity. But suddenly, everyone else picked up their weapons and stood on guard.

“W-Why are you raising your bow? Put it down!”

“Do you want to fight?”

Yun Seung-Ah's hostile voice rang out, and Rachel’s elementals flickered in the air.

I felt a strong urge to reveal my true identity, but I forced it down. Until everything ends, no, even after everything ends, I had to be Black Lotus.

I spoke, “You can go in. Your friends are inside. We have no desire to hinder you.”

My mask changed my voice. I made another [Messenger] with Setting Intervention and threw it to Yun Seung-Ah. The paper flew faster than a bullet, but Yun Seung-Ah easily caught it with her fingers.

“What’s this?”

“It will let you contact me. Take it with you. I’ll protect you and Kim Suho from here.”

“…Protect?”

Yun Seung-Ah frowned. I nodded my head.

“How do you expect us to believe you?”

“You don’t have to if you don’t want to. You will know once you go in.”

“….”

Yun Seung-Ah stared at the paper suspiciously. Meanwhile, I glanced at Shimurin.

Shimurin smirked and immediately cast a spell. As expected of a grand magician, a flash of light erupted, and we were teleported far away.

“Perfect timing.”

“Perfect timing? I delayed the spell as long as possible because the situation looked fun.”

“You did? Well, it’s fine since we passed them the Messenger.”

As long as I could contact them, I should be able to protect them.

With a grin, I took out the [Mystic Key] and [Athena’s Arrow]. Now, it was time to do my job.

“Let’s see….”

A way to destroy Baal’s castle. I didn’t know whether Jin Sahyuk knew about it, but I did have one way of accomplishing this.

[Would you like to fuse ‘Mystic Key’ with ‘Athena’s Arrow’?]

[Warning. The chance of success is astronomically low.]

By using my Lv.10 Synthesis Skill and Stigma’s magic power, I could fuse the Mystic Key and Athena’s Arrow. The resulting arrow should be capable of dismantling anything in the world.

[Synthesis failed.]

[‘Mystic Key’ and ‘Athena’s Arrow’ have been destroyed.]

“…Huh?”

Tk—

With a powerful snapping sound, Athena’s Arrow broke in half, and the Mystic Key turned into dust.

“….”

I blinked my eyes repeatedly and looked at the remnants of the items. Like a carp stuck in a frozen pond, I stared blankly at the remains.

“…The hell?”

A panicked mutter escaped my mouth.

“Yo, what happened to my items!?”

The completely unexpected result caught me off guard. A mental breakdown was coming over me. Feeling like I was dreaming, I gathered the remnants of the broken items in a last-ditch effort to make things right.

Then, I used Synthesis again.

[Synthesis failed]

…Not even dust remained.

My legs gave out, and I fell to the ground.

...

Chapter 343. Final Banquet (3)

[Synthesis failed]

‘Don’t calm down. Wait, that’s not right. Calm down.’

I took a deep breath. The Mystic Key and Athena’s Arrow might have been destroyed, but there had to be a better solution.

—…Oi, you okay?

A voice rang in my head. I turned my head in a daze. Shimurin and Jain were staring at me.

—Hajin, what’s wrong~?

I couldn’t hear them well, almost like I was underwater. Suddenly, I felt sleepy. Perhaps everything would return to normal if I went to sleep and woke up.

Wait, no, that was just running away from reality.

“…What’s wrong with him? He’s seems out of it all of a sudden.”

Shimurin’s voice woke me up. I suddenly remembered something. Right, I still had something I could do, even if it was going overboard.

“Time Reversal.”

“Huh?”

Even though it would hurt a lot, I could just go back in time.

“Huu, huu.”

I took deep breaths. Once, twice, thrice….

“What are you doing?”

Shimurin and Jain stared at me strangely. I took one final breath and turned to face them. Using Time Reversal just to recover destroyed items…

A sudden philosophical thought popped up in my head. Would Jain in the present be the same person as Jain three minutes in the past?

I shook my head and threw the thought away.

“See you in a bit.”

I closed my eyes and activated Time Reversal. The wind blew backwards and a warping sensation surrounded my body. When I opened my eyes, [Athena’s Moonlight Arrow] and the [Mystic Key] were both in my hands.

“…Haa.”

I breathed out a sigh of relief. My legs gave out, and I slumped down on the ground again. Jain and Shimurin gave me strange looks, but that didn’t matter.

Looking at the key and the arrow in my hands, I fell in thought. Should I try fusing them again? Or should I be content that I restored them?

It was then that something strange occurred.

A bright orb of light appeared in the air above the items. The sun-like orb began to bloom like a budding flower. I stared at it with widened eyes.

As the orb gave off a dazzling, golden light, a system window popped up.

[The ‘accumulation of luck’ stacked eight times activates – Miraculous Retry]

[For the next 30 minutes, your invariable stat, ‘luck’, rises to 9.99]

**

[Colosseum]

“…What happened to the thing I talked about?”

On the other hand, in the Colosseum’s waiting room, Jin Seyeon asked Cheok Jungyeong who was lounging around on the couch.

“Do I really have to bring it?”

Jin Seyeon had asked Cheok Jungyeong to bring the furniture from the Chameleon Troupe’s hideout, knowing how much Vassago was interested in them.

“Yes, I told you, they will come in handy during our negotiation.”

“What, after we beat him up, we’ll console him by giving him some furniture and tell him to go home?”

“…Regardless of what the plan is, having more options isn’t bad.”

Vassago’s Colosseum had a simple format. The challengers would put their lives on the line to fight, just like gladiators. There were ten levels to the Colosseum, and challengers had to clear all levels before they could challenge Vassago. His logic was that he would only accept challenges from the strong.

“But it’s not like we can leave this place, right?”

Jin Seyeon furrowed her brows at Cheok Jungyeong’s question.

“Don’t you guys have Khalifa? Tell him to come here.”

Challengers couldn’t leave the Colosseum once they entered, but Jin Seyeon and Cheok Jungyeong earned the right to invite a guest after crushing their way through to level 8.

Cheok Jungyeong got up from the couch and asked.

“You know Khalifa?”

“…Pardon? Ah, well, the Chameleon Troupe is famous, after all.”

Cheok Jungyeong still gave her a suspicious glance. Jin Seyeon let out a few dry coughs and explained.

“I did some background investigation.”

“Why?”

“….”

Jin Seyeon raised her brows unhappily, and Cheok Jungyeong did the same.

“You think I can trust someone who investigated us so easily?”

“…Tsk.”

Jin Seyeon scratched the back of her neck. She trudged to the bed and lied down. Cheok Jungyeong smirked and lied back down on the couch. Just like that, silence filled the room.

The level 8 challenger’s waiting room was large and quiet. After a moment, a soft voice cut through the air.

“You guys killed my father.”

It was Jin Seyeon’s voice.

Cheok Jungyeong murmured while still lying on the couch.

“…It’s pretty common.”

“Killing people?”

“In this world, it’s common to kill and be killed. You should know it too. Think of all the Djinns you killed. Aren’t they human too?”

“….”

Jin Seyeon twisted her body to the side. Her bow was leaning on the head of the bed. It was the same bow that had taken the lives of hundreds of Djinns.

Jin Seyeon spoke calmly.

“My father was my only family.”

“That’s common too. There are also people who are born orphans.”

“I sometimes wish I was born an orphan too.”

“…Pft.”

Cheok Jungyeong suddenly chuckled. Jin Seyeon furrowed her brows and glared at Cheok Jungyeong.

“What’s funny?”

“Nothing, I just remembered something. There was someone who used to make fun of me by calling me ‘Orphan Producer.’”

“What?”

“Puhahaha. I think it’s funny. You don’t have to laugh if you don’t think so.”

Cheok Jungyeong got up from the couch, his large body towering over Jin Seyeon.

Looking at her, Cheok Jungyeong smiled.

“If you want to avenge your father, I’ll welcome you at any time. I don’t know if I’m the one who killed him, but the Chameleon Troupe is one being. But just know that you’ll have to put your life on the line as well.”

Cheok Jungyeong spoke calmly. He had no fear of death, having spent most of his life with one foot in the River Styx. Jin Seyeon’s face quickly turned vicious.

“…No thanks. You weren’t part of the Chameleon Troupe when that incident happened.”

“Oh yeah?”

“Yes, you were busy running around the steppes of Manchu killing people.”

“Kuhum, you even know about that? …Oi, don’t look at me like I’m some sort of a monster. I’m not the man I used to be.”

“Oh please, there are even rumors that you eat human flesh.”

Jin Seyeon pulled the bedsheet over her head. Cheok Jungyeong replied, almost like he was giving an excuse.

“Human flesh? I don’t eat things that aren’t tasty. Plus, it’s true that I changed. That guy changed me before I even noticed.”

“…That guy? You mean Black Lotus?”

“Yep.”

“What do you mean by that?”

When she heard Black Lotus’s name, Jin Seyeon peeked her head out of the bedsheet. She was attracted to Black Lotus for reasons she didn’t understand.

Was it admiration, fear, respect, or rivalry? She didn’t know how to describe her feelings for him. But her intuition as the Divine Archer told her that there was something about Black Lotus that resembled herself.

“Feel free to tell me more.”

Jin Seyeon spoke gently. Cheok Jungyeong raised his head. Jin Seyeon was looking at him in anticipation. However, Cheok Jungyeong only gave off a cold smirk before lying back down.

“Nah.”

“…Just a bit.”

“No. I’ll talk to Khalifa about that furniture though, not that I think it will help.”

“….”

Jin Seyeon scratched her cheek. She was still happy about the information she pried out, so she gave it a rest for the day and closed her eyes.

“Good night.”

**

[Baal’s Castle – Banquet Hall]

An orchestral classical piece was still flowing in the air as Jin Sahyuk stared at Yi Yeonjun. Yi Yeonjun continued as he looked deeper into Jin Sahyuk’s eyes.

“Do you get what kind of an existence you are now? You’re nothing but a puppet.”

“….”

Jin Sahyuk didn’t say anything. She simply thought Yi Yeonjun had gone crazy. But she also didn’t think he was completely insane.

At that moment, Shin Jonghak spoke up.

“That fool must be misunderstanding something, right?”

“What?”

When Jin Sahyuk furrowed her brows, Shin Jonghak smirked and continued.

“I don’t know if it’s his delusion or a side-effect of his Gift, but he must believe that this world is a novel. He’s living while believing that it is.”

Shin Jonghak was saying that Kim Hajin was a megalomaniac who deluded himself into thinking that this world was a novel he wrote.

However, Jin Sahyuk knew Baal was more than capable of discerning reality from fantasy. As far as she was concerned, it was more probable that Yi Yeonjun had gone crazy rather than doubting Baal.

“…Shush.”

Regardless, what she had to do was simple.

“Where’s Baal?”

To find Baal. She would know the truth once she talked to him.

Yi Yeonjun readily replied.

“Baal’s upstairs.”

“So what do we need to do to go up?”

“You need more people.”

As he said that, Yi Yeonjun pointed at the banquet hall’s door. Jin Sahyuk and Shin Jonghak both turned their gazes downwards.

Kiik— And at that moment, the door creaked open. Jin Sahyuk frowned, and Shin Jonghak’s face wriggled with joy.

—Huh? Where’s this?

On the first floor of the banquet hall, Chae Nayun was looking around with a greatsword in her hand.

—I’m not sure… some sort of party?

Yun Seung-Ah’s gaze scanned the hall.

—I see Suho-ssi over there.

Rachel pointed at a couple dancing in the middle of the hall. Kim Suho and Aileen also spotted them. Kim Suho couldn’t hear Yi Yeonjun because he was focused on dancing. Once the others arrived, Kim Suho greeted them with a smile.

—Hey, Suho… it’s been a while.

Yun Seung-Ah stared at Kim Suho from a little distance away. She was happy to see him but didn’t show it on her face.

—Ah, yes, it really has been a while.

Kim Suho stood straight and bowed slightly. Yun Seung-Ah smiled bitterly and told Kim Suho and Aileen about who they met.

—We met Black Lotus.

—Really?

—Yeah. He said he’s helping you. Is that true?

—Yes, it is.

Jin Sahyuk turned back to Yi Yeonjun.

Yi Yeonjun opened his mouth, like he was waiting for this moment.

“Now that there are eleven of you here, you should be able to go up. Go ahead. Find Baal and hear the truth. Then, you can fall into despair.”

Shin Jonghak hopped down to the first floor to see Chae Nayun, leaving only Jin Sahyuk glaring at Yi Yeonjun.

But not long afterwards, Jin Sahyuk made her usual proud smile.

“Yi Yeonjun… it looks like you’re mistaken.”

Jin Sahyuk gathered magic power in her hands. Her black magic power coalesced like a storm and emanated its overwhelming presence. Her Authority blazed up as it devoured reality.

“I don’t care what the truth is. Even if what you’re saying is true, it doesn’t matter to me that this world is a novel.”

Guoooo… She reached out with her burning right hand and grabbed Yi Yeonjun’s head. Looking at Yi Yeonjun’s empty eyes, she shouted loudly.

“I am not a puppet, but a king! And the one who decides that isn’t you or this world! It’s me! I am the one who decides who I am! As long as I’m alive, I am a king, and that’s all I need to know to live in this world!”

She could feel several presences from her spot on the balcony. Chae Nayun and Shin Jonghak, Kim Suho and Yun Seung-Ah, Aileen and Kim Youngjin… there were even more climbing up the staircase.

She could even feel Kim Hajin, watching over her from outside.

Jin Sahyuk made a faint smile.

“I am different from you entirely!”

KOOONG—!

Suddenly, an explosion erupted in the middle of the banquet hall. Yi Yeonjun scattered into dust, and Jin Sahyuk looked down from the balcony with widened eyes.

—W-What happened!? Who are these people?

The men and women, who had been dancing in the hall, had all turned into Death Knights.

“What….”

Jin Sahyuk froze. She looked down at the first floor in a daze.

—Take out your weapons, everyone! Aileen Unni!

—Yeah, I know. I’ll take care of it.

Hundreds of Death Knights were surrounding the group. But what shocked Jin Sahyuk wasn’t the sheer number of Death Knights or the sudden disappearance of Yi Yeonjun.

The Death Knights weren’t wearing helmets, so Jin Sahyuk recognized them. Even if they were wearing them, she wouldn’t have missed the insignia on their armor and shield.

A crown of ice and a wolf.

That was the symbol of Jin Sahyuk’s kingdom, Plerion.

They were the knights of Plerion, who had protected her until the moment she died.

...

Chapter 344. Meeting (1)

[Baal’s Castle – Banquet Hall]

The Death Knights revived by the devil had no emotions in their eyes. However, their hands grasped their swords tightly. Having lost their consciousness and will, the bodies left with only their instincts stared at Jin Sahyuk.

They were the knights of Plerion, the servants of Jin Sahyuk who dreamed of a brighter future. Jin Sahyuk clenched her teeth. She was more confused than angry.

“—!”

At that moment, Chae Nayun swung her sword with a spirited shout. Her greatsword of magic power shattered the banquet hall’s ceiling.

“Sunshine, Earth, Watery…”

Rachel called her elementals. The elementals of wind, ground, and water floated up and revealed themselves. Earth focused on defense, creating barriers to protect its allies; Watery transformed into a cold mist and froze some of the Death Knights.

Whish—

Gusts of white sword wind blew in the battlefield, almost like falling cherry blossoms. This was the work of Yun Seung-Ah’s Flower Sword. With elegant movements, Yun Seung-Ah displayed her swordsmanship.

Slowed by Rachel’s elementals, the Death Knights couldn’t follow Yun Seung-Ah’s attacks. One by one, the Knights’ heads fell to the floor.

—!

Of course, that wasn’t enough to stop the knights who were already dead. In fact, the ones that had their heads chopped off charged at Yun Seung-Ah more viciously. Although her Flower Sword severed their arms and legs, one Death Knight eventually reached Yun Seung-Ah.

Just as its sword was about to stab her, a fierce wind blew around her.

“…A storm will devour you!”

A storm of Spirit Speech pushed the Death Knights up to the sky. Immediately afterward, a flash of golden light from the Sword Saint cut through them.

Kwaaaa—!

A shower of golden light poured down from the sky. Kim Suho’s sword light eliminated dozens of Death Knights instantly. He looked back at Yun Seung-Ah and muttered.

“…Let’s continue.”

Yun Seung-Ah made a faint smile at his encouragement. She woke up from her stupor and returned to battle.

Kwang-! Clang-! Koong-!

The battle continued, destroying the banquet hall. The fancy interior turned into a muddy mess as hundreds of Death Knights ceaselessly fought back.

Jin Sahyuk watched her knights from the balcony. She watched them get beheaded, their hands chopped off, and their swords destroyed.

“Fuck, fuck, fuck….”

Jin Sahyuk cursed out loud. She knew they weren’t the real knights of Plerion. Baal had to be playing a trick on her after reading Bell’s memories.

She tried to calm herself to overcome this unwelcome taste.

But she couldn’t.

“…Ah.”

Jin Sahyuk let out a short cry. A small child she saw in the distance broke her heart.

“What….”

In the corner of the dark battlefield, a child from Plerion was hiding by the curtain. Jin Sahyuk remembered the pitiful boy. He was someone she incarcerated and left to die. The boy who died in the prison cell was now staring at her.

Puharen. The boy who turned into a devil.

Her chest pounded. Unable to meet his eyes, Jin Sahyuk closed her eyes. Something welled up from the bottom of her heart. The boy’s face surfaced beneath her eyelids. Jin Sahyuk fell to her knees.

The seal of magic power buried deep inside her became broken. A faint voice rose up like the falling sand in an hourglass.

Why am I stuck here? It’s cold. I’m hungry. How long do I have to wait? The chains are cold. The pain isn’t going away. I want to leave. Let me out… let me out….

Jin Sahyuk covered her ears, but she could still hear the voice. She clutched her chest in pain, but the pain didn’t go away.

Jin Sahyuk breathed heavily and remembered Akatrina.

The world full of sadness, loneliness, and regret…. Her kingdom…. The boy she killed to become the king, who returned to destroy her kingdom as a devil.

She couldn’t forget Puharen. She felt nauseous, and her head hurt. Almost as if her limbs were rotting away, her past ate away at her…

—…Jin Sahyuk! Jin Sahyuk! Snap out of it!

At that moment, a voice woke her up. Jin Sahyuk snapped her eyes open in surprise.

“W-What?”

—Finally, you can hear me.

A sighing voice rang out. Jin Sahyuk quickly noticed that it was Kim Hajin’s voice.

—What are you doing there, squatting? Are you okay?

“…What? Y-You can see me? Where are you?”

—I’m outside the castle, but I can see what’s happening inside with my awakened eyes. Reinforcements are coming soon, by the way.

Kwang—!

Just as he said that the banquet hall’s door burst open.

“Knight Commander! We are here!”

Reinforcements had arrived, just like Kim Hajin said. Dozens of knights led by Airun, the Devil Hunter Harin, Heroes from Earth like Yohei and Yi Jiyoon, and Yi Yongha and Nicholas from the Temple of Justice….

They were the allies who entered Baal’s barrier through the gap Kim Hajin opened.

“…Looks like the party’s already started.”

Nicholas, the rank 4 member of the Temple of Justice, raised her dagger. With a seductive smile, she licked her dagger. Next, Yi Yongha appeared with his staff raised.

“We’re here, chairman. Not too late, right?”

Looking at Yi Yongha, Aileen smirked.

“No, you’re su~per late. Also, what’s up with that staff?”

“It’s a gift from Yeonha-ssi. It adds the exorcism attribute to my fire.”

Yi Yongha imbued his magic power into the staff. An inextinguishable hellfire shot up to the sky, but Jin Sahyuk didn’t pay any attention to it.

“How long were you watching?”

Jin Sahyuk asked Kim Hajin.

—For about three minutes, I guess?

“Did you… hear anything?”

—Hear what?

It seemed Kim Hajin didn’t know the conversation she had with Yi Yeonjun. She paused for a moment to think. Yi Yeonjun said that this world was a novel Kim Hajin created, but she didn’t have the time to confirm whether that was true.

At that moment, Kim Hajin spoke up once more.

—Anyways, I think I can do it.

“Do what?”

Jin Sahyuk infused magic power into her heart as she replied. It was a bit of a unique process to overcome her trauma.

—Destroy the castle.

“…Really?”

—Yeah. But I’m going to do it right now.

“Now?”

Jin Sahyuk furrowed her brows.

—Yep. So, King, I’ll trust you to take care of Baal.

“…Tsk, do whatever you want.”

Jin Sahyuk got up without saying much. Kim Hajin’s snarky command got on her nerves, but she liked being called a king.

“Hmm….”

She stood tall and looked to the distance. Puharen was still there. But this time, she didn’t avert her gaze.

“…Hahaha.”

Jin Sahyuk suddenly let out a chuckle. She realized she didn’t feel anything when she looked at Puharen.

She knew that the true worth of her Authority, [Reality Manipulation], was in manipulating the ‘inside’ rather than the outside.

“I bet you didn’t know this, you piece of shit.”

Using this Authority, Jin Sahyuk eliminated the complicated and dark feelings she had towards Puharen. Now, she could even smile while looking at him.

“Just you wait, Baal, I’ll go find you soon.”

Jin Sahyuk looked up at the ceiling and crossed her arms arrogantly. Behind her, a terrifying amount of magic power rose up. Her reddish-black magic power turned into dozens of spears.

**

[Outside Baal’s Castle – A Forest Shrouded by a Barrier]

“Yep. So, King, I’ll trust you to take care of Baal.”

I sent Jin Sahyuk a Mental Transmission as I held the Black Lotus Bow and Mystic Key in my hands. As I had activated my Ultimate Skill, [Complete Understanding of Spirit Power], my Mental Transmission was crystal clear.

—…Tsk, do whatever you want.

Jin Sahyuk’s reply was rather simple. With a grin, I checked my luck stat once more.

[Invariable Stat – Luck 9.9]

A luck stat transcending human capability. I wasn’t sure what I would gain from this 30-minute period. But I did know that I couldn’t waste this opportunity.

I immediately used Synthesis.

[Fusing Athena’s Moonlight Arrow with Mystic Key…]

[The chance of success is astronomically low….]

[But you succeed! A perfect fusion increases the rank of the item!]

The key fused with the arrow and became ‘Athena’s Mystic Arrow’.

“Are you ready~? You’re gonna shoot now~?”

“Yep.”

I nodded my head at Jain’s question. Then, I nocked the arrow onto the bow.

Kiik—

The bowstring tensed up. I aimed the bow at the Devil’s Castle and targeted only the castle. Using Overclocking, I squeezed out every ounce of Stigma’s magic power.

“Argh-“

It felt like my heart was going to burst from the Time Reversal I was forced to use, but it was bearable. I needed to endure it at the very least.

[You used Overclocking… Your lifeforce has been damaged!]

[Luck activates!]

[You used Overclocking… Your lifeforce has been damaged!]

[Luck activates!]

Magic power gathered by repeating the above process and began to shake the heaven and earth as it brewed up a storm.

Whish—!

The air currents surrounding me flowed into the arrow, and leaves and grass flew into the air.

Tssssst…

Burned by the magic power, the soil and rock underneath me turned black.

“I’m shooting now. Get ready.”

Before I fired, I signaled Jin Sahyuk. It was then.

….

Suddenly, someone approached me from behind. That person broke through Jain and Shimurin and reached out towards me, pulling my arrow and twisting its course.

Kwaaaang—!

At the same time, large and narrow blades shot up from the spot I was standing.

The misfired arrow then shot up towards the sky, past my intended mark.

“What….”

I stared at the Devil’s Castle as I was dragged back by the mysterious hand.

Even I couldn’t see the peak point of the castle. A mysterious barrier was blocking my vision.

But I decided not to worry about it too much. In fact, I wondered what devastating effect my 9.9 luck stat would have.

**

[Devil’s Castle – Baal’s Room]

On the other hand, Yi Yeonjun returned to Baal’s room. He was still raging. Although Yi Yeonjun couldn’t see Baal, he could tell by the demonic energy covering the room.

“….”

Yi Yeonjun empathized with Baal. Baal called himself a ‘World Collector’, yet he had just found out that he himself was nothing more than a small piece of a collection.

“…Baal.”

Yi Yeonjun called Baal’s name. At that moment,Koong—!

The space pulsed intensely. It was a pulsation of anger.

Sssss….

Soon, demonic energy gathered and formed the shape of a giant face. This was the personification of Baal, a transcendental being.

Baal moved his lips made of magic power.

—Who permitted you to speak my name.

Yi Yeonjun stared at Baal who was expressing his anger. Baal narrowed his eyes and glared at Yi Yeonjun.

“What’s your plan now?”

Yi Yeonjun’s brusque tone caused Baal to narrow his eyes even further. His face twitched a bit, as though he was deep in thought. Then, he spat out in a nonhuman voice.

—…Let me ask you first, human.

The room rumbled. Baal’s fury permeated the room.

—How do you plan to live from now?

“It depends on the truth of the memory you passed me.”

—That was the truth. There wasn’t a single bit of falsehood in the memory Bell gave me. That was… Truth.

“Are you sure?”

—Don’t get too cocky, human. I am an existence that has transcended worlds. I could tell that that was the truth.

“Then….”

Yi Yeonjun closed his eyes.

“I don’t have confidence.”

Yi Yeonjun couldn’t find a way to overcome the helplessness and sense of emptiness he felt. Because he found value in things that weren’t himself, knowing that this world was a novel was a huge blow to him. He couldn’t ignore it as easily as Jin Sahyuk.

—In the end, you are just human. But I am different.

But Baal was different.

A human’s anger was different from Baal’s anger. As a mere human, Yi Yeonjun lost his drive. However, Baal was plenty powerful.

—I will become the destroyer.

Baal’s demonic energy surged up. His presence enveloped the entire castle.

The Demon Realm Gate, the Devil’s Castle, and the container known as Bell.

The conditions for Descent had all been met.

—I will destroy that irresponsible, reckless man and put an end to the world he created.

Guoooo…. An overwhelming reverberation of magic power shook the room. Yi Yeonjun closed his eyes as Baal released demonic energy in fury.

Baal’s demonic energy stormed the room as if to destroy the world.

It was then.

Chweeeek—!

A small arrow broke through the barrier. Baal and Yi Yeonjun turned to the bed, which had just been struck by the arrow.

….

A moment of silence filled the room.

In this short period of time, Yi Yeonjun pondered, ‘How did this arrow get here?’

But before he could even think, the arrow released a brilliant light.

Chwaaaaaa….

A hot, holy current of silver light swallowed everything in the room.

...

Chapter 345. Meeting (2)

Early morning, when the full moon was still shining brightly in the sky, a baby wrapped in a quilt was placed on the steps of a temple. Faint light lit the baby’s face. He wasn’t crying and only stared at his mother’s face.

Soon, the mother began to cry. She turned back as her baby watched her and walked away reluctantly.

A smile emerged on the innocent baby’s face. Hearing the baby’s laughter, the mother began to run. Tears scattered in the air as she ran and ran.

Soon, the moon grew faint, and the temple’s door opened when the sun began to rise. An old nun stopped in front of the baby. With a sigh, she picked him up.

The baby opened his eyes, in which reflected the nun’s wrinkly face. With a gentle smile, the nun stroked the baby’s quilt and congratulated his birth.

The baby was thus placed in the temple’s care and was given the name ‘Eren’.

Eren spent much of his childhood in the temple. The temple was his home, his place of worship, his playground, and school. The temple’s nuns taught him many things.

Eren was never a big fan of studying. He favored cutting wood instead. Rather than history, he wanted to learn swordsmanship and knighthood.

But because the temple was located in the rural countryside far away from the capital, the nuns couldn’t provide him with the education he wanted no matter how hard they tried.

Then one day, a retired knight visited the temple. The nuns introduced Eren to the knight. The knight wanted a successor but had no child. Eren was the perfect match.

With a mutual understanding, Eren became the knight’s student.

Eren felt happy every time he swung his sword. In those moments, he wasn’t sad that he didn’t have parents or friends.

Eren trained with his sword and even slept with it. The dream of becoming a knight sprouted within him. The hero of justice he read about in fairy tales… he trained every day as he imagined himself becoming such a person.

The nuns watched him grow with pride. They treated him as if he were their son.

But they weren’t left with much time because the ‘Demon Realm Transformation’, which had been slowly devouring Akatrina, had finally reached the temple.

**

[Outside Baal’s Castle]

The misfired arrow flew up to the top of Baal’s castle before flying into a bed and causing a silver explosion.

The power of [Dismantling] imbued in the arrow shook the entire castle. The rumbling turned into a terrifying storm of energy that destroyed the top parts of the castle. The demonic energy surrounding the castle scattered, and its foundation broke down. The destruction wasn’t limited to the top of the castle.

Kwaaaaa—!

With an explosive sound, the sound of a collapsing building rang out. The shell of Baal’s Devil’s Castle broke down completely.

However, I didn’t have the time to watch this sight. A blade shot towards me from behind.

Clang—!

A black barrier instantly formed and blocked the attack. The barrier was neither Jain’s nor Shimurin’s. I let out a sigh of relief and turned to the side.

I could see a familiar face. A smile emerged on my face when I saw her.

“Did you rest well, Boss?”

Boss had appeared out of nowhere and protected me.

“You should be careful when you’re using your bow.”

“Ah, Boss~ Are you okay now~?”

Jain cut in. Boss nodded her head nonchalantly, and Shimurin shrugged as she looked at Boss like she was her disciple.

“Rather than that….”

Boss’s shadow stretched out, flying at the speed of light. It grabbed the person responsible for attacking me and dragged him by his feet.

“Kuuk…”

The attacker was a Djinn. The shadow coiled up his body and strangled his neck. Looking at his face, I frowned. I remembered seeing him before.

But since I couldn’t remember, I used [Observation and Reading] to look at his setting.

“…Ah, you’re Terror’s lackey.”

I finally remembered him. I had seen his face before on a wanted poster in Violet Banquet. He was a subordinate of Terror, who was one of the Nine Evils.

"I almost forgot. I guess the Nine Evils are still alive and well."

I turned to Boss, who promptly nodded her head. Other than Destruction, who was killed by Aileen, the rest of the Nine Evils were still unharmed.

"…Terror is a supporter of Astaroth. Let's interrogate this man and find out where Terror is hiding."

Boss took her shadow back and grabbed the Djinn's neck with her hand. She seemed quite angry.

"Oi, I don't think you should be paying attention to that guy right now."

Shimurin muttered as she watched Baal's crumbling castle.

"Huh?"

"Look."

Shimurin pointed at the castle with a grin. Above it, Baal made his appearance. He looked just like Bell, his incarnation body.

He was glaring at me…

—!

He roared.

His scream shook everything inside his barrier. Soon, Baal's body rose to the sky. At the same time, a terrifying amount of demonic energy flowed out.

Baal unleashed his demonic energy in all directions. It seeped into his barrier, turning it even darker.

I had no idea what he was planning to do.

"Oi."

But Shimurin seemed to know something as she nudged my shoulder with a grin. I looked back at her blankly.

"Wait for me. I'll see you again soon."

As she said that, she covered us in a barrier.

Immediately afterward, the world exploded.

**

[Virtual Reality Game - 'Leraje's Game']

Around the same time, Leraje's character, Lijengy, shook. She looked up at the game's sky, feeling an explosion of demonic energy somewhere far away.

"Lord!"

Her loyal servant, Corte, otherwise known by his ID, 'Leraje's Monster', shouted. Leraje nodded her head. She spoke through the chat system.

—Looks like Old Man finally descended.

Leraje let out a light sigh and looked around her surroundings. A vast wilderness dyed in darkness was spread out before her. This place was called Lekior Field and was a famous high-level training ground in the game.

Because it had a high spawn rate of powerful monsters, most players couldn't enter it at all. However, Leraje and her servants had easily occupied the place with Leraje's special control.

—Take all the items.

Leraje ordered her guild members.

—Blacksmith, can you make something with this?

"With enough of them, I should be able to make a [High-rank Obsidian Breastplate]."

A week had passed since the game's release. The game was more realistic than one might expect. To craft high-rank equipment, a large quantity of crafting materials were needed. But no matter how good one's equipment was, a moment of carelessness could lead to their death.

Plus, there was no revival mechanic. Death in the game was permanent.

Leraje enjoyed this realism, and it was the same for other players. If the game wasn't fun, it never would have reached 15 million concurrent players.

The game company Leol had really created an RPG game of the century.

"Will you go meet His Highness, Baal?"

Corte asked as he collected the items. His expression was serious, but the way he was hunched over to pick up the items was funny.

—I should… but since I made a promise with this world, I will keep it. My war will only be within this game.

"…We will follow our Lord's wishes."

Corte bowed. Leraje nodded without a word.

—I'll log out first.

"Yes, Lord!"

Leraje logged out. Meanwhile, Corte remained in the game. He wanted to follow Leraje, but he had been ordered to take care of in-game duties.

15 million human players were gunning for Leraje's guild. It was 15,000,000 vs 1,000, so to say. Corte refused to let his guard down even for a moment.

"Blood Brothers!"

Corte turned back to his fellow demons and shouted with a serious face.

"Collect the items! We will move to the next dungeon soon!"

Corte and the guild members quickly gathered up the necessary items.

—We're ready, sir!

"Good!"

Corte laughed and pointed at the 'boss dungeon cave' in the distance.

"Let's get moving. Get ready for a boss raid!"

Boss raids were one of the most fun parts of this game. Corte was somewhat disappointed that his lord would miss the upcoming raid.

—Yes, sir!

Corte began to march towards the cave. The members of Leraje's guild were filled with excitement and anticipation for the battle. Although they were playing the game for Leraje's sake, they truly enjoyed it as well.

*

[Earth - Korea]

…Hajin… Kim Hajin!

I slowly opened my eyes. I felt terrible aches all over my body, but I could tell that someone was shaking my body.

…Wake up!

It was from Kim Suho. He was slapping my cheeks and saying something. I looked at his lips.

—Wake up, Kim Hajin! Wake up!

Kim Suho was shaking me and slapping me with a face full of worry. However, I couldn't move my body at all. It was as if I had been drained of all energy.

—Hajin, Hajin! Snap out of it!

After an unknown amount of time, my consciousness returned and my other senses including hearing recovered.

"Kim Hajin! Are you okay!?"

"…."

I swallowed the saliva pooling up in my mouth. I looked at the sky and the world around me.

I was familiar with the surrounding scenery. I could see Essential Armory's protective barrier in the distance and even North Hamgyeong Province's city.

This was undoubtedly Korea.

I looked out at the horizon in a daze.

"Are you okay?"

Kim Suho asked again. I turned back to him and nodded. He then helped me up with his hand.

"We're… back on Earth?"

"Yeah."

I first checked to see if Aether worked. After protecting me from the explosion, it had transformed into a small bag and was storing Black Lotus's equipment.

I took out my Desert Eagle and looked up at the clear, blue sky.

"What…."

I furrowed my brows in confusion. Did Jin Sahyuk and Kim Suho kill Baal in that short instance?

I faced Kim Suho once again.

"What happened to Baal?"

"I don't know. The castle suddenly exploded and this happened."

"…."

It was only after this that I realized who was around me. Chae Nayun, Shin Jonghak, Yun Seung-Ah, Jin Sahyuk, Yi Yeonghan, Kim Youngjin, and even Jain and Boss… They were all sprawled out on the ground.

"Ah."

I got up to run to Boss. But I didn't need to. Jin Yohan, Kaita, and Khalifa appeared and took Jain and Boss away.

Soon, other high-ranking Heroes came over.

—Ho~ Looks like everyone's back.

Yoo Sihyuk appeared with nine white wolves.

—Yeonha, Yeonha!

Yoo Jinwoong ran around to look for his daughter.

—Look for anyone who's injured! It doesn't matter what guild they're from! We have to save everyone!

Vice-Leader Yi Jin-Ah arrived with Essence of the Strait's Heroes. Also arriving with them were Seo Youngji, Oh Junhyuk, the fully armored Heynckes, and the apathetic Chae Joochul.

Surrounded by hundreds of Heroes, I breathed out a sigh of relief.

"…Haa."

I felt like I could finally rest. Just as I loosened my nerves a bit…

—!

A loud screech rang out in the sky. The clear sky turned reddish-black, and Baal once again appeared in the air.

The Heroes in the area quickly prepared themselves for battle.

Sssk—

Kim Suho also took out Misteltein.

I chuckled, thinking it would have been too easy if Baal was really dead.

—Grohack Derla Croska Fedra!

Baal muttered incomprehensible words. The devil's cry tore through the sky and formed a pentagram.

Koooong…!

Demonic energy stormed through the air, and the earth rumbled crazily. Kim Suho and I watched the scene in a daze.

Baal seemed to be casting a ritual-like grand magic.

—Come!

In that instant, the pentagram flipped upside down, and the summoning of an evil god began.

First, a giant leg appeared. The leg was bigger than anything I had ever seen before, and it stepped onto Korea's land.

Boom—!

The earth shook from the single step. A huge shockwave spread out and razed the nearby trees.

—Uaaak!

—Kuak!

Several medics fainted after being hit by the collapsing trees. Heroes who were crushed by the foot died on the spot.

Kim Suho's face froze as he watched the scene of devastation.

"…."

Meanwhile, I looked at Kim Suho's hands. They were trembling. Kim Suho was afraid. It must be because he recognized the owner of the leg.

Rank 21 Devil, Morax.

He was the calamity that ruined Akatrina.

Morax was larger and more destructive than the one we saw in the 'Recorded Past'.

"Suho."

I grabbed Kim Suho's trembling hand. He flinched in surprise and looked back at me.

I stared into his eyes and smiled.

"Don't worry."

Kim Suho swallowed his saliva. I grabbed his hand more tightly and announced with confidence.

"I can kill someone like him with a single bullet."

I wasn't lying, technically speaking. After all, I had done exactly that in the world of the Recorded Past.

"…."

Kim Suho looked at me in silence. He seemed to be searching for the source of my confidence.

After about a minute, Kim Suho smirked and muttered.

"…It won't be that easy."

...

Chapter 346. Meeting (3)

The child grew quickly, and the master realized that he alone was not enough to bring out the best in the child. The child needed an even greater role model. In order to blossom as a knight, he had to go to the capital.

His family at the temple understood and supported him. The nuns gave him all they had, three gold coins to use for travel expenses, and the child left for the capital with the knight.

Their journey was not as smooth as they had hoped. They ran into thugs, encountered monsters, and got trapped in natural barriers.

Together, the master and the pupil overcame many obstacles and finally arrived at the capital city.

The capital of Plerion was still magnificent even as the world’s lifespan neared its end. Tall buildings and the bustling streets mesmerized the child.

His master, who used to serve the kingdom as a knight, brought the child to the Royal Palace by connections. There the child met a boy who would later become his lord.

The name of his future lord was ‘Puharen’, a fragile boy trembling with fear and uncertainty.

**

[Earth — Korea]

Morax descended from the pentagram. The advent of this gigantic devil was particularly destructive. His right leg came down first and crushed the grasslands near the border. His left leg destroyed the barriers the Heroes had made.

Just like that, the giant devil set foot on Earth.

“…”

Kim Hajin stared at the devil in silence. Though all Morax had done so far was appear on Earth, his instincts warned him that the current situation was extremely dangerous.

“Hmm….”

The most he could see from the ground was the devil’s knee. Morax’s upper body was hidden from view behind the clouds and the fog.

Kim Hajin decided to increase the distance between them first. Because a sharpshooter had to be far away from his target to be able to aim properly, he needed to be as far away from the battlefield as possible.

“Stay here. I’ll cover you from behind.”

He disappeared, leaving Kim Suho behind. Aileen appeared almost immediately. She had a huge bump on her head from when she fell out of the Demon Realm Gate.

“Hey Kim Suho, what’s that?”

Aileen asked, rubbing her head. Kim Suho tightened his grip around Misteltein.

“It’s Morax.”

“Morax?”

“Yes.”

Morax— the same calamity that destroyed Akatrina in the past.

Kim Suho still remembered the devil, how devastatingly strong it was, and even Puharen’s tears.

“…Well, whatever.”

Aileen increased her magic power. She squinted her eyes and glowered at Morax while stretching.

“Nothing will matter once I kill him.”

It was then.

—We have urgent news! Devils are being witnessed all around the globe!

—Help! Help! We need assistance!

—Requesting backup!

Desperate voices broke out of the Heroes’ smartwatches.

“W-What’s going on? Why all of a sudden?”

Aileen was obviously perplexed. Kim Suho calmly leaned over and looked into the smartwatch of the Hero next to him.

—This is Japan! A huge pentagram suddenly appeared on the ground and countless Djinns began pouring out of it….

—Russia here! D-Devils have appeared here as well!

These voices deprived Kim Suho of his sense of reality. He grew dizzy, his vision clouded and his body staggered. The nightmare of the previous world, which he had worked so hard to forget, seemed to come to life again. This made him sick.

“What's the status quo?”

At that moment, however, a particularly clear voice flowed into his ear. Kim Suho raised his head. Yoo Yeonha was there. She was looking into the current situation with Yoo Jinwoong's smartwatch.

“…”

Her expression stiffened. She looked around again and sighed.

“Father, I’ll get moving now.”

“Yeah, you stay in a safe place. Go on, hurry. Hey, Kim Hwagok!”

Yoo Jinwoong quickly ordered a Hero from Essence of the Strait to accompany Yoo Yeonha.

“My name is Kim Hwagok, a high-intermediate-rank Hero. Please hold my hand, Chief Officer. I have the Teleport Skill.”

“…Okay.”

Yoo Yeonha threw a glance at Kim Suho and held Kim Hwagok’s hand.

Shoong— Soon, Kim Hwagok activated [Teleport] and she was evacuated to a safe place.

It wasn’t long before Kim Hwagok returned to the battlefield again. He held several smartwatches in his hand.

He handed one of them to Kim Suho.

“Chief Officer ordered me to give this to you.”

“Ah, I see. Thank you.”

The smartwatch was immediately connected to Yoo Yeonha.

—Can you hear me?

“…Yeah.”

Kim Suho nodded. He shrugged as he looked into the smartwatch.

“By the way, did you learn a new skill? Your voice is… soothing.”

There was something special about Yoo Yeonha’s voice. The comforting voice seemed to find its way to him naturally even at a time like this. It was thanks to her voice that he had managed to remain sane.

—Yeah, sort of. But I won’t tell you what it is. Focus on the current situation for now.

“…”

Kim Suho grabbed his sword in silence.

At that moment, a woman approached him. Her scent was familiar.

It was Chae Nayun, as he had expected.

Chae Nayun looked up at Morax with Balmung in her hand.

“…He’s freaking huge. How is this size even possible?”

She muttered, and Kim Suho gave a small smile.

Chae Nayun turned to Kim Suho and comforted him.

“Don’t worry too much, though. What’s wrong? You don’t seem yourself.”

“…”

Kim Suho remained silent and scratched the back of his neck. He felt a little ashamed of the fact that his fear was so apparent.

Chae Nayun slapped Kim Suho on the shoulder several times and grinned.

“It’s okay. Everything’s gonna be fine. Grandpa is here. He’s gonna take care of that.”

Chae Nayun was as confident as Kim Hajin had been before. The difference was that her confidence was proven almost immediately.

Koong—!

The surrounding nature resonated.

Grass, trees, the earth, all colors of nature became clearer and began to spur. They quickly gathered together to form a huge human figure.

This was the avatar of the Immortal made by Chae Joochul with his Authority.

The avatar straightened herself up. She was as big as Morax.

“…Wow. I haven’t seen this technique in a while.”

Chae Nayun blurted in admiration. Kim Suho looked up at Mother Nature in a daze. Her legs were trees and soil intertwined, her body was made of Chae Joochul’s magic power, and her arms and head inherited the energy of the azure sky.

This was the great ‘Four-colored Immortal’.

“Well, let’s just leave him to Grandpa.”

Chae Nayun slapped Kim Suho on the shoulder.

Morax began moving towards the Immortal. He stretched his arms towards the divine creation, and the Immortal did the same. The two great forces crashed into each other, causing a devastating shock wave.

KWaaaa—!

Submerged in the wave of gravity pushing against his whole body, Kim Suho grabbed his sword.

**

[Vassago’s Colosseum]

Meanwhile, Cheok Jungyeong and Jin Seyeon became Rank 9 Gladiators. But Jin Seyeon’s heart was not in the Colosseum anymore. She had just discovered that the Demon Realm Gate opened and devils descended on Earth….

“You need to pee? Whatcha nervous for?”

Cheok Jungeyong sneered at Jin Seyeon as she wandered about the waiting room.

Jin Seyeon turned to him with a frown.

“Aren’t you worried at all?”

“About what?”

“Devils have descended on Earth! This is the biggest crisis in the history of humanity since the Great Change. Yet, you’re-”

“Say, what do you think we’re doing right now? Are we just playing around?”

“…What?”

“We’re also trying to stop a devil, are we not?”

“…”

Jin Seyeon fell silent. She had nothing to counter him with. It was true that they were here to protect humanity from a devil.

Not knowing what else to say, she glared at Cheok Jungyeong, sighed, and threw herself on the couch.

“But still. Four devils have appeared at once. Four! Morax, Baal, Phenex, Vual-”

“What? Ball?”

“No, no, not ball, Baal. The pronunciation is similar, but…. Wait, stop fooling around!”

Cheko Jungyeong’s sordid joke angered Jin Seyeon.

It was then.

A bird appeared from nowhere. It fluttered its wings and landed on Cheok Jungeyong’s shoulder.

“…What’s this?”

Cheko Jungyeong and Jin Seyeon looked at the bird in a daze. The bird tilted its head a couple of times, and…

—Peep.

…Chirped.

At the same time, a sentence rose above the beak of the bird.

[My name is Observer No.3]

It was a rather sassy self-introduction.

“…What? Observer?”

Cheok Jungeyong frowned, and peep—, the bird chirped again.

[I shall help you communicate with my master]

“Haha. You’re pretty feisty for a little guy. Just who is your master…?”

Cheok Jungyeong shuddered slightly as if he had suddenly realized something. Jin Seyeon stared at Cheok Jungyeong who had frozen in place.

“…Aha.”

After organizing his thoughts, Cheok Jungyeong let out a chuckle. He lightly patted the head of the Observer on his shoulder and gestured at Jin Seyeon to come near him.

“Oi, come here.”

“What is that?” Jin Seyeon asked brusquely.

Cheok Jungyeong answered, “It’s a messenger from the Seat of Black.”

Jin Seyeon flinched.

She continued to wander about the room, pretending to be indifferent.

“Seat of Black?”

“Yup. Oi, Black. Are you currently outside? I’m with Jin Seyeon right now.”

Cheok Jungyeong whispered to the Observer. About 3 minutes later, the bird chirped, relaying Black Lotus’s message to him.
