It saddened Heynckes that Chae Joochul had lost all purpose and destination in life a long time ago. In return for acquiring the most beautiful power in the world, Chae Joochul lost what was most precious to him. He became Immortal without the ability to love.

“…Joochul, wait for me.”

Thankfully, a man who lacked emotion also lacked the need for a purpose and a destination in life. Also, it was due to his lack of emotions that Chae Joochul couldn’t feel the loneliness of not being able to love. It was therefore pointless to pity him.

“Come on, let’s go together.”

Heynckes followed after Chae Joochul. Nature continued to emerge wherever Chae Joochul went. Now other Heroes would be able to use this scenery as a guide to finding the correct path.

Green grass and tall trees.

Enjoying the sight of nature consuming the barrier, Heynckes walked on. For a moment, he felt as if a gentle breeze of wind had brushed his cheek.

**

Meanwhile, Kim Suho and others were following Shimurin’s lead. The grand magician was an excellent guide, and they could see they were getting closer to Baal with every step they took.

———!

Baal roared again. Kim Suho swung his sword almost immediately. The crescent mass of energy from Misteltein erased the demonic energy again.

“…Uuk.”

Perhaps that last attack put too much strain on his body. Suddenly, Kim Suho felt dizzy. He got down on his knees and rubbed his temples.

“Are you all right?”

Rachel and the others approached Kim Suho worriedly. “I’m fine,” he said. But even as he said so, he felt nauseous, and his shoulders were way too stiff.

Kim Suho knew instinctively that he could do this only three or four more times at best. He raised himself, trying to contain his nervousness.

“Are you tired?” Bell asked suddenly.

Kim Suho smiled bitterly.

Bell shook his head with a broad smile.

“No, you’re not tired.”

“…Excuse me?”

“Your mind thinks you are, but you aren’t. You can’t grow tired, at least not inside this barrier.”

Kim Suho tilted his head, unable to understand Bell’s words, but Bell did not bother to add an explanation.

So they kept walking. Shimurin led them with her eyes closed. She was extremely cautious because one wrong step meant they would have to start from scratch.

However, when they reached a certain point in the labyrinth, everyone had to pause for a moment. They raised their heads with a stiff look. Looking up was the only way they could see clearly the enemy before their eyes.

“…Morax.”

The devil suddenly revealed his huge presence to them. Jin Sahyuk looked up at him, feeling a sharp pain in her chest.

“It seems that he got caught up in this, too.”

Shimurin gave a small smile. Within this barrier, Morax was like Baal’s bodyguard, whose purpose was to buy Baal time to reconstruct himself.

Claang—

Everyone drew their weapons. They aimed their spears and swords at Morax.

Guoooo….

Facing them, Morax let out a low, dismal groan. Jin Sahyuk felt like he was crying for some reason.

“Get ready….”

Jin Sahyuk clenched her teeth. Morax was strong, but he was no match for Airun, Harin, and others from the first world. They were born with the inherent ability to resist evil.

“Everyone-”

“Wait.”

Just before everyone rushed at Morax, Jin Sahyuk stepped forward.

Facing the many confused expressions, she announced, “I’ll take care of him.”

Everyone turned to Jin Sahyuk, but Jin Sahyuk’s gaze was locked on Kim Suho. Their eyes met, and just from that, she knew what Kim Suho wanted to say.

“You mean alone, Knight Commander Shin Jahyuk-nim?”

“It’ll be a tough fight.”

Rachel and Tomer objected, but Jin Sahyuk was resolute. She shook her head and went on.

“I can only say this is what I have to do. Above all, we’re running out of time. Your first and foremost priority should be stopping Baal. You shouldn’t waste time here.”

There was a point in what she said. It was enough to convince Shimurin and everybody else.

“…Jin Sahyuk.”

Kim Suho looked at Jin Sahyuk with eyes full of complicated emotions. She wasn’t the only one who remembered the fall of Plerion. Despite Kim Suho’s concerns, Jin Sahyuk crossed her arms and answered sharply.

“Who said you could call my name?”

Kim Suho’s lips curved into a smile at Jin Sahyuk’s arrogant comeback. He felt relieved by her unwavering attitude. It suited her.

“…Fine.”

Kim Suho finally nodded. At this point, everyone else had no choice but to comply.

They passed by Jin Sahyuk, wishing her luck. Surprisingly, Morax did not disturb their departure. The devil’s gaze was locked on Jin Sahyuk.

Jin Sahyuk waited until everyone had left, and then approached Morax.

“We’re finally alone.”

The moment she said so, a man approached her. Jin Sahyuk grimaced when she turned and saw his face.

“Why the hell are you still here?”

“…A little delay won’t cost me my victory.”

“What?”

The man was Shin Jonghak. It seemed that he was trying to help Jin Sahyuk defeat Morax, even though she never asked him to repay her for arranging that meeting with his grandfather.

“I’m trying to help you, you idiot.”

“Just shut up and leave-”

But before Jin Sahyuk could turn him down, Morax began to move.

Guuuuo….

It was like the roar of a beast. Morax let out a dismal cry and swung his gigantic arms.

KOONG—!

**

[Yi Yeonjun’s Barrier]

Chae Nayun swung Balmung downward. The gigantic sword unleashed fiery magic power that flew right at Yi Yeonjun. Balmung aimed at Yi Yeonjun from the front and her flying swords attacked him from the sides and the rear. As such, there was no physical way to avoid her attack.

But Yi Yeonjun managed to fend off Chae Nayun’s attack with his psychokinesis. Kiiik— Chae Nayun’s magic power collided with an invisible wall, and was lost due to friction.

“That was pretty cool.”

Chae Nayun muttered calmly.

“Let’s see how long you can last.”

She could repeat the previous attack a dozen times more. Her Gift was [Sea of Magic Power]. It was named so because her magic power capacity was as big as the sea.

When fighting, she never lacked magic power.

It was by no accident that her specialty was a prolonged battle. She was well known for her endless stamina.

Woosh—

At that moment the barrier began to move. Yi Yeonjun tried to crush Chae Nayun by shrinking his barrier. But Chae Nayun managed to push the walls away, and Kim Hajin fired the Desert Eagle in a brief moment when Yi Yeonjun was off guard.

Kwagwagwagwa—!

Countless Venomous Basilisk Bullets flew at Yi Yeonjun. He dodged the bullets and glared at Kim Hajin.

“…”

Yi Yeonjun could feel anger boiling up inside him.

Before his eyes were the creator of this world. Sadly, Yi Yeonjun was disappointed with him. He hated the fact that his creator was a human, just like himself. The creator was neither graceful nor elegant nor radiant.

Kwaaaaa-!

‘What have I lived for?’ Yi Yeonjun wondered, blocking Chae Nayun’s sword smashing down on him from all sides.

Because he was born into this world without anything to call his own, he desired everything.

He wanted to rule Pandemonium and everything else he could see.

In a pit of despair called life, only his possessions gave him meaning. Greed and obsession helped him to survive. Had it not been for them, Yi Yeonjun would have lost his meaning in life and died a long time ago….

It was then that Yi Yeonjun recalled the face of the most precious treasure he had ever owned. Her jewellike eyes and long black hair that swayed like waves— he remembered them all.

The treasure’s name was Yi Byul.

But that treasure was no longer his. She used to be in his hands, which was where she should have stayed forever, but… the man before his eyes stole her from him.

Such a trifling man robbed him of everything.

Yi Yeonjun’s rage turned into tears that streamed down his cheeks. He aimed at Kim Hajin.

He planned to blow up his own barrier, the space itself. It would mean double suicide, but Yi Yeonjun felt his life was meaningless anyway. His life was nothing but a story in a novel.

But Kim Hajin’s life was different. His life had a real meaning. So if Yi Yeonjun could bring about Kim Hajin’s death, then it would be his first and last meaningful action.

“——!”

Yi Yeonjun roared. He then tried to detonate the barrier using the remainder of his magic power. He reaped the fruits of his efforts when the barrier began to crumble. There was only a little left until everyone in the barrier had a painful death.

However.

Yi Yeonjun suddenly realized that he could not move his body as freely as he had hoped. The shrinking of the barrier paused, and Yi Yeonjun’s vision became blurred.

He fell down. Black blood spurted out of his body and soaked the ground.

“Ah….” Yi Yeonjun muttered.

His body lost the ability to breathe. His limbs became limp.

‘How…?’ Yi Yeonjun wondered. ‘What kind of trick is this?’

Kim Hajin hadn’t moved an inch, so how was this possible?

It was then.

Yi Yeonjun’s eyes reflected the treasure that once belonged to him.

The treasure—Yi Byul—was much more beautiful than he remembered.

Yi Byul was looking down at him with cold eyes. Yi Yeonjun stared at her with his half-shut eyes. He tried to contain every fragment of her beauty in them.

And she… was too good to be the last thing he saw.

Yi Yeonjun never blinked to his dying breath.

...

Chapter 360. Final Name (8)

Psh—!

The sound of stabbing flesh rang out. The black blade pierced Yi Yeonjun’s stomach, and he fell slowly, and helplessly, like a puppet with its strings cut.

“…”

I lowered the Desert Eagle and looked forward.

Boss stood behind Yi Yeonjun, who had fallen. Blood was dripping from her hand.

“Ah-”

Yi Yeonjun let out a cry. He tried to move his neck, but it was hardly a struggle for survival. Yi Yeonjun seemed to want to capture Boss in his vacant eyes for as long as possible.

But why would he do that? Because he wanted to know who killed him? Or did he want to see Boss one last time?

I couldn’t figure out the answer, but I wasn't very curious anyway.

What I really wanted to know was why Boss was here.

Fortunately, my curiosity was quickly satisfied. I spotted Spartan, who popped his head out from behind Boss’s leg.

Clearly, he was the one who brought Boss here, even though I didn’t ask. Boss might have asked Spartan to bring her here. Perhaps Spartan made an independent decision to save me. The exact circumstances were unknown, but I could see that Spartan was extremely exhausted from multiple trips through distorted space.

“What’s going on?”

Chae Nayun looked at Boss and me in bewilderment. She raised Balmung thinking that Boss might be an enemy, but Boss looked at Chae Nayun without a hint of hostility.

Chae Nayun slowly lowered her sword. And then, she turned her gaze on me.

“…Hey.”

Chae Nayun called me. I answered with a bitter smile.

“It’s been a while.”

“…”

Chae Nayun looked at me in silence. Her lips moved as she chose her words carefully; but what finally came out of her mouth after long deliberation was a notice of postponement.

“Let’s catch up later. We don’t have time right now,” She muttered with a bitter smile.

Her words saddened me. How much time did I have left in this world? Will I be able to sort things out with her before everything is over?

“No, wait.”

Chae Nayun frowned as if she had suddenly changed her mind.

“Hey, you!”

She yelled and grabbed me by the collar. Though she took me by surprise, I couldn’t help but smile. Her unpredictable disposition was what I liked the most about her.

“…You ass- I mean, stupid… person… who’s always running away.”

Chae Nayun carefully chose her words. Struggling not to swear, she sounded a little awkward.

“Do you have any idea what you mean to…. And…. Ugh. Just tell me. Explain everything to me.”

It was then that Boss moved. She carried Yi Yeonjun’s body on her shoulder. Chae Nayun flinched.

“What does she need the dead body for? Wait, more importantly, who is she?” Chae Nayun whispered to me.

The barrier dissolved immediately when Boss removed Yi Yeonjun’s body. The crust of the barrier shook and cracked open.

“Boss! You’re b-”

We returned to Baal’s barrier, and Jain and the other members of the Chameleon Troupe welcomed Boss. Jain ran to Boss with a smile, but her expression stiffened when she saw Yi Yeonjun’s body on Boss’s back. Boss nodded without a word, and put Yi Yeonjun’s body down onto the ground.

“…I don’t know what to say~”

Jain mumbled and looked closely at Yi Yeonjun. In his wide-opened eyes was Boss’s shadow.

Jain gave a small sigh and closed Yi Yeonjun’s eyes for him.

It was then.

“Is that Nayun?”

Yoo Yeonha, who had been resting in the fortress, suddenly yelled. Only then did Jain notice that there was one more person here besides Boss and me.

Chae Nayun turned to Yoo Yeonha in surprise.

“Yeonha?”

Their eyes met, and the two hesitated for a moment before rushing into each other’s arms.

I watched them for a while, and then turned my gaze on the fortress built by Arashi.

***

[Arashi’s Magic Fortress]

—A magic fortress built by Hirano Arashi, the master of fortress building

*Increase attacks from within the fortress to outside by 20%

*Increase defense against attacks from outside the fortress by 20%

—The Dignity of a Master

*Enhance Summoned Beasts

*External Automatic Artillery

…

There were many useful functions attached to the fortress. But looking into them in detail would have to come later. I had something more important to do right now.

“…”

Boss was standing in a daze and looking down at Yi Yeonjun’s body. There was no sadness, no joy, no resentment in her eyes. It was as if Yi Yeonjun’s emptiness had infected her.

I approached her slowly. But she avoided meeting my eyes. Slowly, I whispered her name.

“Yi Byul.”

Boss flinched. Her lifeless eyes looked up at me. They were still as beautiful as a pair of obsidian but they had lost their sparkle.

I wanted to hold her in my arms.

[Starting the Final Arc.]

But then a sentence appeared before me, that seemed to remind me that it was not yet time.

I read that sentence.

[The completion of this arc will unlock ‘???’]

The last arc.

The final destination of a long journey.

I clenched my fists.

I had to finish this last arc in order to put a proper end to everything.

Only then would I be able to define my existence.

I decided to save my feelings for that final day.

“…”

I held Boss’s hand in mine. Her hands were cold, and shaking as if they were crying for her.

“Hey Boss.”

I asked in a soft voice, holding her hand in mine tightly.

“Do you still remember my name?”

**

Koong—!

Morax slammed his fist into the ground. Jin Sahyuk recalled the past as she dodged Morax’s fist. She thought of her half-brother, Prince Puharen, the legitimate heir to the throne of Akatrina who feared becoming King.

“…Puharen.”

Jin Sahyuk called his name.

The prince did not want to be king, but the tradition of the kingdom was not something he could ignore. Puharen’s servants wanted him to rise to the throne.

They never gave him a chance to decide for himself. They wanted a king they could easily control. Even as demons rampaged through the streets and their kingdom sunk into the dirt, they still only cared about their power and security.

“I’ll save you from them.” She lied to her brother.

And then she threw her innocent brother into a dungeon where he stayed until he died.

“I’m sorry.”

Levitating in air, Jin Sahyuk muttered words of apology.

Puharen— no, Morax gazed at her. What a pitiable being! Her brother, the victim of her greed and ambition, was denied a peaceful rest even after death….

All of a sudden, Morax appeared before Jin Sahyuk. She realized too late that the devil’s fists were headed for her.

Kwaaaaa—!

Shin Jonghak thrust his spear for Jin Sahyuk. The pressure from his spear pushed Morax away.

“…Haa.”

Jin Sahyuk breathed heavily. Her heart was racing.

She turned her gaze to Shin Jonghak, reproaching herself for being shaken by the past.

“Stay focused. You’d be dead if it wasn’t for me,” Shin Jonghak said with a smirk.

“Guess you aren’t completely useless,” answered Jin Sahyuk.

She took a deep breath and collected herself. Someone who could sacrifice morality for her own ambitions and murder her brother without hesitation— that was the kind of person she was, after all.

“…Rest in peace,” Jin Sahyuk looked up at Morax and muttered.

At that moment, however, an unexpected pair of guests appeared before them.

“What the hell…?”

Jin Sahyuk spotted the two silhouettes behind the gap between Morax’s legs. One had the appearance of an insect, and the other….

“Orden?”

…Was Monster King Orden, whom she had been acquainted with in the past.

**

Kim Suho followed Shimurin. The closer they got to Baal, the greater the number of demons. Difficult battles followed, but thanks to Aileen, Yoon Seuang-Ah, Yi Younghan and many other Heroes who joined along the way, they were able to win without casualties.

“So you’re a magician from another world?”

Aileen asked Shimurin.

Shimurin nodded but said nothing, and concentrated on her role as the guide.

“…Well, sure. I don’t like chatting either, so let’s just walk.”

Aileen pouted and walked along Shimurin. The Heroes moved forward amidst the tension.

How long had it been?

By the time the demonic energy penetrated into their bodies and its pressure seemed to crush their hearts, they finally arrived at the center of the barrier.

“…Ah.”

“That’s….”

Many exclaimed in both amazement and horror.

Baal was much larger when viewed closer than from afar. The Heroes were overwhelmed by the mere sight of him. The demonic energy flowing out of his body kept humans from getting close to him, and the bodies of fallen Heroes were scattered under his feet.

“…”

Kim Suho stared into Baal’s eyes, which looked like two black holes. They contained many worlds within them. Everything Baal had ever destroyed was displayed in its eyes. The fallen worlds were screaming in agony. Enraged, Kim Suho grabbed Misteltein. The god-slaying tree branch had become a holy sword through Enlightenment and Awakening and was ready to strike at evil.

"Glad to see you again, everyone.”

A voice brought Kim Suho to his senses.

Everyone turned to where the voice had come from. They saw Master-rank Heroes Yoo Sihyuk and Yoo Jinwoong. Following the two, dozens of Heroes gathered where Kim Suho and his friends were.

"How did they escape from the labyrinth?"

Shimurin muttered in confusion. How could they have found their way through such a complicated labyrinth without the kind of knowledge that she had?

Her curiosity was quickly satisfied when ‘nature’ suddenly appeared in the barrier. Soil covered the dark void on which everyone was standing, and the empty sky turned blue. Two men appeared beyond the landscape of nature. Everyone turned their attention to them, and they walked all the way to the center of the barrier.

"…Haha. It seems we have lots of comrades here."

Chae Joochul remained calm even when he saw Baal, and as usual, Heynckes opened his mouth first.

“Say, before you all leave, would you care to listen to what this old man has to say? I’ve fought in many wars, and I’d like to make some strategic suggestions based on my past experiences.”

Heynckes suggested, and the Heroes, including Kim Suho, nodded without a moment’s hesitation. They all admired Hyenckes, a member of the Nine Stars.

But Airun, who came from a different world, seemed hesitant. She looked at Heynckes with suspicious eyes and whispered to Bell, who stood beside her.

“Would it be wise to trust him? Your Highness, please consider taking refuge in a safe place.”

She hoped to persuade the prince to leave the battlefield. But Bell turned down Airun’s offer with a smile and turned his gaze to Kim Suho.

“No worries. We’re going to win this fight.”

Bell sounded extremely confident; it was almost as if he had seen the future.

Perplexed, Airun asked cautiously.

“What do you mean?”

“Look over there.”

Bell pointed to Kim Suho, who was listening to Heynckes with Misteltein in his hand.

Bell was confident in Kim Suho’s victory.

Kim Suho was ‘designed’ to be the winner of this fight from the start.

Baal chose to descend inside a barrier in order to avoid the interference of the world. But this was a mistake. Baal was not the only one under the influence of the world’s interference.

“He’s the main character of this world afterall.”

Kim Suho.

He was also under the influence of this world, just like Baal.

The world’s deterrence was weakening his power.

“Main character…?”

“I don’t expect you to understand.”

The world's deterrence limited Kim Suho’s power to ‘human level’. But the said constraint did not exist in this barrier, for this barrier was technically Baal’s world.

So what would happen if there was less interference?

Kim Suho’s power would no longer be bound to the limits set by the world.

Baal had unwittingly removed Kim Suho’s shackles by bringing him into this barrier.

“I’m just saying he’s going to win no matter what.”

Baal's defeat had been predetermined by fate.

Yes, fate.

Everything was all part of a novel with a prearranged beginning and end….

"Do you understand?”

In the meantime, Heynckes’s explanation was over.

The Heroes roared and lined up for the upcoming battle.

"Good. Now let us pray to God, as we prepare for this final battle."

Heynckes declared solemnly and raised his steel sword.

...

Chapter 361. Final Name (9)

“You haven’t forgotten my name, right?”

I asked while holding onto Boss’s hand. She stared at me fixedly before slowly tilting her head. It was as if she was asking what I was talking about. And for a moment, her expressionless face turned to fluster.

It was a change I was quite happy about.

I pretended to be disappointed and asked again.

“You forgot?”

“…Hajin.”

Boss murmured in a quiet voice with a somewhat dissatisfied look. She seemed to be saying she wasn’t in a mood to joke around.

However, I asked again. I couldn’t be comfortable with just hearing my name.

“My last name too.”

Boss’s eyebrows perked up. Of course, it was only for a split second, and she soon returned the answer ‘Kim Hajin’.

But that was enough evidence. I felt like I understood what the final [???] was.

“Why are you asking me all of a sudden?”

“…No reason. Anyways, thanks.”

I raised Boss’s hand. She flinched as if she didn’t realize I was holding her hands until now.

Her cheeks flushed red, but she soon collected her composure and let go.

“Go. I want to be alone right now.”

She chased me away like shooing away a fly.

I turned back with a bitter smile. Boss glanced at me several times before creating a coffin out of her shadow. Jin Yohan, Arashi, and Jain approached her.

I didn’t wait to find out what happened next.

I stopped in front of the stronghold, the magic power fortress taking root in the part of the barrier I purified. I looked inside the fortress wavering with magic power. My Thousand-Mile Eyes could peer into even a master artisan’s work.

—…By the way, who are the people outside?

—Ah~ You’ve heard of them, right, Nayun? They’re from the ‘Chameleon Troupe’.

—Yeah, I’ve worked with them during the Orden mission.

—Yep, that’s them. I hired them.

Yoo Yeonha and Chae Nayun were talking with each other. Then, Chae Nayun glanced outside.

—Then that woman is also from the Chameleon Troupe? She seems to be… rather close to Kim Hajin.

—Oh, that? Well, you know, Kim Hajin did a lot of work in the shade. They must be acquaintances from that time.

—They’re too touchy to just be acquaintances though….

—…Maybe they’re close acquaintances.

Yoo Yeonha tricked Chae Nayun without much effort. She lied naturally without even batting an eye.

“…Whew.”

Before I entered the stronghold, I took another deep breath and closed my eyes. I checked my Stigma, which was slowly recovering. Thanks to the [Orb of Regeneration], more than two streaks had already been filled.

I focused one streak into my eyes.

Immediately, my vision shot up into a satellite view. Looking down from a lofty height, I could see everything from a third-person perspective, and I quickly spotted Baal.

Kim Suho, Chae Joochul, Rachel, Heynckes, Aileen…. Almost all Heroes I knew were fighting Baal. I could even see Shimurin, Harin, and even 'Bell'.

Even though Baal was right in front of me, I had no choice but to watch from afar. It was funny saying this at this point, but that was the role of an 'extra'. At least for now, my job was simply to assist them from a distance.

However, Chae Nayun was different.

She would be able to awaken her true worth by facing Baal.

After thinking this far, I let out a few dry coughs before entering the fortress. At last, Yoo Yeonha and Chae Nayun's chatter stopped.

Chae Nayun stood next to Yoo Yeonha and asked while she stole glances at me.

"…What were you doing?"

She scratched her head somewhat awkwardly. Yoo Yeonha noticed how Chae Nayun and I were acting and let out a bitter smile.

I said to her, "You don't need to know that. It's about time we go back."

"…Y-Yeah, I was just about to…."

Chae Nayun replied while furrowing her brows. She seemed to be dissatisfied with something.

"I'll be back soon, Yeonha."

Chae Nayun got up after tapping Yoo Yeonha's lap a couple times. Yoo Yeonha also tried to get up, but I stopped her.

"You stay here. You're weaker than even me."

Yoo Yeonha immediately pouted. Her protruding lips moved like a bird's beak.

"At least let me say goodbye."

She then held Chae Nayun's hand and whispered into her ear. Chae Nayun laughed as if she had been told a joke. Yoo Yeonha then sat back down.

"Okay, you can take her now."

I left the stronghold with Chae Nayun. She tried to go right away, but I grabbed her wrist and stopped her.

"Wha—"

The moment my hand touched her, Chae Nayun jumped like a cat who stepped on a needle.

"W-What! What is it!?"

"I have something to give you."

I smiled faintly. There was something I needed to give her before she left.

"G-Give what?"

I silently took out a necklace from my pocket. A carefully crafted fingernail-sized diamond hung on a blue string.

This was an item that would replace what she should have had in the original story. I had crafted this [Magic Power Amplification Blue Diamond Necklace] with care.

"…."

Chae Nayun dropped her jaw as she stared at the necklace. Even inside the barrier's darkness, it shone brightly.

***

[Magic Power Amplification Blue Diamond Necklace] [Pinnacle-grade] [Masterpiece]

- The work surmised to be crafted by a famous Dwarf. Special magical effects are enchanted on it.

—High-rank Magic Power Amplification

—High-rank Magic Power Circulation

—High-rank Mental Interference Immunity

***

Thanks to using high-quality ingredients, it was equal to or above Homer's Ring in functionality. I gave it a blessing with Stigma's magic power before putting it in Chae Nayun's hand.

"…."

Chae Nayun stared at it blankly.

I tapped on her shoulder and spoke.

"You can tell how good it is, right? Be sure to give it back later."

"Huh?"

Chae Nayun's gaze shot up before falling on the necklace once again. This time, she seemed to be checking the effects of the necklace rather than its outer appearance. Soon, she smiled and nodded her head.

"…Right, there's no way something like this would be a gift. Alright, thanks. It should help out a lot."

Chae Nayun put the necklace on, thinking only about its utility. The change happened immediately.

Guooo…. A blue aura rose up around Chae Nayun. The uncontrolled current of magic power escaped in all directions. But, as expected of Chae Nayun, she suppressed the amplified magic power with just a breath.

"Whew, done. What about you, Kim Hajin?"

Chae Nayun asked.

I tapped on the Desert Eagle in my hand and answered.

"I'll support you guys with this."

That was the best thing I could do at the moment. I had to search for an opening to drill the god-slaying bullet into Baal.

"What a scaredy-cat."

Chae Nayun grinned.

There was no need for me to feel bad. It was true. So, I simply nodded my head.

"You know me. I always run away or shoot from far away."

"And you're going to do that until the end?"

Chae Nayun stared into my eyes. Her big, clear eyes carried her sincere feelings. I answered truthfully as well.

"…Yeah. But maybe I can stop running away when everything ends."

"…."

Chae Nayun silently thought about what I said before tilting her head confusedly.

"Okay, so you're saying you won't run away after this, right?"

"Yeah."

I'm okay with that. Chae Nayun murmured before laughing out loud.

"Then see you later."

That was the final goodbye.

Chae Nayun watched Chae Joochul's nature rising in the distance. In that instant, she ran off without hesitation. She ran without turning back, to that 'final' place.

**

The Heroes assumed a loose formation. Since going all out would only result in their death, they wanted to take it slow and understand Baal's attack patterns first.

Bell didn't think that was a bad tactic. As Baal had yet to fully descend, his attack patterns were simple, and the Heroes could slowly chip away at him without being sacrificed.

Bell called this the 'Toothpick Tactic', hoping Baal would eventually fall if he was poked by toothpicks endlessly.

However, not all toothpicks were the same, and some couldn't even be called toothpicks. Kim Suho was the prime example. He cut apart Baal's demonic energy while directly affecting its true body.

"Haa…. Haa…."

But now, Kim Suho was reaching his limit. His body was drenched in sweat, and his hands were barely holding onto his sword. Most importantly, he was running low on magic power.

Seeing Kim Suho out of energy, Bell clicked his tongue.

Kim Suho's fuel efficiency simply wasn't good. Because he was trapped within a mental barricade, he was wasting too much magic power, despite only needing a simple change in thinking to face Baal alone.

That said, Bell couldn't help him with this problem. Kim Suho had to realize this himself for it to have any effect.

"How troublesome…. I can't see an end to this."

At that moment, Heynckes muttered softly. Unlike Kim Suho, Heynckes and Chae Joochul weren't efficient in damaging non-physical beings.

In fact, there weren't many Heroes who were capable of damaging Baal's true body. Other than Kim Suho, only Rachel and Aileen were worth mentioning. Thankfully, the power of these two women wasn't on the level of a mere toothpick.

It was then.

….

A faint tremor shook the barrier. Some Heroes might not have felt a thing. However, Bell clearly felt it - the quickening of death issued from Baal's heart.

"…Hm."

Bell fell in thought. Should he escape to save the finite life he finally reclaimed? Or should he stay to watch the interesting spectacle develop?

However, Bell's old friend Baal did not give him any time to decide.

—Pathetic insects who cannot even touch the edge of true existence.

His calm murmuring resounded clearly from what seemed to be the mouth of the true body. All Heroes widened their eyes.

Baal glared at them with his distant, piercing gaze. His eyes, which had been filled with nothing but vast darkness, now carried a powerful, transcendent power of destruction. Just staring at his eyes caused a few Heroes to collapse.

—Why struggle so much to continue such pitiful lives?

The devil so transcendent that he could not exist in the material realm - Baal - finally descended successfully.

—Death suits you all more.

This sentence marked the outbreak of war.

Baal infused the power of destruction in his breath. A storm of demonic energy brewed from his origin. This was the same 'breath' that had destroyed countless worlds in the past.

It swallowed everything inside the barrier.

Kim Suho swung his sword with what little power he had left, but it 'looked' like it didn't reach Baal….

**

…Tadadak—

A campfire was crackling. The shadow of a fire danced on the ground. Inside a cave filled with deathly silence, Kim Suho was with his king, the ruler of an already-ruined kingdom.

Was her name Priha or Praha? Kim Suho didn't care to find out. He currently didn't even know his own name.

Kim Suho offered the food he cooked on the campfire to his king. It was a simple dish cooked by adding herbs and potatoes in an earthenware pot. As he was lucky that day, he was able to obtain two abandoned potatoes.

Jin Sahyuk stared at the dish with vacant eyes before grabbing it with her hand and taking a bite. After that, she quickly began to devour it. Kim Suho didn't expect any of the food to come back to him.

He thought it was enough if he could help relieve his king's hunger even a little bit.

Right, he thought it was enough.

But when she finished eating, Jin Sahyuk confessed what should have never been said.

'I killed your master to obtain you. It was all a ploy to cut you off from Puharen and have you offer your loyalty to me. I could have saved your master, but I ended his life to save money. Because with the same amount of money, I could have saved a hundred subordinates.'

Kim Suho still didn't understand why Jin Sahyuk said this. Was it because she was grateful? Or did she want to confess her sins before death?

Regardless, Kim Suho became furious. Even though the world fell, rage ignited from the bottom of his heart. No, he raged precisely because the world fell.

The concept of a king or a knight no longer existed in this world. Since everything had fallen to ruin, nothing was restricting him from doing whatever he wanted. After all, what use was there talking about the concept of nobility?

Kim Suho thought this as his hands trembled. And, in the end, he pounced on Jin Sahyuk, cursing for the first time in his life.

Their scuffle continued for a long time. The two of them ran out of the cave at one point and eventually reached a dead-end.

A frightening cliff was awaiting them. However, the two entangled children failed to notice it.

Just like that, they fell from the cliff.

Who killed who in this instance? Did Kim Suho kill Jin Sahyuk? Or did Jin Sahyuk kill Kim Suho?

Well, since they both went through reincarnation, it didn't really matter.

But Kim Suho had to wonder as he fell to his death.

Why did he have to feel such pain?

Why was there nothing but pain and despair in this world?

And why did Jin Sahyuk confess her sins at the end? Wouldn't it have been better for both of them if she kept quiet and died peacefully?

Kim Suho had no way of finding out, but in reality, the answer was simple. The truth was so surprisingly simple that it made one chuckle. And Kim Suho had found out today.

The reason was that… this world was a mere 'novel' created by a damned author….

…This information, this mysterious narration, entered his brain. The voice was too insidious to be a fairytale, but the subdued emptiness was too frightening to be a documentary.

"…."

Kim Suho slowly opened his eyes. Tadak, tadak— He could hear the sound of something crackling.

"Auuk—"

Kim Suho got up with a groan, and only then was he was able to look around his surroundings.

"Ah."

A short mutter escaped his mouth.

Everything had been destroyed. The ground burned instead of the campfire, and a fog carrying a scent of death filled the air. The nature created by Chae Joochul had sunk and turned into a swamp of demonic energy, and countless Heroes were collapsed on the ground either dead or unconscious.

With a single breath, Baal had materialized the word 'destruction' in this space.

—You've woken up.

A voice resounded in the barrier. Kim Suho looked up and saw the true body of Baal looking down on him.

A black dragon.

That's how Kim Suho would describe him. The feeling he got when he first saw him wasn't wrong. That was the Black Dragon, often referred to as the Harbinger of Destruction in legends and myths.

Baal's reptilian mouth moved.

—I've received your memories. How painful. You must have received mine too, no?

Kim Suho fell silent. Just like Baal said, a few pieces of memories had flowed into this brain and taken place naturally.

—Transmigrator Hero.

Hearing this voice, Kim Suho's shoulders flinched. His response was almost instinctive. Kim Suho knew what those two words were referring to.

—For what purpose was that title created?

Baal's form suddenly grew small. His giant, draconic body quickly became as big as a puppy.

Now looking like a cute lizard, Baal walked up to Kim Suho.

—'Main Character', if you know the answer, I want to ask you.

The lizard made a joking expression.

—Are you disappointed? Are you angry? Or are you confused?

Kim Suho's mouth remained shut.

—Main Character, you should already know who the author of this world is.

Kim Suho didn't know, but he found out.

Kim Hajin.

Information about Kim Hajin poured into his brain. Kim Hajin was Kim Suho's creator. He mapped out Kim Suho's character, wrote everything about his life, and used his misfortunes, happiness, and growth for other people's satisfaction.

The existence named 'Kim Suho' had been created for others' enjoyment.

—Don't tell me you think this is okay? That you can continue to live in this world even if it is a mere novel. Such foolishness will not be tolerated.

Kim Suho remembered how Kim Hajin was unreasonably kind when he treated him. Kim Suho thought it was due to friendship, but now he understood the real reason.

—Unfortunately, that is not true. Why? Because if I die, the task of the author will come to an end.

Kim Suho stared at Baal, who was chattering in front of him.

—This is the final arc, Kim Suho, the final arc! When the curtain closes to the final arc, this world will come to an end. Everything will stop for eternity.

Baal spoke with a grin.

The final arc. In other words, the conclusion.

A novel would end when it reached its conclusion. No matter how curious the readers were of the after story, the world inside the novel wouldn't continue on.

—But Main Character, I know how to save this world. A method to let this world continue living…. You should know it now too.

"…."

When Kim Suho didn't answer, Ball pointed at Kim Suho's hip.

—That method lies in your sword.

The god-slaying sword, Misteltein.

Baal suggested that Kim Suho point this world at someone else.

—Entrap the author's soul in this world forever. This world will stop if the author leaves, but it will be a different story if his soul stays. I will split his soul into pieces and scatter them throughout the world. That way, a natural world full of life will continue to exist. The world will not stop and move eternally.

The core forming the world. Baal thought that this was Kim Hajin's soul. And most likely, it was true.

—Kim Suho, you can become the sword that slays the god. For the sake of this world, play the role of killing its god. If 'he' dies, we will become complete existences. I will gladly accept you as my equal and bring eternal richness and fertility to your world. Wouldn't that be the true method of protecting and saving this world?

Baal's long speech ended. He took a few steps back and stared at Kim Suho while floating around in the air.

Kim Suho didn't say a word. He stared at Baal without a hint of emotion on his face. Just like that, a long yet short time passed by.

—…And your answer?

Baal wanted to know what Kim Suho was thinking. However, even Baal couldn't read Kim Suho's thoughts. He guessed that this was because Kim Suho was the main character.

As such, Baal waited for Kim Suho's response. Of course, he didn't care if Kim Suho didn't agree right away.

His barrier was still trapping the so-called Creator. As long as the Creator was in this barrier and not his world, Baal felt like he could kill him.

So if Kim Suho refused, he planned to end everything here. It was just that convincing Kim Suho was a surer method of doing so.

…However, what Kim Suho was thinking was completely different than Baal's. No, perhaps they were similar.

Kim Suho had a simple desire of wanting to cut Baal's twisted eyes.

"Haa…."

Kim Suho took a deep breath and shook off this desire. He remembered the past that he experienced in the form of a dream.

—You! Let me go! I am your king! You dare….

—Shut up! You beggar!

—W-What? Beggar!? I saved you when you were a beggar, yet you dare to say this!?

Two children were arguing loudly.

Kim Suho had failed to protect Puharen and killed Prihi with his own hands. His final memories were of him becoming tainted.

However, he finally gained the chance to atone for his past sins.

He didn't want to fail again at protecting what he cherished.

He still remembered the day over 20 years ago when he was born on Earth as a baby. He didn't have parents in his previous life, but the parents in his current life gave him the name 'Suho'.

Suho, meaning, to protect. He felt as if fate was playing a trick on him. Regardless, he didn't want to become a Hero. He simply couldn't see himself as one when he had murdered the very person he swore to protect.

But as time passed, he felt the invisible hand of fate constrict him. That feeling intensified every time he saw, touched, or swung a sword.

The existence known as Kim Suho carried a clear, noble 'will of the sword'.

Growing up, he came to realize something.

That perhaps, this fate began from his name.

He heard the answer to his suspicion on TV from a well-respected Hero named 'Shin Myungchul'.

Shin Myungchul stood in front of a group of boys and girls who would become Heroes in the future and gave a speech Kim Suho could never forget.

—Everyone, do not forget. A Gift isn't a special right, but a duty. With great power comes great responsibility.

When Kim Suho heard these words, he chose the path he wanted to take. In a way, it was quite obvious. After all, it was unlikely that he reincarnated in this world for no reason.

He didn't think he was 'chosen'.

He didn't think he had to become the savior either.

It was just that… he thought it was his duty… to protect.

The meaning behind protecting wasn't so complex. Protecting someone's family, protecting someone's friends, and protecting oneself…. That was all.

"…Baal."

Today, the intent he had carried from that day was ascertained by Baal.

From the start— he had been born to 'protect everyone'.

—How disappointing.

The moment Kim Suho said his name, Baal realized what decision he made.

Baal emitted demonic energy, which was dense and powerful enough to melt a human soul instantly.

However, Kim Suho severed it in half just by swinging his sword once. No, perhaps he didn't even take his sword out.

—…!

Taken by surprise, Baal shot back and transformed back into his dragon form.

But to Kim Suho, his transformation looked like a pufferfish puffing its body in fright.

To be frank— he pitied him.

"Thanks. I found out thanks to you."

Kim Suho smiled gently.

Even if what Baal said was true, or in other words, even if this world was a part of a novel, it didn't matter. Even if he was created by another being, he just had to be thankful of what he had and continue to live.

Moreover, he trusted that Kim Hajin wouldn't abandon this world.

"I… have to defeat you."

Although he was speaking calmly, he was boiling with rage on the inside. Around him were corpses of countless Heroes or those who were barely breathing.

Kim Suho's fury had surpassed his limit, and that made him calmer instead.

"That way, I can protect this world."

To actualize his previous thought - to cut Baal's twisted eyes - he swung his sword. Baal made something similar to a smile.

—You just made the worst possible deci….

Baal couldn't finish his sentence. Baal was waiting for Kim Suho to attack, but when Kim Suho swung his sword through the air— Baal lost his eye.

—Ah?

Rather than pain or rage, he felt doubt.

Why? And how?

"A novel or not, this world isn't something you can destroy as you please. There are people I need to protect. And as long as I can protect them, that's enough for me."

—…You insufferable mortal!

His rage arrived late. Baal shouted in anger and shot his demonic energy forward. Even now, Baal didn't think it was possible for him to lose.

He had an infinite amount of demonic energy in his barrier. As long as he waited until Kim Suho ran out of magic power, he believed he could win.

However….

"Too light."

Kim Suho cut Baal's demonic energy too easily. He didn't even need to use his sword. With a single wave of his hand, he erased Baal's demonic energy.

——!

Baal roared and increased the amount and intensity of his demonic energy. A storm of demonic energy brewed in the air.

A terrifying, great power of destruction shot out. But even against a force capable of devouring a world….

"Compared to the weight of your existence, you are too light."

Kim Suho was relaxed.

—You…!

He's looking down on me!

A mere mortal is looking down on me!

That cannot be tolerated. That MUST not be allowed.

How can a mere human threaten me…!?

For the first time, Baal felt resentment.

"Let me ask."

Kim Suho slowly approached Baal.

Baal backed off, matching Kim Suho's steps.

"Were you created to live so pitifully?"

—….

At that moment, Baal stopped emitting his demonic energy. Kim Suho's arrogance had stepped over a line that turned his fury into calmness.

Baal made his emotions cold and thought how Kim Suho suddenly reached 'Transcendence'.

It was then.

"Wait, wait."

A cheerful voice rang out.

"I'm here too, Kim Suho~!"

Chae Nayun called Kim Suho while shaking Balmung in one hand.

Kim Suho stared at her with a look of surprise.

However, that wasn't the only thing to surprise him.

"Keuuu—"

A pain-filled stretching sound rang out. A Hero stood up from the ruined scenery of nature. It was the Hero with his body covered in steel - the Nine Stars' Heynckes.

"Ah, you were alive, as I thought! Oh! My disciple is here too!"

Heynckes exclaimed as he looked back and forth between Kim Suho and Chae Nayun.

"…."

Soon afterward, Chae Joochul got up without a sound. He straightened out his bent back and neck, then cusped his hands behind his back. Although his traditional uniform was tattered, his skin underneath showed no signs of injury. His body was even more perfect than Kim Suho's, especially considering his age.

"Aigo, my head…."

Aileen was the next to get up. She furrowed her brows and pressed down on her temple. Because of the bags under her eyes, she looked like a caterpillar.

"Thanks, Earth, you saved me."

Rachel got up next. Earth's barrier had protected her body.

"Keeeu… Where has my honor as a leader gone?"

Yun Seung-Ah smiled as she looked at Kim Suho.

Kim Suho slowly turned around and stared at them.

They weren't the only ones awakening. Many Heroes were getting up one by one.

Although a vast majority were still collapsed unconscious, the Heroes had not lost to Baal yet.

In other words- there was no reason for Kim Suho to fight alone.

"Why the hell is he so strong?"

"Ah… damn it. I'm out of magic power."

"Hey, Kim Suho, are you alright?"

Hearing the voices of several Heroes, Kim Suho smiled faintly. They approached him one by one.

Soon, Kim Suho was surrounded by dozens of Heroes, and they stood together to gaze at Baal. Their will and fighting spirit had not been destroyed in the slightest.

—…..

On the other hand, Baal chuckled as he stared at the ant-like Heroes. An unappeasable fury welled up in his heart. This rage had to be bigger than the combined rage of all others in this world.

…Next, Baal's eyes contorted.

Kim Suho took out the holy sword containing his will.

The human and devil began their final fight, thinking of two different conclusions.

...

Chapter 362. Ending (1)

[Morax and Jin Sahyuk's Story]

Jiing— Hearing this vibration, Jin Sahyuk shook her head. Demonic energy exploded from an unknown place and burned the surface of her skin. Jin Sahyuk purified the demonic energy with a simple use of Reality Manipulation. The demonic energy turned blue before dissipating into the air.

"Are you okay?" A somewhat arrogant voice rang out. Jin Sahyuk turned to that direction. Shin Jonghak was looking at her with his spear in his hand. He seemed to have been unaffected by the demonic energy explosion.

"…." Jin Sahyuk got up silently. She then checked on Morax. The devil was full of slash marks. He was missing most of his fingers, and black blood was covering his giant body. A human would have died by now, but Morax was without a doubt alive.

It was then.

"Interesting."

A voice that was neither Shin Jonghak's nor Jin Sahyuk's resounded in the barrier. Shin Jonghak grabbed his spear, while Jin Sahyuk tied her disheveled, lightly-burnt hair into a ponytail.

"These beings called devils are truly interesting. Not as much as humans, of course, but interesting indeed."

The Monster King Orden murmured as he looked up at Morax. His eyes flickered with curiosity, and Jin Sahyuk couldn't help but find this sight shocking.

"Did he go crazy after reviving?"

The bastard had appeared out of nowhere and was simply staring at Morax. Without doing anything, it stood fixed on the ground. He was 'observing' Morax, just as the word suggested.

Orden turned his head and faced Jin Sahyuk.

"Do you need help, human?"

"…."

Jin Sahyuk shrugged off Orden's gaze with a grin.

"You can help by screwing off."

Kurukuru, who was standing next to Orden, flapped its wings in response. It seemed to be threatening Jin Sahyuk, saying, 'How dare you—'

Orden suppressed Kurukuru and replied dryly.

"It's too interesting a sight to just pass by, no?"

"…I didn't know you talked so much."

Just like how Orden found the situation interesting, Jin Sahyuk was interested in Orden's change. His body was a lot smaller than it was in the past, and humor seemed to take place of the weight that was lost.

Whoosh—

At that moment, Shin Jonghak's spear flew through the sky. He muttered as he glared at Jin Sahyuk with a displeased look.

"Orden doesn't seem to be an ally or a foe. Just focus on the devil, Jin Sahyuk."

At the same time, Morax began to move once again. He let out an odd screech and swung his arm, and Shin Jonghak swung his spear and pushed him away.

Black light flickered from the tip of his spear. This light of darkness was hard to explain in theory, but in any case, it was the power that belonged to Shin Myungchul, which Shin Jonghak had now succeeded.

"…Hmm."

With this, Jin Sahyuk saw their chance of winning was high. However, Jin Sahyuk didn't want to kill Morax yet.

Whooosh—

Morax punched out, but Shin Jonghak struck back with his spear. That wasn't all. The black light imbued in the spear traveled through Morax's fist and bound his entire body.

Light of darkness that burned and purified everything.

This black light, which Shin Myungchul acquired by atoning for his sins, was not perfect by any means. However, it boasted an undeniable advantage against one type of opponent.

With this power, Shin Jonghak became the perfect natural enemy of demons. After all, the black light had the power to 'purify demonic energy'.

"Oi, hold down that guy's body. Don't burn everything."

However, Jin Sahyuk didn't want to kill Morax yet. She jumped up lightly.

"What? Wait, where are you going, dumbass?"

Shin Jonghak shouted, but Jin Sahyuk didn't answer. She slowly flew up and landed on Morax's shoulder. The skin on Morax's shoulder was quite a disgusting mess. Morax knew his large body was both its advantage and disadvantage. To overcome this flaw, he had transformed the surface of his skin into a scorching swamp of demonic energy.

Thus, when Jin Sahyuk's shoes touched Morax's shoulder, they melted in an instant. However, Jin Sahyuk's feet were fine. She had already used Reality Manipulation to change the properties of her feet. Although she wouldn't be able to last long, she should be fine for a few minutes.

"…Wait for me, Puharen."

Jin Sahyuk muttered as she glared at Morax's giant eyes. Then, she drew a deep breath. She looked like a diver preparing to jump, and what she did afterward was exactly that.

Jin Sahyuk swam through the demonic energy swamp trying to cuff her in… and jumped into Morax's pupils.

Just like what she did to Shin Jonghak, she was entering Morax's deep consciousness.

*

[Evandel's Cabin]

—Crevon's army is supposedly sweeping through all regions of Earth. After setting off from the Steppes of Manchu two days ago, the Crevon Army stretched out to the west and east, defeating the demons' armies. That's not all. In Paris, Grand Magician Oh Jaejin, 9-star Magician Ah Hae-In, and her disciple 'Evandel'….

On the other hand, Evandel was watching TV in her cabin. Public broadcast had been cut off with Baal's descent and was only restored today. Many broadcasters were reporting hopeful news all over the world.

Evandel calmed herself as she listened to these reports.

—Astaroth, the demon of the west, has been defeated by the combined efforts of Grand Magician Oh Jaejin and Grand Magician Ah Hae-In. The east side's Valac has been pushed back by the German government and Crevon's Hwarangs.

At first, Evandel was scared of this war. But after watching numerous Heroes fight while risking their lives, she learned something new. Their sacrifice and commitment taught her an important lesson.

In this world, many people fought to protect the world. To protect the animals, to protect the land, and to protect people, they stood back up no matter how many times they fell and didn't give up no matter how frightened they were.

Even though they should be afraid as well, they were overcoming their fears.

So, starting from today, Evandel decided to admire them. Not only that, she swore to follow in their footsteps. The weight behind the word 'Hero' increased in Evandel's heart, and she set a new goal for her future self.

—On the other hand, the less belligerent Leraje and Vassago have shown strange signs of protecting the citizens of their land. The World Government and the Hero Association have chosen not to antagonize them.

Ssk- ssk- At that moment, a strange noise rang out. Evandel tilted her head at the faint sound and looked around the cabin room.

—Ah, we just received additional reports. The demon army that invaded Gaeseong has reportedly been annihilated by an unknown creature. Eye-witnesses described the mysterious creature as a black rabbit….

Ssk- ssk- Evandel strained her ears and listened carefully. It was the sound of words being written. But where was it coming from? Curious, Evandel thought for a moment before suddenly realizing something and turning her head.

—Humanity's war against demons seems to be racing toward the victory line, but there is danger remaining. The Nine Evils who serve the devils are still alive and well, and the rank 1 devil, Baal, is currently at the border of the Korean Peninsula….

Ssk- ssk- Characters were being written on the 'Communication Letter' she treasured. Evandel quickly sprinted to it and picked it up.

[Evandel, are you there?]

"Aaah!"

When she saw these four words, her eyes widened. Evandel swallowed hard and held the letter tightly.

[It's me, Hajin. Kim Hajin.]

She almost burst into tears the moment she saw the words. No, she teared up. Huaaaang— Evandel held the letter in her embrace while crying. Then, she looked down at the letter once again.

[Are you doing well?]

"Un! Un! Un!"

Evandel shouted before realizing her voice couldn't reach him. She only knew one way to reply to him.

She quickly began to jot down a reply. The pencil in her cute hands began to draw adorable characters….

*

[Un! I'm doing well! What about you, Hajin? Are you okay? I want to see you!]

Inside the stronghold Hirano Arashi constructed, I smiled as I read the words being transmitted to me by the Communication Letter. I felt like I could hear Evandel's voice through the text.

[I'm doing fine. Soon….]

I fell in thought in the middle of writing.

Would I be able to safely go back to Evandel's side?

"Haa…."

I planned to do everything in my power to tie the final knot. Even if I died in the process, I still had one chance to revive.

But even if revived….

[Everything's almost over, so be a good girl and listen to Master Ah Hae-In, okay?]

After hesitating for a while, I changed what I was going to say. Evandel replied immediately in the same cute, child-like tone she always had.

"What are you doing, laughing like that?" At that moment, Boss peeked her head up from the bottom of the ladder. I was on the second floor of the stronghold, while she was on the first.

After walking up to the second floor, Boss narrowed her eyes and glanced at the letter in my hand. I covered the letter with my hand and replied to Boss.

"Getting mentally ready for the war that's about to begin."

From the outside, I might look like I was fooling around. But in reality, I was keeping a close eye on Baal through the Thousand-Mile Eyes. Although it would probably be difficult to kill him in one attack, all I could do was sit here and wait for an opportunity.

"What about you, Boss? Are you done?"

"…Yeah."

Boss sat down next to me. Then, she muttered somewhat bitterly.

"I retrieved Yi Yeonjun's corpse. I plan on burying him in Pandemonium later."

"…Got it."

I bitterly smiled back and nodded my head.

Yi Yeonjun had done something horrible to Boss. He had destroyed the happy life she could have led. But I couldn't fault him for that in good conscience.

After all, I was the one who created Boss, and her past was only materialized around my writing.

"…If it weren't for him, I might have led a normal life."

Boss muttered as she looked out into the far distance. I wasn't sure if she knew what I was thinking about.

I didn't say anything. What she said wasn't true. Boss couldn't have led a normal life.

Because I created her.

"But…."

Boss glanced at my hand. Then, like a crawling caterpillar, her hand slowly moved toward it.

"…But… you know…."

But because her hand was moving at a speed of 1mm per second, I decided to act first and grabbed her hand. Boss flinched at first but soon smiled gently and said, "I was able to meet you because of it."

My heart jumped. I wondered if Boss could also hear the Ba-Thump- sound-effect. I raised my head in a daze and stared at Boss. She was doing the same.

"…."

"…."

I felt a strange sensation welling up inside me. I couldn't tell whether it was sadness, gratitude, or love.

I also thought this.

Even if her past was created by my settings, the current reality was no longer a part of my novel. So maybe, it didn't matter.

Since I couldn't write about what would unfold in the future, and since I couldn't know about it and decide anything, perhaps I had finally been freed from the restraints of this world being a novel.

"Boss."

I squeezed her hand.

Setting all these thoughts aside, what I wanted to do now was clear.

I slowly leaned towards her. Boss didn't avoid me. In fact, she seemed to be waiting, as she slowly closed her eyes….

"We're all down here~"

Jain's voice suddenly cut in. Boss jumped in a fluster and pushed me away. Then, she shot a glance down.

"Hm~? What are you two doing up the… Aak!"

Boss threw a shadow rock at Jain before approaching me again. She then set the previous mood in a hurry.

"…Then, Hajin, what should I do from now on?"

Boss asked as she played with my hand. I knew what she was asking for, but I asked anyway.

"What do you mean?"

Somewhat frustratedly, Boss returned to her usual self and spoke in a dry voice.

"I lived to fulfill Yi Yeonjun's wish in his place. Reforming the Chameleon Troupe, killing people and stealing items… they were all for him. But now…."

Boss stopped and suddenly closed her eyes. She didn't finish no matter how long I waited.

I smiled bitterly and pulled her towards me. Although we didn't kiss, the embrace was even softer.

"…It's fine."

I pointed at the members of the Chameleon Troupe who were waiting on the first floor. They were 'preparing' what I asked for along with Yoo Yeonha.

"You have them. If you don't have a goal, or if you don't have a purpose, you can look for it with your comrades. You must. This time, without killing people. So that you can be happy together…."

Although it might not be the best answer, it was the most ideal solution. A text-book answer or a cliche, if you will.

But Boss smiled even at my corny line. Looking into my eyes, with a delicate smile.

"…."

Seeing this smile and feeling my beating heart, I was convinced once again.

I wanted this woman to be happy. I wanted her to laugh. I… I loved everything about her….

And that's what saddened me more.

*

With the battle against Baal about to break out in full, the atmosphere was tense. In this frozen-cold silence, a rather light word popped out.

"Grandfather."

It was Chae Nayun. Everyone, including Baal, turned to face her. Chae Nayun's expression was somewhat sinister. Chae Joochul stood apathetically for a moment as if he didn't know how to react. Then, he made a gentle smile as he had always done.

"…Grandfather."

But Chae Nayun wasn't smiling. She was glaring at Chae Joochul a bit resentfully.

"When this ends, we need to talk."

Her tone was laced with thorns. Chae Joochul didn't know why Chae Nayun was angry, but he nodded his head anyway.

"Baal."

Then, Kim Suho stepped forward.

—….

Baal looked down at Kim Suho from above and thought about the youth's sudden transcendence and the barrier's effect on him.

However, Kim Suho didn't wait for him to finish his thoughts.

—!

Many Heroes roared out from their hearts. They ran toward Baal without a moment of hesitation.

Baal observed their moves with his narrowed, devilish eyes.

Heynckes's Steel Spirit cut his skin. Chae Joochul's storm dug into his eyes. Rachel's elementals and Aileen's Spirit Speech combined to form a dragon-like creature that bit down on his neck. Chae Nayun's sword shot to a gigantic size and slashed at his chest.

However, Baal didn't react. He knew any attempts to counter-attack would be nullified by Kim Suho's sword. He simply focused on calming his heart to avoid wasting any energy.

Even as he bled, Baal continued to think. Perhaps, he was desperate. Baal toiled like a human to find an answer. That in itself was humiliating enough, but thanks to it, he was able to arrive at a reasonable answer soon.

The root cause was him cutting off the world's deterrent force. So that he could descend, he had isolated the space inside the barrier from the world's deterrent force. That had also affected Kim Suho, allowing him to transcend.

This was only possible because Kim Suho was a Hero with an Authority and because he was the 'main character'.

—….

Remaining silent amidst the barrage of attacks, Baal searched for only one person - Kim Hajin.

The foolish humans had refused the offer he made, but he was convinced that the world would end if Kim Hajin didn't die. And when that happened, he, Baal, would die as well.

—Where are you….

Baal couldn't find him.

Most likely, he wouldn't be able to find him for all eternity. This was because Kim Hajin was hiding in the barrier's crack.

—….Hah?

At that moment, Baal let out a short cry. Chwaaaack— He could hear something cutting his heart. A giant sword had invaded Baal's true body.

Baal stared at the sword piercing his skin, and the woman holding this sword.

"Uhahaha, how is it? Painful, right?"

A lowly human, a swordswoman named Chae Nayun, was looking at him with a smile. Baal's mind reeled from rage.

—…I admit. I cannot defeat you all.

Baal muttered with cold fury. Although this declaration was humiliating, he still had a method left.

—But did you forget?

If his barrier was setting the stage for Kim Suho, all he had to do was destroy it. Although he wouldn't be able to maintain his true body, Earth still had devils and demons under his rule.

Accepting their help wasn't a pleasant thing to do, but Baal knew he wasn't in a position to care about his pride. His subordinates would destroy Earth for him.

—I might die, but I am the god of evil who can never be annihilated.

Baal glared at Kim Suho's unshaking eyes and declared his intention to destroy the barrier.

An author of a novel might describe this move as 'self-destructing'.

Even Kim Suho's Authority shouldn't be able to interfere with him trying to detonate the barrier alongside everything within it.

Believing this, Baal destroyed his body.

…No.

He tried to destroy it.

...

Chapter 363. Ending (2)

[Puharen’s Inner Mind]

Jin Sahyuk slowly opened her eyes, but she was met with a darkness that made it no different. Puharen’s inner mind was dark. Coldness, emptiness, and loneliness…. Negative emotions weighing down the atmosphere constricted her feet.

Jin Sahyuk began to walk, relying only on her senses, to a place where a certain ‘presence’ was flickering.

“….”

After walking endlessly for a while, Jin Sahyuk suddenly stopped. Her intuition told her that this was the place. The wavering of the soul was calling her.

Jin Sahyuk opened her palm, and a small source of light floated up. The light soon illuminated parts of the dark inner mind.

Just like that, Jin Sahyuk found him - her younger brother, squatting in the middle of the darkness, shaking.

“…Ah.”

Her breath halted. A thick, heavy ball of fire surged up from the bottom of her heart, and it seemed to burn up her entire body.

Jin Sahyuk swallowed the pain and looked down at Puharen. His thin, small body was colder than before, and his lifeless pupils were imbued with bottomless darkness.

He had not grown up in the slightest from his child state. Jin Sahyuk placed his frail appearance in her eyes so that it wouldn’t flow out; so that it wouldn’t escape.

“Puharen.”

Jin Sahyuk’s voice couldn’t reach him as it scattered in the air. Puharen had been stuck in this dark place for dozens of years. Jin Sahyuk already knew that meeting him once would not change anything.

“Puharen.”

Still, she called his name. Puharen didn’t move. Jin Sahyuk bit down on her lips and fell in thought.

What were you doing here alone? Were you resenting me? Or were you looking for your mother, who left the world before you?

Jin Sahyuk bent down to her knees and slowly reached out with her hand. Her trembling fingers touched Puharen’s face. A chilling coldness stung Jin Sahyuk’s heart, as though she were touching a corpse.

Jin Sahyuk called the child’s name once again.

“Puharen.”

And on this third attempt, Puharen’s inner mind shook. It was a small tremor, but it wasn’t caused by Puharen. An outside impact had shaken his inner mind. And if even his inner mind was being affected, it meant he didn’t have much time left.

She had to hurry.

For now, she had something she needed to do. She could seek ‘forgiveness’ later.

Still on her knees, Jin Sahyuk placed her hand on Puharen’s shoulder.

“…I know I have no right to ask for forgiveness.”

Most likely, Puharen would never be able to forgive her, and she would never be able to atone for her sins.

So why? For some reason, Baal’s words suddenly popped up in her mind.

That this world was just a novel where everything was decided on beforehand. Those simple words.

That the reason she was like this and the reason Puahren became like this were all according to the settings created by ‘that man’….

Jin Sahyuk laughed mockingly.

“But you know….”

No, Baal’s words were just a lame excuse. A way to pass on one’s fault to another in the form of resentment.

But Jin Sahyuk considered herself a ‘king’. And from what she had learned, a king did not make excuses. Funnily enough, Kim Hajin was the one who helped her achieve this realization. He had shattered her principles and reforged them as she begged for her life.

“There’s something I’ve always wanted to say to you.”

Magic power surged out from the hand that was touching Puharen’s shoulder. However, Puharen did not even try to see it. His dull eyes seemed to have already lost their ability to see.

Jin Sahyuk spoke.

“…I’m sorry.”

With that, she released her magic power. The Authority of Reality Manipulation seeped into Puharen, and his shoulders faintly shook.

Jin Sahyuk closed her eyes and murmured calmly.

“Hurt me all you want inside my heart for all of eternity.”

Her magic power shot up like flames. After spreading to every corner of Puharen’s body, Jin Sahyuk’s magic power dismantled his body. Like a feathery speck of dust, or like a midsummer night’s flower petal, Puharen scattered away. Almost as if he didn’t exist in the first place.

With this- Jin Sahyuk killed Puharen for the second time.

But this time, it would be a slightly different death.

“Haa….”

Jin Sahyuk took in a deep breath. She sucked in the remnants of Puharen mixed in the air, and her body flashed with a blue light.

This was something Jin Sahyuk thought of on the spot when she saw Shin Myunchul meet Shin Jonghak. Morax had trapped Puharen’s soul in his body, and Shin Myungchul had lived on in Shin Jonghak’s inner mind. Who was to say she couldn’t do the same?

No, she was confident she would succeed.

I am a king who’s above a devil.

As a king, I will embrace Puharen. This place is too desolate. I don’t know if my heart will be any warmer, but I cannot let you be imprisoned here. Since I’m the one who made you fall into this place, I should be the one to take you out.

You can bother me all you want by letting your soul cry out. Even if you cut my heart until I’m close to dying, I will not complain.

“…Let’s go. Together.”

Of course, this was a one-sided abduction that didn’t ask for Puharen’s approval.

So, Jin Sahyuk used a Jin Sahyuk-like approach.

Tzzzt….

Puharen let out a small fricative sound as he seeped into Jin Sahyuk’s heart. Immediately, Jin Sahyuk’s body became overloaded. Puharen’s soul clashed with hers, the pain from which was difficult to endure for a human.

But Jin Sahyuk held on. Even as she coughed out one mouthful of blood after the other, she endured the heart-wrenching pain.

Koong-!

When Puharen’s soul reached the Jin Sahyuk’s heart, a thud rang out from the outside. Jin Sahyuk sensed that this impact was far more stable than the last.

She could also smell a familiar scent.

‘That man’ had finally stepped in.

Jin Sahyuk closed her eyes, feeling relieved.

Chwaaaa….

Soon, Morax began to crumble. He couldn’t maintain his form now that his host’s soul disappeared.

As he scattered away into dust-like particles, Jin Sahyuk felt Puharen’s emotions. Uncontrollable pain, resentment, and sorrow… accepting them all with her body, Jin Sahyuk made a thin smile.

Although she couldn’t put any adjectives to this smile, at the very least, she believed it looked like a king’s. If her scribe were here, he would surely give it a dignifying name like a King’s Smile.

Thinking such unimportant things, she lost consciousness.

**

The barrier was slowly contracting. The sky became narrower, and the earth crumbled down. Seeing this, the Heroes in the area could easily tell what Baal was planning. Thus, the battle became even more intense.

Steel Spirit and Spirit Speech. The magic sword and elementals. Swordsmanship and punches. The Heroes gathered here poured out everything they had.

Chae Joochul created undulations of nature and created explosions inside Baal, and Heynckes sliced off Baal’s skin. Chae Nayun raised her magic sword to push the falling sky up and support it.

“Don’t come down… damned ceiling! Uaaaah-! Kkuaaaaaa-!”

…What she was doing might look funny, but it served an important purpose.

Chae Nayun’s magic sword was delaying the contraction of the barrier. This was something only Chae Nayun could, as her magic power capacity had surpassed the level of humans.

“—Huup!”

Kim Suho swung Misteltein. He wanted to cut Baal’s ‘action’ itself. However, it wasn’t so easy. Kim Suho cut off his arm, skinned him, and even tore off his wings, yet it was impossible to destroy his will.

Eventually, Kim Suho thought about cutting the barrier before Baal. But even that was impossible.

This barrier was a form of protection from the world’s interference. In other words, this barrier was what granted him his current Transcendent state. Because of this, Kim Suho’s Authority could not destroy the barrier.

—It’s futile.

Baal knew this too. Baal seemed to have reined in his rage as he muttered with a tone of ridicule. All the meanwhile, the destruction of the barrier continued.

Soon, the barrier would contract completely and, unable to bear the compressed density and pressure, explode. Not even Baal would be able to survive from this total destruction.

Although the Heroes inside the barrier would die, Baal was different. As death was different from ‘annihilation’, Baal would be able to return to Earth one day. His death would only be temporary, and Earth would be unable to escape destruction.

From the beginning, Baal had created a game where his victory was guaranteed.

—It’s your loss.

Baal made a sinister smile. Then, he twisted his hand. The sky inside the barrier began to crumble down even quicker.

Kwagwagwagwa….

As the thunderous sounds of destruction rang out, Baal saw signs of despair from the Heroes’ eyes. He grinned. Sinister ecstasy welled up inside the evil god’s heart.

…It was then. A mysterious voice rang out from the ceiling.

“Futile? Says who?”

This somewhat dry voice immediately drew the attention of everyone present.

The Heroes were confused, but Baal’s eyes widened in shock. He turned to the direction the voice came from.

“You’re wide open right now because of all the attacks you received. Without your outer skin, you should be weaker to outside damage, right?”

Only then did Baal look down at his body. Demonic energy was leaking out of the numerous cuts and cracks on his skin. He belatedly roused his demonic energy to form a barrier.

However, Kim Suho instantly nullified it.

—Y-You… until the end…!

Just as Baal raged at Kim Suho-

“Let’s see if you can take this. It’ll be a bit different.”

BOOM-!

A thunderous boom shook the barrier. Kim Suho, Chae Nayun, Rachel, Yun Seung-Ah, Heynckes, Chae Joochul, Baal and Bell…. All of them stared right at it — a bullet flying forward while drawing a white rift in space.

The bullet emitting a brilliant light drew a straight line in the air before digging into Baal’s heart.

Pzzzt-!

—…!

The moment the bullet reached Baal’s heart, his eyes widened. Then, the contraction of the barrier stopped. The force of the shock had cut off Baal’s will from the barrier.

—Kuuuu… KUAAAAAAK-!

Baal coughed out a mouthful of blood. Reddish-black liquid flowed down from the dragon’s mouth.

Even as he writhed in pain, Baal refused to believe it. A bullet with ‘deterrent force’. Such a thing couldn’t exist. It couldn’t….

——!

Baal roared. He pinpointed the location of the shooter using the direction the bullet came from, and his eyes captured ‘that man’.

That damned man was right there.

That arrogant, lazy man was aiming his gun at him.

Baal opened his mouth and breathed out demonic energy that was mixed with blood.

The breath filled with killing intent followed the same path the bullet traveled, but….

“…Good try.”

Kim Suho cut it into nothingness once again. Kim Suho smiled as he stared at Baal.

Baal also stopped the rage he was spitting out and looked down at Kim Suho contemptibly.

—….

Next, a thick silence descended.

The Hero and Baal only glared at each other. Was it disgust, resentment, or resignation? Unknown feelings flickered in their eyes.

The cold silence didn’t last long.

Soon, Baal let out a hollow chuckle.

—Real cheeky… so much so that I want to destroy everything….

Kim Suho didn’t let Baal continue any further. It was his ironclad rule to never let his guard down.

“—!”

Kim Suho let out a spirited shout and swung his sword.

Seeing Kim Suho’s all-out attack, many other Heroes did the same.

Baal simply watched.

“Break—!”

Aileen’s short, full-power Spirit Speech; Chae Nayun’s greatsword emanating a terrifying amount of magic power; Heynckes’s sharp Steel Spirit; Chae Joochul’s emotionless nature.

Rachel’s purification activating using the Fairy Sword Galatine and her elementals; Yun Seung-Ah’s white Flower Sword blooming in all directions; Shimurin’s grand magic shaking the earth.

Harin’s exorcism spell activating which could even penetrate Baal; Yoo Jinwoong’s crimson electricity flowing through the air; Yoo Sihyuk’s wolves leaping toward Baal’s neck; Yi Yongha’s inextinguishable flames….

Everything enriched the brilliance of the Sword Saint’s sword strike.

...

Chapter 364. Ending (3)

[Baal’s Barrier]

I changed the Desert Eagle into its sniper rifle form. With the rigid sound of machinery, the handgun expanded in size. The barrel fused with Aether and extended forward frighteningly, and the muzzle accurately captured the existence in the far distance.

Baal was still there. I thought about which area to snipe at every moment - the heart, the head, the eyes…. None of these looked like weak points. After all, not even the god-slaying bullet could pierce through Baal’s defense easily.

The problem was the strength of the bullet and Baal’s outer skin. The destructive power of the god-slaying bullet wasn’t all that special. It couldn’t cut everything like Kim Suho, it could not push forward with sheer force like Chae Nayun’s terrifying magic power, and it couldn’t distort reality like Jin Sahyuk.

Although it could deal critical damage to a devil that reached divinity, it would have to pierce the devil’s ‘outer skin’ first. However, the god-slaying bullet lacked the power to do so.

“….”

I was mulling over my options, but I soon realized that was unnecessary.

—!

Baal was focused on self-destructing through destroying his barrier. Because of it, he wasn’t paying attention to the Heroes’ attacks, so as the battle continued, his outer skin was being torn apart little by little.

Demonic energy trickled down like sand from the cracks created by his torn skin.

Although the contraction of the barrier hastened because of this sacrifice, it didn’t matter to me.

Click—

I loaded the god-slaying bullet into the gun’s chamber. Then, I roused Stigma’s magic power to the limit. Pouring out every ounce of Stigma I had left, I used Overclocking to add in even more.

It wasn’t an easy process.

For a moment, I felt like my soul was getting sucked out, like the rampaging Stigma was grabbing onto my mind and shaking it crazily.

That was, until someone touched my shoulder.

“Hajin.”

The voice grabbed my consciousness right as it was on the verge of scattering. A gentle touch embraced my cheeks. I could see Boss’s face. She was staring at me with a warm gaze.

“…Thanks.”

I snapped out of my daze thanks to her.

I slowly took her fingers off, then locked my finger on the trigger again.

“Boss… I hope you didn’t forget… but you remember my Unique skill right?”

With Stigma’s immense pressure pressing down on me, I could barely speak. But I still forced myself to eke out some words.

“I do.”

“So even if it looks like I’m dead….”

I roused Stigma’s magic power once again. It blazed around me like wildfire. The overclocked magic power stole energy from my heart, and the extracted lifeforce seeped into the bullet.

“I won’t… really die.”

Boss smiled bitterly and nodded. At that moment, the ‘charging’ was completed. Any more would be impossible even if I risked something greater than my life, so if this didn’t work, that would be it.

[Stigma has been overclocked to 1353%.]

A system message popped up, notifying me that I expended an additional 13.5 streaks of Stigma. For some reason, this made me feel relieved.

I had put my all into this god-slaying bullet.

—It’s futile.

At that moment, Baal muttered arrogantly.

I gazed into Boss’s eyes one last time, then grinned as I faced the battlefield.

—It’s your loss.
